That is why it is not mentioned here. And this bhikkhu has no reviewing of the kind already mentioned, “I am understanding suffering,” “I am abandoning origination,” “I am realizing cessation,” “I am developing the path,” which is a kind of attention associated with strong desire to act. It is only after the discerning that it occurs. But in the later stage the path is only developed, and so on.

original: Tattha dve saccāni duddasattā gambhīrāni, dve gambhīrattā duddasāni. Dukkhasaccañhi
analyzed: tattha dve saccāni duddasa ttā gambhīrāni dve gambhīra ttā duddasāni dukkha saccañhi
translated: Herein, two truths are difficult to see because of profundity, and two are difficult to see because of that difficulty. For the truth of suffering

original: uppattito pākaṭaṃ; khāṇukaṇṭakappahārādīsu ‘aho dukkha’nti vattabbatampi āpajjati.🔽Samudayampi khāditukāmatābhuñjitukāmatādivasena uppattito pākaṭaṃ. Lakkhaṇapaṭivedhato🔽pana ubhayampi gambhīraṃ. Iti tāni duddasattā gambhīrāni. Itaresaṃ pana dvinnaṃ dassanatthāya🔽payogo bhavaggagahaṇatthaṃ hatthappasāraṇaṃ viya, avīciphusanatthaṃ pādappasāraṇaṃ
analyzed: uppattitaḥ pākaṭam khāṇu kaṇṭaka ppahāra ādīsu aho dukkhan ti vattabba tam pi āpajjati  samudayam pi khāditu kāma tā bhuñjitu kāma tā ādi vasena uppattitaḥ pākaṭam lakkhaṇa paṭivedhato  pana ubhayam pi gambhīram iti tāni gambhīrāni itaresam pana dvinnam dassana tthāya  payogaḥ bhavagga gahaṇa attham hattha ppasāraṇam viya avīci phusana attham pāda ppasāraṇam
translated: is obvious in its origination, since one has to admit that it is suffering when one is struck by a clod, a stick, etc.,🔽and the truth of origin is obvious in its origination since one wants to eat when one is hungry, to drink when one is thirsty, and so on. But both are profound in the penetration of their characteristics.

original: viya, satadhā bhinnavālassa koṭiyā koṭiṃ paṭipādanaṃ viya ca hoti. Iti tāni gambhīrattā
analyzed: satadhā bhinna vālassa koṭiyā koṭim paṭipādanam viya ca hoti iti tāni gambhīra ttā
translated: So they are difficult to see because of profundity. But the other two are difficult to see because of that difficulty. For the penetration of the truths of cessation and the path is like the effort to grasp the end of a long rope or a long creeper hanging in a deep well or the effort to grasp the end of a long strip of bark or cloth pulled over the edge of a deep ravine.🔽So they are difficult to see because of that difficulty.

original: duddasāni. Evaṃ duddasattā gambhīresu gambhīrattā ca duddasesu catūsu saccesu uggahādivasena
analyzed: duddasāni evam duddasa ttā gambhīresu gambhīra ttā ca duddasesu catūsu saccesu uggaha ādi vasena
translated: So in the four truths, which are difficult to see because of profundity and because of that difficulty,

original: pubbabhāgañāṇuppattiṃ sandhāya idaṃ “dukkhe ñāṇa”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Paṭivedhakkhaṇe pana ekameva ñāṇaṃ hoti.
analyzed: pubbabhāga ñāṇa uppattim sandhāya idam dukkhe ñāṇa nti ādi vuttam paṭivedha kkhaṇe pana ekam eva ñāṇam hoti
translated: The words “Knowledge of suffering” and so on are said with reference to the arising of the knowledge of the prior stage. But at the moment of penetration there is only one knowledge.

original: Sammāsaṅkappaniddese kāmato nissaṭoti nekkhammasaṅkappo. Byāpādato nissaṭoti abyāpādasaṅkappo.
analyzed: sammāsaṅkappa niddese kāmataḥ nissaṭaḥ ti nekkhamma saṅkappo byāpādataḥ nissaṭaḥ ti a byāpāda saṅkappo
translated: In the description of right thought, “Renunciation of sense desires” is the thought of renunciation. “Renunciation of ill will” is the thought of non-ill will.

original: Vihiṃsāya nissaṭoti avihiṃsāsaṅkappo. Tattha nekkhammavitakko kāmavitakkassa padaghātaṃ
analyzed: vihiṃsāya nissaṭaḥ ti avihiṃsā saṅkappaḥ tattha nekkhamma vitakko kāma vitakkassa pada ghātam
translated: “Renunciation of cruelty” is the thought of non-cruelty. Herein, the thought of renunciation arises as the thought of renunciation of the thought of sense desires,

original: padacchedaṃ karonto uppajjati, abyāpādavitakko byāpādavitakkassa, avihiṃsāvitakko
analyzed: pada chedam karontaḥ uppajjati a byāpāda vitakkaḥ byāpāda vitakkassa a vihiṃsā vitakko
translated: as the thought of non-ill will of the thought of ill will,

original: vihiṃsāvitakkassa. Nekkhammavitakko ca kāmavitakkassa paccanīko hutvā uppajjati,
analyzed: vihiṃsā vitakkassa nekkhamma vitakko ca kāma vitakkassa paccanīkaḥ hutvā uppajjati
translated: as the thought of non-cruelty of the thought of cruelty. The thought of renunciation arises as the opponent of the thought of sense desires,

original: abyāpādaavihiṃsāvitakkā byāpādavihiṃsāvitakkānaṃ.🔽Tattha yogāvacaro kāmavitakkassa padaghātanatthaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ vā sammasati aññaṃ
analyzed: a byāpāda avihiṃsā vitakkāḥ byāpāda vihiṃsā vitakkānam  tattha yogāvacaraḥ kāma vitakkassa pada ghātana attham kāma vitakkam vā sammasati aññam
translated: the thought of non-ill will and the thought of non-cruelty as the opponents of the thought of ill will and the thought of cruelty.

original: vā pana kiñci saṅkhāraṃ. Athassa vipassanākkhaṇe vipassanāsampayutto saṅkappo tadaṅgavasena
analyzed: vā pana kiñci saṅkhāram athassa vipassanā kkhaṇe vipassanā sampayuttaḥ saṅkappo tad aṅga vasena
translated: Herein, in order to destroy the thought of sense desires, the meditator comprehends the thought of sense desires or any other formation. Then, at the moment of insight, the thought associated with insight arises as the opponent of the thought of sense desires by the method of abandoning the condition.

original: kāmavitakkassa padaghātaṃ padacchedaṃ karonto uppajjati, vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā🔽maggaṃ pāpeti. Athassa maggakkhaṇe maggasampayutto saṅkappo samucchedavasena kāmavitakkassa
analyzed: kāma vitakkassa pada ghātam pada chedam karontaḥ uppajjati vipassanam  maggam pāpa iti atha assa magga kkhaṇe magga sampayuttaḥ saṅkappaḥ samuccheda vasena kāma vitakkassa
translated: while he is making the onslaught and the breach of the thought of sensual desire, he arouses insight and🔽brings the path to presence. Then at the path moment his volition associated with the path is the abandoning of the thought of sensual desire by cutting it off.

original: padaghātaṃ padacchedaṃ karonto uppajjati; byāpādavitakkassāpi padaghātanatthaṃ byāpādavitakkaṃ🔽vā aññaṃ vā saṅkhāraṃ sammasati; vihiṃsāvitakkassa padaghātanatthaṃ vihiṃsāvitakkaṃ
analyzed: pada ghātam pada chedam karontaḥ uppajjati byāpāda vitakkassa api pada ghātana attham byāpāda vitakkam  vā aññam vā saṅkhāram sammasati vihiṃsā vitakkassa pada ghātana attham vihiṃsā vitakkaṃ
translated: He brings about the cutting off of the pursuit of sensual-desire thoughts by arousing insight and he brings the path to presence. At the path moment the intention associated with the path arises to cut off the pursuit of sensual-desire thoughts by way of abandoning.

original: vā aññaṃ vā saṅkhāraṃ sammasati. Athassa vipassanākkhaṇeti sabbaṃ purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ.🔽Kāmavitakkādīnaṃ pana tiṇṇaṃ pāḷiyaṃ vibhattesu aṭṭhatiṃsārammaṇesu ekakammaṭṭhānampi
analyzed: vā aññam vā saṅkhāram sammasati athassa vipassanā khaṇe ti sabbam purima nayena iva yojetabbam  kāma vitakka ādīnam pana tiṇṇam pāḷiyam vibhattesu aṭṭhatiṃsa ārammaṇesu eka kammaṭṭhānam pi
translated: He comprehends either ill will or some other formation in order to cut off the pursuit of ill will. He comprehends either cruelty or some other formation in order to cut off the pursuit of cruelty. Then at the insight moment … all should be construed in the way already stated.🔽But as regards the thirty-eight objects of the three kinds of thoughts, namely, sensual-desire thoughts, etc., which are given in the texts, there is not a single meditation subject that is not a counter-part of one or other of them.

original: apaccanīkaṃ nāma natthi. Ekantato pana kāmavitakkassa tāva asubhesu paṭhamajjhānameva
analyzed: apaccanīkam nāma natthi ekantato pana kāma vitakkassa tāva asubhesu paṭhamajjhānam eva
translated: But as regards the first jhāna in foulness, for instance, that is only

original: paccanīkaṃ, byāpādavitakkassa mettāya tikacatukkajjhānāni, vihiṃsāvitakkassa karuṇāya
analyzed: paccanīkam byāpāda vitakkassa mettāya tika catukka jjhānāni vihiṃsā vitakkassa karuṇāya
translated: and the three or four jhānas of compassion are the opposition to cruelty.

original: tikacatukkajjhānāni. Tasmā asubhe parikammaṃ katvā jhānaṃ samāpannassa samāpattikkhaṇe
analyzed: tika catukka jhānāni tasmai asubhe parikammam katvā jhānam samāpannassa samāpatti khaṇe
translated: So when one who has made the preliminary work with foulness enters upon jhāna,

original: jhānasampayutto saṅkappo vikkhambhanavasena kāmavitakkassa paccanīko hutvā uppajjati.
analyzed: jhāna sampayuttaḥ saṅkappaḥ vikkhambhana vasena kāma vitakkassa paccanīkaḥ hutvā uppajjati
translated: the volition associated with the jhāna arises as the opposition to lust by suppression at the moment of the jhāna itself.

original: Jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapentassa vipassanākkhaṇe vipassanāsampayutto🔽saṅkappo tadaṅgavasena kāmavitakkassa paccanīko hutvā uppajjati. Vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā
analyzed: jhānam pādakam katvā vipassanam paṭṭhapentassa vipassanā kkhaṇe vipassanā sampayutto  saṅkappo tad aṅga vasena kāma vitakkassa paccanīkaḥ hutvā uppajjati vipassanam ussukkāpetvā
translated: When one who has made the jhāna the basis for direct-knowledge enters upon direct- knowledge, the volition associated with the direct-knowledge🔽arises as the opposition to lust by the abandoning of the hindrances at the moment of the direct-knowledge.

original: maggaṃ pāpentassa maggakkhaṇe maggasampayutto saṅkappo samucchedavasena kāmavitakkassa
analyzed: maggam pāpentassa magga kkhaṇe magga sampayuttaḥ saṅkappaḥ samuccheda vasena kāma vitakkassa
translated: When one who has made direct-knowledge the basis for the path enters upon the path, the volition associated with the path arises as the opposition to lust by the cutting off of the defilements at the moment of the path.

original: paccanīko hutvā uppajjati. Evaṃ uppanno nekkhammasaṅkappoti vuccatīti veditabbo.
analyzed: paccanīkaḥ hutvā uppajjati evam uppannaḥ nekkhamma saṅkappaḥ iti vuccati iti veditabbaḥ
translated: So it should be understood that the “ renunciation-wish” arises in this way.

original: Mettāya pana parikammaṃ katvā, karuṇāya parikammaṃ katvā jhānaṃ samāpajjatīti sabbaṃ
analyzed: mettāya pana parikammam katvā karuṇāya parikammam katvā jhānam samāpajjati iti sabbam
translated: But when he enters upon jhāna after making loving-kindness the subject of his meditation, and after making compassion the subject of his meditation, all🔽the rest is as already stated.

original: purimanayeneva yojetabbaṃ. Evaṃ uppanno abyāpādasaṅkappoti vuccati, avihiṃsāsaṅkappoti
analyzed: purima nayena iva yojetabbam evam uppannaḥ abyāpāda saṅkappo ti vuccati avihiṃsā saṅkappo ti
translated: and it should be construed in the same way as the preceding . So it is called disinterested-hatred-free-cruelty-free thought.🔽And it should be understood as called disinterested-hatred-free-cruelty-free thought.

original: ca vuccatīti veditabbo. Evamete nekkhammasaṅkappādayo vipassanājhānavasena uppattīnaṃ🔽nānattā pubbabhāge nānā; maggakkhaṇe pana imesu tīsu ṭhānesu uppannassa akusalasaṅkappassa
analyzed: ca vuccati iti veditabbaḥ evam ete nekkhamma saṅkappa ādayaḥ vipassanā jhāna vasena uppattīnam  nānattā pubbabhāge nānā magga kkhaṇe pana imesu tīsu ṭhānesu uppannassa akusala saṅkappassa
translated: So these disinterested-hatred-free-cruelty-free thoughts, etc., are different in the earlier stage because of the difference in the arising of insight and jhāna,🔽but at the moment of the path they are one, being a profitable thought that arises in these three instances,

original: padacchedato anuppattisādhanavasena maggaṅgaṃ pūrayamāno ekova kusalasaṅkappo uppajjati.
analyzed: padacchedataḥ anuppatti sādhana vasena maggaṅgam pūrayamānaḥ ekaḥ iva kusala saṅkappaḥ uppajjati
translated: fulfilling the path factor by cutting off the unprofitable thought called wrong thinking that arose in these three instances and by effecting the prevention of its arising.

original: Ayaṃ sammāsaṅkappo nāma.
analyzed: ayam sammāsaṅkappaḥ nāma
translated: This is called right thought.

original: Sammāvācāniddesepi yasmā aññeneva cittena musāvādā viramati, aññenaññena pisuṇavācādīhi,🔽tasmā catassopetā veramaṇiyo pubbabhāge nānā; maggakkhaṇe pana micchāvācāsaṅkhātāya
analyzed: sammāvācā niddese pi yasmai aññena iva cittena musāvādāḥ viramati aññena aññena pisuṇa vācā ādīhi  tasmā catasso upetāḥ veramaṇiyaḥ pubbabhāge nānā magga kkhaṇe pana micchā vācā saṅkhātāya
translated: As regards the description of right speech, since one refrains from lying by means of one kind of consciousness, and from malicious speech, etc., by another and another kind,🔽therefore the four kinds of refraining are different in the earlier stage,

original: catubbidhāya akusaladussīlyacetanāya padacchedato anuppattisādhanavasena maggaṅgaṃ
analyzed: catubbidhāya akusala dussīlya cetanāya padacchedataḥ anuppatti sādhana vasena maggaṅgaṃ
translated: but at the moment of the path they are one, being a path factor that effects the prevention of the arising of the four kinds of unprofitable unvirtuous consciousness called wrong speech,

original: pūrayamānā ekāva sammāvācāsaṅkhātā kusalaveramaṇī uppajjati. Ayaṃ sammāvācā nāma.
analyzed: pūrayamānā ekā ava sammāvācā saṅkhātā kusala veramaṇī uppajjati ayam sammāvācā nāma
translated: and they arise as one abstention called right speech. This is called right speech.

original: Sammākammantaniddesepi yasmā aññeneva cittena pāṇātipātā viramati, aññena adinnādānā,
analyzed: sammā kammanta niddese pi yasmai aññena iva cittena pāṇa atipātā viramati aññena adinnādānā
translated: In the description of right action, since one abstains from killing living things with one kind of consciousness, and from taking what is not given with another,

original: aññena kāmesumicchācārā, tasmā tissopetā veramaṇiyo pubbabhāge nānā; maggakkhaṇe🔽pana micchākammantasaṅkhātāya tividhāya akusaladussīlyacetanāya padacchedato anuppattisādhanavasena
analyzed: aññena tasmā tissa upetāḥ veramaṇiyaḥ pubbabhāge nānā magga kkhaṇe  pana micchā kammanta saṅkhātāya tividhāya akusala dussīlya cetanāya padacchedataḥ anuppatti sādhana vasena
translated: and from sexual misconduct with still another, therefore these three kinds of abstention are separate in the prior stage of virtue.

original: maggaṅgaṃ pūrayamānā ekāva sammākammantasaṅkhātā akusalaveramaṇī uppajjati. Ayaṃ sammākammanto nāma.
analyzed: maggaṅgam pūrayamānā ekā ava sammākammanta saṅkhātā akusala veramaṇī uppajjati ayam sammākammantaḥ nāma
translated: But at the moment of the path they arise as one abstention called right action, which is a kind of unwholesome abstention, fulfilling the path factor that is the opposite of the threefold unwholesome conduct called wrong action, in the sense of preventing its arising. This is called right action.

original: Sammāājīvaniddese idhāti imasmiṃ sāsane. Ariyasāvakoti ariyassa buddhassa sāvako.
analyzed: sammāājīva niddese idha ati imasmin sāsane ariya sāvako ariyassa buddhassa sāvako
translated: In the description of right livelihood, here in this Dispensation, a noble disciple,

original: Micchāājīvaṃ pahāyāti pāpakaṃ ājīvaṃ pajahitvā. Sammāājīvenāti buddhapasatthena kusalaājīvena.
analyzed: micchāājīvam pahāya ati pāpakam ājīvam pajahitvā sammāājīvena ati buddha pasatthena kusala ājīvena
translated: having abandoned wrong livelihood, should make his living by means of right livelihood that is commended by the wise.

original: Jīvikaṃ kappetīti jīvitappavattiṃ pavatteti. Idhāpi yasmā aññeneva cittena kāyadvāravītikkamā
analyzed: jīvikam kappeti iti jīvita ppavattim pavatteti idha api yasmai aññena iva cittena kāya dvāra vītikkamā
translated: He makes his living by it: he maintains his life by it. Here too, since he refrains from transgressing the bodily and verbal doors by means of different kinds of consciousness,

original: viramati; aññena vacīdvāravītikkamā, tasmā pubbabhāge nānākkhaṇesu uppajjati; maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: viramati aññena vacī dvāra vītikkamā tasmā pubbabhāge nānā kkhaṇesu uppajjati magga kkhaṇe
translated: in the earlier stage they arise at different times. But at the moment of the path

original: pana dvīsu dvāresu sattannaṃ kammapathānaṃ vasena uppannāya micchāājīvadussīlyacetanāya🔽padacchedato anuppattisādhanavasena maggaṅgaṃ pūrayamānā ekāva sammāājīvasaṅkhātā
analyzed: pana dvīsu dvāresu sattannam kammapathānam vasena uppannāya micchā ājīva dussīlya cetanāya  padacchedataḥ anuppatti sādhana vasena maggaṅgam pūrayamānā ekā ava sammāājīva saṅkhātā
translated: they arise together in one consciousness moment as the volition of wrong livelihood and unvirtuousness in the case of the seven courses of unskillful action that pertain to the two doors.🔽In the analysis of the path factors, the right livelihood that fulfills the path factor by way of preventing the arising of wrong livelihood is a single wholesome volition that arises as right livelihood.

original: kusalaveramaṇī uppajjati. Ayaṃ sammāājīvo nāma.🔽Sammāvāyāmaniddeso sammappadhānavibhaṅge anupadavaṇṇanāvasena āvibhavissati. Ayaṃ🔽pana pubbabhāge nānācittesu labhati. Aññeneva hi cittena anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ
analyzed: kusala veramaṇī uppajjati ayam sammāājīvaḥ nāma  sammāvāyāma niddeso sammappadhāna vibhaṅge anupada vaṇṇanā vasena ayam  pana pubbabhāge nānā cittesu labhati aññena iva hi cittena anuppannānam pāpakānam akusalānam
translated: This is called right livelihood.🔽The exposition of right effort will be given in the Description of the Right Endeavors .🔽But this is obtained in different kinds of consciousness in the earlier stage. For one makes effort by means of different kinds of consciousness to prevent the arising of unarisen evil unwholesome states, and to abandon arisen evil unwholesome states;

original: dhammānaṃ anuppādāya vāyāmaṃ karoti, aññena uppannānaṃ pahānāya; aññeneva ca anuppannānaṃ
analyzed: dhammānam an uppādāya vāyāmam karoti aññena uppannānam pahānāya aññena iva ca anuppannānam
translated: and by means of different kinds of consciousness one makes effort to arouse unarisen wholesome states and to increase arisen wholesome states.

original: kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya, aññena uppannānaṃ ṭhitiyā; maggakkhaṇe pana ekacitteyeva
analyzed: kusalānam dhammānam uppādāya aññena uppannānam ṭhitiyā magga kkhaṇe pana
translated: But at the moment of the path they are found in a single consciousness.

original: labbhati. Ekameva hi maggasampayuttaṃ vīriyaṃ catukiccasādhanaṭṭhena cattāri nāmāni labbhati.
analyzed: labbhati ekam eva hi magga sampayuttam vīriyam catu kicca sādhana ṭṭhena cattāri nāmāni labbhati
translated: For the energy associated with the path is one only, but it is called the four right endeavours in the sense of accomplishing the four tasks.

original: Sammāsatiniddesopi satipaṭṭhānavibhaṅge anupadavaṇṇanāvasena āvibhavissati. Ayampi
analyzed: sammāsati niddesaḥ api sati paṭṭhāna vibhaṅge anupada vaṇṇanā vasena ayam pi
translated: The description of right mindfulness will be evident in the Description of the Ways of Mindfulness.🔽And this is found in various consciousnesses in the prior stage.

original: ca pubbabhāge nānācittesu labbhati. Aññeneva hi cittena kāyaṃ pariggaṇhāti, aññenaññena🔽vedanādīni; maggakkhaṇe pana ekacitteyeva labbhati. Ekāyeva hi maggasampayuttā sati
analyzed: ca pubbabhāge nānā cittesu labbhati aññena iva hi cittena kāyam pariggaṇhāti aññena aññena  vedanā ādīni magga kkhaṇe pana eka cittā iya iva labbhati ekāya iva hi magga sampayuttā sati
translated: For one discerns the body with one kind of consciousness, feelings with another, and so on.🔽But at the moment of the path it is found in a single consciousness.

original: catukiccasādhanaṭṭhena cattāri nāmāni labhati.
analyzed: catu kicca sādhana ṭṭhena cattāri nāmāni labhati
translated: For the mindfulness associated with the path is one only, but it is called the four establishments of mindfulness in the sense of accomplishing the four tasks.

original: Sammāsamādhiniddese cattāri jhānāni pubbabhāgepi nānā, maggakkhaṇepi. Pubbabhāge
analyzed: sammāsamādhi niddese cattāri jhānāni pubbabhāge pi nānā magga kkhaṇe pi pubbabhāge
translated: As regards the description of right concentration, the four jhānas are found in the prior stage and at the moment of the path.🔽In the prior stage they are found as attainments, and at the moment of the path they are found as paths.

original: samāpattivasena nānā, maggakkhaṇe nānāmaggavasena. Ekassa hi paṭhamamaggo paṭhamajjhāniko
analyzed: samāpatti vasena nānā magga kkhaṇe nānā magga vasena ekassa hi paṭhama maggaḥ paṭhamajjhānikaḥ
translated: For one person’s first path is the jhāna of another.

original: hoti, dutiyamaggādayopi paṭhamajjhānikā, dutiyādīsu aññatarajjhānikā vā. Ekassa paṭhamamaggo
analyzed: hoti dutiya magga ādayaḥ api paṭhama jhānikāḥ dutiya ādīsu aññatara jjhānikāḥ vā ekassa paṭhama maggo
translated: and the second path, etc., are of the first jhāna, or of the second, etc.,

original: dutiyādīnaṃ aññatarajjhāniko hoti, dutiyādayopi dutiyādīnaṃ aññatarajjhānikā vā paṭhamajjhānikā
analyzed: dutiya ādīnam aññatara jhānikaḥ hoti dutiya ādayaḥ api dutiya ādīnam aññatara jhānikā vā paṭhama jhānikā
translated: and the second path, etc., are of the second, etc., or of the first jhāna.

original: vā. Evaṃ cattāropi maggā jhānavasena sadisā vā asadisā vā ekaccasadisā vā honti.
analyzed: vā evam cattāro api maggāḥ jhāna vasena sadisāḥ vā asadisāḥ vā ekacca sadisāḥ vā honti
translated: So the four paths are either equal in jhāna or unequal in jhāna, or one is equal and the other unequal.

original: Ayaṃ panassa viseso pādakajjhānaniyāmena hoti. Pādakajjhānaniyāmena tāva paṭhamajjhānalābhino
analyzed: ayam pana assa visesaḥ pādaka jjhāna niyāmena hoti pādaka jjhāna niyāmena tāva paṭhama jhāna lābhinaḥ
translated: But this difference is according to the order of the basic jhāna.

original: paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhāya vipassantassa uppannamaggo paṭhamajjhāniko hoti; maggaṅgabojjhaṅgāni🔽panettha paripuṇṇāneva honti. Dutiyajjhānato uṭṭhāya vipassantassa uppanno maggo
analyzed: paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhāya vipassantassa uppanna maggaḥ paṭhamajjhānikaḥ hoti maggaṅga bojjhaṅgāni  pana ittha paripuṇṇāni iva honti dutiya jhānataḥ uṭṭhāya vipassantassa uppannaḥ maggo
translated: To begin with, when one who has acquired the first jhāna has insight after emerging from the first jhāna, the path that arises is of the first jhāna.🔽But here the path factors and the enlightenment factors are complete.🔽When he has insight after emerging from the second jhāna, the path is of the second jhāna.

original: dutiyajjhāniko hoti; maggaṅgāni panettha satta honti. Tatiyajjhānato uṭṭhāya vipassantassa
analyzed: dutiya jhānikaḥ hoti maggaṅgāni pana ittha satta honti tatiya jhānataḥ uṭṭhāya vipassantassa
translated: But here there are only seven path factors. When he has insight after emerging from the third jhāna,

original: uppanno maggo tatiyajjhāniko hoti; maggaṅgāni panettha satta, bojjhaṅgāni cha honti.
analyzed: uppannaḥ maggaḥ tatiya jhānikaḥ hoti maggaṅgāni pana ittha satta bojjhaṅgāni cha honti
translated: The path that arises is of the third jhāna. But here there are seven path factors and six enlightenment factors.

original: Esa nayo catutthajjhānato paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanā.
analyzed: esa nayo catuttha jhānato paṭṭhāya yāva nevasaññānāsaññāyatanā
translated: This is the method in the case of the fourth jhāna, and so on up to the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: Āruppe catukkapañcakajjhānaṃ uppajjati. Tañca kho lokuttaraṃ no lokiyanti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: āruppe catukka pañcaka jjhānam uppajjati tat ca kho lokuttaram no lokiyanti vuttam
translated: The fourfold and fivefold jhāna arise in the immaterial states, and that is supramundane, not mundane, it is said.

original: Ettha kathanti? Etthāpi paṭhamajjhānādīsu yato uṭṭhāya sotāpattimaggaṃ paṭilabhitvā🔽āruppasamāpattiṃ bhāvetvā yo āruppe uppanno, taṃjhānikāva tassa tattha tayo maggā
analyzed: ettha kathan ti ettha api paṭhama jhāna ādīsu yatas uṭṭhāya sotāpatti maggam paṭilabhitvā  āruppa samāpattim bhāvetvā yaḥ āruppe uppanno taṃjhānikā va tassa tattha tayo maggā
translated: Herein, what is the meaning of “here”? Here too, in the first jhāna, etc., when he has emerged from which he obtains the stream-entry path,🔽and when he has developed the immaterial jhāna and has emerged from which he obtains the Arahant path,

original: uppajjanti. Evaṃ pādakajjhānameva niyāmeti. Keci pana therā “vipassanāya ārammaṇabhūtā
analyzed: uppajjanti evam pādakajjhānam eva niyāmeti keci pana therāḥ vipassanāya ārammaṇa bhūtā
translated: the three paths arise in him there with that jhāna as jhāna condition. So it is jhāna that determines. But some elders say that it is the aggregates that are the object of insight that determine.

original: khandhā niyāmentī”ti vadanti. Keci “puggalajjhāsayo niyāmetī”ti vadanti. Keci “vuṭṭhānagāminīvipassanā
analyzed: khandhāḥ niyāmenti iti vadanti keci puggala jhāsayaḥ niyāmeti iti vadanti keci vuṭṭhāna gāminī vipassanā
translated: Some say it is the individual’s temperament that determines. Some say it is the insight that leads to emergence that determines.

original: niyāmetī”ti vadanti. Tesaṃ vādavinicchayo heṭṭhā cittuppādakaṇḍe lokuttarapadabhājanīyavaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: niyāma iti iti vadanti tesam vāda vinicchayaḥ heṭṭhā cittuppāda kaṇḍe lokuttara padabhājanīya vaṇṇanā ayam
translated: The exposition of the terms in the section on the kinds of consciousness should be understood in the way given in the Description of the Path of Purification .

original: vuttanayeneva veditabbo. Ayaṃ vuccati sammāsamādhīti yā imesu catūsu jhānesu ekaggatā,
analyzed: vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ ayam vuccati sammāsamādhi iti yā imesu catūsu jhānesu ekagga tā
translated: this unification of mind in these four jhānas is called right concentration.

original: ayaṃ pubbabhāge lokiyo, aparabhāge lokuttaro sammāsamādhi nāma vuccatīti. Evaṃ lokiyalokuttaravasena
analyzed: ayam pubba bhāge lokiyaḥ apara bhāge lokuttaro sammāsamādhi nāma vuccati iti evam lokiya lokuttara vasena
translated: In the earlier stage it is mundane, and in the later stage it is supramundane.

original: bhagavā maggasaccaṃ desesi.
analyzed: bhagavā magga saccam desesi
translated: This is how the Blessed One expounded the truth of the path.

original: Tattha lokiyamagge sabbāneva maggaṅgāni yathānurūpaṃ chasu ārammaṇesu aññatarārammaṇāni🔽honti. Lokuttaramagge pana catusaccapaṭivedhāya pavattassa ariyassa nibbānārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: tattha lokiya magge maggaṅgāni yathānurūpam chasu ārammaṇesu aññatara ārammaṇāni  honti lokuttara magge pana catu sacca paṭivedhāya pavattassa ariyassa nibbāna ārammaṇam
translated: Herein, in the case of the mundane path all the path factors have any one of the six kinds of object according to circumstances.

original: avijjānusayasamugghātakaṃ paññācakkhu sammādiṭṭhi. Tathā sampannadiṭṭhissa taṃsampayuttaṃ
analyzed: avijjā anusaya samugghātakam paññā cakkhu sammādiṭṭhi tathā sampanna diṭṭhissa tad sampayuttam
translated: But in the case of the noble supramundane path, the eye of knowledge that occurs in order to penetrate the four truths, which eye of knowledge is the cause for the uprooting of the inherent tendency to ignorance, is right view.

original: tividhamicchāsaṅkappasamugghātakaṃ cetaso nibbānapadābhiniropanaṃ sammāsaṅkappo.
analyzed: tividham icchā saṅkappa samugghātakam cetasaḥ nibbāna pada abhiniropanam sammāsaṅkappo
translated: And the directing of the mind on to the state of Nibbāna associated with that right view, which is the cause for the uprooting of the three kinds of wrong thinking, is right thinking.

original: Tathā passantassa vitakkentassa ca taṃsampayuttāva catubbidhavacīduccaritasamugghātikāya
analyzed: tathā passantassa vitakkentassa ca catubbidha vacī duccarita samugghātikāya
translated: And the speech of one who has thus seen and is thus thinking, which is the cause for the uprooting of the four kinds of verbal misconduct,

original: micchāvācāya virati sammāvācā. Tathā viramantassa taṃsampayuttāva micchākammantasamucchedikā
analyzed: micchāvācāya virati sammāvācā tathā viramantassa micchā kammanta samucchedikā
translated: Abstinence from false speech is right speech.🔽Abstinence from the other three bodily wrongdoings is right action.

original: tividhakāyaduccaritavirati sammākammanto. Tesaṃyeva sammāvācākammantānaṃ vodānabhūtā🔽taṃsampayuttāva kuhanādisamucchedikā micchāājīvavirati sammāājīvo. Imissā sammāvācākammantājīvasaṃkhātāya
analyzed: tividha kāya duccarita virati sammākammanto tesam yeva sammā vācā kammantānam vodāna bhūtā  tad sampayuttā ava kuhanā ādi samucchedikā micchāājīva virati sammāājīvaḥ imissā sammā vācā kammanta ājīva saṃkhātāya
translated: Abstinence from the three kinds of wrong livelihood is right livelihood.

original: sīlabhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhamānassa tadanurūpo taṃsampayuttova kosajjasamucchedako anuppannuppannānaṃ🔽akusalakusalānaṃ anuppādapahānuppādaṭṭhitisādhako ca vīriyārambho sammāvāyāmo. Evaṃ🔽vāyamantassa taṃsampayuttova micchāsativiniddhunanako kāyādīsu kāyānupassanādisādhako
analyzed: sīlabhūmiyam patiṭṭhamānassa tad anurūpaḥ tad sampayuttaḥ uva kosajja samucchedako anuppanna uppannānam  akusala kusalānaṃ anuppāda pahā anuppāda ṭṭhiti sādhako ca vīriya ārambho sammāvāyāmo evam  kāya ādīsu kāya anupassanā ādi sādhako
translated: When he has thus established himself in this plane of virtue consisting in right speech, right action, and right livelihood,🔽the arousing of energy that is in conformity with it and which cuts off idleness associated with it is right effort.🔽When he has thus aroused energy, the non-remissness of the mind associated with it, which sweeps away wrong mindfulness, and which accomplishes the foundation of mindfulness consisting in contemplation of the body, etc.,

original: ca cetaso asammoso sammāsati. Iti anuttarāya satiyā suvihitacittārakkhassa taṃsampayuttāva
analyzed: ca cetasaḥ asammoso sammā sati iti anuttarāya satiyā su vihita citta ārakkhassa tad sampayuttā ava
translated: is right mindfulness. Thus when his mind is well guarded by supreme mindfulness, the concentration associated with it, which sweeps away wrong concentration and accomplishes the jhānas, is right concentration.

original: micchāsamādhisamugghātikā cittekaggatā sammāsamādhīti. Esa lokuttaro ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko
analyzed: micchāsamādhi samugghātikā citta ekagga tā sammāsamādhi iti esa lokuttaraḥ ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgiko
translated: This is the Noble Eightfold Path, which is supramundane,

original: maggo yo saha lokiyena maggena dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadāti saṅkhaṃ gato.
analyzed: maggaḥ yaḥ saha lokiyena maggena dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati saṅkham gataḥ
translated: and which, together with the mundane path, is called “the way leading to the cessation of suffering.”

original: So kho panesa maggo sammādiṭṭhisaṅkappānaṃ vijjāya, sesadhammānaṃ caraṇena saṅgahitattā🔽vijjā ceva caraṇañca. Tathā tesaṃ dvinnaṃ vipassanāyānena, itaresaṃ samathayānena🔽saṅgahitattā samatho ceva vipassanā ca. Tesaṃ vā dvinnaṃ paññākkhandhena, tadanantarānaṃ🔽tiṇṇaṃ sīlakkhandhena, avasesānaṃ samādhikkhandhena adhipaññāadhisīlaadhicittasikkhāhi
analyzed: so kho pana isa maggo sammā diṭṭhi saṅkappānam vijjāya sesa dhammānam caraṇena saṅgahita ttā  vijjā ca iva caraṇam ca tathā tesam dvinnam vipassanā yānena itaresam samatha yānena  saṅgahita ttā samathaḥ ca iva vipassanā ca tesam vā dvinnam paññā kkhandhena  tiṇṇam sīla kkhandhena avasesānam samādhi kkhandhena adhi paññā adhi sīla adhi citta sikkhāhi
translated: This path is both knowledge and conduct because it includes right view and right thought as knowledge and the rest of the factors as conduct.🔽It is both serenity and insight because it includes the first two factors as the vehicle of serenity and the rest as the vehicle of insight.

original: ca saṅgahitattā khandhattayañceva sikkhāttayañca hoti; yena samannāgato ariyasāvako
analyzed: ca saṅgahita ttā khandhattayam ca iva sikkhāttayam ca hoti yena samannāgataḥ ariya sāvako
translated: Or it is both the three aggregates and the three trainings because it includes the first two factors as the aggregate of wisdom, the next three as the aggregate of virtue, the rest as the aggregate of concentration, and all eight as the training in higher wisdom, the training in higher virtue, and the training in higher concentration.🔽A noble disciple who possesses this path

original: dassanasamatthehi cakkhūhi gamanasamatthehi ca pādehi samannāgato addhiko viya vijjācaraṇasampanno
analyzed: dassana samatthehi cakkhūhi gamana samatthehi ca pādehi samannāgataḥ addhikaḥ viya vijjā caraṇa sampanno
translated: is like a man who has eyes and can see, and who is endowed with feet and can walk. He is endowed with knowledge and conduct.

original: hutvā vipassanāyānena kāmasukhallikānuyogaṃ, samathayānena attakilamathānuyoganti
analyzed: hutvā vipassanā yānena kāma sukhallikā anuyogam samatha yānena atta kilamatha anuyogam ti
translated: and by the vehicle of insight he avoids the pursuit of sensual happiness and the pursuit of self-torment,

original: antadvayaṃ parivajjetvā majjhimapaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno paññākkhandhena mohakkhandhaṃ,🔽sīlakkhandhena dosakkhandhaṃ, samādhikkhandhena ca lobhakkhandhaṃ padālento adhipaññāsikkhāya
analyzed: anta dvayam parivajjetvā majjhima paṭipadam paṭipanno paññā kkhandhena moha kkhandham  sīla kkhandhena dosa kkhandham samādhi kkhandhena ca lobha kkhandham padālentaḥ adhi paññā sikkhāya
translated: and by the vehicle of serenity he avoids the two extremes, and he practices the middle way. He breaks up the mass of delusion by the category of understanding,🔽the mass of hate by the category of virtue, and the mass of greed by the category of concentration. He thus perfects understanding by the training in higher understanding,

original: paññāsampadaṃ, adhisīlasikkhāya sīlasampadaṃ, adhicittasikkhāya samādhisampadanti
analyzed: paññā sampadam adhi sīla sikkhāya sīla sampadam adhi citta sikkhāya samādhi sampadanti
translated: perfects virtue by the training in higher virtue, and perfects concentration by the training in higher consciousness.

original: tisso sampattiyo patvā amataṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikaroti, ādimajjhapariyosānakalyāṇaṃ
analyzed: tissaḥ sampattiyaḥ patvā amatam nibbānam sacchikaroti ādi majjha pariyosāna kalyāṇam
translated: And having attained these three perfections, he realizes the deathless Nibbāna, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.

original: sattatiṃsabodhipakkhiyadhammaratanavicittaṃ sammattaniyāmasaṅkhātaṃ ariyabhūmiñca okkanto hotīti.
analyzed: sattatiṃsa bodhi pakkhiya dhammaratana vicittam sammatta niyāma saṅkhātam ariya bhūmiñca okkantaḥ hoti iti
translated: And he enters upon the noble plane called the right way, which is adorned with the jewel of the thirty-seven states partaking of enlightenment, and which is called the path of stream-entry.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
translated: The exposition of the basket of Discourses is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the basket of the Abhidhamma

original: 206-214. Idāni abhidhammabhājanīyaṃ hoti. Tattha “ariyasaccānī”ti avatvā nippadesato
analyzed: idāni abhidhamma bhājanīyam hoti tattha ariya saccāni iti avatvā nippadesataḥ
translated: Now comes the basket of the Abhidhamma. Herein, instead of “noble truths” in the first line,

original: paccayasaṅkhātaṃ samudayaṃ dassetuṃ “cattāri saccānī”ti vuttaṃ. Ariyasaccānīti hi🔽vutte avasesā ca kilesā, avasesā ca akusalā dhammā, tīṇi ca kusalamūlāni sāsavāni,
analyzed: paccaya saṅkhātam samudayam dassetum cattāri saccāni iti vuttam ariya saccāni iti hi  vutte avasesā ca kilesā avasesā ca akusalā dhammā tīṇi ca kusala mūlāni sa āsavāni
translated: The four truths are stated in order to show the origin, which is called condition.🔽For if it were said “noble truths,” then the remaining defilements, the remaining unwholesome states,

original: avasesā ca sāsavā kusalā dhammā na saṅgayhanti. Na ca kevalaṃ taṇhāva dukkhaṃ samudāneti,
analyzed: avasesā ca sa āsavā kusalā dhammā na saṅgayhanti na ca kevalam taṇhā va dukkham samudāneti
translated: the three wholesome roots with the cankers, and the remaining wholesome states with the cankers would not be included.🔽And craving is not the only condition that generates suffering;

original: imepi avasesā ca kilesādayo paccayā samudānentiyeva. Iti imepi paccayā dukkhaṃ samudānentiyevāti
analyzed: ime api avasesā ca kilesa ādayo paccayā samudānentiya iva iti ime pi paccayā dukkham samudānentiya iva ati
translated: these remaining defilements, etc., are also conditions that generate it. So these conditions also generate suffering.

original: nippadesato paccayasaṅkhātaṃ samudayaṃ dassetuṃ “ariyasaccānī”ti avatvā “cattāri saccānī”ti vuttaṃ.🔽Niddesavāre ca nesaṃ paṭhamaṃ dukkhaṃ aniddisitvā tasseva dukkhassa sukhaniddesatthaṃ
analyzed: nippadesataḥ paccaya saṅkhātam samudayam dassetum ariya saccāni iti avatvā cattāri saccāni iti vuttam  niddesa vāre ca nesam paṭhamam dukkham a niddisitvā tassa iva dukkhassa sukha niddesa attham
translated: Therefore, in order to show the origin, which is called condition, without specifying it, it is said “four truths” instead of “noble truths.”🔽And in the section on the definitions, after the first truth, suffering, is defined, the origin of that same suffering is defined in order to show its definition as pleasure.

original: dukkhasamudayo niddiṭṭho. Tasmiñhi niddiṭṭhe “avasesā ca kilesā”tiādinā nayena dukkhasaccaṃ
analyzed: dukkha samudayo niddiṭṭho tasmin hi niddiṭṭhe avasesā ca kilesa ati ādinā nayena dukkha saccam
translated: For when that is defined, the truth of suffering is defined by the method beginning, “The remaining defilements” .

original: sukhaniddesaṃ hoti. Nirodhasaccampettha taṇhāya pahānaṃ “taṇhāya ca avasesānañca
analyzed: sukha niddesam hoti nirodha saccam pa ittha taṇhāya pahānam taṇhāya ca
translated: and it is well described as pleasure.

original: kilesānaṃ pahāna”nti evaṃ yathāvuttassa samudayassa pahānavasena pañcahākārehi niddiṭṭhaṃ.🔽Maggasaccaṃ panettha paṭhamajjhānikasotāpattimaggavasena dhammasaṅgaṇiyaṃ vibhattassa
analyzed: kilesānam pahānam ti evam yathā vuttassa samudayassa pahāna vasena pañcahākārehi niddiṭṭham  magga saccam pana ittha paṭhama jhānika sotāpatti magga vasena dhammasaṅgaṇiyam vibhattassa
translated: The truth of cessation is described in five ways as the abandoning of craving and the abandoning of the remaining defilements.🔽The truth of the path is described by the mere mention of the method of teaching given in the Dhamma-sangani in the first jhana section, in the case of the stream-entry path.

original: desanānayassa mukhamattameva dassentena niddiṭṭhaṃ. Tattha nayabhedo veditabbo. Taṃ
analyzed: desanā nayassa mukha mattam eva dassentena niddiṭṭham tattha naya bhedaḥ veditabbo tam
translated: The classification of the method should be understood there.

original: upari pakāsayissāma.🔽Yasmā pana na kevalaṃ aṭṭhaṅgiko maggova paṭipadā “pubbeva kho panassa kāyakammaṃ
analyzed: upari pakāsayissāma  yasmā pana na kevalam aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ iva paṭipadā pubbā iva kho panassa kāya kammam
translated: We shall explain it later.

original: vacīkammaṃ ājīvo suparisuddho hotī”ti vacanato pana puggalajjhāsayavasena pañcaṅgikopi
analyzed: vacī kammam ājīvo su parisuddho hoti iti vacanato pana puggala jhāsaya vasena pañcaṅgikaḥ api
translated: But the path is not only the eight-factored path. The five-factored path is also taught as the path according to the inclination of individuals, since it is said: “His bodily action, speech, and livelihood are already well purified” .

original: maggo paṭipadā evāti desito, tasmā taṃ nayaṃ dassetuṃ pañcaṅgikavāropi niddiṭṭho.
analyzed: maggo paṭipadā evā ti desito tasmā tam nayam dassetum pañcaṅgika vāraḥ api niddiṭṭhaḥ
translated: Therefore the five-factored path is also described in order to show that method.

original: Yasmā ca na kevalaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikapañcaṅgikamaggāva paṭipadā, sampayuttakā pana atirekapaññāsadhammāpi
analyzed: yasmā ca na kevalam paṭipadā sampayuttakā pana atireka paññā sa dhammā api
translated: And since the path is not only the eight-factored and five-factored paths but also the more than fifty states associated with them,

original: paṭipadā eva, tasmā taṃ nayaṃ dassetuṃ tatiyo sabbasaṅgāhikavāropi niddiṭṭho. Tattha
analyzed: paṭipadā eva tasmā tam nayam dassetum tatiyaḥ sabba saṅgāhika vāraḥ api niddiṭṭhaḥ tattha
translated: the third section, which includes all, is given in order to show that method. Herein,

original: “avasesā dhammā dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya sampayuttā”ti idaṃ parihāyati. Sesaṃ
analyzed: avasesāḥ dhammāḥ dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya sampayuttā ati idam parihāyati sesam
translated: “The remaining states are associated with the way leading to the cessation of suffering” is excluded. The rest

original: sabbattha sadisameva.
analyzed: sabbattha sadisam eva
translated: is the same in all cases.

original: Tattha aṭṭhaṅgikavārassa “taṇhāya avasesānañca kilesānaṃ pahāna”ntiādīsu pañcasu
analyzed: tattha aṭṭhaṅgika vārassa taṇhāya avasesānam ca kilesānam pahāna nti ādīsu pañcasu
translated: Herein, in the case of the eight-factored section, in the five sections beginning with “The abandoning of craving and of the remaining defilements”

original: koṭṭhāsesu paṭhamakoṭṭhāse tāva sotāpattimagge jhānābhinivese suddhikapaṭipadā, suddhikasuññatā,
analyzed: koṭṭhāsesu paṭhama koṭṭhāse tāva sotāpatti magge jhāna abhinivese suddhika paṭipadā suddhika suñña tā
translated: there are ten methods in each of the first five sections, that is to say, in the five sections on “Resolution in absorption” in the case of the stream-entry path,

original: suññatapaṭipadā, suddhikaappaṇihitaṃ, appaṇihitapaṭipadāti imesu pañcasu vāresu dvinnaṃ
analyzed: suññata paṭipadā suddhika appaṇihitam appaṇihita paṭipadā ti imesu pañcasu vāresu dvinnam
translated: on “The empty purification” and “The purification consisting in emptiness,” on “The desireless purification” and “The purification consisting in the desireless,”🔽on “The signless purification” and “The purification consisting in the signless,” on “The desireless purification” and “The purification consisting in the desireless,” and on “The desireless purification” and “The purification consisting in the desireless.”

original: dvinnaṃ catukkapañcakanayānaṃ vasena dasa nayā honti. Evaṃ sesesupīti vīsatiyā abhinivesesu
analyzed: dvinnam catukka pañcaka nayānam vasena dasa nayāḥ honti evam sesesu pi iti vīsatiyā abhinivesesu
translated: So there are fifty methods in all. And there are twenty methods in each of the remaining twenty-four sections.

original: dve nayasatāni. Tāni catūhi adhipatīhi catugguṇitāni aṭṭha. Iti suddhikāni dve sādhipatī
analyzed: dve naya satāni tāni catūhi adhipatīhi catur guṇitāni aṭṭha iti suddhikāni dve sa adhipatī
translated: There are two hundred methods. These, multiplied by the four Lords, make eight. So there are two pure methods and eight with Lords.

original: aṭṭhāti sabbampi nayasahassaṃ hoti. Yathā ca sotāpattimagge, evaṃ sesamaggesupīti
analyzed: sabbam api naya sahassam hoti yathā ca sotāpatti magge evam sesa maggesu pi iti
translated: Thus there are a thousand methods in all. And as there are in the case of the stream-entry path, so there are in the case of the other paths.

original: cattāri nayasahassāni honti. Yathā ca paṭhamakoṭṭhāse cattāri, evaṃ sesesupīti aṭṭhaṅgikavāre
analyzed: cattāri naya sahassāni honti yathā ca paṭhama koṭṭhāse cattāri evam sesesu pi iti aṭṭhaṅgika vāre
translated: So there are four thousand methods in all. And as there are in the case of the first section, so there are in the other sections. In the eight sections on the eight-factored way

original: pañcasu koṭṭhāsesu vīsati nayasahassāni honti. Tathā pañcaṅgikavāre sabbasaṅgāhikavāre
analyzed: pañcasu koṭṭhāsesu vīsati naya sahassāni honti tathā pañcaṅgika vāre sabbasaṅgāhika vāre
translated: there are twenty thousand methods in the five sections. Likewise in the five- factored way and in the all-inclusive way

original: cāti sabbānipi saṭṭhi nayasahassāni satthārā vibhattāni. Pāḷi pana saṅkhepena āgatā.
analyzed: sabbāni api saṭṭhi naya sahassāni satthārā vibhattāni pana saṅkhepena āgatā
translated: there are altogether sixty thousand methods expounded by the Master. But the text is given in brief.

original: Evamidaṃ tividhamahāvāraṃ pañcadasakoṭṭhāsaṃ saṭṭhinayasahassapaṭimaṇḍitaṃ abhidhammabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: evam idam tividha mahāvāram pañcadasa koṭṭhāsam saṭṭhi naya sahassa paṭimaṇḍitam abhidhamma bhājanīyam
translated: So this threefold great section, adorned with fifteen sections and sixty thousand methods,

original: nāma niddiṭṭhanti veditabbaṃ.🔽Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: nāma niddiṭṭhanti veditabbam  abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā
translated: should be understood to be the “exposition of the Abhidhamma” .🔽The exposition of the Abhidhamma🔽.

original: 3. Pañhāpucchakavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañhāpucchaka vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the questions and answers

original: 215. Pañhāpucchake catunnampi saccānaṃ khandhavibhaṅge vuttanayānusāreneva kusalādibhāvo
analyzed: pañhāpucchake catunnam pi saccānam khandha vibhaṅge vutta naya anusārena iva kusala ādi bhāvaḥ
translated: In the case of the questions on interrogation, the profitable, etc.,🔽state should be understood in the way already stated under the analysis of the aggregates.

original: veditabbo. Ārammaṇattikesu pana samudayasaccaṃ kāmāvacaradhamme assādentassa parittārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: veditabbaḥ ārammaṇa ttikesu pana samudaya saccam kāmāvacara dhamme assādentassa paritta ārammaṇam
translated: In the case of the questions on object, the truth of origination is a limited object for one who delights in the things of the sense sphere,

original: hoti, mahaggatadhamme assādentassa mahaggatārammaṇaṃ, paññattiṃ assādentassa navattabbārammaṇaṃ.
analyzed: hoti mahaggata dhamme assādentassa mahaggata ārammaṇam paññattim assādentassa navattabba ārammaṇam
translated: it is a great object for one who delights in the things of the fine-material sphere, it is an immeasurable object for one who delights in the things of the immaterial sphere, and it is a non-existent object for one who delights in the description.

original: Dukkhasaccaṃ kāmāvacaradhamme ārabbha uppannaṃ parittārammaṇaṃ, rūpārūpāvacaradhamme
analyzed: dukkha saccam kāma avacara dhamme ārabbha uppannam paritta ārammaṇam rūpa arūpa avacara dhamme
translated: The truth of suffering is a limited object when it arises in dependence on things of the sense sphere,

original: ārabbha uppattikāle mahaggatārammaṇaṃ, nava lokuttaradhamme paccavekkhaṇakāle appamāṇārammaṇaṃ,🔽paṇṇattiṃ paccavekkhaṇakāle navattabbārammaṇaṃ. Maggasaccaṃ sahajātahetuvasena sabbadāpi
analyzed: ārabbha uppatti kāle mahaggata ārammaṇam nava lokuttara dhamme paccavekkhaṇa kāle appamāṇa ārammaṇam  paṇṇattim paccavekkhaṇa kāle nava ttabba ārammaṇam magga saccam sahajāta hetu vasena sabbadā api
translated: it is a great object when it arises in dependence on things of the fine-material sphere, it is an immeasurable object when it reviews the nine supramundane states,🔽and it is a non-existent object when it reviews the description. The truth of the path is always

original: maggahetukaṃ vīriyaṃ vā vīmaṃsaṃ vā jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā maggabhāvanākāle maggādhipati,
analyzed: magga hetukam vīriyam vā vīmaṃsam vā jeṭṭhakam katvā magga bhāvanā kāle magga adhipati
translated: the path’s object when it is the path’s conascence cause. But when it is the path’s object as the path’s predominance condition, then it is the path’s object when energy or understanding is prominent in the development of the path.

original: chandacittesu aññatarādhipatikāle navattabbaṃ nāma hoti. Dukkhasaccaṃ ariyānaṃ maggapaccavekkhaṇakāle
analyzed: chanda cittesu aññatara adhipati kāle navattabbam nāma hoti dukkha saccam ariyānam magga paccavekkhaṇa kāle
translated: At the time of the predominance of any one of the kinds of consciousness accompanied by joy, there is no such thing as a “non-cognizable” .

original: maggārammaṇaṃ, tesaṃyeva maggaṃ garuṃ katvā paccavekkhaṇakāle maggādhipati, sesadhammapaccavekkhaṇakāle navattabbaṃ hoti.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇam tesam yeva maggam garum katvā paccavekkhaṇa kāle magga adhipati sesa dhamma paccavekkhaṇa kāle na vattabbam hoti
translated: When the noble disciples review the path, the truth of path is the object of their consciousness. When they review the path as being of great importance, the path is the predominant factor. When they review the remaining dhammas, there is no such thing as a “non-cognizable” .

original: Dve saccānīti dukkhasamudayasaccāni. Etāni hi atītādibhede dhamme ārabbha uppattikāle
analyzed: dve saccāni iti dukkha samudaya saccāni etāni hi atīta ādi bhede dhamme ārabbha uppatti kāle
translated: Two truths: the truths of suffering and of the origin. For these two truths arise with reference to dhammas classified as past, etc.

original: atītādiārammaṇāni honti. Samudayasaccaṃ ajjhattādibhede dhamme assādentassa ajjhattādiārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: atīta ādi ārammaṇāni honti samudaya saccam ajjhatta ādi bhede dhamme assādentassa ajjhatta ādi ārammaṇam
translated: At the time of their arising, they have as their object the past, etc. When one delights in dhammas classified as internal, etc., the truth of the origin has as its object the internal, etc.

original: hoti, dukkhasaccaṃ ākiñcaññāyatanakāle navattabbārammaṇampīti veditabbaṃ. Iti imasmiṃ🔽pañhāpucchake dve saccāni lokiyāni honti, dve lokuttarāni. Yathā ca imasmiṃ, evaṃ
analyzed: hoti dukkha saccam ākiñcaññāyatana kāle navattabba ārammaṇam pi iti veditabbam iti imasmin  pañhāpucchake dve saccāni lokiyāni honti dve lokuttarāni yathā ca imasmin evam
translated: The truth of suffering should be understood as having as its object the non-cognizable at the time of the base of nothingness. Thus,🔽in this question, two truths are mundane, and two are supramundane.

original: purimesupi dvīsu. Sammāsambuddhena hi tīsupi suttantabhājanīyādīsu lokiyalokuttarāneva
analyzed: purimesu pi dvīsu sammāsambuddhena hi tīsu pi suttanta bhājanīya ādīsu lokiya lokuttarān eva
translated: And just as in this question, so also in the first two questions. For the Exalted One has taught the mundane and supramundane dhammas in the three baskets of the Teaching, the Suttanta basket, etc.

original: saccāni kathitāni. Evamayaṃ saccavibhaṅgopi teparivaṭṭaṃ nīharitvāva bhājetvā dassitoti.
analyzed: saccāni kathitāni evam ayam sacca vibhaṅgaḥ api te parivaṭṭam nīharitvā ava bhājetvā dassito ti
translated: The four Truths have been told. So this exposition of the Truths has been given by taking them in this way in three rounds and dividing them up.

original: Sammohavinodanīyā vibhaṅgaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sammoha vinodanīyāḥ vibhaṅga ṭṭhakathāya
translated: The Commentary on the Vibhaṅga that removes confusion

original: Saccavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sacca vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the four truths is ended.

original: 5. Indriyavibhaṅgo
analyzed: indriya vibhaṅgaḥ
translated: The exposition of the faculties

original: 1. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Abhidhamma

original: 219. Idāni tadanantare indriyavibhaṅge bāvīsatīti gaṇanaparicchedo. Indriyānīti paricchinnadhammanidassanaṃ.
analyzed: idāni tad anantare indriya vibhaṅge bāvīsati iti gaṇana paricchedaḥ indriyāni iti paricchinna dhamma nidassanam
translated: Now in the following exposition of the faculties, the first section is the enumeration, which is “twenty-two.” The second section is the definition of the states, which is “faculties.”

original: Idāni tāni sarūpato dassento cakkhundriyantiādimāha. Tattha cakkhudvāre indaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: idāni tāni sarūpataḥ dassento cakkhu indriya nti ādim āha tattha cakkhu dvāre
translated: Now, in order to show them in their individual essences, he said “Eye faculty” and so on. Herein, it causes the act of “ruling” in the eye door,

original: kāretīti cakkhundriyaṃ. Sotaghānajivhākāyadvāre indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti kāyindriyaṃ. Vijānanalakkhaṇe🔽indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti manindriyaṃ. Itthibhāve indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti itthindriyaṃ. Purisabhāve
analyzed: kāreti iti cakkhu indriyam sota ghāna jivhā kāya dvāre indaṭṭham kāreti iti kāyindriyam vijānana lakkhaṇe  indaṭṭham kāreti iti man indriyam itthi bhāve indaṭṭham kāreti iti itthi indriyam purisa bhāve
translated: so it is the eye faculty. It causes the act of “ruling” in the ear, nose, tongue, and body doors, so it is the body faculty. It causes the act of “ruling” in the act of cognizing,🔽so it is the mind faculty. It causes the act of “ruling” in the state of femininity, so it is the femininity faculty. It causes the act of “ruling” in the state of masculinity,

original: indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti purisindriyaṃ. Anupālanalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti jīvitindriyaṃ.
analyzed: indaṭṭham kāreti iti purisa indriyam anupālana lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti jīvitindriyam
translated: so it is the masculinity faculty. It causes the act of “ruling” in the act of guarding, so it is the life faculty.

original: Sukhalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti sukhindriyaṃ. Dukkhasomanassa domanassa upekkhālakkhaṇe
analyzed: sukha lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti sukha indriyam dukkha somanassa domanassa upekkhā lakkhaṇe
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the faculty of pleasure in the sense of the characteristic of pleasure. The faculty of pain is the faculty of pain in the sense of the characteristic of pain. The faculty of joy is the faculty of joy in the sense of the characteristic of joy. The faculty of grief is the faculty of grief in the sense of the characteristic of grief. The faculty of equanimity is the faculty of equanimity in the sense of the characteristic of equanimity.

original: indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti upekkhindriyaṃ. Adhimokkhalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti saddhindriyaṃ.🔽Paggahalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti vīriyindriyaṃ. Upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti
analyzed: indaṭṭham kāreti iti upekkhā indriyam adhimokkha lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti saddhindriyam  paggaha lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti vīriya indriyam upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti
translated: It makes the faculty of pleasure stand out by its characteristic of pleasure. It makes the faculty of pain stand out by its characteristic of pain. It makes the faculty of grief stand out by its characteristic of grief. It makes the faculty of joy stand out by its characteristic of joy. It makes the faculty of equanimity stand out by its characteristic of equanimity.🔽It makes the faith faculty stand out by its characteristic of resolution.🔽It makes the energy faculty stand out by its characteristic of exerting. It makes the mindfulness faculty stand out by its characteristic of establishing.

original: satindriyaṃ. Avikkhepalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti samādhindriyaṃ. Dassanalakkhaṇe🔽indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti paññindriyaṃ. Anaññātaññassāmīti pavatte jānanalakkhaṇe indaṭṭhaṃ🔽kāretīti anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṃ. Ñātānaṃyeva dhammānaṃ puna ājānane indaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: sati indriyam avikkhepa lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham kāreti iti samādhi indriyam dassana lakkhaṇe  indaṭṭham kāreti iti paññindriyam pavatte jānana lakkhaṇe indaṭṭham  kāreti iti dhammānam puna ājānane indaṭṭham
translated: It makes the concentration faculty stand out by its characteristic of non-distraction. It makes the understanding faculty stand out by its characteristic of seeing.🔽It makes the faculty “I shall come to know the unknown” stand out by its characteristic of knowing what is not yet known in the course of the first path.

original: kāretīti aññindriyaṃ. Aññātāvībhāve indaṭṭhaṃ kāretīti aññātāvindriyaṃ.
analyzed: kāreti iti aññindriyam aññātāvībhāve indaṭṭham kāreti iti aññātāvindriyam
translated: It makes the faculty of understanding stand out by its characteristic of knowing again what has been known. It makes the faculty of final knowledge stand out by its characteristic of final knowledge.

original: Idha suttantabhājanīyaṃ nāma na gahitaṃ. Kasmā? Suttante imāya paṭipāṭiyā bāvīsatiyā
analyzed: idha suttantabhājanīyam nāma na gahitam kasmā suttante imāya paṭipāṭiyā bāvīsatiyā
translated: Herein, the “discourse-division” is not included. Why? Because in the texts the twenty-two faculties are given in this order:

original: indriyānaṃ anāgatattā. Suttantasmiñhi katthaci dve indriyāni kathitāni, katthaci
analyzed: indriyānaṃ anāgata ttā suttantasmin hi katthaci dve indriyāni kathitāni katthaci
translated: because the faculties are not yet arisen. For in the sutta the two faculties are stated in some places,

original: tīṇi, katthaci pañca. Evaṃ pana nirantaraṃ dvāvīsati āgatāni nāma natthi. Ayaṃ tāvettha
analyzed: tīṇi katthaci pañca evam pana nirantaram dvāvīsati āgatāni nāma natthi ayam tau ettha
translated: in some three, in some five. But there is no occurrence of twenty-two in unbroken succession. This, firstly, is the method of the commentary.🔽But there is another method, as follows:

original: aṭṭhakathānayo. Ayaṃ pana aparo nayo – etesu hi
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā nayaḥ ayam pana aparaḥ nayaḥ etesu hi
translated: For in these🔽The exposition should be known🔽By meaning, characteristic, etc.,

original: Atthato lakkhaṇādīhi, kamato ca vijāniyā;
analyzed: atthataḥ lakkhaṇa ādīhi kamataḥ ca vijāniyā
translated: By function, classification, and non-classification,

original: Bhedābhedā tathā kiccā, bhūmito ca vinicchayaṃ.
analyzed: tathā ca vinicchayam
translated: And by what is proper to each, and by plane.

original: Tattha cakkhādīnaṃ tāva “cakkhatīti cakkhū”tiādinā nayena attho pakāsito. Pacchimesu🔽pana tīsu paṭhamaṃ ‘pubbabhāge anaññātaṃ amataṃ padaṃ catusaccadhammaṃ vā jānissāmī’ti
analyzed: tattha cakkha ādīnam tāva cakkhati iti cakkhu uti ādinā nayena attho pakāsito pacchimesu  pana tīsu paṭhamam pubba bhāge anaññātam amatam padam catu sacca dhammam vā jānissāmi iti
translated: Herein, firstly, as regards meaning, the eye, etc., are so called with the meaning of seeing, etc., according to the method stated in the Abhidhamma as follows: “The eye sees visible data;🔽The ear hears sounds; the nose smells smells; the tongue tastes tastes; the body feels tangible data; the mind cognizes mental data” .🔽But the meaning of the last three is stated in the sutta itself: “The faith faculty is the non-wavering of consciousness about the profundities of the Dhamma of the noble ones” , and so on.

original: evaṃ paṭipannassa uppajjanato indriyaṭṭhasambhavato ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyanti
analyzed: evam paṭipannassa uppajjanataḥ indriya ṭṭha sambhavataḥ ca anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam
translated: Herein, the first is called the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty because it arises in one who has thus begun to practice for the purpose of knowing the state of peace, which is not yet known, or the four noble truths, which are not yet known, and because it is the forerunner of the faculties.🔽The second is called the “I-shall-come-to-know” faculty because it arises in one who has begun to practice for the purpose of knowing what is still unknown, and because it is the forerunner of the faculties.

original: vuttaṃ. Dutiyaṃ ājānanato ca indriyaṭṭhasambhavato ca aññindriyaṃ. Tatiyaṃ aññātāvino
analyzed: vuttam dutiyam ājānanataḥ ca indriya aṭṭha sambhavataḥ ca aññindriyam tatiyam aññātāvino
translated: The third is called the “I-have-known” faculty because it arises in one who has begun to practice for the purpose of knowing what remains to be known, and because it is the forerunner of the faculties.

original: catūsu saccesu niṭṭhitañāṇakiccassa khīṇāsavasseva uppajjanato indriyaṭṭhasambhavato ca aññātāvindriyaṃ.
analyzed: catūsu saccesu niṭṭhita ñāṇa kiccassa khīṇa āsavassa iva uppajjanataḥ indriya aṭṭha sambhavataḥ ca aññātau indriyam
translated: The faculty of final knowledge is so called because it arises only in those whose cankers are destroyed, who have completed the task of knowing in the four truths, and because it is the source of the eight faculties.

original: Ko panesa indriyaṭṭho nāmāti? Indaliṅgaṭṭho indriyaṭṭho, indadesitaṭṭho indriyaṭṭho,
analyzed: kaḥ pana esa indriya ṭṭhaḥ nāma ati inda liṅga ṭṭhaḥ indriya ṭṭhaḥ inda desita ṭṭhaḥ indriya ṭṭhaḥ
translated: But what is the meaning of “faculty”? The meaning of “sign of lordship,” the meaning of “sign of what is taught by a lord,”

original: indadiṭṭhaṭṭho indriyaṭṭho, indasiṭṭhaṭṭho indriyaṭṭho, indajuṭṭhaṭṭho indriyaṭṭho.
analyzed: inda diṭṭha aṭṭhaḥ indriya ṭṭhaḥ inda siṭṭha aṭṭhaḥ indriya ṭṭhaḥ inda juṭṭha aṭṭhaḥ indriya ṭṭhaḥ
translated: the meaning of “seen by a lord,” the meaning of “taught by a lord,” the meaning of “chosen by a lord.”

original: So sabbopi idha yathāyogaṃ yujjati. Bhagavā hi sammāsambuddho paramissariyabhāvato🔽indo. Kusalākusalañca kammaṃ kammesu kassaci issariyābhāvato. Tenevettha kammasañjanitāni
analyzed: saḥ sabbaḥ api idha yathāyogam yujjati bhagavā hi sammāsambuddhaḥ para missariya bhāvataḥ  indo kusala akusalam ca kammam kammesu kassaci issariya abhāvataḥ tena iva ittha kamma sañjanitāni
translated: All these meanings are applicable here as appropriate. For the Blessed One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is a lord in the sense of supreme ownership.🔽And kamma, whether profitable or unprofitable, is a lord in the sense of ownership over the kamma-process in the sense-world and fine-material world.

original: indriyāni kusalākusalakammaṃ ulliṅgenti. Tena ca siṭṭhānīti indaliṅgaṭṭhena indasiṭṭhaṭṭhena
analyzed: indriyāni kusala akusala kammam ulliṅgenti tena ca siṭṭhāni iti inda liṅga ṭṭhena inda siṭṭha ṭṭhena
translated: So the faculties generated by that kamma are “signs of lordship” in the sense that they are signs of kamma, and they are “taught by a lord” and “chosen by a lord” in the sense that they are taught and chosen by a lord.

original: ca indriyāni. Sabbāneva panetāni bhagavatā yathābhūtato pakāsitāni ca abhisambuddhāni
analyzed: ca indriyāni sabbāneva pana itāni bhagavatā yathābhūtataḥ pakāsitāni ca abhisambuddhāni
translated: And all these faculties have been revealed by the Blessed One as they are, and he has awakened to them,

original: cāti indadesitaṭṭhena indadiṭṭhaṭṭhena ca indriyāni. Teneva bhagavatā munindena kānici
analyzed: ca ati inda desita ṭṭhena inda diṭṭha ṭṭhena ca indriyāni tena iva bhagavatā munindena kānicid
translated: “Indriya” is derived from the word “inda” in the sense of “one who teaches” and in the sense of “one who sees.” Thus the Blessed One, the Sage, has said:

original: gocarāsevanāya, kānici bhāvanāsevanāya sevitānīti indajuṭṭhaṭṭhenapi indriyāni. Apica🔽ādhipaccasaṅkhātena issariyaṭṭhenāpi etāni indriyāni. Cakkhuviññāṇādippavattiyañhi
analyzed: gocara āsevanāya kānici bhāvanā sevanāya sevitāni iti indriyāni api ca  ādhipacca saṅkhātena issariya ṭṭhena api etāni indriyāni cakkhu viññāṇa ādi ppavattiyam hi
translated: “Some are cultivated by the cultivation of the object, and some are cultivated by the cultivation of development.” Thus the faculties are also called “inda” in the sense of “one who is governed.” Furthermore,🔽they are called “indriya” in the sense of “one who has sovereignty” by way of the sovereignty of predominance. For in the occurrence of eye-consciousness, etc.,

original: cakkhādīnaṃ siddhamādhipaccaṃ; tasmiṃ tikkhe tikkhattā mande ca mandattāti. Ayaṃ
analyzed: cakkha ādīnam siddham ādhipaccam tasmin tikkhe tikkhattā mande ca mandattā ati ayam
translated: the predominance of the eye, etc., is established, and in their keenness and dullness, their keenness and dullness. This,

original: tāvettha ‘atthato’ vinicchayo.🔽‘Lakkhaṇādīhī’ti lakkhaṇarasapaccupaṭṭhānapadaṭṭhānehipi cakkhādīnaṃ vinicchayaṃ
analyzed: tau ettha atthataḥ vinicchayo  lakkhaṇa ādīhi iti lakkhaṇa rasa paccupaṭṭhāna padaṭṭhānehi pi cakkha ādīnam vinicchayam
translated: in the first place, is the exposition of the faculties “as to meaning.”

original: vijāniyāti attho. Tāni nesaṃ lakkhaṇādīni heṭṭhā vuttanayāneva. Paññindriyādīni hi
analyzed: vijāniyā ti attho tāni nesam lakkhaṇa ādīni heṭṭhā vutta nayānā iva paññindriya ādīni hi
translated: “As to characteristic, etc.”: the meaning is that one should discern the faculties “as to characteristic, function, etc.” Their characteristics, etc., are given below in the appropriate places.

original: cattāri atthato amohoyeva. Sesāni tattha sarūpenevāgatāni.
analyzed: cattāri atthataḥ sesāni tattha sarūpena iva āgatāni
translated: The four beginning with the faculty of understanding is non-delusion itself. The rest are given there in their individual forms.

original: ‘Kamato’ti ayampi desanākkamova. Tattha ajjhattadhammaṃ pariññāya ariyabhūmipaṭilābho
analyzed: kamataḥ ti ayam pi desanā kkamaḥ uva tattha ajjhatta dhammam pariññāya ariya bhūmi paṭilābho
translated: “As to order”: this is also the order of teaching. Herein, the obtaining of the noble plane is through the full understanding of the internal dhammas.

original: hotīti attabhāvapariyāpannāni cakkhundriyādīni paṭhamaṃ desitāni. So panattabhāvo
analyzed: hoti iti atta bhāva pariyāpannāni cakkhu indriya ādīni paṭhamam desitāni saḥ pana atta bhāvo
translated: “It is” : the eye faculty, etc., which are included in the individual essence are taught first. But that individual essence

original: yaṃ dhammaṃ upādāya itthīti vā purisoti vā saṅkhaṃ gacchati, ayaṃ soti nidassanatthaṃ
analyzed: yam dhammam upādāya itthī iti vā purisaḥ iti vā saṅkham gacchati ayam saḥ ti nidassana ttham
translated: which is the basis for the designation “woman” or “man” is shown by the words “that is this.”

original: tato itthindriyaṃ purisindriyañca. So duvidhopi jīvitindriyapaṭibaddhavuttīti ñāpanatthaṃ🔽tato jīvitindriyaṃ. Yāva tassa pavatti tāva etesaṃ vedayitānaṃ anivatti. Yaṃ kiñci
analyzed: tatas itthi indriyam purisa indriyam ca saḥ duvidhaḥ api jīvitindriya paṭibaddha vutti iti ñāpana ttham  tatas jīvitindriyam yāva tassa pavatti tāva etesam vedayitānam yam kiñci
translated: After that, the femininity faculty and the masculinity faculty, because they are the basis for the designation “woman” or “man.”🔽The life faculty is next, in order to show that both of these are maintained by the life faculty.🔽As long as the life faculty continues, so long do these feelings continue. In order to show that whatever is felt is either pleasant or painful,

original: vedayitaṃ sabbaṃ taṃ sukhadukkhanti ñāpanatthaṃ tato sukhindriyādīni. Taṃnirodhatthaṃ
analyzed: vedayitam sabbam tat sukha dukkham ti ñāpana ttham tatas sukha indriya ādīni tad nirodha ttham
translated: the pleasure faculty, etc., are next.🔽But in order to show that these states are to be developed for the purpose of their cessation,

original: pana ete dhammā bhāvetabbāti paṭipattidassanatthaṃ tato saddhādīni. Imāya paṭipattiyā
analyzed: pana ete dhammā bhāvetabbā ti paṭipatti dassana tham tatas saddhā ādīni imāya paṭipattiyā
translated: the faith faculty, etc., are next.

original: esa dhammo paṭhamaṃ attani pātubhavatīti paṭipattiyā amoghabhāvadassanatthaṃ tato
analyzed: esa dhammo paṭhamam attani pātubhavati iti paṭipattiyā amogha bhāva dassana attham tatas
translated: In order to show that this practice is not fruitless, since this state becomes evident in oneself first by means of this practice,🔽the faculty of final knowledge is next.

original: anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṃ. Tasseva phalattā tato anantaraṃ bhāvetabbattā ca tato
analyzed: anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam tassa iva phala ttā tatas anantaram bhāvetabba ttā ca tatas
translated: And because it is the fruit of that and because it is to be developed immediately after that,

original: aññindriyaṃ. Ito paraṃ bhāvanāya imassa adhigamo, adhigate ca panimasmiṃ natthi kiñci
analyzed: aññindriyam itas param bhāvanāya imassa adhigamaḥ adhigate ca panimasmin natthi kiñci
translated: The last is the faculty of final knowledge.🔽The rest are to be developed. The last is taught as the supreme comfort for one who has reached it and for one who has no more to do.

original: uttari karaṇīyanti ñāpanatthaṃ ante paramassāsabhūtaṃ aññātāvindriyaṃ desitanti ayamettha kamo.
analyzed: uttari karaṇīyanti ñāpana attham ante parama ssāsa bhūtam aññātau indriyam desitam ti ayam ettha kamaḥ
translated: This is the order here.

original: ‘Bhedābhedā’ti jīvitindriyasseva cettha bhedo. Tañhi rūpajīvitindriyaṃ arūpajīvitindriyanti duvidhaṃ hoti. Sesānaṃ abhedoti evamettha bhedābhedato vinicchayaṃ vijāniyā.🔽‘Kiccā’ti kiṃ indriyānaṃ kiccanti ce? Cakkhundriyassa tāva “cakkhāyatanaṃ cakkhuviññāṇadhātuyā
analyzed: bheda abhedā ti jīvita indriyassa iva ca ittha tat hi rūpa jīvita indriyam a rūpa jīvita indriyanti duvidham hoti sesānam abhedo ti evam ettha bheda abhedataḥ vinicchayam  kicca ati kim ce cakkhu indriyassa tāva cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇa dhātuyā
translated: As to classed and unclassed: here the life faculty is classed, for that is twofold as material-life faculty and immaterial-life faculty. The rest are unclassed. This is how the exposition should be known here as to classed and unclassed.

original: taṃsampayuttakānañca dhammānaṃ indriyapaccayena paccayo”ti vacanato yaṃ taṃ indriyapaccayabhāvena
analyzed: tad sampayuttakānam ca dhammānam indriya paccayena paccayo ti vacanataḥ yam tam indriya paccaya bhāvena
translated: As to function: what is the function of the faculties? The eye faculty’s function is to serve as a proximate cause for eye-consciousness and for the states associated with it, according to the passage: “The eye base is a condition, as a proximate condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with it” .

original: sādhetabbaṃ attano tikkhamandādibhāvena cakkhuviññāṇādidhammānaṃ tikkhamandādisaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: sādhetabbam attanaḥ tikkha manda ādi bhāvena cakkhu viññāṇa ādi dhammānam tikkha manda ādi saṅkhātam
translated: So the function of the eye faculty is to be a proximate condition for eye-consciousness and for the states associated with it.🔽The function of the ear faculty, etc., should be understood in the same way.

original: attākārānuvattāpanaṃ idaṃ ‘kiccaṃ’. Evaṃ sotaghānajivhākāyānaṃ. Manindriyassa pana
analyzed: idam kiccam evam sota ghāna jivhā kāyānam man indriyassa pana
translated: This is its function. So too with the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: sahajātadhammānaṃ attano vasavattāpanaṃ, jīvitindriyassa sahajātadhammānupālanaṃ,🔽itthindriyapurisindriyānaṃ itthipurisanimittakuttākappākārānuvidhānaṃ, sukhadukkhasomanassadomanassindriyānaṃ
analyzed: sahajāta dhammānam attanaḥ jīvita indriyassa sahajāta dhamma anupālanam  itthi indriya purisa indriyānaṃ itthi purisa nimitta kuttā kappa ākāra anuvidhānam sukha dukkha somanassa domanassa indriyānaṃ
translated: The mind faculty’s function is to dominate associated states. The life faculty’s function is to maintain associated states.🔽The femininity and masculinity faculties’ function is to cause the appearance of the signs of sex and the behaviour of women and men.

original: sahajātadhamme abhibhavitvā yathāsakaṃ oḷārikākārānupāpanaṃ, upekkhindriyassa santapaṇītamajjhattākārānupāpanaṃ,
analyzed: sahajāta dhamme abhibhavitvā yathāsakam oḷārika ākāra anupāpanam upekkhindriyassa santa paṇīta majjhatta ākāra anupāpanam
translated: The pleasure faculty, etc.’s function is to dominate associated states and to cause the manifestation of their respective gross physical appearance. The equanimity faculty’s function is to cause the manifestation of the appearance of peace, purity, and the middle.

original: saddhādīnaṃ paṭipakkhābhibhavanaṃ sampayuttadhammānañca pasannākārādibhāvasampāpanaṃ,🔽anaññātaññassāmītindriyassa saṃyojanattayappahānañceva sampayuttakānañca tappahānābhimukhabhāvakaraṇaṃ,
analyzed: saddhā ādīnam paṭipakkha abhibhavanam sampayutta dhammānam ca pasanna ākāra ādi bhāva sampāpanam  anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyassa saṃyojana ttaya pahānam ca iva sampayutta kānam ca tad pahāna abhimukha bhāva karaṇam
translated: The faith faculty, etc.’s function is to overcome their opposites and to cause the associated states to possess the aspect of confidence, etc.🔽The “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty’s function is to cause the abandoning of the three fetters and to cause the associated states to face towards their abandoning.

original: aññindriyassa kāmarāgabyāpādāditanukaraṇapahānañceva sahajātānañca attano vasānuvattāpanaṃ,
analyzed: aññindriyassa kāma rāga byāpāda ādi tanu karaṇa apahānam ca iva sahajāta anañca attanaḥ
translated: The final-knowledge faculty’s function is to cause the weakening and abandoning of lust, hatred, and delusion, and to cause the associated states to submit to its control.

original: aññātāvindriyassa sabbakiccesu ussukkappahānañceva amatābhimukhabhāvapaccayatā ca
analyzed: aññātau indriyassa sabba kiccesu ussukka ppahānam ca iva amata abhimukha bhāva paccaya tā ca
translated: The faculty of final knowledge is the abandoning of concern about all duties and the condition for the state of being turned towards the Deathless.

original: sampayuttānanti evamettha kiccato vinicchayaṃ vijāniyā.🔽‘Bhūmito’ti cakkhusotaghānajivhākāyaitthipurisasukhadukkhadomanassindriyāni cettha🔽kāmāvacarāneva. Manindriyajīvitindriyaupekkhindriyāni, saddhāvīriyasatisamādhipaññindriyāni🔽ca catubhūmipariyāpannāni. Somanassindriyaṃ kāmāvacara-rūpāvacara-lokuttaravasena
analyzed: evam ettha kiccataḥ vinicchayam  bhūmito ti cakkhu sota ghāna jivhā kāya etthi purisa sukha dukkha domanassa indriyāni ca ittha  kāmāvacarān eva manindriya jīvitindriya aupekkhindriyāni saddhā vīriya sati samādhi paññindriyāni  ca catu bhūmi pariyāpannāni somanassindriyam kāmāvacara rūpāvacara lokuttara vasena
translated: The faculties are associated with these states. This is how the exposition should be known here “as to function.”

original: bhūmittayapariyāpannaṃ. Avasāne tīṇi lokuttarānevāti evaṃ bhūmito vinicchayaṃ vijāniyā. Evañhi vijānanto –
analyzed: bhūmi ttaya pariyāpannam avasāne tīṇi lokuttarān eva ati evam bhūmitaḥ vinicchayam evam hi vijānantaḥ
translated: As to plane: here the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, femininity, masculinity, pleasure, pain, and grief faculties are only of the sense sphere. The mind faculty, life faculty, and equanimity faculty, and the faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and understanding faculties are included in the four planes. The joy faculty is included in the three planes as the sense-sphere, fine-material, and supramundane kinds. The last three are only supramundane. This is how the exposition should be known here “as to plane.”🔽For one who knows thus🔽The monk who has much thought of this

original: Saṃvegabahulo bhikkhu, ṭhito indriyasaṃvare;
analyzed: saṃvega bahulaḥ bhikkhu ṭhitaḥ indriya saṃvare
translated: And stands restrained in faculty,🔽By understanding of the faculties

original: Indriyāni pariññāya, dukkhassantaṃ nigacchatīti.
analyzed: indriyāni pariññāya dukkhaḥ santam nigacchati iti
translated: He comes to end of suffering.

original: 220. Niddesavāre “yaṃ cakkhu catunnaṃ mahābhūtāna”ntiādi sabbaṃ dhammasaṅgaṇiyaṃ
analyzed: niddesa vāre yam cakkhu catunnam mahābhūtānam ti ādi sabbam dhammasaṅgaṇiyam
translated: In the Description of the faculties in the Description of the Aggregates, etc., the following is said: “The eye faculty is the visible-data base of the four great entities” , and so on.

original: padabhājane vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Vīriyindriyasamādhindriyaniddesādīsu ca sammāvāyāmo
analyzed: pada bhājane vutta nayena iva veditabbam vīriya indriya samādhi indriya niddesa ādīsu ca sammāvāyāmaḥ
translated: In the description of the energy faculty, concentration faculty, etc., right effort,

original: micchāvāyāmo sammāsamādhi micchāsamādhītiādīni na vuttāni. Kasmā? Sabbasaṅgāhakattā.
analyzed: micchā vāyāmo sammā samādhi micchā samādhi iti ādīni na vuttāni kasmā sabba saṅgāhaka ttā
translated: wrong effort, right concentration, wrong concentration, etc., are not mentioned. Why? Because they are included in the others.🔽For the faculties are mentioned here as all-inclusive.

original: Sabbasaṅgāhakāni hi idha indriyāni kathitāni. Evaṃ santepettha dasa indriyāni lokiyāni
analyzed: sabba saṅgāhakāni hi idha indriyāni kathitāni evam dasa indriyāni lokiyāni
translated: When that is so, here ten faculties are mundane,

original: kāmāvacarāneva, tīṇi lokuttarāni, nava lokiyalokuttaramissakānīti.
analyzed: tīṇi lokuttarāni nava lokiya lokuttara missakāni iti
translated: belonging to the sense sphere only; three are supramundane; nine are mixed mundane and supramundane.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Abhidhamma basket.

original: 2. Pañhāpucchakavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañhāpucchaka vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the questions

original: 221. Pañhāpucchake sabbesampi indriyānaṃ kusalādivibhāgo pāḷinayānusāreneva veditabbo.🔽223. Ārammaṇattikesu pana sattindriyā anārammaṇāti cakkhusotaghānajivhākāyaitthipurisindriyāni
analyzed: pañhāpucchake sabbesam pi indriyānam kusala ādi vibhāgaḥ pāḷi naya anusārena iva veditabbo  ārammaṇa attikesu pana satti indriyāḥ anārammaṇā ti cakkhu sota ghāna jivhā kāya etthi purisa indriyāni
translated: In the questions, the classification of all the faculties as profitable, etc., should be understood according to the method of the texts.🔽As regards the questions on objects, the statement “Seven faculties have no object”🔽refers to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, femininity, and masculinity faculties.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Jīvitindriyaṃ pana arūpamissakattā idha anābhaṭṭhaṃ. Dvindriyāti
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam jīvita indriyam pana arūpa missaka ttā idha an ābhaṭṭham dvi indriya ti
translated: But the life faculty is not mentioned here because it is not classed as material.

original: dve indriyā; sukhadukkhadvayaṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. Tañhi ekantaparittārammaṇaṃ. Domanassindriyaṃ🔽siyā parittārammaṇaṃ, siyā mahaggatārammaṇanti kāmāvacaradhamme ārabbha pavattikāle
analyzed: dve indriyā sukha dukkha dvayam sandhāya itam vuttam tat hi ekanta paritta ārammaṇam domanassindriyam  siyā paritta ārammaṇam siyā mahaggata ārammaṇam ti kāmāvacara dhamme ārabbha pavatti kāle
translated: Two faculties are limited in scope, namely, pleasure and pain. This is said with reference to the two kinds of limited objects. The faculty of grief🔽is sometimes limited in scope and sometimes exalted in scope. When it occurs with reference to sense-sphere states,

original: parittārammaṇaṃ hoti, rūpāvacarārūpāvacare pana ārabbha pavattikāle mahaggatārammaṇaṃ,
analyzed: paritta ārammaṇam hoti rūpāvacara arūpāvacare pana ārabbha pavatti kāle mahaggata ārammaṇam
translated: it is limited in scope; when it occurs with reference to fine-material and immaterial states, it is exalted in scope.

original: paṇṇattiṃ ārabbha pavattikāle navattabbārammaṇaṃ. Navindriyā siyā parittārammaṇāti🔽manindriyajīvitindriyasomanassindriyaupekkhindriyāni ceva saddhādipañcakañca sandhāya
analyzed: paṇṇattim ārabbha pavatti kāle navattabba ārammaṇam nava indriyā siyā paritta ārammaṇā ati  manindriya jīvitindriya somanassindriya aupekkhindriyāni ca iva saddhā ādi pañcakam ca sandhāya
translated: When it occurs with reference to the expression of those states, it is not classifiable as either. Nine faculties are sometimes limited in scope and sometimes exalted in scope.🔽This is said with reference to the mind faculty, the life faculty, the faculties of joy, pleasure, and equanimity, and the five beginning with faith.

original: idaṃ vuttaṃ. Jīvitindriyañhi rūpamissakattā anārammaṇesu rūpadhammesu saṅgahitampi
analyzed: idam vuttam jīvita indriyam hi rūpa missaka ttā anārammaṇesu rūpa dhammesu saṅgahitam pi
