original: “Akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṃ cakkhuviññāṇaṃ uppannaṃ hoti. Tathā sotaghānajivhākāyaviññāṇaṃ, vipākā manodhātu, vipākā manoviññāṇadhātu uppannā hotī”ti.
analyzed: akusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākam cakkhu viññāṇam uppannam hoti tathā sota ghāna jivhā kāya viññāṇam vipākā manaḥ dhātu vipākā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu uppannā hoti iti
translated: “Because of the doing and the storing up of unprofitable action, eye-consciousness has arisen … ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-consciousness have arisen. The resultant mind element and the resultant mind-consciousness element have arisen” .

original: Āneñjābhisaṅkhārapaccayā pana cattāri arūpavipākānīti evaṃ catubbidhaṃ viññāṇaṃ hotīti. Yathāha –🔽“Tasseva arūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa katattā upacitattā vipākaṃ sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ🔽samatikkamā ākāsānañcāyatanasaññāsahagataṃ…pe… viññāṇañcāyatanasaññāsahagataṃ…pe…
analyzed: āneñja abhisaṅkhāra paccayā pana cattāri arūpa vipākāni iti evam catubbidham viññāṇam hoti iti yathā āha  tassa iva arūpāvacarassa kusalassa kammassa kata ttā upacita ttā vipākam sabbaso rūpa saññānam  samatikkamā ākāsānañcāyatana saññā sahagatam pe viññāṇañcāyatana saññā sahagatam pe
translated: But with the inoperative formations as condition there are four kinds of immaterial resultant consciousness, so there are four kinds of consciousness. As it is said:

original: ākiñcaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṃ…pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṃ sukhassa ca🔽pahānā…pe… catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharatī”ti.
analyzed: ākiñcañña āyatana saññā sahagatam pe nevasaññānāsaññāyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca  pahāna āpe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati iti
translated: “Because of the doing and the storing up of that same profitable action of the immaterial sphere, with the complete surmounting of perceptions of material form … he enters upon and dwells in the base consisting of boundless space … the base consisting of boundless consciousness … the base consisting of nothingness … the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception” .

original: Evaṃ yaṃ saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ hoti, taṃ ñatvā idānissa evaṃ pavatti veditabbā
analyzed: evam yam saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇam hoti tam ñatvā idānissa evam pavatti veditabbā
translated: So when it is said that “consciousness is with formations as condition,” this should be understood to apply to the four kinds of consciousness.🔽Now, when it has occurred thus,

original: – sabbameva hi idaṃ pavattipaṭisandhivasena dvidhā pavattati. Tattha dve pañcaviññāṇāni,
analyzed: sabbam eva hi idam pavatti paṭisandhi vasena dvidhā pavattati tattha dve pañca viññāṇāni
translated: For all these are twofold in occurrence as rebirth-linking and as life-continuum. Herein, the two sets of five consciousnesses,

original: dve manodhātuyo, somanassasahagatāhetukamanoviññāṇadhātūti imāni terasa pañcavokārabhave🔽pavattiyaṃyeva pavattanti. Sesāni ekūnavīsati tīsu bhavesu yathānurūpaṃ pavattiyampi
analyzed: dve manaḥ dhātuyo somanassa sahagatā ahetuka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātū ti imāni terasa pañca vokāra bhave  pavattiyam yeva pavattanti sesāni ekūnavīsati tīsu bhavesu yathānurūpam pavattiyam pi
translated: the two mind elements, and the profitable mind element accompanied by joy are the thirteen that occur only in the five-constituent kind of becoming.

original: paṭisandhiyampi pavattanti.🔽Kathaṃ? Kusalavipākāni tāva cakkhuviññāṇādīni pañca kusalavipākena vā akusalavipākena🔽vā nibbattassa yathākkamaṃ paripākamupagatindriyassa cakkhādīnaṃ āpāthagataṃ iṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: paṭisandhiyam pi pavattanti  katham kusala vipākāni tāva cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni pañca kusala vipākena vā akusala vipākena  vā nibbattassa yathākkamam paripākam upagati indriyassa cakkha ādīnam āpātha gatam iṭṭham
translated: The remaining nineteen occur in the three kinds of becoming, in the kinds with five constituents and four constituents, as rebirth-linking and in the course of an existence according to the kind of becoming.

original: vā iṭṭhamajjhattaṃ vā rūpādiārammaṇaṃ ārabbha cakkhādipasādaṃ nissāya dassanasavanaghāyanasāyanaphusanakiccaṃ
analyzed: vā iṭṭha majjhattam vā rūpa ādi ārammaṇam ārabbha cakkha ādi pasādam nissāya dassana savana ghāyana sāyana phusana kiccaṃ
translated: How? First, the five profitable resultant and unprofitable resultant eye- consciousnesses, etc., occur in one who has been reborn in a five-constituent becoming or a four-constituent becoming, according as the case may be, in the course of an existence, having a desirable, undesirable, or neutral function respectively, according as the object is a desirable visible datum, etc., or an undesirable one, etc., or neither, in dependence on the eye sensitivity, etc., that have reached maturity through the profitable or unprofitable resultant root causes.🔽And likewise the five unprofitable resultant eye-consciousness, etc. But only the desirable and neutral objects are for the profitable resultant eye-consciousness, etc.;

original: sādhayamānāni pavattanti. Tathā akusalavipākāni pañca. Kevalañhi tesaṃ aniṭṭhaṃ aniṭṭhamajjhattaṃ
analyzed: sādhayamānāni pavattanti tathā akusala vipākāni pañca kevalam hi tesam aniṭṭham aniṭṭham ajjhattam
translated: the undesirable ones are not.

original: vā rūpādiārammaṇaṃ hoti, ayameva viseso. Dasāpi cetāni niyatadvārārammaṇavatthuṭṭhānāni
analyzed: vā rūpa ādi ārammaṇam hoti ayam eva visesaḥ dasā api cetāni niyata dvāra ārammaṇa vatthu ṭṭhānāni
translated: And these ten are limited as to door, object, physical basis, and location,

original: niyatakiccāneva ca bhavanti.🔽Tato kusalavipākānaṃ cakkhuviññāṇādīnaṃ anantaraṃ kusalavipākamanodhātu tesaññeva
analyzed: ca bhavanti  tatas kusala vipākānam cakkhu viññāṇa ādīnam anantaram kusala vipāka manaḥ dhātu tesaññeva
translated: and they are limited as to function.

original: ārammaṇamārabbha hadayavatthuṃ nissāya sampaṭicchanakiccaṃ sādhayamānā pavattati.
analyzed: ārammaṇam ārabbha hadaya vatthum nissāya sampaṭicchana kiccam sādhayamānā pavattati
translated: Then next to the profitable resultant eye-consciousness, etc., the profitable resultant mind element occurs making the function of receiving with the heart- basis as physical basis and having as its object the same kind of object as that of the preceding kind of consciousness.🔽Next to the unprofitable resultant kinds, the unprofitable resultant mind element occurs in the same way.

original: Tathā akusalavipākānaṃ anantaraṃ akusalavipākā. Idañca pana dvayaṃ aniyatadvārārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: tathā akusala vipākānam anantaram akusala vipākāḥ idam ca pana dvayam aniyata dvāra ārammaṇam
translated: But this pair is limited as to physical basis and location,

original: niyatavatthuṭṭhānaṃ niyatakiccañca hoti.🔽Somanassasahagatā pana ahetukamanoviññāṇadhātu kusalavipākamanodhātuyā anantaraṃ
analyzed: niyata vatthu ṭṭhānam niyata kiccam ca hoti  somanassa sahagatā pana ahetuka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu kusala vipāka manaḥ dhātuyāḥ anantaram
translated: and it is limited as to function.🔽Next to the profitable resultant mind element accompanied by joy, the unprofitable resultant mind element accompanied by equanimity occurs making the function of determining with the heart-basis as physical basis and having as its object the same kind of object as that of the preceding kind of consciousness.

original: tassā eva ārammaṇaṃ ārabbha hadayavatthuṃ nissāya santīraṇakiccaṃ sādhayamānā ca
analyzed: tassāḥ eva ārammaṇam ārabbha hadaya vatthum nissāya santīraṇa kiccam sādhayamānā ca
translated: And it occurs

original: chasu dvāresu balavārammaṇe kāmāvacarasattānaṃ yebhuyyena lobhasampayuttajavanāvasāne
analyzed: chasu dvāresu balava ārammaṇe kāmāvacara sattānam yebhuyyena lobha sampayutta javana avasāne
translated: in the six doors at the end of the impulsions associated with greed in the majority of cases in sense-sphere beings when there is a strong object.

original: bhavaṅgavīthiṃ pacchinditvā javanena gahitārammaṇe tadārammaṇavasena ca sakiṃ vā🔽dvikkhattuṃ vā pavattati. Cittappavattigaṇanāyaṃ pana sabbadvāresu tadārammaṇe dve🔽eva cittavārā āgatā. Idaṃ pana cittaṃ tadārammaṇanti ca piṭṭhibhavaṅganti cāti dve
analyzed: bhavaṅga vīthim pacchinditvā javanena gahita ārammaṇe tad ārammaṇa vasena ca sakim vā  dvi kkhattum vā pavattati citta ppavatti gaṇanāyam pana sabba dvāresu tad ārammaṇe dve  eva citta vārāḥ āgatāḥ idam pana cittam tad ārammaṇanti ca ca ati dve
translated: It occurs once or twice by way of the registration of the object apprehended by the impulsion. But in the counting of the occurrences of consciousness, only two occurrences of consciousness are given for the registration at the six doors.

original: nāmāni labhati, aniyatadvārārammaṇaṃ niyatavatthukaṃ aniyataṭṭhānakiccañca hotīti.
analyzed: nāmāni labhati aniyata dvāra ārammaṇam niyata vatthukam aniyata ṭṭhāna kiccam ca hoti iti
translated: This consciousness is given two names, namely, “registration” and “reviving consciousness.” It has an unspecified door and object, a specified physical basis, and an unspecified location and function.

original: Evaṃ tāva terasa pañcavokārabhave pavattiyaṃyeva pavattantīti veditabbāni. Sesesu
analyzed: evam tāva terasa pañcavokāra bhave pavattiyam yeva pavattanti iti veditabbāni sesesu
translated: Thus these should be understood to occur only in the occurrence of the thirteen kinds of consciousness in the five-door process.

original: ekūnavīsatiyā cittesu na kiñci attano anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā na pavattati.
analyzed: ekūnavīsatiyā cittesu na kiñci attanaḥ anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā na pavattati
translated: But in the remaining nineteen kinds of consciousness there is none that does not occur as a rebirth-linking in accordance with its kind.

original: Pavattiyaṃ pana kusalākusalavipākā tāva dve ahetukamanoviññāṇadhātuyo pañcadvāre🔽kusalākusalavipākamanodhātūnaṃ anantaraṃ santīraṇakiccaṃ, chasu dvāresu pubbe vuttanayeneva
analyzed: pavattiyam pana kusala akusala vipākā tāva dve ahetuka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyo pañca dvāre 🔽kusala akusala vipāka manaḥ dhātūnam anantaram santīraṇa kiccam chasu dvāresu pubbe vutta nayena iva
translated: As regards occurrence, however, the two kinds of sense-sphere profitable and unprofitable resultant consciousness without root-cause occur in the five doors🔽after the profitable and unprofitable resultant eye-, ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness. The function of investigating is present in them. In the six doors they occur in the way already stated .

original: tadārammaṇakiccaṃ, attanā dinnapaṭisandhito uddhaṃ asati bhavaṅgupacchedake cittuppāde🔽bhavaṅgakiccaṃ, ante cutikiccañcāti cattāri kiccāni sādhayamānā niyatavatthukā aniyatadvārārammaṇaṭṭhānakiccā hutvā pavattanti.
analyzed: tad ārammaṇa kiccam attanā dinna paṭisandhitaḥ asati bhavaṅga upacchedake cittuppāde  bhavaṅga kiccam ante cuti kiccam ca ati cattāri kiccāni sādhayamānāḥ niyata vatthukāḥ aniyata dvāra ārammaṇa ṭṭhāna kiccāḥ hutvā pavattanti
translated: The function of adverting is the function of adverting to an object that has come into focus in the six doors.🔽The function of registering is the function of registering the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of receiving is the function of receiving the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of investigating is the function of investigating the object of the five consciousnesses.

original: Aṭṭha kāmāvacarasahetukacittāni pavattiyaṃ vuttanayeneva chasu dvāresu tadārammaṇakiccaṃ,
analyzed: aṭṭha kāmāvacara sa hetuka cittāni pavattiyam vutta nayena iva chasu dvāresu tad ārammaṇa kiccam
translated: The function of determining is the function of determining the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of impulsion is the function of impulsion of the five consciousnesses.

original: attanā dinnapaṭisandhito uddhaṃ asati bhavaṅgupacchedake cittuppāde bhavaṅgakiccaṃ,🔽ante cutikiccañcāti tīṇi kiccāni sādhayamānāni niyatavatthukāni aniyatadvārārammaṇaṭṭhānakiccāni hutvā pavattanti.🔽Pañca rūpāvacarāni cattāri ca arūpāvacarāni attanā dinnapaṭisandhito uddhaṃ asati
analyzed: attanā dinna paṭisandhitaḥ asati bhavaṅga upacchedake cittuppāde bhavaṅga kiccam  ante cuti kiccam ca ati tīṇi kiccāni sādhayamānāni niyata vatthukāni aniyata dvāra ārammaṇa ṭṭhāna kiccāni hutvā pavattanti  pañca rūpāvacarāni cattāri ca arūpāvacarāni attanā dinna paṭisandhitaḥ
translated: The function of javana is the function of impulsion of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of registration is the function of registering the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of rebirth-linking is the function of rebirth-linking in the five doors and the mind door.🔽The function of life-continuum is the function of life-continuum in the mind door.🔽The function of death is the function of death in the mind door.🔽The function of object-determining is the function of determining the object as the object of the life-continuum, which occurs in the six doors, and the function of determining the object as the object of adverting, which occurs in the mind door only.🔽The function of adverting is the function of adverting to an object that has come into focus in the six doors.🔽The function of registering is the function of registering the object of the five consciousnesses.

original: bhavaṅgupacchedake cittuppāde bhavaṅgakiccaṃ, ante cutikiccañcāti kiccadvayaṃ sādhayamānāni
analyzed: bhavaṅga upacchedake cittuppāde bhavaṅga kiccam ante cuti kiccañca ati kicca dvayam sādhayamānāni
translated: The function of receiving is the function of receiving the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of investigating is the function of investigating the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of determining is the function of determining the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of impulsion is the function of impulsion of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of javana is the function of impulsion of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of registration is the function of registering the object of the five consciousnesses.🔽The function of rebirth-linking is the function of rebirth-linking in the five doors and the mind door.🔽The function of life-continuum is the function of life-continuum in the mind door.

original: pavattanti. Tesu rūpāvacarāni niyatavatthārammaṇāni aniyataṭṭhānakiccāni, itarāni🔽avatthukāni niyatārammaṇāni aniyataṭṭhānakiccāni hutvā pavattantīti. Evaṃ tāva bāttiṃsavidhampi
analyzed: pavattanti tesu rūpāvacarāni niyata vattha ārammaṇāni aniyata ṭṭhāna kiccāni itarāni  avatthukāni niyata ārammaṇāni aniyata ṭṭhāna kiccāni hutvā pavattanti iti evam tāva bāttiṃsavidham pi
translated: The fine-material-sphere consciousnesses have a fixed physical basis and object, but their location and function are unfixed. The rest

original: viññāṇaṃ pavattiyaṃ saṅkhārapaccayā pavattati. Tatrassa te te saṅkhārā kammapaccayena🔽ca upanissayapaccayena ca paccayā honti.🔽Tattha yānetāni ekādasa tadārammaṇacittāni vuttāni, tesu ekampi rūpārūpabhave tadārammaṇaṃ🔽hutvā na pavattati. Kasmā? Bījābhāvā. Tattha hi kāmāvacaravipākasaṅkhātaṃ paṭisandhibījaṃ🔽natthi, yaṃ rūpādīsu ārammaṇesu pavattiyaṃ tassa janakaṃ bhaveyya. Cakkhuviññāṇādīnampi
analyzed: viññāṇam pavattiyam saṅkhāra paccayā pavattati tatra assa te te saṅkhārā kamma paccayena  ca upanissaya paccayena ca paccayāḥ honti  tattha yāni etāni ekādasa tad ārammaṇa cittāni vuttāni tesu ekam pi rūpa arūpa bhave tad ārammaṇam  hutvā na pavattati kasmā bīja abhāvā tattha hi kāmāvacara vipāka saṅkhātam paṭisandhi bījam  natthi yam rūpa ādīsu ārammaṇesu pavattiyam tassa janakam bhaveyya cakkhu viññāṇa ādīnam pi
translated: have no physical basis. They have a fixed object, but their location and function are unfixed. This is how the thirty-two kinds of consciousness occur in the course of an individual existence with formations as condition. And in this connection those formations are a condition for them in two ways, as kamma condition and decisive-support condition.🔽Herein, of the eleven kinds of resultant consciousness mentioned, not a single one occurs in the fine-material or immaterial kinds of becoming as a rebirth-linking consciousness. Why is that? Because of the absence of the seed. For there is no rebirth-linking consciousness called “sense-sphere resultant” there that could be the progenitor of the kinds of consciousness occurring in the course of an existence in the fine-material sphere, etc., with the fine-material-sphere kinds of materiality, etc., as their object.

original: rūpabhave abhāvo āpajjatīti ce? Na; indriyappavattiānubhāvato dvāravīthibhede cittaniyamato ca.
analyzed: rūpa bhave abhāvaḥ āpajjati iti ce na indriya ppavatti ānubhāvataḥ dvāra vīthi bhede citta niyamato ca
translated: But if that is so, then it follows that eye consciousness, etc., are absent in the fine-material sphere.🔽—Not so, because of the presence of the functioning of the faculties, and because of the restriction of consciousness to the door and to the path.

original: Yathā cetaṃ tadārammaṇaṃ ekantena rūpārūpabhave nappavattati tathā sabbepi akāmāvacare
analyzed: yathā cetam tad ārammaṇam ekantena rūpa arūpa bhave na ppavattati tathā sabbe pi akāmāvacare
translated: And just as this is invariably non-existent in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming, so too all the kinds of sense-desire element are invariably non-existent in the immaterial kinds of becoming.

original: dhamme nānubandhati. Kasmā? Ajanakattā ceva janakassa ca asadisattā. Tañhi yathā🔽nāma gehā nikkhamitvā bahi gantukāmo taruṇadārako attano janakaṃ pitaraṃ vā aññaṃ
analyzed: dhamme na anubandhati kasmai ajanaka ttā ca iva janakassa ca asadisa ttā tat hi yathā  nāma gehā nikkhamitvā bahi gantu kāmo taruṇa dārakaḥ attanaḥ janakam pitaram vā aññam
translated: And just as this does not occur in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming, so too it does not occur in any of the states of consciousness and consciousness-concomitants that are not of the sense sphere.

original: vā pitusadisaṃ hitakāmaṃ ñātiṃ aṅguliyaṃ gahetvā anubandhati, na aññaṃ rājapurisādiṃ,🔽tathā etampi bhavaṅgārammaṇato bahi nikkhamitukāmaṃ sabhāgatāya attano janakaṃ pitaraṃ
analyzed: vā pitu sadisam hita kāmam ñātim aṅguliyam gahetvā anubandhati na aññam rāja purisa ādiṃ  tathā etam pi bhavaṅga ārammaṇataḥ bahi nikkhamitu kāmam sabhā gatāya attanaḥ janakam pitaram
translated: Why not? Because they are not its progenitor, and because it is unlike its progenitor. For just as a young child who wants to go out of the house and play in the street takes hold of his father or some other affectionate person who is a helper and protector, and follows after him, and does not do so in the case of a stranger such as a king’s officer,

original: vā pitusadisaṃ vā kāmāvacarajavanameva anubandhati, na aññaṃ mahaggataṃ anuttaraṃ vā.🔽Yathā cetaṃ mahaggatalokuttare dhamme nānubandhati, tathā yadā ete kāmāvacaradhammāpi
analyzed: vā pitu sadisam vā kāmāvacara javanam eva anubandhati na aññam mahaggatam anuttaram vā  yathā ca itam mahaggata lokuttare dhamme na anubandhati tathā yadā ete kāmāvacara dhammā api
translated: so too this mind-door adverting, which wants to go out of the range of the life-continuum and play in the street of the sense doors, follows after the consciousness that is its progenitor, which is of the sense sphere and similar to itself, and does not do so in the case of the other kinds of consciousness, which are of the fine-material and immaterial spheres and are not similar to itself.

original: mahaggatārammaṇā hutvā pavattanti tadā tepi nānubandhati. Kasmā? Aparicitadesattā
analyzed: mahaggata ārammaṇāḥ hutvā pavattanti tadā te pi na anubandhati kasmai a paricita desa ttā
translated: And just as this does not follow after states of the fine-material and immaterial spheres, so too it does not follow after the states of the sense sphere when these occur with a fine-material or immaterial object. Why not? Because they are unfamiliar territory.

original: accantaparittārammaṇattā ca. Tañhi yathā pitaraṃ vā pitusadisaṃ vā ñātiṃ anubandhantopi
analyzed: ca tat hi yathā pitaram vā pitu sadisam vā ñātim anubandhantaḥ api
translated: and because it has a very limited object. For just as a young child, though following a father or a paternal uncle,

original: taruṇadārako gharadvāraantaravīthicatukkādimhi pariciteyeva dese anubandhati, na
analyzed: taruṇa dārakaḥ dese anubandhati na
translated: follows him only within the range of what is familiar to him, such as the door of the house, the yard, the street, the neighbourhood, and does not

original: araññaṃ vā yuddhabhūmiṃ vā gacchantaṃ; evaṃ kāmāvacaradhamme anubandhantampi amahaggatādimhi
analyzed: araññam vā yuddha bhūmim vā gacchantam evam kāmāvacara dhamme anubandhantam pi a mahaggata ādimhi
translated: follow him when he goes to the forest or to the battlefield, so too, though this consciousness follows the states of the sense sphere, it does so only

original: pariciteyeva dese pavattamāne dhamme anubandhati, na mahaggatalokuttaradhamme ārabbha pavattamāneti.
analyzed: paricitā iya iva dese pavattamāne dhamme anubandhati na mahaggata lokuttara dhamme ārabbha pavattamānā iti
translated: when they occur in a limited range such as the four mental aggregates, and it does not do so when they occur in the great range of the supramundane states.

original: Yasmā cassa “sabbo kāmāvacaravipāko kiriyamanodhātu kiriyaahetukamanoviññāṇadhātu🔽somanassasahagatā ime dhammā parittārammaṇā”ti evaṃ accantaparittameva ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: yasmā ca ssa sabbo kāmāvacara vipāko kiriya manaḥ dhātu kiriya ahetuka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu  somanassa sahagatāḥ ime dhammā paritta ārammaṇā ti evam accanta parittam eva ārammaṇam
translated: And because it is said that “all resultant consciousness of the sense sphere, and the functional mind element and the functional mind-consciousness element,

original: vuttaṃ, tasmāpetaṃ mahaggatalokuttarārammaṇe kāmāvacaradhammepi nānubandhatīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuttam mahaggata lokuttara ārammaṇe kāmāvacara dhamme pi na anubandhati iti veditabbam
translated: are of limited sphere because they have a very limited object,” it should be understood that it does not follow the states of the sense sphere that have a great or supramundane object.

original: Kiṃ vā imāya yuttikathāya? Aṭṭhakathāyañhi ekanteneva vuttaṃ – ekādasa tadārammaṇacittāni
analyzed: kim vā imāya yutti kathāya aṭṭhakathāyan hi ekantena iva vuttam ekādasa tad ārammaṇa cittāni
translated: Or what is the use of this discussion? For it is stated in the commentaries without reservation that the eleven consciousnesses that have that as their object

original: nāmagottaṃ ārabbha javane javite tadārammaṇaṃ na gaṇhanti. Paṇṇattiṃ ārabbha javane
analyzed: nāma gottam ārabbha javane javite tad ārammaṇam na gaṇhanti paṇṇattim ārabbha javane
translated: do not take up the cognitive series that has name-and-surname as its object. The cognitive series that has the designation as its object

original: javite tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Tilakkhaṇārammaṇikavipassanāya tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati.
analyzed: javite tad ārammaṇam na labbhati ti lakkhaṇa ārammaṇika vipassanāya tad ārammaṇam na labbhati
translated: does not have that as its object. The insight that has the three characteristics as its object does not have that as its object.

original: Vuṭṭhānagāminiyā balavavipassanāya tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Rūpārūpadhamme ārabbha
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā balava vipassanāya tad ārammaṇam na labbhati rūpa arūpa dhamme ārabbha
translated: The powerful insight that leads to emergence does not have that as its object. The cognitive series that has material and immaterial dhammas as its object

original: javane javite tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Micchattaniyatadhammesu tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati.
analyzed: javane javite tad ārammaṇam na labbhati micchat ta niyata dhammesu tad ārammaṇam na labbhati
translated: does not have that as its object. The dhammas that are fixed in wrongness do not have that as their object.

original: Sammattaniyatadhammesu tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Lokuttaradhamme ārabbha javane javite
analyzed: sammatta niyata dhammesu tad ārammaṇam na labbhati lokuttara dhamme ārabbha javane javite
translated: The dhammas that are fixed in rightness do not have that as their object. The cognitive series that has supramundane dhammas as its object🔽does not have that as its object. The cognitive series that has the knowledge of the kinds of extrasensory perception as its object

original: tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Abhiññāñāṇaṃ ārabbha javane javite tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati.
analyzed: tad ārammaṇam na labbhati abhiññā ñāṇam ārabbha javane javite tad ārammaṇam na labbhati
translated: does not have that as its object.

original: Paṭisambhidāñāṇaṃ ārabbha javane javite tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati. Kāmāvacare dubbalārammaṇe
analyzed: paṭisambhidā ñāṇam ārabbha javane javite tad ārammaṇam na labbhati kāmāvacare dubbala ārammaṇe
translated: The object of knowledge of the analytical insights is not found in the impulsion that is the basis for the knowledge.🔽The object is not found in the weak object of the sense sphere.

original: tadārammaṇaṃ na labbhati, chasu dvāresu balavārammaṇe āpāthagateyeva labbhati, labbhamānañca
analyzed: tad ārammaṇam na labbhati chasu dvāresu balava ārammaṇe labbhati labbhamānam ca
translated: It is found only when a strong object is present in the six doors. And when it is found,

original: kāmāvacareyeva labbhati. Rūpārūpabhave tadārammaṇaṃ nāma natthīti.🔽Yaṃ pana vuttaṃ “sesesu ekūnavīsatiyā cittesu na kiñci attano anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā
analyzed: kāmāvacareya iva labbhati rūpa arūpa bhave tad ārammaṇam nāma natthi iti  yam pana vuttam sesesu ekūnavīsatiyā cittesu na kiñci attanaḥ anurūpāya paṭisandhiyā
translated: it is found only in the sense sphere. There is no such thing as the object of the analytical insights in the fine-material and immaterial spheres.

original: na pavattatī”ti, taṃ atisaṃkhittattā dubbijānaṃ. Tenassa vitthāranayadassanatthaṃ
analyzed: na pavattati iti tam ati saṃkhitta ttā dubbijānam tena assa vitthāra naya dassana attham
translated: But what was said above, namely, “in the remaining nineteen kinds of consciousness there is no rebirth-linking that is not appropriate to itself” , is difficult to understand because it is too concise. So in order to show the detailed method in this connection,

original: vuccati – “kati paṭisandhiyo? Kati paṭisandhicittāni? Kena kattha paṭisandhi hoti?
analyzed: vuccati kati paṭisandhiyaḥ kati paṭisandhi cittāni kena kattha paṭisandhi hoti
translated: it may be asked: How many kinds of rebirth-linking are there? How many kinds of rebirth-linking consciousness? By what means does rebirth-linking come about?

original: Kiṃ paṭisandhiyā ārammaṇa”nti?
analyzed: kim paṭisandhiyā
translated: What is the object of rebirth-linking?

original: Asaññapaṭisandhiyā saddhiṃ vīsati paṭisandhiyo. Vuttappakārāneva ekūnavīsati paṭisandhicittāni.
analyzed: asañña paṭisandhiyā saddhim vīsati paṭisandhiyaḥ vutta ppakārān eva ekūnavīsati paṭisandhi cittāni
translated: There are twenty kinds of rebirth-linking with the rebirth-linking of the non-percipient beings. There are nineteen kinds of rebirth-linking consciousness of the kinds already stated.

original: Tattha akusalavipākāya ahetukamanoviññāṇadhātuyā apāyesu paṭisandhi hoti, kusalavipākāya
analyzed: tattha akusala vipākāya ahetuka manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā apāyesu paṭisandhi hoti kusala vipākāya
translated: Herein, rebirth-linking in the unhappy destinies is by means of the unprofitable resultant mind-element without root-cause. Rebirth-linking in the happy destinies is by means of the profitable resultant mind-element without root-cause.

original: manussaloke jaccandhajātibadhirajātiummattakaeḷamūganapuṃsakādīnaṃ. Aṭṭhahi sahetukamahāvipākehi
analyzed: manussa loke aṭṭhahi sa hetuka mahā vipākehi
translated: That is to say, in the human world, in the case of the blind, the deaf, the dumb, the insane, the paralysed, the sexless, and so on. Rebirth-linking in the happy destinies of the sense sphere is by means of the eight resultant great primaries with root-cause.

original: kāmāvacaradevesu ceva manussesu ca puññavantānaṃ paṭisandhi hoti, pañcahi rūpāvacaravipākehi
analyzed: kāmāvacara devesu ca iva manussesu ca puññavantānam paṭisandhi hoti pañcahi rūpāvacara vipākehi
translated: That is to say, in the case of the gods and human beings who possess merit. Rebirth-linking in the happy destinies of the fine-material sphere is by means of the five resultant great primaries of the fine-material sphere.

original: rūpībrahmaloke, catūhi arūpāvacaravipākehi arūpaloketi. Yena ca yattha paṭisandhi
analyzed: rūpī brahma loke catūhi arūpāvacara vipākehi arūpa loka iti yena ca paṭisandhi
translated: That is to say, in the case of the Brahmās, etc., in the fine-material world. Rebirth-linking in the happy destinies of the immaterial sphere is by means of the four resultant great primaries of the immaterial sphere. That is to say, in the case of the beings in the immaterial world.

original: hoti, sā eva tassā anurūpapaṭisandhi nāma.
analyzed: hoti sā eva tassā anurūpapaṭisandhi nāma
translated: And the kind of rebirth-linking that occurs in any given case is called its “rebirth-linking appropriate to that.”

original: Saṅkhepato paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti – kammaṃ, kammanimittaṃ, gatinimittanti.🔽Tattha kammaṃ nāma āyūhitā kusalākusalacetanā. Kammanimittaṃ nāma yaṃ vatthuṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhepato paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti kammam kamma nimittam gati nimittam ti  tattha kammam nāma āyūhitā kusala akusala cetanā kamma nimittam nāma yam vatthum ārammaṇam
translated: In brief, rebirth-linking has three objects, namely, kamma, sign of kamma, and sign of destiny.

original: katvā kammaṃ āyūhati. Tattha atīte kappakoṭisatasahassamatthakasmimpi kamme kate
analyzed: katvā kammaṃ āyūhati tattha atīte kappa koṭi sata sahassa matthakasmim pi kamme kate
translated: Herein, kamma is profitable and unprofitable volition that has been stored up. The sign of kamma is the object that is the cause of the volition’s being stored up. Herein, kamma that has been done, even a hundred thousand eons ago, is still a condition for rebirth-linking by means of the sign of kamma.

original: tasmiṃ khaṇe kammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ vā āgantvā upaṭṭhāti.
analyzed: tasmin khaṇe kammam vā kamma nimittam vā āgantvā upaṭṭhāti
translated: At that moment, either kamma or a sign of kamma appears.

original: Tatridaṃ kammanimittassa upaṭṭhāne vatthu – gopakasīvalī kira nāma tālapiṭṭhikavihāre🔽cetiyaṃ kāresi. Tassa maraṇamañce nipannassa cetiyaṃ upaṭṭhāsi. So tadeva nimittaṃ
analyzed: tatra idam kamma nimittassa upaṭṭhāne vatthu gopakasīvalī kira nāma tālapiṭṭhika vihāre  cetiyam kāresi tassa maraṇa mañce nipannassa cetiyam upaṭṭhāsi so tat eva nimittam
translated: Here is an instance of the appearance of a sign of kamma: Gopaka-Sīvalī, it seems, had a shrine built at the Tālapiṭṭhika Monastery.🔽When he lay down on his deathbed, the shrine appeared to him. He took that as the sign of his rebirth,

original: gaṇhitvā kālaṃkatvā devaloke nibbatti. Aññā sammūḷhakālakiriyā nāma hoti. Parammukhaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhitvā kālaṃ katvā deva loke nibbatti aññā sammūḷhakālakiriyā nāma hoti parammukham
translated: and when he died he was reborn in the world of the gods. Another kind of death is called “confused death.”

original: gacchantassa hi pacchato tikhiṇena asinā sīsaṃ chindanti. Nipajjitvā niddāyantassāpi🔽tikhiṇena asinā sīsaṃ chindanti. Udake osīdāpetvā mārenti. Evarūpepi kāle aññataraṃ🔽kammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ vā upaṭṭhāti. Aññaṃ lahukamaraṇaṃ nāma atthi. Nikhādanadaṇḍakamatthakasmiñhi
analyzed: gacchantassa hi pacchatas tikhiṇena asinā sīsam chindanti nipajjitvā niddāyantassa api  tikhiṇena asinā sīsam chindanti udake osīdāpetvā mārenti evarūpe pi kāle aññataram  kammam vā kamma nimittam vā upaṭṭhāti aññam lahukamaraṇam nāma atthi nikhādana daṇḍaka matthakasmin hi
translated: For when a man is dying, they cut off his head from behind with a sharp sword. Also when a man is lying down and dozing,🔽they cut off his head with a sharp sword. They drown him in water. At such a time, too, either kamma or a sign of kamma appears.🔽There is another kind of easy death. For when a man is being executed,

original: nilīnamakkhikaṃ muggarena paharitvā pisanti. Evarūpepi kāle kammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ
analyzed: nilīna makkhikam muggarena paharitvā pisanti evarūpe pi kāle kammam vā kamma nimittam
translated: they kill him by beating him with clubs, by stabbing him with daggers, and by other such means. At such a time, too, kamma or a sign of kamma appears.

original: vā upaṭṭhāti. Evaṃ pisiyamānāya pana makkhikāya paṭhamaṃ kāyadvārāvajjanaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ
analyzed: vā upaṭṭhāti evam pisiyamānāya pana makkhikāya paṭhamam kāya dvāra āvajjanam bhavaṅgam
translated: But when the fly is being crushed in this way, the first adverting at the eye door does not cause the life-continuum to cease;

original: nāvaṭṭeti, manodvārāvajjanameva āvaṭṭeti. Atha javanaṃ javitvā bhavaṅgaṃ otarati.
analyzed: na avaṭṭeti manaḥ dvāra āvajjanam eva āvaṭṭeti atha javanam javitvā bhavaṅgam otarati
translated: it causes only the mind-door adverting to cease. Then the impulsions occur, and after impulsion the life-continuum arises again.

original: Dutiyavāre kāyadvārāvajjanaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ āvaṭṭeti. Tato kāyaviññāṇaṃ, sampaṭicchanaṃ,
analyzed: dutiya vāre kāya dvāra āvajjanam bhavaṅgam āvaṭṭeti tatas kāya viññāṇam sampaṭicchanam
translated: In the second cycle the adverting at the eye door causes the life-continuum to cease; then eye-consciousness, receiving,

original: santīraṇaṃ, voṭṭhapananti vīthicittāni pavattanti. Javanaṃ javitvā bhavaṅgaṃ otarati.
analyzed: santīraṇam voṭṭhapananti vīthi cittāni pavattanti javanam javitvā bhavaṅgam otarati
translated: investigating, and determining occur, and after impulsion the life-continuum arises again.

original: Tatiyavāre manodvārāvajjanaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ āvaṭṭeti. Atha javanaṃ javitvā bhavaṅgaṃ otarati.
analyzed: tatiya vāre bhavaṅgam āvaṭṭeti atha javanam javitvā bhavaṅgam otarati
translated: In the third cycle the adverting at the mind door causes the life-continuum to cease; then the impulsions occur, and after impulsion the life-continuum arises again.

original: Etasmiṃ ṭhāne kālakiriyaṃ karoti. Idaṃ kimatthaṃ ābhataṃ? Arūpadhammānaṃ visayo nāma
analyzed: etasmin ṭhāne kālakiriyam karoti idam kimattham arūpa dhammānam visayaḥ nāma
translated: At this point death occurs. What is the purpose of this? It is to show that the object of immaterial states is

original: evaṃ lahukoti dīpanatthaṃ.
analyzed: evam lahukā ti dīpana ttham
translated: so swift.

original: Gatinimittaṃ nāma nibbattanakaokāse eko vaṇṇo upaṭṭhāti. Tattha niraye upaṭṭhahante
analyzed: gati nimittam nāma nibbattanaka okāse ekaḥ vaṇṇaḥ upaṭṭhāti tattha niraye upaṭṭhahante
translated: The sign of the destiny is a colour that appears in the place where the rebirth-linking will occur. When it appears in hell,

original: lohakumbhisadiso hutvā upaṭṭhāti. Manussaloke upaṭṭhahante mātukucchikambalayānasadisā
analyzed: loha kumbhi sadisaḥ hutvā upaṭṭhāti manussa loke upaṭṭhahante mātukucchi kambala yāna sadisā
translated: It appears like a copper pot. When it appears in the human world, it appears like a bed of lotus fibres in a mother’s womb.

original: hutvā upaṭṭhāti. Devaloke upaṭṭhahante kapparukkhavimānasayanādīni upaṭṭhahanti.
analyzed: hutvā upaṭṭhāti deva loke upaṭṭhahante kappa rukkha vimāna sayana ādīni upaṭṭhahanti
translated: When it appears in the deva world, it appears as a celestial mansion, a bed, etc., made of the pārijāta tree.

original: Evaṃ kammaṃ, kammanimittaṃ, gatinimittanti saṅkhepato paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti.
analyzed: evam kammam kamma nimittam gati nimittan ti saṅkhepato paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti
translated: So there are three objects of the rebirth-linking consciousness in brief: kamma, sign of kamma, and sign of destiny.

original: Aparo nayo – paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti? Atītaṃ, paccuppannaṃ, navattabbañca.
analyzed: aparaḥ nayaḥ paṭisandhiyā tīṇi ārammaṇāni honti atītam paccuppannam navattabbam ca
translated: Another method: Are there three objects of the rebirth-linking consciousness? The past, the present, and the unapprehendable.

original: Asaññīpaṭisandhi anārammaṇāti. Tattha viññāṇañcāyatananevasaññānāsaññāyatanapaṭisandhīnaṃ
analyzed: asaññī paṭisandhi anārammaṇā ti tattha viññāṇañcāyatana nevasaññānāsaññāyatana paṭisandhīnam
translated: The rebirth-linking consciousness of the non-percipient beings has no object. Herein, the rebirth-linking consciousness of the base consisting of boundless consciousness and of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception

original: atītameva ārammaṇaṃ. Dasannaṃ kāmāvacarānaṃ atītaṃ vā paccuppannaṃ vā. Sesānaṃ navattabbaṃ.
analyzed: atītam eva ārammaṇam dasannam kāmāvacarānam atītam vā paccuppannam vā sesānam
translated: has only the past as its object. That of the ten kinds of sense-sphere beings has either the past or the present as its object. That of the rest has the unapprehendable as its object.

original: Evaṃ tīsu ārammaṇesu pavattamānā pana paṭisandhi yasmā atītārammaṇassa vā navattabbārammaṇassa
analyzed: evam tīsu ārammaṇesu pavattamānā pana paṭisandhi yasmai atīta ārammaṇassa vā navattabba ārammaṇassa
translated: But as to the rebirth-linking consciousness occurring with these three objects, that with a past object or with an unapprehendable object

original: vā cuticittassa anantarameva hoti. Paccuppannārammaṇaṃ pana cutticittaṃ nāma natthi.
analyzed: vā cuti cittassa anantaram eva hoti paccuppanna ārammaṇam pana cutti cittam nāma natthi
translated: Or it is next to the death consciousness. But there is no death consciousness with a present object.

original: Tasmā dvīsu ārammaṇesu aññatarārammaṇāya cutiyā anantaraṃ tīsu ārammaṇesu aññatarārammaṇāya
analyzed: tasmai dvīsu ārammaṇesu aññatara ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantaram tīsu ārammaṇesu aññatara ārammaṇāya
translated: So rebirth-linking occurs with one of the three kinds of objects next to death consciousness with one of the two kinds of objects.

original: paṭisandhiyā sugatiduggativasena pavattanākāro veditabbo.🔽Seyyathidaṃ – kāmāvacarasugatiyaṃ tāva ṭhitassa pāpakammino puggalassa “tānissa tamhi🔽samaye olambantī”tiādivacanato maraṇamañce nipannassa yathūpacitaṃ pāpakammaṃ vā🔽kammanimittaṃ vā manodvāre āpāthamāgacchati. Taṃ ārabbha uppannāya tadārammaṇapariyosānāya
analyzed: paṭisandhiyā sugati duggati vasena pavattana ākāraḥ veditabbo  seyyathidam kāmāvacara sugatiyam tāva ṭhitassa pāpa kammino puggalassa tamhi  samaye olambanti iti ādi vacanataḥ maraṇa mañce nipannassa yathā upacitam pāpa kammam vā  kamma nimittam vā manaḥ dvāre āpātham āgacchati tam ārabbha uppannāya tad ārammaṇa pariyosānāya
translated: The way in which it occurs should be understood as follows according to the happy and unhappy destinies.🔽When a person of evil conduct is lying on his deathbed in a happy destiny in the sense-sphere, then, according to the words, “At that time they hang down before him” , etc., either the evil kamma that he has stored up or the sign of it comes into focus in the mind door. Next to the clean cognitive series that arises making that the object,

original: suddhāya vā javanavīthiyā anantaraṃ bhavaṅgavisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā cuticittaṃ uppajjati.
analyzed: suddhāya vā javana vīthiyāḥ anantaram bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam katvā cuti cittam uppajjati
translated: death consciousness occurs making the life-continuum’s objective field its object.

original: Tasmiṃ niruddhe tadeva āpāthagataṃ kammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ vā ārabbha anupacchinnakilesabalavināmitaṃ
analyzed: tasmin niruddhe tat eva āpātha gatam kammam vā kamma nimittam vā ārabbha anupacchinna kilesa bala vināmitam
translated: When that has ceased, either the kamma or the sign of it that came into focus, being brought to mind by the force of defilements that have not been cut off,

original: duggatipariyāpannaṃ paṭisandhicittaṃ uppajjati. Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā
analyzed: duggati pariyāpannam paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati ayam atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā
translated: and the rebirth-linking consciousness that is included in the unhappy destinies arises. This is the next after the death consciousness that has a past object.

original: atītārammaṇā paṭisandhi.🔽Aparassa maraṇasamaye vuttappakārakammavasena narakādīsu aggijālavaṇṇādikaṃ duggatinimittaṃ
analyzed: atīta ārammaṇā paṭisandhi  aparassa maraṇa samaye vutta ppakāra kamma vasena naraka ādīsu aggi jāla vaṇṇa ādikam duggati nimittam
translated: and rebirth-linking consciousness belonging to an unhappy destiny arises. This is rebirth-linking with a past object next to death consciousness with a past object.

original: manodvāre āpāthamāgacchati. Tassa dvikkhattuṃ bhavaṅge uppajjitvā niruddhe taṃ ārammaṇaṃ🔽ārabbha ekaṃ āvajjanaṃ, maraṇassa āsannabhāvena mandībhūtavegattā pañca javanāni,
analyzed: manaḥ dvāre āpātham āgacchati tassa dvi kkhattum bhavaṅge uppajjitvā niruddhe tam ārammaṇam  ārabbha ekam āvajjanam maraṇassa āsanna bhāvena mandībhūta vega ttā pañca javanāni
translated: When another is dying, the sign of an unhappy destiny, such as the appearance of flames of fire, etc., in the hells, etc., comes into focus in the mind door through kamma of the kind already described. After that has arisen twice in the life-continuum and ceased, then, next to the last life-continuum,

original: dve tadārammaṇānīti tīṇi vīthicittāni uppajjanti. Tato bhavaṅgavisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: dve tad ārammaṇāni iti tīṇi vīthi cittāni uppajjanti tatas bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam
translated: three impulsions arise, that is to say, one adverting, five approach impulsions, and two determining impulsions, because the force of the adverting is reduced owing to the nearness of death.

original: katvā ekaṃ cuticittaṃ. Ettāvatā ekādasa cittakkhaṇā atītā honti. Athāvasesapañcacittakkhaṇāyuke🔽tasmiṃyeva ārammaṇe paṭisandhicittaṃ uppajjati. Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā
analyzed: katvā ekam cuti cittam ettāvatā ekādasa cittakkhaṇāḥ atītāḥ honti atha avasesa pañca cittakkhaṇa āyuke  tasmin yeva ārammaṇe paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati ayam atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā
translated: Then, making that same object its object, one death consciousness arises. At this point eleven consciousnesses have elapsed. Then, next to the last death consciousness,

original: paccuppannārammaṇā paṭisandhi.
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇā paṭisandhi
translated: rebirth-linking consciousness arises with the same object that lasted for the five remaining consciousnesses. This is rebirth-linking with a present object next to death consciousness with a past object.

original: Aparassa maraṇasamaye pañcannaṃ dvārānaṃ aññatarasmiṃ dvāre rāgādihetubhūtaṃ hīnārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: aparassa maraṇa samaye pañcannam dvārānam aññatarasmim dvāre rāga ādi hetu bhūtam hīna ārammaṇam
translated: In the case of the other, a sense object that is a cause of lust, etc., comes into focus at the time of death in one of the five doors.

original: āpāthamāgacchati. Tassa yathākkamena uppannavoṭṭhabbanāvasāne maraṇassa āsannabhāvena
analyzed: āpātham āgacchati tassa yathākkamena uppanna voṭṭhabbana avasāne maraṇassa āsanna bhāvena
translated: Then, as the impulsions arise in due order and reach the stage of impulsion that is near to death,

original: mandībhūtavegattā pañca javanāni dve tadārammaṇāni ca uppajjanti. Tato bhavaṅgavisayamārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: mandībhūta vega ttā pañca javanāni dve tad ārammaṇāni ca uppajjanti tatas bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam
translated: they become slower owing to the weakness of the faculties. So only five impulsions and two registration consciousnesses arise.🔽Then, making the object of the life-continuum its object,

original: katvā ekaṃ cuticittaṃ. Ettāvatā dve bhavaṅgāni, āvajjanaṃ, dassanaṃ, sampaṭicchanaṃ,
analyzed: katvā ekam cuti cittam ettāvatā dve bhavaṅgāni āvajjanam dassanam sampaṭicchanam
translated: a death consciousness arises. At this point, two life-continuum consciousnesses, a adverting, b seeing, c receiving,

original: santīraṇaṃ, voṭṭhabbanaṃ, pañca javanāni, dve tadārammaṇāni, ekaṃ cuticittanti pañcadasa🔽cittakkhaṇā atītā honti. Athāvasesaekacittakkhaṇāyuke tasmiṃ yeva ārammaṇe paṭisandhicittaṃ
analyzed: santīraṇam voṭṭhabbanam pañca javanāni dve tad ārammaṇāni ekam cuti cittanti pañcadasa  citta kkhaṇāḥ atītāḥ honti atha avasesa eka citta kkhaṇa āyuke tasmin yā iva ārammaṇe paṭisandhi cittam
translated: d investigating, e determining, f five impulsions, g two registration consciousnesses, h a death consciousness—fifteen consciousnesses🔽have elapsed. Then, in that same object, which has a life span of one remaining consciousness, rebirth-linking consciousness arises.

original: uppajjati. Ayampi atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā paccuppannārammaṇā paṭisandhi. Esa
analyzed: uppajjati ayam pi atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā paccuppanna ārammaṇā paṭisandhi esa
translated: This is rebirth-linking immediately next to death consciousness that has an object of the past.

original: tāva atītārammaṇāya sugaticutiyā anantarā atītapaccuppannārammaṇāya duggatipaṭisandhiyā pavattanākāro.🔽Duggatiyaṃ ṭhitassa pana upacitānavajjakammassa vuttanayeneva taṃ anavajjakammaṃ
analyzed: atīta ārammaṇāya sugati cutiyā anantarā atīta paccuppanna ārammaṇāya duggati paṭisandhiyā pavattana ākāro  duggatiyam ṭhitassa pana upacita anavajja kammassa vutta nayena iva tam anavajja kammam
translated: This is how the mode of occurrence is in the case of rebirth-linking with past and present object next to death consciousness in the happy destinies.

original: vā kammanimittaṃ vā manodvāre āpāthamāgacchatīti kaṇhapakkhe sukkapakkhaṃ ṭhapetvā
analyzed: vā kamma nimittam vā manaḥ dvāre āpātham āgacchati iti kaṇha pakkhe sukka pakkham ṭhapetvā
translated: But when one who is in the unhappy destinies has stored up bad kamma, then either the good kamma or the sign of the good kamma comes into focus in the mind door in the way already described.

original: sabbaṃ purimanayeneva veditabbaṃ. Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya duggaticutiyā anantarā atītapaccuppannārammaṇāya🔽sugatipaṭisandhiyā pavattanākāro.🔽Sugatiyaṃ ṭhitassa pana upacitānavajjakammassa “tānissa tamhi samaye olambantī”tiādivacanato
analyzed: sabbam purima nayena iva veditabbam ayam atīta ārammaṇāya duggati cutiyāḥ anantarā atīta paccuppanna ārammaṇāya  sugati paṭisandhiyā pavattana ākāro  sugatiyam ṭhitassa pana upacita anavajja kammassa tānissa tamhi samaye olambanti iti ādi vacanato
translated: So all should be understood in the way already described, substituting “black” for “white” in the case of the black-&-white mode. This is how the mode of occurrence is in the case of rebirth-linking with past and present object next to death consciousness in the unhappy destinies.

original: maraṇamañce nipannassa yathūpacitaṃ anavajjakammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ vā manodvāre
analyzed: maraṇa mañce nipannassa yathā upacitam anavajja kammam vā kamma nimittam vā manaḥ dvāre
translated: But when one who is in the happy destinies has stored up bad kamma, then either the bad kamma or the sign of the bad kamma comes into focus in the mind door in one who is lying on his deathbed, according as it is said: “At that time it hangs down in front of him” , etc.

original: āpāthamāgacchati. Tañca kho upacitakāmāvacarānavajjakammasseva. Upacitamahaggatakammassa
analyzed: āpātham āgacchati tat ca kho upacita kāmāvacara anavajja kammassa iva upacita mahaggata kammassa
translated: And that is only in the case of stored-up bad kamma of the sense sphere. In the case of stored-up fine-material-sphere kamma,

original: pana kammanimittameva āpāthamāgacchati. Taṃ ārabbha uppannāya tadārammaṇapariyosānāya🔽suddhāya vā javanavīthiyā anantaraṃ bhavaṅgavisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā cuticittamuppajjati.
analyzed: pana kamma nimittam eva āpātham āgacchati tam ārabbha uppannāya tad ārammaṇa pariyosānāya  suddhāya vā javana vīthiyāḥ anantaram bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam katvā cuti cittam uppajjati
translated: but only the sign of the kamma comes into focus.🔽Then, after the pure impulsions that arose making that the object have ceased, death consciousness arises making the life-continuum’s object its object.

original: Tasmiṃ niruddhe tadeva āpāthagataṃ kammaṃ vā kammanimittaṃ vā ārabbha anupacchinnakilesabalavināmitaṃ
analyzed: tasmin niruddhe tat eva āpātha gatam kammam vā kamma nimittam vā ārabbha anupacchinna kilesa bala vināmitam
translated: After that has ceased, rebirth-linking consciousness arises making that same object that had come into focus, that is to say, either the kamma or the sign of the kamma, its object, and it is deflected by the force of defilements that have not been cut off.

original: sugatipariyāpannaṃ paṭisandhicittamuppajjati. Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā
analyzed: sugati pariyāpannam paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati ayam atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā
translated: This is rebirth-linking with a past object next to death consciousness with a past object.

original: atītārammaṇā navattabbārammaṇā vā paṭisandhi.🔽Aparassa maraṇasamaye kāmāvacarānavajjakammavasena manussaloke mātukucchivaṇṇasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: atīta ārammaṇā navattabba ārammaṇā vā paṭisandhi  aparassa maraṇa samaye kāmāvacara anavajja kamma vasena manussa loke mātukucchi vaṇṇa saṅkhātam
translated: Or it is rebirth-linking with a non-existent object next to death consciousness with a past object.

original: vā devaloke uyyānakapparukkhādivaṇṇasaṅkhātaṃ vā sugatinimittaṃ manodvāre āpāthamāgacchati.
analyzed: vā deva loke uyyāna kappa rukkha ādi vaṇṇa saṅkhātam vā sugati nimittam manaḥ dvāre āpātham āgacchati
translated: In another’s case, at the time of death, a sign of a good destination comes into focus in the mind door, either the appearance of a human womb in the human world or the appearance of a heavenly park, palace, etc., according to the kamma done in the sense-desire world that is likely to bear fruit.

original: Tassa duggatinimitte dassitānukkameneva cuticittānantaraṃ paṭisandhicittaṃ uppajjati.
analyzed: tassa duggati nimitte dassita anukkamena iva cuti citta anantaram paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati
translated: Then, after death consciousness, rebirth-linking consciousness arises in the same way as in the case of the bad destination described under §109.

original: Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā paccuppannārammaṇā paṭisandhi.
analyzed: ayam atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā paccuppanna ārammaṇā paṭisandhi
translated: This is rebirth-linking with a present object next to death with a past object.

original: Aparassa maraṇasamaye ñātakā ‘ayaṃ, tāta, tavatthāya buddhapūjā karīyati, cittaṃ
analyzed: aparassa maraṇa samaye ñātakāḥ ayam tāta tavatthāya buddha pūjā cittam
translated: When another is dying, his relatives may say to him, “Dear, this is done for your sake. Be calm,🔽have faith,” and they may present a visible datum as object by means of a garland, flag, banner, etc.,

original: pasādehī’ti vatvā pupphadāmadhajapaṭākādivasena rūpārammaṇaṃ vā dhammassavanatūriyapūjādivasena🔽saddārammaṇaṃ vā dhūmavāsagandhādivasena gandhārammaṇaṃ vā ‘idaṃ, tāta, sāyassu,🔽tavatthāya dātabbaṃ deyyadhamma’nti vatvā madhuphāṇitādivasena rasārammaṇaṃ vā ‘idaṃ,
analyzed: pasādehi iti vatvā puppha dāma dhaja paṭākā ādi vasena rūpa ārammaṇam vā dhamma ssavana tūriya pūjā ādi vasena  sadda ārammaṇam vā dhūma vāsa gandha ādi vasena gandha ārammaṇam vā idam tāta sāyassu  tavatthāya dātabbam deyya dhamman ti vatvā madhu phāṇita ādi vasena rasa ārammaṇam vā idam
translated: or a sound as object by means of the sound of the Dhamma being spoken, or by means of the sound of offerings being made,🔽or an odour as object by means of incense, etc., saying, “Dear, smell this, this is an offering to be given,”🔽or a flavour as object by means of honey, molasses, etc., saying, “Dear, taste this, this is an offering to be given,”

original: tāta, phusassu, tavatthāya dātabbaṃ deyyadhamma’nti vatvā cīnapaṭasomārapaṭādivasena🔽phoṭṭhabbārammaṇaṃ vā pañcadvāre upasaṃharanti. Tassa tasmiṃ āpāthagate rūpādiārammaṇe
analyzed: tāta phusassu tavatthāya dātabbam deyya dhamman ti vatvā cīna paṭa somāra paṭa ādi vasena  phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇam vā pañca dvāre upasaṃharanti tassa tasmin āpātha gate rūpa ādi ārammaṇe
translated: or a tangible datum as object by means of Chinese silk, Kāsi silk, etc., saying, “Dear, touch this, this is an offering to be given.”🔽When that object comes into focus,

original: yathākkamena uppannavoṭṭhapanāvasāne maraṇassa āsannabhāvena mandībhūtavegattā pañca
analyzed: yathākkamena uppanna voṭṭhapana avasāne maraṇassa āsanna bhāvena mandībhūta vega ttā pañca
translated: at the end of the impulsions arisen in due succession, the life-continuum ceases in him, and then either a death consciousness or an adverting consciousness arises.

original: javanāni dve tadārammaṇāni ca uppajjanti. Tato bhavaṅgavisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā ekaṃ
analyzed: javanāni dve tad ārammaṇāni ca uppajjanti tatas bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam katvā ekam
translated: making the life-continuum’s objective field its object,

original: cuticittaṃ, tadavasāne tasmiññeva ekacittakkhaṇaṭṭhitike ārammaṇe paṭisandhicittaṃ
analyzed: cuti cittam tad avasāne tasmin ñeva eka citta khaṇa ṭṭhitike ārammaṇe paṭisandhi cittam
translated: a death consciousness arises. Immediately next to that, on the same object that lasted for one conscious moment,

original: uppajjati. Ayampi atītārammaṇāya cutiyā anantarā paccuppannārammaṇā paṭisandhi.
analyzed: uppajjati ayam pi atīta ārammaṇāya cutiyāḥ anantarā paccuppanna ārammaṇā paṭisandhi
translated: rebirth-linking consciousness arises. This is also rebirth-linking with a present object immediately next to death consciousness with a past object.

original: Aparassa pana pathavīkasiṇajjhānādivasena paṭiladdhamahaggatassa sugatiyaṃ ṭhitassa🔽maraṇasamaye kāmāvacarakusalakamma-kammanimitta-gatinimittānaṃ aññataraṃ pathavīkasiṇādikaṃ🔽vā nimittaṃ mahaggatacittaṃ vā manodvāre āpāthamāgacchati. Cakkhusotānaṃ vā aññatarasmiṃ
analyzed: aparassa pana pathavī kasiṇa jhāna ādi vasena paṭiladdha mahaggatassa sugatiyam ṭhitassa  maraṇa samaye kāmāvacara kusala kamma kamma nimitta gati nimittānam aññataram pathavī kasiṇa ādikam  vā nimittam mahaggata cittam vā manaḥ dvāre āpātham āgacchati cakkhu sotānam vā aññatarasmin
translated: But when someone who has attained exalted consciousness by means of the earth kasiṇa jhāna, etc., and is reborn in a happy destiny,🔽at the time of his death either a sign of sense-sphere profitable kamma or of sense-sphere unprofitable kamma or a sign of the destination comes into focus in the mind door, or else a sign such as the earth kasiṇa, or exalted consciousness, comes into focus. Or else a desirable object that is a cause for the arising of profitable consciousness comes into focus in the eye or ear door.

original: kusaluppattihetubhūtaṃ paṇītamārammaṇaṃ āpāthamāgacchati. Tassa yathākkamena uppannavoṭṭhabbanāvasāne
analyzed: kusala uppatti hetu bhūtam paṇītam ārammaṇam āpātham āgacchati tassa yathākkamena uppanna voṭṭhabbana avasāne
translated: At the end of the process of re-cognizing that object,

original: maraṇassa āsannabhāvena mandībhūtavegattā pañca javanāni uppajjanti. Mahaggatagatikānaṃ
analyzed: maraṇassa āsanna bhāvena mandībhūta vega ttā pañca javanāni uppajjanti mahaggata gatikānam
translated: because of the nearness of death, the force of the impulsions is weak, and five impulsions arise.

original: pana tadārammaṇaṃ natthi. Tasmā javanānantaraṃyeva bhavaṅgavisayaṃ ārammaṇaṃ katvā🔽ekaṃ cuticittaṃ uppajjati. Tassāvasāne kāmāvacaramahaggatasugatīnaṃ aññatarasugatipariyāpannaṃ
analyzed: pana tad ārammaṇam natthi tasmā javana anantaram yeva bhavaṅga visayam ārammaṇam katvā  ekam cuti cittam uppajjati tassa avasāne kāmāvacara mahaggata sugatīnam aññatara sugati pariyāpannam
translated: But those of the fine-material sphere have no registration. Therefore, immediately next to the impulsions,🔽one death consciousness arises with the life-continuum’s objective field as its object. At the end of that,

original: yathūpaṭṭhitesu ārammaṇesu aññatarārammaṇaṃ paṭisandhicittaṃ uppajjati. Ayaṃ navattabbārammaṇāya🔽sugaticutiyā anantarā atītapaccuppannanavattabbānaṃ aññatarārammaṇā paṭisandhi.
analyzed: yathā upaṭṭhitesu ārammaṇesu aññatara ārammaṇam paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati ayam navattabba ārammaṇāya  sugati cutiyāḥ anantarā atīta paccuppanna navattabbānam aññatara ārammaṇā paṭisandhi
translated: a rebirth-linking consciousness occurs with an object of the kind already described, which is included in one of the happy destinies, namely, the fine-material or immaterial divine abodes. This is rebirth-linking with an object that is not past or future but is present.🔽This is rebirth-linking with an object that is either past or present but not future, next to death in the happy destinies with an object that is not past, future, or present.

original: Etenānusārena āruppacutiyāpi anantarā paṭisandhi veditabbā. Ayaṃ atītanavattabbārammaṇāya sugaticutiyā anantarā atītanavattabbapaccuppannārammaṇāya paṭisandhiyā pavattanākāro.
analyzed: etena anusārena āruppa cutiyā api anantarā veditabbā ayam atīta navattabba ārammaṇāya sugati cutiyā anantarā atīta navattabba paccuppanna ārammaṇāya paṭisandhiyā pavattana ākāraḥ
translated: The occurrence of rebirth-linking should be understood in the same way next to death in the immaterial sphere. This is the way in which rebirth-linking occurs with an object that is either past or present but not future next to death in the happy destinies with an object that is not past, future, or present.

original: Duggatiyaṃ ṭhitassa pana pāpakammino vuttanayeneva taṃ kammaṃ kammanimittaṃ gatinimittaṃ
analyzed: duggatiyam ṭhitassa pana pāpa kamminaḥ vutta nayena iva tam kammam kamma nimittam gati nimittam
translated: But when he is in an unhappy destiny, then that kamma or the sign of the kamma or the sign of the destiny appears in the mind door in the way already described under the unprofitable kamma of the kind called “to be experienced in a future state of existence” .

original: vā manodvāre, pañcadvāre pana akusaluppattihetubhūtaṃ ārammaṇaṃ āpāthamāgacchati.🔽Athassa yathākkamena cuticittāvasāne duggatipariyāpannaṃ tesu ārammaṇesu aññatarārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: vā manaḥ dvāre pañca dvāre pana akusala uppatti hetu bhūtam ārammaṇam āpātham āgacchati  athassa yathākkamena cuti citta avasāne duggati pariyāpannam tesu ārammaṇesu aññatara ārammaṇam
translated: But in the five doors the object that is the cause of the unprofitable arising comes into focus.🔽Then, at the end of the consciousnesses of the process of dying, rebirth-linking consciousness arises in him in one of the destinies included in an unhappy destiny, having as its object any one of those objects.

original: paṭisandhicittaṃ uppajjati. Ayaṃ atītārammaṇāya duggaticutiyā anantarā atītapaccuppannārammaṇāya
analyzed: paṭisandhi cittam uppajjati ayam atīta ārammaṇāya duggati cutiyāḥ anantarā atīta paccuppanna ārammaṇāya
translated: This is how rebirth-linking occurs next to death in an unhappy destiny with a past object or with a past and present object.

original: paṭisandhiyā pavattanākāroti. Ettāvatā ekūnavīsatividhassāpi viññāṇassa paṭisandhivasena🔽pavatti dīpitā hoti.
analyzed: paṭisandhiyā pavattanā ākāro ti ettāvatā ekūnavīsatividhassa api viññāṇassa paṭisandhi vasena  pavatti dīpitā hoti
translated: This is how the occurrence of the nineteen kinds of resultant consciousness as rebirth-linking has been demonstrated.

original: Tayidaṃ sabbampi evaṃ –
analyzed: tayidam sabbam pi evam
translated: And all this is as follows:🔽When it occurs in rebirth-linking,

original: Pavattamānaṃ sandhimhi, dvidhā kammena vattati;
analyzed: pavattamānam sandhimhi dvidhā kammena vattati
translated: It does so by two kinds of kamma,🔽And by the mixed and other kinds,

original: Missādīhi ca bhedehi, bhedassa duvidhādiko.
analyzed: missa ādīhi ca bhedehi bhedassa duvidha ādiko
translated: And by the twofold classification of the kind.

original: Idañhi ekūnavīsatividhampi vipākaviññāṇaṃ paṭisandhimhi pavattamānaṃ dvidhā kammena
analyzed: idam hi ekūnavīsatividham pi vipāka viññāṇam paṭisandhimhi pavattamānam dvidhā kammena
translated: For this nineteenfold resultant consciousness occurs in rebirth-linking by two kinds of kamma, namely, by kamma to be experienced here and there , and by kamma to be experienced in some future existence .

original: vattati. Yathāsakañhi etassa janakaṃ kammaṃ nānākkhaṇikakammappaccayena ceva upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: vattati yathāsakam hi etassa janakam kammam nānākkhaṇika kamma ppaccayena ca iva upanissaya paccayena
translated: For the kamma that generates it is a condition for it by way of the various kinds of kamma condition, namely, by way of decisive-support condition.

original: ca paccayo hoti. Vuttañhetaṃ “kusalākusalaṃ kammaṃ vipākassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: ca paccayaḥ hoti vuttam ha etam kusala akusalam kammam vipākassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: For this is said: “Profitable and unprofitable kamma is a condition, by way of decisive-support condition, for its ripening” .

original: paccayo”ti. Evaṃ vattamānassa panassa missādīhi bhedehi duvidhādikopi bhedo veditabbo,
analyzed: paccayaḥ ti evam vattamānassa panassa missa ādīhi bhedehi duvidha ādikaḥ api bhedaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: But when it occurs thus, it should be understood as twofold, etc., according to the divisions of mixed and unmixed, and so on.

original: seyyathidaṃ – idañhi paṭisandhivasena ekadhā vattamānampi rūpena saha missāmissabhedato
analyzed: seyyathīdam idam hi paṭisandhi vasena ekadhā vattamānam pi rūpena saha missā amissa bhedataḥ
translated: For this, although it occurs in one way as rebirth-linking, is twofold as mixed and unmixed with materiality;

original: duvidhaṃ, kāmarūpārūpabhavabhedato tividhaṃ, aṇḍajajalābujasaṃsedajaopapātikayonivasena
analyzed: duvidham tividham aṇḍa ja jalābu ja saṃseda ja opapātika yoni vasena
translated: it is threefold as the kinds of becoming of the sensual-desire, fine-material, and immaterial kinds; it is fourfold as born of an egg, born from the womb, born from moisture, and spontaneous;

original: catubbidhaṃ, gativasena pañcavidhaṃ, viññāṇaṭṭhitivasena sattavidhaṃ, sattāvāsavasena
analyzed: catubbidham gati vasena pañcavidham viññāṇa ṭṭhiti vasena sattavidham sattāvāsa vasena
translated: it is fivefold according to destiny; it is sevenfold according to the seven stations of consciousness ;🔽it is eightfold according to the eight kinds of beings ;

original: aṭṭhavidhaṃ hoti. Tattha –
analyzed: aṭṭhavidham hoti tattha
translated: Herein:🔽Mixed, twofold, by kind of becoming;

original: Missaṃ dvidhā bhāvabhedā, sabhāvaṃ tattha ca dvidhā;
analyzed: missam dvidhā bhāva bhedā sabhāvam ca dvidhā
translated: And there, in essence, twofold too;

original: Dve vā tayo vā dasakā, omato ādinā saha.
analyzed: dve vā tayaḥ vā dasakāḥ omataḥ ādinā saha
translated: Ten times two, or three, with start.

original: ‘Missaṃ dvidhā bhāvabhedā’ti yañhetamettha aññatra arūpabhavā rūpamissaṃ paṭisandhiviññāṇaṃ
analyzed: missam dvidhā bhāva bhedā ati yat ha etam ettha aññatra arūpa bhavāḥ rūpa missam paṭisandhi viññāṇam
translated: ‘With matter, twofold by the difference of presence and absence’ means that the rebirth-linking consciousness with matter here, apart from the immaterial becoming,

original: uppajjati, taṃ rūpabhave itthindriyapurisindriyasaṅkhātena bhāvena vinā uppattito
analyzed: uppajjati tam rūpa bhave itthi indriya purisa indriya saṅkhātena bhāvena vinā uppattitaḥ
translated: arises without the presence called the femininity faculty and the masculinity faculty in the case of the material becoming,

original: kāmabhave aññatra jātipaṇḍakapaṭisandhiyā bhāvena saha uppattito sabhāvaṃ abhāvanti duvidhaṃ hoti.
analyzed: kāma bhave aññatra jāti paṇḍaka paṭisandhiyā bhāvena saha uppattitaḥ sa bhāvam a bhāvanti duvidham hoti
translated: and it arises with the presence in the case of the sense-desire becoming, apart from the rebirth-linking of a hermaphrodite. So it is twofold as to presence and absence.

original: ‘Sabhāvaṃ tattha ca dvidhā’ti tatthāpi ca yaṃ sabhāvaṃ taṃ itthipurisabhāvānaṃ aññatarena saha uppattito duvidhameva hoti.🔽‘Dve vā tayo vā dasakā, omato ādinā sahā’ti yañhetamettha missaṃ amissanti dvaye
analyzed: sabhāvam tattha ca dvidhā ati tattha api ca yam sabhāvam tam itthi purisa bhāvānam aññatarena saha uppattitaḥ duvidham eva hoti  dve vā tayaḥ vā dasakāḥ ādinā saha ati yat ha etam ettha missam dvaye
translated: ‘And twofold there by the presence’ means that there too the presence is twofold as to arising with either the femininity or the masculinity presence.🔽‘Two or three decades with, Or else with one, from the start’ means that the rebirth-linking consciousness with matter here, which is twofold as to presence and absence,

original: ādibhūtaṃ rūpamissaṃ paṭisandhiviññāṇaṃ, tena saha vatthukāyadasakavasena dve vā
analyzed: ādi bhūtam rūpa missam paṭisandhi viññāṇam tena saha vatthu kāya dasaka vasena dve vā
translated: arises with two decades or three decades, from the start, that is, from the beginning, with the matter that is present. For two decades arise with the ten material instances of the physical heart- basis,

original: vatthukāyabhāvadasakavasena tayo vā dasakā omato uppajjanti, natthi ito paraṃ rūpaparihānīti.
analyzed: vatthu kāya bhāva dasaka vasena tayaḥ vā dasakāḥ omataḥ uppajjanti natthi itas param rūpa parihāni iti
translated: and three decades arise with the ten material instances of the physical heart-basis and the ten material instances of the physical sex.

original: Taṃ panetaṃ evaṃ omakaparimāṇaṃ uppajjamānaṃ aṇḍajajalābujanāmikāsu dvīsu yonīsu
analyzed: tam pana itam evam omaka parimāṇam uppajjamānam aṇḍa ja jalābu ja nāmikāsu dvīsu yonīsu
translated: But this, when it arises, is the size of a mere louse’s egg in the two kinds of generation, namely, oviparous and moisture-born.

original: jātiuṇṇāya ekena aṃsunā uddhatatelasappimaṇḍappamāṇaṃ kalalanti laddhasaṅkhaṃ hutvā
analyzed: jāti uṇṇāya ekena aṃsunā uddhata tela sappi maṇḍa ppamāṇam kalalanti laddha saṅkham hutvā
translated: It arises as a glob of semen and blood, the size of a small pea, called “morula,” and it is born in the womb by the force of kamma-resultant temperature.

original: uppajjati. Tattha yonīnaṃ gativasena sambhavabhedo veditabbo. Etāsu hi –
analyzed: uppajjati tattha yonīnam gati vasena sambhava bhedaḥ veditabbaḥ etāsu hi
translated: Herein, the kinds of generation should be understood according to the mode of conveyance. For of these:🔽In hell and among the gods,

original: Niraye bhummavajjesu, devesu ca na yoniyo;
analyzed: niraye devesu ca na
translated: And in the human womb,🔽The first three kinds of generation

original: Tisso purimikā honti, catassopi gatittaye.🔽Tattha devesu cāti casaddena yathā niraye ca bhummavajjesu ca devesu, evaṃ nijjhāmataṇhikapetesu🔽ca purimikā tisso yoniyo na santīti veditabbā. Opapātikā eva hi te honti. Sese pana
analyzed: tissaḥ purimikāḥ honti catassaḥ api gatittaye  tattha devesu ca ati ca saddena yathā niraye ca bhummavajjesu ca devesu evam nijjhāma taṇhika petesu  ca purimikā tissaḥ yoniyaḥ na santi iti veditabbā opapātikāḥ eva hi te honti sese pana
translated: Are found in all three realms.

original: tiracchānapettivisayamanussasaṅkhāte gatittaye pubbe vajjitabhummadevesu ca catasso
analyzed: tiracchāna petti visaya manussa saṅkhāte gatittaye pubbe vajjita bhumma devesu ca catasso
translated: Herein, by the word “and” the three kinds of generation are to be understood as not being in the ghosts who are not partakers of offerings and in the gods of the sense sphere, just as in hell and among the gods of the fine-material sphere. For they are only apparitional. But in the three realms, namely, the animal realm, the ghost realm, and the human realm, and among the gods of the fine-material sphere who have already been mentioned, all four kinds of generation are found.

original: yoniyo honti. Tattha –
analyzed: yoniyaḥ honti tattha
translated: Herein,

original: Tiṃsa nava ceva rūpīsu, sattati ukkaṃsatova rūpāni;
analyzed: tiṃsa nava ca iva rūpīsu sattati ukkaṃsataḥ uva rūpāni
translated: Thirty-nine and also seventy-two,

original: Saṃsedajopapātīsu, atha vā avakaṃsato tiṃsa.🔽Rūpībrahmesu tāva opapātikayonikesu cakkhusotavatthudasakānaṃ jīvitanavakassa cāti
analyzed: saṃseda ja upapātīsu atha vā tiṃsa  rūpī brahmesu tāva opapātika yonikesu cakkhu sota vatthu dasakānam jīvita navakassa ca ati
translated: Or else, thirty, at most, in the case of the spontaneously born.🔽In the case of the form-sphere deities who are apparitional and born of womb generation, thirty-one material instances arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness, that is to say,🔽four sets of ten, namely, the ten beginning with eye, the ten beginning with ear, the ten beginning with visible data, and the ten beginning with sound,

original: catunnaṃ kalāpānaṃ vasena tiṃsa ca nava ca paṭisandhiviññāṇena saha rūpāni uppajjanti.
analyzed: catunnam kalāpānam vasena tiṃsa ca nava ca paṭisandhi viññāṇena saha rūpāni uppajjanti
translated: and the ninefold life faculty. But in the case of the form-sphere deities, apart from the apparitional beings, thirty-seven material instances arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness, that is to say,

original: Rūpībrahme pana ṭhapetvā aññesu saṃsedajaopapātikesu ukkaṃsato cakkhusotaghānajivhākāyabhāvavatthudasakānaṃ
analyzed: rūpī brahme pana ṭhapetvā aññesu saṃseda ja opapātikesu ukkaṃsato cakkhu sota ghāna jivhā kāya bhāva vatthu dasakānam
translated: seven sets of ten, namely, the ten beginning with eye, the ten beginning with ear, the ten beginning with nose, the ten beginning with tongue, the ten beginning with body, the ten beginning with bodily intimation, and the ten beginning with vocal intimation,

original: vasena sattati. Tāni ca niccaṃ devesu. Tattha vaṇṇo gandho raso ojā catasso cāpi🔽dhātuyo cakkhupasādo jīvitindriyanti ayaṃ dasarūpaparimāṇo rūpapuñjo cakkhudasako
analyzed: vasena tāni ca niccam devesu tattha vaṇṇaḥ gandhaḥ rasaḥ ojā catasso ca api  dhātuyaḥ cakkhu pasādaḥ jīvitindriyanti ayam dasa rūpa parimāṇaḥ rūpa puñjaḥ cakkhu dasako
translated: and the ninefold life faculty. And these are always found among the deities. Herein, the ten material instances consisting of the visible-data base, odour, flavour, nutritive essence, and the four primary elements,

original: nāma. Evaṃ sesā veditabbā. Avakaṃsato pana jaccandhabadhiraaghānakanapuṃsakassa jivhākāyavatthudasakānaṃ
analyzed: nāma evam sesāḥ veditabbāḥ avakaṃsataḥ pana jaccandha badhira aghānaka napuṃsakassa jivhā kāya vatthu dasakānam
translated: the eye faculty, and the life faculty, are called the “eye decad.” The rest should be understood in like manner. At least, thirty material instances arise together with the rebirth-linking consciousness in the case of the spontaneously born and the egg-born among the non-percipient deities and the ghosts, and in the case of the womb-born and the moisture-born among the animals and ghosts, that is to say,

original: vasena tiṃsa rūpāni uppajjanti. Ukkaṃsāvakaṃsānaṃ pana antare anurūpato vikappo veditabbo.
analyzed: vasena tiṃsa rūpāni uppajjanti ukkaṃsa avakaṃsānam pana antare anurūpataḥ vikappaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: the seven sets of ten beginning with the eye, and the ninefold life faculty. But the distribution should be understood according to the appropriate mode among those of maximum and minimum.

original: Evaṃ viditvā puna –🔽Khandhārammaṇagatihetu-vedanāpītivitakkavicārehi;
analyzed: evam viditvā punar  khandha ārammaṇa gati hetu vedanā pīti vitakka vicārehi
translated: Having understood thus, he should again understand the difference in the way of entering upon rebirth-linking as follows:🔽By aggregates, object, destiny, cause, feeling, life span,

original: Bhedābhedaviseso, cutisandhīnaṃ pariññeyyo.
analyzed: bheda abheda visesaḥ cuti sandhīnam pariññeyyaḥ
translated: Thought, and speech, and by the difference in the way of entering upon rebirth-linking.

original: Yāhesā missāmissato duvidhā paṭisandhi, yā cassā atītānantarā cuti, tāsaṃ imehi khandhādīhi bhedābhedaviseso ñātabboti attho.
analyzed: yā ha esā missā amissataḥ duvidhā paṭisandhi yā ca assāḥ atīta anantarā tāsam imehi khandha ādīhi bheda abheda visesaḥ ñātabbaḥ ti attho
translated: The meaning is that the difference in the way of entering upon rebirth-linking should be known by these aggregates, etc., in the case of the two kinds of rebirth-linking, mixed and unmixed, and in the case of the death that is next to the past rebirth-linking.

original: Kathaṃ? Kadāci catukkhandhāya āruppacutiyā anantarā catukkhandhāva ārammaṇatopi abhinnā
analyzed: katham kadāci catu khandhāya āruppa cutiyāḥ anantarā ārammaṇataḥ pi abhinnā
translated: How? Sometimes, immediately next to immaterial death that is of the four aggregates, rebirth-linking occurs that is of the four aggregates, and it is undifferentiated from that death by object too.

original: paṭisandhi hoti, kadāci amahaggatabahiddhārammaṇāya mahaggataajjhattārammaṇā. Ayaṃ🔽tāva arūpabhūmīsuyeva nayo. Kadāci pana catukkhandhāya āruppacutiyā anantarā pañcakkhandhā🔽kāmāvacarā paṭisandhi. Kadāci pañcakkhandhāya kāmāvacaracutiyā rūpāvacaracutiyā vā
analyzed: paṭisandhi hoti kadāci amahaggata bahiddhā ārammaṇāya mahaggata ajjhatta ārammaṇā ayaṃ  tāva kadāci pana catu khandhāya āruppa cutiyāḥ anantarā pañca kkhandhā  kāmāvacarā kadāci pañcakkhandhāya kāmāvacara cutiyā rūpāvacara cutiyā vā
translated: Sometimes it is of the exalted kind with an internal object, next to immaterial death that is of the non-exalted kind with an external object.🔽This is the method in the immaterial sphere. Sometimes, immediately next to immaterial death that is of the four aggregates, rebirth-linking occurs that is of the five aggregates in the sense sphere.🔽Sometimes, immediately next to death that is of the five aggregates in the sense sphere or immaterial death, rebirth-linking occurs that is of the four aggregates in the immaterial sphere.

original: anantarā catukkhandhā āruppapaṭisandhi. Evaṃ atītārammaṇacutiyā atītanavattabbapaccuppannārammaṇā
analyzed: anantarā catu khandhāḥ āruppa paṭisandhi evam atīta ārammaṇa cutiyā atīta navattabba paccuppanna ārammaṇā
translated: So too in the case of death that has a past object, next to which there occurs rebirth-linking that has a past, future, or present object.

original: paṭisandhi, ekaccasugaticutiyā ekaccaduggatipaṭisandhi, ahetukacutiyā sahetukapaṭisandhi,
analyzed: paṭisandhi ekacca sugati cutiyā ekacca duggati paṭisandhi ahetuka cutiyā sa hetuka paṭisandhi
translated: rebirth-linking, rebirth-linking in an unhappy destiny from a happy destiny, rebirth-linking with root-cause from rebirth due to no-cause,

original: duhetukacutiyā tihetukapaṭisandhi, upekkhāsahagatacutiyā somanassasahagatapaṭisandhi,
analyzed: du hetuka cutiyā ti hetuka paṭisandhi upekkhā sahagata cutiyā somanassa sahagata paṭisandhi
translated: rebirth-linking with two root-causes from rebirth with three root-causes, rebirth-linking accompanied by joy from rebirth accompanied by equanimity,

original: appītikacutiyā sappītikapaṭisandhi, avitakkacutiyā savitakkapaṭisandhi, avicāracutiyā
analyzed: appītika cutiyā sappītika paṭisandhi avitakka cutiyā sa vitakka paṭisandhi avicāra cutiyā
translated: rebirth-linking accompanied by happiness from rebirth accompanied by neither happiness nor sorrow, rebirth-linking with applied thought from rebirth without applied thought, rebirth-linking with sustained thought from rebirth without sustained thought,

original: savicārapaṭisandhi, avitakkaavicāracutiyā savitakkasavicārapaṭisandhīti tassa tassa
analyzed: sa vicāra paṭisandhi avitakka avicāra cutiyā sa vitakka sa vicāra paṭisandhi iti tassa tassa
translated: rebirth-linking with both applied and sustained thought from rebirth without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: viparītato ca yathāyogaṃ yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: viparītataḥ ca yathāyogam yojetabbam
translated: And the opposite should be construed in each case as appropriate.

original: Laddhappaccayamitidhamma-mattametaṃ bhavantaramupeti;
analyzed: laddhappaccayam iti dhammam attam etam bhavantaram upeti
translated: “The mere states that have obtained conditions go to the next becoming”:

original: Nāssa tato saṅkanti, na tato hetuṃ vinā hoti.
analyzed: na assa tatas na tatas hetum vinā hoti
translated: it does not pass on from there, nor does it occur without a cause from there.

original: Iti hetaṃ laddhapaccayaṃ rūpārūpadhammamattaṃ uppajjamānaṃ bhavantaraṃ upetīti vuccati,
analyzed: iti ha etam laddha paccayam rūpa arūpa dhamma mattam uppajjamānam bhavantaram upeti iti vuccati
translated: So this mere states, the states of form and the formless states, that have obtained conditions and arise are said to “go to the next becoming,”

original: na satto, na jīvo. Tassa nāpi atītabhavato idha saṅkanti atthi, nāpi tato hetuṃ vinā
analyzed: na satto na jīvaḥ tassa nā api atīta bhavataḥ idha atthi nā api tatas hetum vinā
translated: not a being, not a soul. And there is no passing on of it from the past becoming to this one, nor does it occur

original: idha pātubhāvo. Tayidaṃ pākaṭena manussacutipaṭisandhikkamena pakāsayissāma –
analyzed: idha pātubhāvaḥ tayidam pākaṭena manussa cuti paṭisandhi kkamena pakāsayissāma
translated: This is the manifestation here. And we shall make this clear by the actual process of death and rebirth-linking in a human being.

original: Atītabhavasmiñhi sarasena upakkamena vā samāsannamaraṇassa asayhānaṃ sabbaṅgapaccaṅgasandhibandhanacchedakānaṃ
analyzed: atīta bhavasmin hi sarasena upakkamena vā samāsanna maraṇassa a sayhānam sabbaṅga paccaṅga sandhibandhana chedakānam
translated: For in a past becoming, when the time of death was approaching, the man, unable to endure the gathering together of all the joints and limbs,

original: māraṇantikavedanāsattānaṃ sannipātaṃ asahantassa ātape pakkhittaharitatālapaṇṇamiva
analyzed: māraṇa antika vedanā sattānam sannipātam a sahantassa ātape pakkhitta harita tāla paṇṇam iva
translated: which is brought about by the dissolution of the primary and secondary elements, like a palm leaf in the fire,

original: kamena upasussamāne sarīre niruddhesu cakkhādīsu indriyesu hadayavatthumatte patiṭṭhitesu
analyzed: kamena upasussamāne sarīre niruddhesu cakkha ādīsu indriyesu hadaya vatthumatte patiṭṭhitesu
translated: gradually dries up, and when the eye and the other faculties have ceased, and only the heart-basis remains,

original: kāyindriyamanindriyajīvitindriyesu taṅkhaṇāvasesaṃ hadayavatthusannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ🔽garusamāsevitāsannapubbakatānaṃ aññataraṃ laddhāvasesapaccayasaṅkhārasaṅkhātaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: kāyindriyam anindriya jīvitindriyesu tad khaṇa avasesam hadaya vatthu sannissitam viññāṇam  garu samāsevita āsanna pubbaka tānam aññataram laddha avasesa paccaya saṅkhāra saṅkhātam kammaṃ
translated: and the body faculty, the life faculty, and the mind faculty are left, then the consciousness that is dependent on the heart-basis

original: vā tadupaṭṭhāpitaṃ vā kammanimittagatinimittasaṅkhātaṃ visayamārabbha pavattati.
analyzed: vā tad upaṭṭhāpitam vā kamma nimitta gati nimitta saṅkhātam visayam ārabbha pavattati
translated: and is called “the aggregate of mental formations that occur with what is felt” is the kamma that has obtained a remainder of result to give, or it is the object consisting of the sign of kamma and the sign of destiny that is manifested by that kamma.
