analyzed: pana tad antogadhāḥ eva iti sīlabbatu pādānam pi sa pabhedānam sa antogadhānam tiṇṇam
translated: So the clinging of virtue and duty is a condition for the three kinds of becoming with their divisions and subdivisions.

original: bhavānaṃ paccayo hotīti evamettha yaṃ yassa paccayo hoti tatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: bhavānam paccayaḥ hoti iti evam ettha yam yassa paccayaḥ hoti tatas api viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: This is how the exposition should be known here as to what is a condition for what.🔽But how is it to be known here as to what is a condition for what kind of becoming?

original: Kiṃ panettha kassa bhavassa kathaṃ paccayo hotīti ce?
analyzed: kim pana ittha kassa bhavassa katham paccayaḥ hoti iti ce
translated: It should be known that assuming is a condition🔽For fine-material and immaterial kinds of being,

original: Rūpārūpabhavānaṃ, upanissayapaccayo upādānaṃ;
analyzed: rūpa arūpa bhavānam upanissaya paccayaḥ upādānam
translated: As decisive support, and also as conascence, etc.,

original: Sahajātādīhipi taṃ, kāmabhavassāti viññeyyaṃ.🔽Rūpārūpabhavānañhi kāmabhavapariyāpannassa ca kāmabhave kusalakammasseva upapattibhavassa
analyzed: tam kāma bhavassa ati viññeyyam  rūpa arūpa bhavānam hi kāma bhava pariyāpannassa ca kāma bhave kusala kammassa iva upapatti bhavassa
translated: It is a condition for sensual becoming too.

original: cetaṃ catubbidhampi upādānaṃ upanissayapaccayena ekadhā paccayo hoti. Kāmabhave attanā🔽sampayuttaakusalakammabhavassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatahetupaccayappabhedehi
analyzed: ca itam catubbidham pi upādānam upanissaya paccayena ekadhā paccayaḥ hoti kāma bhave attanā  sampayutta akusala kamma bhavassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata hetu paccaya ppabhedehi
translated: For assuming, which is of four kinds, is a condition in one way only, as decisive-support condition, for fine-material and immaterial kinds of being and for the sensual becoming included in the profitable kamma-process of rebirth-process becoming in the sensual world.🔽It is a condition for the unprofitable kamma-process becoming in the sensual world as conascence, etc., that is to say, as conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, non- disappearance, and root-cause conditions.

original: sahajātādīhi paccayo hoti. Vippayuttassa pana upanissayapaccayenevāti.
analyzed: sahajāta ādīhi paccayaḥ hoti vippayuttassa pana upanissaya paccayena eva ati
translated: But it is a condition for the dissociated kamma-process becoming in the sensual world only as decisive-support condition.

original: Upādānapaccayā bhavapadaniddeso.
translated: This is the section of the detailed explanation dealing with the clause “With assuming as condition, becoming.”

original: Jātijarāmaraṇādipadaniddeso
analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇa ādi pada niddeso
translated: The section of the detailed explanation dealing with the clause “With birth as condition, ageing, death, and so on” is finished.

original: 235. Bhavapaccayā jātiniddesādīsu jātiādīnaṃ vinicchayo saccavibhaṅge vuttanayeneva
analyzed: bhava paccayāḥ jāti niddesa ādīsu jāti ādīnam vinicchayaḥ sacca vibhaṅge vutta nayena iva
translated: As regards the description of birth with becoming as condition, etc., the exposition of birth, etc., should be understood in the way already given in the Description of the Truths.

original: veditabbo. Bhavoti panettha kammabhavova adhippeto. So hi jātiyā paccayo, na upapattibhavo.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ bhavaḥ ti pana ittha kamma bhavaḥ uva adhippeto so hi jātiyā paccayaḥ na upapatti bhavo
translated: The exposition of birth, etc., should be understood in the way already given in the Saccavibhaṅga . Herein, “existence” is intended as kamma-process existence, for that is the condition for birth, not rebirth-process existence.

original: So pana kammapaccayaupanissayapaccayavasena dvidhāva paccayo hotīti.🔽Tattha siyā – kathaṃ panetaṃ jānitabbaṃ “bhavo jātiyā paccayo”ti ce? Bāhirapaccayasamattepi
analyzed: so pana kamma paccaya upanissaya paccaya vasena dvidhā va paccayaḥ hoti iti  tattha siyā katham pana itam jānitabbam bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayaḥ ti ce bāhira paccaya samatte pi
translated: But that is a condition in two ways, as kamma condition and decisive-support condition.🔽Here it may be asked: But how is it to be known that existence is a condition for birth?🔽Because of the perception of differences in the inferior and superior, etc.,

original: hīnapaṇītatādivisesadassanato. Bāhirānañhi janakajanettisukkasoṇitāhārādīnaṃ paccayānaṃ
analyzed: hīna paṇīta tā ādi visesa dassanataḥ bāhirānam hi janaka janetti sukka soṇita āhāra ādīnam paccayānam
translated: even when external conditions are complete. For even when external conditions that produce beings, such as mother and father, milk, etc., are complete,

original: samattepi sattānaṃ yamakānampi sataṃ hīnapaṇītatādiviseso dissati. So ca na ahetuko,🔽sabbadā ca sabbesañca abhāvato; na kammabhavato aññahetuko, tadabhinibbattakasattānaṃ
analyzed: samatte pi sattānam yamakānam pi satam hīna paṇīta tā ādi visesaḥ dissati saḥ ca na ahetukaḥ  sabbadā ca sabbesam ca abhāvataḥ na kamma bhavataḥ añña hetukaḥ tad abhinibbattaka sattānam
translated: the difference in the inferior and superior, etc., among beings is still evident. And that is not without a cause;

original: ajjhattasantāne aññassa kāraṇassa abhāvatoti kammabhavahetukova. Kammañhi sattānaṃ
analyzed: ajjhatta santāne aññassa kāraṇassa abhāvato ti kamma bhava hetukaḥ uva kammaṃ hi sattānam
translated: for it would then be causeless and so would occur at all times and for all beings. Nor is it caused by anything other than kamma-process existence, because there is no other cause in the internal continuity of beings that produces them.🔽So it is only the cause of that that is the cause of the difference in the inferior and superior, etc., among beings. And that is kamma-process existence. For kamma is the cause of the difference in the inferior and superior, etc., among beings.

original: hīnapaṇītādivisesahetu. Tenāha bhagavā – “kammaṃ satte vibhajati yadidaṃ hīnappaṇītatāyā”ti.
analyzed: hīna paṇīta ādi visesa hetu tena āha bhagavā kammam satte vibhajati yat idam hīna ppaṇīta tāya ati
translated: and the cause for the distinction of inferior and superior. Hence the Blessed One said: “It is kamma that divides beings into inferior and superior” .

original: Tasmā jānitabbametaṃ – “bhavo jātiyā paccayo”ti.
analyzed: tasmā jānitabbam etam bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayaḥ ti
translated: So it should be understood that “becoming is a condition for birth.”

original: Yasmā ca asati jātiyā jarāmaraṇaṃ nāma na hoti, sokādayo ca dhammā na honti, jātiyā
analyzed: yasmā ca asati jātiyā jarā maraṇam nāma na hoti soka ādayo ca dhammā na honti jātiyā
translated: And because there is no ageing-and-death, sorrow, etc., when there is no birth,🔽but when there is birth there is ageing-and-death, and there are the states of sorrow, etc.,

original: pana sati jarāmaraṇañceva jarāmaraṇasaṅkhātadukkhadhammaphuṭṭhassa ca bālassa jarāmaraṇābhisambandhā🔽vā tena tena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa anabhisambandhā vā sokādayo ca dhammā honti,
analyzed: pana sati jarā maraṇam ca iva jarā maraṇa saṅkhāta dukkha dhamma phuṭṭhassa ca bālassa jarā maraṇa abhisambandhā  vā tena tena dukkha dhammena phuṭṭhassa anabhisambandhāḥ vā soka ādayo ca dhammā honti
translated: in one who is touched by the state called ageing-and-death, whether or not he is touched by other states,

original: tasmā ayaṃ jātijarāmaraṇassa ceva sokādīnañca paccayo hotīti veditabbā. Sā pana upanissayakoṭiyā
analyzed: tasmai ayam jāti jarā maraṇassa ca iva soka ādīnam ca paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbā sā pana upanissaya koṭiyā
translated: therefore it should be understood that birth is a condition for ageing-and-death and for sorrow, etc.,

original: ekadhāva paccayo hotīti.
analyzed: ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: but it is a condition in one way only, as decisive-support condition.

original: Bhavapaccayā jātiādipadaniddeso.
analyzed: bhava paccayā jāti ādi pada niddeso
translated: The explanation of the terms “birth,” etc., for which “becoming” is a condition.

original: 242. Evametassātiādīnaṃ attho uddesavāre vuttanayeneva veditabbo. Saṅgatiādīni samudayavevacanāneva.
analyzed: evam etassa ati ādīnam atthaḥ uddesa vāre vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ saṅgati ādīni
translated: The meaning of the terms “thus,” etc., should be understood in the way already stated in the Description of the Mode of Conveying a Teaching . “Union,” etc., are synonyms for “arising.”

original: Yasmā panettha sokādayo avasāne vuttā, tasmā yā sā avijjā “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”ti evametassa bhavacakkassa ādimhi vuttā, sā –
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha soka ādayaḥ avasāne vuttā tasmā yā sā avijjā avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ti evam etassa bhava cakkassa ādimhi vuttā sā
translated: But since sorrow, etc., are mentioned last, it is established that ignorance is the first of the twelve factors in the chain of conditions beginning with the words “With ignorance as condition there are formations” .🔽Sorrow, etc., establish ignorance;

original: Sokādīhi avijjā, siddhā bhavacakkamaviditādimidaṃ;
analyzed: soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā bhava cakkam avidita ādim idam
translated: This wheel of becoming is unknown at the beginning;🔽It is devoid of a maker and a feeler;

original: Kārakavedakarahitaṃ, dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññaṃ.
analyzed: kāraka vedaka rahitam dvādasavidha suñña tā asuññam
translated: It is void of the void of the twelve kinds of void.

original: Satataṃ samitaṃ pavattatīti veditabbaṃ. Kathaṃ panettha sokādīhi avijjā siddhā? Kathamidaṃ
analyzed: satatam samitam pavattati iti veditabbam katham pana ittha soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā katham idam
translated: It should be understood that it occurs constantly and uninterruptedly.

original: bhavacakkaṃ aviditādi? Kathaṃ kārakavedakarahitaṃ? Kathaṃ dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññanti
analyzed: bhava cakkam avidita ādi katham kāraka vedaka rahitam katham dvādasavidha suñña tā asuññanti
translated: But how is ignorance established by sorrow, etc.? How is this wheel of becoming unknown at the beginning? How is it devoid of a maker and a feeler? How is it void of the void of the twelve kinds of void?

original: ce? Ettha hi sokadukkhadomanassupāyāsā avijjāya aviyogino, paridevo ca nāma mūḷhassāti
analyzed: ce ettha hi soka dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ avijjāya aviyogino paridevaḥ ca nāma mūḷhassa ati
translated: Herein, sorrow, grief, despair, and fever are not dissociated from ignorance, and lamentation is a state of one who is confused.

original: tesu tāva siddhesu siddhāva hoti avijjā. Apica “āsavasamudayā avijjāsamudayo”ti hi
analyzed: tesu tāva siddhesu hoti avijjā apica āsava samudayā hi
translated: So when these are established, ignorance is established too. Moreover, it is said: “With the arising of cankers there is the arising of ignorance” .🔽And these sorrow, etc., arise with the arising of cankers. How? Firstly, sorrow arises with the arising of the canker of sense desire. As it is said:

original: vuttaṃ. Āsavasamudayā cete sokādayo honti. Kathaṃ? Vatthukāmaviyoge tāva soko kāmāsavasamudayo hoti? Yathāha –
analyzed: vuttam āsava samudayā ca ite soka ādayaḥ honti katham vatthu kāma viyoge sokaḥ kāma āsava samudayo hoti yathā āha
translated: “When a man is separated from what he likes, sorrow, grief, despair, and fever arise in him” .

original: “Tassa ce kāmayānassa, chandajātassa jantuno;
analyzed: tassa ce kāmayānassa chanda jātassa jantunaḥ
translated: Who is born with craving in his heart,🔽When those desires are lost, he suffers,

original: Te kāmā parihāyanti, sallaviddhova ruppatī”ti. ;
analyzed: te kāmā parihāyanti salla viddhaḥ uva ruppati iti
translated: Like one who is pierced by a dart” .

original: Yathā cāha – “kāmato jāyatī soko”ti. Sabbepi cete diṭṭhāsavasamudayā honti, yathāha
analyzed: yathā ca āha kāmataḥ jāyati soko ti sabbe pi ca ite diṭṭha āsava samudayāḥ honti yathā āha
translated: And all these are originated by the origin of the taints of sensual desire, as it is said:

original: – “tassa ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpanti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā
analyzed: tassa aham rūpam mama rūpam ti pariyuṭṭha ṭṭhāyinaḥ tam rūpam vipariṇamati aññathā
translated: “When his material form is appropriated by the appropriating of ‘This is me, this is mine,’ that material form of his changes and alters.

original: hoti. Tassa rūpavipariṇāmaññathābhāvā uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā”ti.
analyzed: hoti tassa rūpa vipariṇāma aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati
translated: With the change and alteration of material form there arise in him sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief and despair” .

original: Yathā ca diṭṭhāsavasamudayā evaṃ bhavāsavasamudayāpi, yathāha – “yepi te devā dīghāyukā
analyzed: yathā ca diṭṭha āsava samudayā evam bhava āsava samudayā api yathā āha ye pi te devāḥ dīghāyukā
translated: And as with the origin of the taints of sensual desire, so also with the origin of the taints of being, as it is said:

original: vaṇṇavanto sukhabahulā uccesu vimānesu ciraṭṭhitikā tepi tathāgatassa dhammadesanaṃ
analyzed: vaṇṇavanto sukha bahulāḥ uccesu vimānesu ciraṭṭhitikā te pi tathāgatassa dhamma desanam
translated: “Those gods who are long-lived, beautiful, blissful, and long-enduring in the heavenly worlds, when they hear the Tathagata’s teaching of the Dhamma,

original: sutvā yebhuyyena bhayaṃ saṃvegaṃ santāsaṃ āpajja”nti pañca pubbanimittāni disvā maraṇabhayena
analyzed: sutvā yebhuyyena bhayam saṃvegam santāsam āpajjanti pañca pubba nimittāni disvā maraṇa bhayena
translated: for the most part they are made to feel terror, a sense of urgency, and fear” .🔽And as with the origin of the taints of being, so also with the origin of the taints of ignorance, as it is said:

original: santajjitānaṃ devānaṃ viyāti. Yathā ca bhavāsavasamudayā evaṃ avijjāsavasamudayāpi,
analyzed: devānam viyāti yathā ca bhava āsava samudayā evam avijja āsava samudayā api
translated: “The gods who are long-lived,🔽beautiful, blissful, and long-enduring in the heavenly worlds, when they hear the Tathagata’s teaching of the Dhamma,🔽for the most part they are made to feel terror, a sense of urgency, and fear” .

original: yathāha – “sa kho so, bhikkhave, bālo diṭṭheva dhamme tividhaṃ dukkhadomanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedetī”ti.🔽Iti yasmā āsavasamudayā ete honti, tasmā ete sijjhamānā avijjāya hetubhūte āsave
analyzed: yathā āha sa kho saḥ bhikkhave bālaḥ diṭṭhe iva dhamme tividham dukkha domanassam paṭisaṃvedeti iti  iti yasmai āsava samudayāḥ ete honti tasmai ete sijjhamānāḥ avijjāya hetu bhūte āsave
translated: as is said: “That fool, bhikkhus, in this very life feels pain and grief because of his bodily misconduct” .🔽So since these things come about with the arising of the defilements, they are established as the cause of ignorance when they are established as the cause of the defilements.

original: sādhenti. Āsavesu ca siddhesu paccayabhāve bhāvato avijjāpi siddhāva hotīti. Evaṃ
analyzed: sādhenti āsavesu ca siddhesu paccaya bhāve bhāvataḥ avijjā api siddhā ava hoti iti evam
translated: And when the defilements are established, ignorance is established as their condition.

original: tāvettha ‘sokādīhi avijjā siddhā’ hotīti veditabbā.🔽Yasmā pana evaṃ paccayabhāve bhāvato avijjāya siddhāya puna “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā,
analyzed: tau ettha soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā hoti iti veditabbā  yasmai pana evam paccaya bhāve bhāvataḥ avijjāya siddhāya puna avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā
translated: So it should be understood that “ignorance is established by grief, etc.”🔽But since ignorance is established as a condition in this way, there is no end to the succession of cause and effect stated thus, “With ignorance as condition there are formations,

original: saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇa”nti evaṃ hetuphalaparamparāya pariyosānaṃ natthi, tasmā taṃ
analyzed: saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇan ti evam hetu phala paramparāya pariyosānam na atthi tasmā taṃ

original: Evaṃ sati “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”ti idaṃ ādimattakathanaṃ virujjhatīti ce? Nayidaṃ
analyzed: evam sati avijjā paccayāḥ saṅkhārāḥ idam ādimatta kathanam virujjhati iti ce
translated: No, it is not contradicted.

analyzed: ādimatta kathanam padhāna dhamma kathanam pana etat tiṇṇam hi vaṭṭānam avijjā padhānā
translated: and the exposition of the beginning is the exposition of the principal state. For ignorance is the principal state in the three rounds.🔽For the round of defilements and the round of kamma and the round of becoming all entangle the fool,

original: Avijjāggahaṇena hi avasesaṃ kilesavaṭṭañca kammādīni ca bālaṃ paliveṭhenti, sappasiraggahaṇena🔽sesaṃ sappasarīraṃ viya bāhaṃ. Avijjāsamucchede pana kate tehi vimokkho hoti, sappasiracchede
analyzed: avijjā ggahaṇena hi avasesam kilesa vaṭṭam ca kamma ādīni ca bālam paliveṭhenti sappa sira ggahaṇena  sesam sappa sarīram viya bāham avijjā samucchede pana kate tehi vimokkho hoti sappa sira chede
translated: just as the body of the snake and its coils entangle the arm. But when ignorance is abolished, he is freed from them,

original: kate paliveṭhitabāhāvimokkho viya. Yathāha – “avijjāyatveva asesavirāganirodhā saṅkhāranirodho”tiādi.
analyzed: kate paliveṭhita bāhā vimokkhaḥ yathā āha avid jāyatu eva asesa virāga nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodhā tiādi
translated: just as the man is freed from the coils when the head of the snake is cut off. As it is said: “With the remainderless fading away and cessation of ignorance” , and so on.

original: Iti yaṃ gaṇhato bandho muñcato ca mokkho hoti, tassa padhānadhammassa kathanamidaṃ,
analyzed: iti yam gaṇhataḥ bandhaḥ muñcataḥ ca mokkhaḥ hoti tassa padhāna dhammassa kathanam idam
translated: So this is the exposition of the principal state from which there is bondage when it is grasped and freedom when it is released.🔽It is not an exposition of the beginning. This round of becoming should therefore be understood as “unknown in the beginning.”

analyzed: na ādimatta kathanam ti evam idam bhava cakkam avidita ādi iti veditabbam tayā idam yasmā 🔽avijjā ādīhi kāraṇehi saṅkhāra ādīnam pavatti tasmā tatas aññena brahmā mahābrahmā seṭṭhaḥ

original: sajitā”ti evaṃ parikappitena brahmādinā vā saṃsārassa kārakena “so kho pana me ayaṃ
analyzed: sajitā ati evam parikappitena brahma ādinā vā saṃsārassa kārakena saḥ kho pana me ayam
translated: and by the creator of the round of rebirths, whether it be Brahmā or some other being, who is imagined in some such way as “He is the maker of this world” ,

original: attā vado vedeyyo”ti evaṃ parikappitena attanā vā sukhadukkhānaṃ vedakena rahitaṃ.
analyzed: attā vadaḥ vedeyyaḥ ti evam parikappitena attanā vā sukha dukkhānam vedakena rahitam
translated: or by a self imagined in some such way as “This self of mine is the experiencer of pleasure and pain” , which is the doer and the experiencer of the various kinds of pleasure and pain.

original: Iti ‘kārakavedakarahita’nti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: iti kāraka vedaka rahitan ti veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood that it is devoid of a doer and an experiencer.

original: Yasmā panettha avijjā udayabbayadhammakattā dhuvabhāvena, saṃkiliṭṭhattā saṃkilesikattā
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha avijjā udaya bbaya dhammaka ttā dhuva bhāvena saṃkiliṭṭha ttā saṃkilesika ttā
translated: But it is void too in the following twelve ways. Ignorance is void of permanence because it is subject to arising and falling away; it is void of beauty because it is defiled and is the defilement of what is compounded;

original: ca subhabhāvena, udayabbayapaṭipīḷitattā sukhabhāvena, paccayāyattavuttittā vasavattanabhūtena
analyzed: ca subha bhāvena udaya bbaya paṭipīḷita ttā sukha bhāvena paccaya āyatta vutti ttā vasavattana bhūtena
translated: it is void of pleasure because it is afflicted by arising and falling away; it is void of self because it exists in dependence on conditions and is not a self that is independent and wields power;

original: attabhāvena ca suññā, tathā saṅkhārādīnipi aṅgāni; yasmā vā avijjā na attā, na attano,
analyzed: atta bhāvena ca suññā tathā saṅkhāra ādīni pi aṅgāni yasmai vā avijjā na attā na attano
translated: and likewise the other factors of the chain of conditions. Or alternatively, ignorance is not self, not a being, not a soul, not a person;

original: na attani, na attavatī, tathā saṅkhārādīnipi aṅgāni; tasmā ‘dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññamidaṃ’🔽bhavacakkanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: na attani na attavatī tathā saṅkhāra ādīni aṅgāni tasmā dvādasavidha suñña tā suññam idam  bhava cakkam ti veditabbam
translated: and likewise the other factors of the chain of conditions. Therefore this wheel of becoming should be understood to be void of twelve voids.

original: Evañca viditvā puna –
analyzed: evañca viditvā punar
translated: And having understood it thus, he should again consider it as follows:

original: Tassa avijjātaṇhā, mūlamatītādayo tayo kālā;
analyzed: tassa mūlam atīta ādayaḥ tayo kālā
translated: The root of it is ignorance and craving, the three times are past, future, and present,

original: Dve aṭṭha dve eva ca, sarūpato tesu aṅgāni.
analyzed: dve aṭṭha dve eva ca sarūpataḥ tesu aṅgāni
translated: The factors in it should be understood as two eights and two twos respectively.

original: Tassa kho panetassa bhavacakkassa avijjā taṇhā cāti dve dhammā mūlanti veditabbā.
analyzed: tassa kho pana itassa bhava cakkassa avijjā taṇhā ca ati dve dhammā mūlanti veditabbā
translated: And of this wheel of becoming, ignorance and craving should be understood as the two ideas that are its root.

original: Tadetaṃ pubbantāharaṇato avijjāmūlaṃ vedanāvasānaṃ, aparantasantānato taṇhāmūlaṃ
analyzed: tat etam pubbanta āharaṇataḥ avijjā mūlam vedanā avasānam aparanta santānataḥ taṇhā mūlam
translated: For this wheel of becoming is rooted in ignorance in the past and ends in feeling in the future, and it is rooted in craving in the future and ends in birth in the past.

original: jarāmaraṇāvasānanti duvidhaṃ hoti. Tattha purimaṃ diṭṭhicaritavasena vuttaṃ, pacchimaṃ
analyzed: jarā maraṇa avasānam ti duvidham hoti tattha purimam diṭṭhi carita vasena vuttam pacchimam
translated: So it is of two kinds as rooted in ignorance and ending in feeling, and rooted in craving and ending in birth. Herein, the former is stated in terms of those of wrong view, and the latter

original: taṇhācaritavasena. Diṭṭhicaritānañhi avijjā, taṇhācaritānaṃ taṇhā saṃsāranāyikā.
analyzed: taṇhā carita vasena diṭṭhi caritānam hi avijjā taṇhā caritānam taṇhā saṃsāra nāyikā
translated: in terms of those of craving. For ignorance is the leader of those of wrong view, and craving is the leader of those of craving in the round of rebirths.

original: Ucchedadiṭṭhisamugghātāya vā paṭhamaṃ, phaluppattiyā hetūnaṃ anupacchedapakāsanato;🔽sassatadiṭṭhisamugghātāya dutiyaṃ, uppannānaṃ jarāmaraṇapakāsanato; gabbhaseyyakavasena
analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhi samugghātāya vā paṭhamam phala uppattiyā hetūnam an upaccheda pakāsanato  dutiyam uppannānam jarā maraṇa pakāsanataḥ gabbhaseyyaka vasena
translated: Or alternatively, the first is stated for the purpose of removing the view of annihilation, since it shows that there is no cutting off of causes in the production of the fruit;🔽and the second is stated for the purpose of removing the view of eternalism, since it shows that what is born must age and die.

original: vā purimaṃ, anupubbapavattidīpanato; opapātikavasena pacchimaṃ sahuppattidīpanato.
analyzed: vā purimam anupubba pavatti dīpanataḥ opapātika vasena pacchimam sahuppatti dīpanato
translated: Or the first is stated in terms of womb-born creatures, since it shows the successive order of the round; and the second is stated in terms of those born by transformation, since it shows the simultaneous order.

original: Atītapaccuppannānāgatā cassa tayo kālā. Tesu pāḷiyaṃ sarūpato āgatavasena avijjā
analyzed: atīta paccuppanna anāgatā ca ssa tayo kālā tesu pāḷiyam sarūpataḥ āgata vasena avijjā
translated: And there are three times, past, future, and present. Of these, two factors, ignorance and formations, are past time,

original: saṅkhārā cāti dve aṅgāni atītakālāni, viññāṇādīni bhavāvasānāni aṭṭha paccuppannakālāni,🔽jāti ceva jarāmaraṇañca dve anāgatakālānīti veditabbāni. Puna –
analyzed: saṅkhārā ca ati dve aṅgāni atīta kālāni viññāṇa ādīni bhava avasānāni aṭṭha paccuppanna kālāni  ca iva jarā maraṇam ca dve anāgata kālāni iti veditabbāni puna
translated: eight factors, consciousness, etc., down to feeling, are present time,🔽and two factors, birth and ageing-and-death, are future time. This is how they should be understood.

original: Hetuphalahetupubbaka-tisandhicatubhedasaṅgahañcetaṃ;
analyzed: hetu phala hetu pubbaka tisandhi catu bheda saṅgahañca itam
translated: Again, it is to be understood that this wheel of becoming has three spokes,

original: Vīsatiākārāraṃ, tivaṭṭamanavaṭṭhitaṃ bhamati.
analyzed: vīsati ākāra aram tivaṭṭam anavaṭṭhitam bhamati
translated: and it revolves with its hub well concealed.

original: Itipi veditabbaṃ. Tattha saṅkhārānañca paṭisandhiviññāṇassa ca antarā eko hetuphalasandhi🔽nāma. Vedanāya ca taṇhāya ca antarā eko phalahetusandhi nāma. Bhavassa ca jātiyā
analyzed: iti pi veditabbam tattha saṅkhārānam ca paṭisandhi viññāṇassa ca antarā ekaḥ hetu phala sandhi  nāma vedanāya ca taṇhāya ca antarā ekaḥ phala hetu sandhi nāma bhavassa ca jātiyā
translated: Herein, there is one connection between formations and rebirth-linking consciousness, which is a connection of cause with fruit.🔽There is one connection between feeling and craving, which is a connection of fruit with cause.

original: ca antarā eko hetuphalasandhīti. Evamidaṃ hetuphalahetupubbakatisandhīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: ca antarā ekaḥ hetu phala sandhi iti evam idam hetu phala hetu pubba kati sandhi iti veditabbam
translated: And there is one connection between becoming and birth, which is a connection of cause with fruit. This is how it is to be understood that it has three spokes.

original: Sandhīnaṃ ādipariyosānavavatthitā panassa cattāro saṅgahā honti, seyyathidaṃ – avijjāsaṅkhārā
analyzed: sandhīnam ādi pariyosāna vavatthitā panassa cattāro saṅgahāḥ honti seyyathidam avijjā saṅkhārā
translated: But its fourfold inclusion is determined by the division of beginning, end, etc., for the spokes, etc., are included in the beginning, the end, the middle, and the middle only.🔽Herein, ignorance and formations are the beginning;

original: eko saṅgaho, viññāṇanāmarūpasaḷāyatanaphassavedanā dutiyo, taṇhupādānabhavā tatiyo,
analyzed: eko saṅgahaḥ viññāṇa nāma rūpa saḷāyatana phassa vedanā dutiyo taṇhu pādāna bhavā tatiyo
translated: One is the aggregate of consciousness, name-and-form, sixfold base, contact, and feeling. The second is craving, assuming, and being.

original: jātijarāmaraṇaṃ catutthoti. Evamidaṃ catubhedasaṅgahanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇam catutthaḥ ti evam idam catu bheda saṅgahan ti veditabbam
translated: Birth and ageing-and-death are the fourth. This is how the exposition should be known here as to grouping by fours.

original: Atīte hetavo pañca, idāni phalapañcakaṃ;
analyzed: atīte pañca idāni phala pañcakam
translated: Five causes in the past, and now the five fruits;

original: Idāni hetavo pañca, āyatiṃ phalapañcakanti.
analyzed: idāni pañca āyatim
translated: Five causes now, and in the future the five fruits.

original: Etehi pana vīsatiyā ākārehi arehi vīsatiākārāranti veditabbaṃ. Tattha ‘atīte hetavo
analyzed: etehi pana vīsatiyā ākārehi arehi vīsati ākāra aram ti veditabbam tattha atīte hetavaḥ
translated: But it should be understood that the exposition is in twenty ways by means of these twenty aspects. Herein,🔽five in the past are ignorance, formations,

original: pañcā’ti avijjā saṅkhārā cāti ime tāva dve vuttā eva. Yasmā pana avidvā paritassati,🔽paritasito upādiyati, tassa upādānapaccayā bhavo, tasmā taṇhupādānabhavāpi gahitā
analyzed: pañca ati avijjā saṅkhārā ca ati ime tāva dve vuttā eva yasmā pana a vidvā paritassati  paritasitaḥ upādiyati tassa upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ tasmā taṇhā upādāna bhavā api gahitā
translated: and these two are stated already. But when one who is ignorant is perturbed,

original: honti. Tenāha “purimakammabhavasmiṃ moho avijjā, āyūhanā saṅkhārā, nikanti taṇhā,
analyzed: honti tena āha purima kamma bhavasmim mohaḥ avijjā āyūhanā saṅkhārāḥ taṇhā
translated: he clings when perturbed, and his being is conditioned by clinging, thus craving, assuming, and being are also included. Hence it is said: “In the previous kamma-process becoming, delusion is ignorance, accumulation is formations, affection is craving,

original: upagamanaṃ upādānaṃ, cetanā bhavo, ime pañca dhammā purimakammabhavasmiṃ idha paṭisandhiyā paccayā”ti.
analyzed: upagamanam upādānam cetanā bhavaḥ ime pañca dhammā purima kamma bhavasmin idha paṭisandhiyā paccayā ti
translated: grasping is assuming, volition is being. These five things in the previous kamma-process becoming are conditions for rebirth-linking here” .

original: Tattha purimakammabhavasminti purime kammabhave, atītajātiyaṃ kammabhave kariyamāneti🔽attho. Moho avijjāti yo tadā dukkhādīsu moho, yena mūḷho kammaṃ karoti, sā avijjā.🔽Āyūhanā saṅkhārāti taṃ kammaṃ karoto purimacetanāyo, yathā ‘dānaṃ dassāmī’ti cittaṃ🔽uppādetvā māsampi saṃvaccharampi dānūpakaraṇāni sajjentassa uppannā purimacetanāyo.
analyzed: tattha purima kamma bhavasmin ti purime kamma bhave atīta jātiyam kamma bhave kariyamānā iti  atthaḥ mohaḥ avijjā ati yaḥ tadā dukkha ādīsu mohaḥ yena mūḷhaḥ kammam karoti sā avijjā  tam kammam yathā dānam dassāmi iti cittam  uppādetvā māsam pi saṃvaccharam pi dānu upakaraṇāni sajjentassa uppannā purima cetanāyo
translated: Herein, in the previous kamma-process becoming: in the previous kamma-process becoming, in the kamma-process becoming in the past birth. The meaning is: when kamma was being done.🔽Delusion is ignorance: the delusion about suffering, etc., at that time is ignorance, since it is by being deluded about suffering, etc., that one does kamma.🔽Accumulation is formations: the prior volitions of one who does kamma are formations. As when someone thinks, “I shall give a gift,” and for a month or a year he makes preparations for the gift by accumulating the requisites. The prior volitions that arise in him are formations.

original: Paṭiggāhakānaṃ pana hatthe dakkhiṇaṃ patiṭṭhāpayato cetanā bhavoti vuccati. Ekāvajjanesu🔽vā chasu javanesu cetanā āyūhanasaṅkhārā nāma. Sattamā cetanā bhavo. Yā kāci vā pana🔽cetanā bhavo, taṃsampayuttā āyūhanasaṅkhārā nāma. Nikanti taṇhāti yā kammaṃ karontassa🔽tassa phale uppattibhave nikāmanā patthanā sā taṇhā nāma. Upagamanaṃ upādānanti yaṃ
analyzed: paṭiggāhakānam pana hatthe dakkhiṇam patiṭṭhāpayato cetanā bhavoti vuccati ekāvajjanesu 🔽vā chasu javanesu cetanā āyūhanasaṅkhārā nāma sattamā cetanā bhavaḥ yā kāci vā pana 🔽cetanā bhavaḥ tad sampayuttā āyūhana saṅkhārā nāma nikanti taṇhā ati yā kammam karontassa 🔽tassa phale uppatti bhave nikāmanā patthanā sā taṇhā nāma upagamanam upādānan ti yaṃ
translated: Herein, in the prior kamma-process becoming means in the prior kamma-process becoming, in the kamma-process becoming in the past birth. The meaning is: when kamma is done. Delusion is ignorance: the delusion about suffering, etc., that there then is, by means of which he who is deluded does kamma, is ignorance. Accumulation is formations: the prior volitions of one who does kamma are called “accumulation” . As one who has aroused the thought “I shall give a gift” prepares the requisites for giving a gift for a month or a year, his prior volitions are so called. But the volition of one who actually places the gift in the recipients’ hands is called becoming. Or the volitions in the six impulsions in a single cognitive series are called “accumulation formations,” and the seventh volition is called “becoming.” Or any volition is called “becoming,” and the associated states are called “accumulation formations.” Attachment is craving: the desire, longing, wish, and aspiration for the arising of the kamma’s result in a future becoming is called “craving.” Grasping is clinging: the grasping, grasping at, cleaving, cleaving to, of sense desires, views, virtue and practices, and doctrines of self, is called “clinging.”

original: kammaṃ bhavassa paccayabhūtaṃ; ‘idaṃ katvā asukasmiṃ nāma ṭhāne kāme sevissāmi ucchijjissāmī’tiādinā
analyzed: kammam bhavassa paccaya bhūtam idam katvā asukasmin nāma ṭhāne kāme sevissāmi ucchijjissāmi itiādinā
translated: Kamma is the condition for becoming. The act of approaching, taking, and misapprehending with the thought, “Having done this, I shall enjoy sensual pleasures in such and such a place, or I shall attain nibbāna,”

original: nayena pavattaṃ upagamanaṃ gahaṇaṃ parāmasanaṃ – idaṃ upādānaṃ nāma. Cetanā bhavoti
analyzed: nayena pavattam upagamanam gahaṇam parāmasanam idam upādānam nāma cetanā bhavoti
translated: is clinging. The volition is becoming.

original: āyūhanāvasāne vuttacetanā bhavoti evamattho veditabbo.
analyzed: āyūhana avasāne vutta cetanā bhavaḥ ti evamatthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning should be understood as stated in the section on accumulation.

original: ‘Idāni phalapañcaka’nti viññāṇādi vedanāvasānaṃ pāḷiyaṃ āgatameva. Yathāha “idha🔽paṭisandhi viññāṇaṃ, okkanti nāmarūpaṃ, pasādo āyatanaṃ, phuṭṭho phasso, vedayitaṃ
analyzed: idāni viññāṇa ādi vedanā avasānam pāḷiyam āgatam eva yathā āha  paṭisandhi viññāṇam okkanti nāma rūpam pasādaḥ āyatanam phuṭṭhaḥ phassaḥ vedayitam
translated: Now, the five fruits are consciousness, etc., ending with feeling, which are given in the text. As it is said:

original: vedanā ime pañca dhammā idhūpapattibhavasmiṃ purekatassa kammassa paccayā”ti. Tattha🔽paṭisandhi viññāṇanti yaṃ bhavantarapaṭisandhānavasena uppannattā paṭisandhīti vuccati,
analyzed: vedanā ime pañca dhammā idha upapatti bhavasmim purekatassa kammassa paccayā ti tattha  paṭisandhi viññāṇan ti yam bhava antara paṭisandhāna vasena uppanna ttā paṭisandhī iti vuccati
translated: “Herein, the rebirth-linking is consciousness, the descent into the womb is mentality-materiality, sensitivity is the sixfold base, contact is impingement, and what is felt is feeling. These five things are in the rebirth process in this existence, conditioned by kamma done in the past” .🔽Herein, the rebirth-linking is consciousness: that which is called “rebirth-linking” because it arises by linking to the next becoming is consciousness.

original: taṃ viññāṇaṃ. Okkanti nāmarūpanti yā gabbhe rūpārūpadhammānaṃ okkanti, āgantvā pavisanaṃ
analyzed: tam viññāṇam okkanti nāma rūpanti yā gabbhe rūpa arūpa dhammānam okkanti āgantvā pavisanam
translated: The descent into the womb is mentality-materiality: the descent of the mental and material phenomena into the womb, their arrival and entry,

original: viya – idaṃ nāmarūpaṃ. Pasādo āyatananti idaṃ cakkhādipañcāyatanavasena vuttaṃ. Phuṭṭho🔽phassoti yo ārammaṇaṃ phuṭṭho phusanto uppanno – ayaṃ phasso. Vedayitaṃ vedanāti
analyzed: viya idam nāma rūpam pasādaḥ āyatananti idam cakkha ādi pañcāyatana vasena vuttam phuṭṭhaḥ  phassaḥ ti yaḥ ārammaṇam phuṭṭhaḥ phusantaḥ uppannaḥ ayam phassaḥ vedayitam vedanā ati
translated: “Name-and-form” is like the “name” and “form” in the passage beginning, “Name-and-form are conditions for the sixfold base” . “The sense bases are the manifestation of confidence” is said with reference to the five bases beginning with the eye. “Contact is the touching of the object” is the contact that arises touching an object. “Feeling is the experience” is the experience of the object.

original: yaṃ paṭisandhiviññāṇena vā saḷāyatanapaccayena vā phassena sahuppannaṃ vipākavedayitaṃ,
analyzed: yam paṭisandhi viññāṇena vā saḷāyatana paccayena vā phassena saha uppannam vipāka vedayitam
translated: and so on. This is mentality-materiality. “The sense bases are the clarity” : this is said with reference to the five bases beginning with the eye. “Contact is the touching” : that which arises touching the object is contact. “Feeling is the feeling” : the feeling that arises together with the rebirth-linking consciousness or with the contact that has the sixfold base as its condition is the feeling.

original: sā vedanāti evamattho veditabbo.
analyzed: sā vedanā iti evamatthaḥ veditabbo
translated: The meaning should be understood thus.

analyzed: tassa pubba bhāgā tad sampayuttāḥ vā saṅkhārāḥ gahitā ava honti taṇhā upādāna ggahaṇena ca

analyzed: tad sampayuttā yāya vā mūḷhaḥ kammam karoti sā avijjā gahitā ava hoti iti evam pañca

analyzed: tena āha idha paripakka ttā āyatanānam mohaḥ avijjā āyūhanā saṅkhārāḥ nikanti taṇhā
translated: Therefore it is said: “Here, with the maturity of the sense bases, delusion is ignorance; accumulation is formations; attachment is craving;

analyzed: upagamanam upādānam cetanā bhavaḥ ime pañca dhammā idha kamma bhavasmiṃ āyatim paṭisandhiyā  paccayā ti tattha idha paripakka ttā āyatanānam paripakka āyatanassa kamma karaṇa kāle
translated: The act of approaching is Clinging, and the volition is Becoming. These five things here in the kamma process are conditions for rebirth-linking in the future.

translated: Herein, “when the bases are fully matured” is said to show delusion at the time of performing the kamma of one whose bases are fully matured. The rest is plain.

translated: the aging-and-death of those same things. Hence it is said: “Rebirth-linking is consciousness in the future; descent into the womb is mentality-materiality;

analyzed: pasādaḥ āyatanam phuṭṭhaḥ phassaḥ vedayitam vedanā ime pañca dhammā āyatim upapatti bhavasmiṃ
translated: the development of the embryo is the six sense bases; contact of the embryo is contact; the feeling of the embryo is feeling. These five things in the future in the rebirth process are

analyzed: idha katassa kammassa evam idam vīsati ākāra aram hoti
translated: the result of kamma done here.” So it has twenty aspects.

analyzed: kamma saṅkhepaḥ dvīsu ṭhānesu vipākaḥ vipāka saṅkhepo ti sabbam petam kamma saṅkhepo ca iva
translated: the brief description of action, in two places result is called the brief description of result. All this is the brief description of action

original: vipākasaṅkhepo ca. Dvīsu ṭhānesu kammaṃ kammavaṭṭaṃ, dvīsu ṭhānesu vipāko vipākavaṭṭanti
analyzed: vipāka saṅkhepaḥ ca dvīsu ṭhānesu kammam kammavaṭṭam dvīsu ṭhānesu vipākaḥ vipākavaṭṭanti

translated: action is called the occurrence of action, in two places result is called the occurrence of result. All this is the occurrence of action🔽and the occurrence of result.

analyzed: vipāka pavattam ca tathā dvīsu ṭhānesu kammam kamma santati dvīsu vipākaḥ vipāka santati iti

original: sabbampetaṃ kammasantati ceva vipākasantati ca. Dvīsu ṭhānesu kammaṃ kiriyā nāma,
analyzed: sabbam petam kamma santati ca iva vipāka santati ca dvīsu ṭhānesu kammam kiriyā nāma
translated: So all this is a kamma-process and a result-process. In two instances kamma is called a function,

original: dvīsu vipāko kiriyāphalaṃ nāmāti sabbampetaṃ kiriyā ceva kiriyāphalañcāti.
analyzed: dvīsu vipāko kiriyā phalam nāma ati sabbam petam kiriyā ca iva kiriyā phalam ca ati
translated: and in two instances result is called the fruit of the function. So all this is a function and the fruit of the function.

original: Evaṃ samuppannamidaṃ sahetukaṃ,
analyzed: evam samuppannam idam sa hetukam
translated: So this suffering has arisen with a cause,

original: Dukkhaṃ aniccaṃ calamittaraddhuvaṃ;
analyzed: dukkham aniccam
translated: Unstable, a disease, a dart, a misery, impermanent,

original: Dhammehi dhammā pabhavanti hetuso,
analyzed: dhammehi dhammā pabhavanti hetuso
translated: From states, states arise through a cause,

original: Na hettha attāva parova vijjati.
analyzed: na ha itthā attā ava paras uva vijjati
translated: And here no being is to be found.🔽States cause states to arise,

original: Dhammā dhamme sañjanenti, hetusambhārapaccayā;
analyzed: dhammā dhamme sañjanenti hetu sambhāra paccayā
translated: With conditions and with cause;🔽And through the cessation of the cause,

original: Hetūnañca nirodhāya, dhammo buddhena desito;
analyzed: hetūnam ca nirodhāya dhammo buddhena desito
translated: The state is taught by the Enlightened One.🔽When the cause is stopped,

original: Hetūsu uparuddhesu, chinnaṃ vaṭṭaṃ na vaṭṭati.
analyzed: hetūsu uparuddhesu chinnam vaṭṭam na vaṭṭati
translated: The round is broken, it does not go on.🔽So here the life of purity

original: Evaṃ dukkhantakiriyāya, brahmacariyīdha vijjati;
analyzed: evam dukkhanta kiriyāya vijjati
translated: Is taught for ending suffering,🔽And beings are not apprehended,

original: Satte ca nūpalabbhante, nevucchedo na sassataṃ.
analyzed: satte ca nu upalabbhante na iva ucchedaḥ na
translated: Nor is there annihilation or eternalism.

original: Tivaṭṭamanavaṭṭhitaṃ bhamatīti ettha pana saṅkhārabhavā kammavaṭṭaṃ, avijjātaṇhūpādānāni
analyzed: ti vaṭṭam anavaṭṭhitam bhamati iti ettha pana saṅkhāra bhavā kamma vaṭṭam avijjāta ṇhu upādānāni
translated: Herein, the round of formations and becoming is the round of kamma; ignorance, craving and assuming are the round of defilements;🔽consciousness, mentality-materiality, the sixfold base, contact and feeling are the round of result.

original: kilesavaṭṭaṃ, viññāṇanāmarūpasaḷāyatanaphassavedanā vipākavaṭṭanti imehi tīhi vaṭṭehi🔽tivaṭṭamidaṃ bhavacakkaṃ yāva kilesavaṭṭaṃ na upacchijjati tāva anupacchinnapaccayattā
analyzed: kilesa vaṭṭam viññāṇa nāma rūpa saṅgāyatana phassa vedanā vipāka vaṭṭanti imehi tīhi vaṭṭehi  tivaṭṭam idam bhava cakkam yāva kilesa vaṭṭam na upacchijjati tāva anupacchinna paccaya tā
translated: So this wheel of becoming, which is a three- fold round,

original: anavaṭṭhitaṃ punappunaṃ parivaṭṭanato bhamatiyevāti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: an avaṭṭhitam punappunam parivaṭṭanataḥ bhamatiyā iva āti veditabbam
translated: keeps revolving as long as the round of defilements is not interrupted, since its conditions are not interrupted, and it keeps revolving because of the occurrence of the three rounds again and again.

original: Tayidamevaṃ bhamamānaṃ –
analyzed: tayā idam evam bhamamānam
translated: And while it is revolving thus,🔽It should be known as it occurs,🔽By truth, by origin, by function,

original: Saccappabhavato kiccā, vāraṇā upamāhi ca;
analyzed: sacca ppabhavataḥ kiccā vāraṇāḥ upamāhi ca
translated: By prevention, by simile,🔽By deep meaning, by analysis,

original: Gambhīranayabhedā ca, viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: gambhīra naya bhedā ca viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: As each one is appropriate.

original: Tattha yasmā kusalākusalakammaṃ avisesena samudayasaccanti saccavibhaṅge vuttaṃ,
analyzed: tattha yasmā kusala akusala kammam avisesena samudaya saccan ti sacca vibhaṅge vuttam
translated: Herein, since profitable and unprofitable kamma are called the truth of origin without distinction in the Vibhaṅga on the Truths ,

original: tasmā avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti avijjāya saṅkhārā dutiyasaccappabhavaṃ dutiyasaccaṃ,
analyzed: tasmai avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ati avijjāya saṅkhārāḥ dutiya sacca ppabhavam dutiya saccam
translated: so the formations due to ignorance are the second truth, which has ignorance for its source,

original: saṅkhārehi viññāṇaṃ dutiyasaccappabhavaṃ paṭhamasaccaṃ, viññāṇādīhi nāmarūpādīni
analyzed: saṅkhārehi viññāṇam dutiya sacca ppabhavam paṭhama saccam viññāṇa ādīhi nāma rūpa ādīni
translated: and consciousness due to formations is the first truth, which has the second truth for its source. And the mentality-materiality due to consciousness, etc.,

original: vipākavedanāpariyosānāni paṭhamasaccappabhavaṃ paṭhamasaccaṃ, vedanāya taṇhā paṭhamasaccappabhavaṃ🔽dutiyasaccaṃ, taṇhāya upādānaṃ dutiyasaccappabhavaṃ dutiyasaccaṃ, upādānato bhavo
analyzed: vipāka vedanā pariyosānāni paṭhama sacca ppabhavam paṭhama saccam vedanāya taṇhā paṭhama sacca ppabhavam  dutiya saccam taṇhāya upādānam dutiya sacca ppabhavam dutiya saccam upādānataḥ bhavaḥ
translated: The first truth has the first truth for its origin since it is the culmination of the experience of the result of kamma.🔽The second truth has the second truth for its origin since craving is the cause of craving.

original: dutiyasaccappabhavaṃ paṭhamadutiyasaccadvayaṃ, bhavato jāti dutiyasaccappabhavaṃ
analyzed: dutiya sacca ppabhavam paṭhama dutiya sacca dvayam bhavataḥ jāti dutiya sacca ppabhavam
translated: The first and second truths have the second truth for their origin since becoming is the cause of kamma-result and kamma-producing aggregates.

original: paṭhamasaccaṃ, jātiyā jarāmaraṇaṃ paṭhamasaccappabhavaṃ paṭhamasaccanti. Evaṃ tāvidaṃ
analyzed: paṭhama saccam jātiyāḥ jarā maraṇam paṭhama sacca ppabhavam paṭhama saccanti evam tau idam
translated: The first truth has the first truth for its origin since birth is the cause of ageing and death.

original: ‘saccappabhavato’ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: sacca ppabhavataḥ viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: This is how it should be understood “according as is appropriate” as to the origin of the truths.

original: Yasmā panettha avijjā vatthūsu ca satte sammoheti paccayo ca hoti saṅkhārānaṃ pātubhāvāya,🔽tathā saṅkhārā saṅkhatañca abhisaṅkharonti paccayā ca honti viññāṇassa, viññāṇampi
analyzed: yasmai pana ittha avijjā vatthūsu ca satte sammoheti paccayaḥ ca hoti saṅkhārānam pātubhāvāya  tathā saṅkhārā saṅkhatañca abhisaṅkharonti paccayā ca honti viññāṇassa viññāṇam pi
translated: But here ignorance deludes beings about the bases and is a condition for the manifestation of formations.🔽So too formations form the formed and are a condition for consciousness.

original: vatthuñca paṭijānāti paccayo ca hoti nāmarūpassa, nāmarūpampi aññamaññañca upatthambheti
analyzed: vatthuñca paṭijānāti paccayaḥ ca hoti nāma rūpassa nāma rūpam pi aññam aññam ca upatthambheti
translated: Consciousness cognizes the base and is a condition for mentality-materiality. Mentality-materiality supports each other and is a condition for the sixfold base.

original: paccayo ca hoti saḷāyatanassa, saḷāyatanampi savisaye ca vattati paccayo ca hoti
analyzed: paccayaḥ ca hoti saḷāyatanassa saḷāyatanam pi sa visaye ca vattati paccayaḥ ca hoti
translated: and it is a condition for the sixfold base. The sixfold base too occurs in the objective field and is a condition

original: phassassa, phassopi ārammaṇañca phusati paccayo ca hoti vedanāya, vedanāpi ārammaṇarasañca
analyzed: phassassa phassaḥ api ārammaṇam ca phusati paccayaḥ ca hoti vedanāya vedanā api ārammaṇa rasañca
translated: for contact. Contact too contacts the object and is a condition for feeling. Feeling too experiences the taste of the object

original: anubhavati paccayo ca hoti taṇhāya, taṇhāpi rajjanīye ca dhamme rajjati paccayo ca
analyzed: anubhavati paccayaḥ ca hoti taṇhāya taṇhā api rajjanīye ca dhamme rajjati paccayaḥ ca
translated: and is a condition for craving. Craving too lusts after things that give rise to lust and is a condition

original: hoti upādānassa, upādānampi upādānīye ca dhamme upādiyati paccayo ca hoti bhavassa,
analyzed: hoti upādānassa upādānam pi upādānīye ca dhamme upādiyati paccayaḥ ca hoti bhavassa
translated: for assuming. Assuming too assumes things that can be assumed and is a condition for being.

original: bhavopi nānāgatīsu ca vikkhipati paccayo ca hoti jātiyā, jātipi khandhe ca janeti
analyzed: bhavaḥ api nānā gatīsu ca vikkhipati paccayaḥ ca hoti jātiyā jāti pi khandhe ca janeti
translated: Being too distributes itself among the various future lives and is a condition for birth. Birth too generates the aggregates

original: tesaṃ abhinibbattibhāvena pavattatā paccayo ca hoti jarāmaraṇassa, jarāmaraṇampi
analyzed: tesam abhinibbatti bhāvena pavatta tā paccayaḥ ca hoti jarā maraṇassa jarā maraṇam pi
translated: and occurs in the sense of the manifestation of those aggregates, and it is a condition for ageing and death. Ageing and death too

original: khandhānaṃ pākabhedabhāvañca adhitiṭṭhati paccayo ca hoti bhavantarapātubhāvāya sokādīnaṃ
analyzed: khandhānam pāka bheda bhāvañca adhitiṭṭhati paccayo ca hoti bhavantara pātubhāvāya soka ādīnam
translated: uphold the maturing and dissolution of the aggregates and are a condition for the manifestation of the next becoming and for sorrow, etc.,

original: adhiṭṭhānattā, tasmā sabbapadesu dvidhā pavatta‘kiccato’pi idaṃ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: adhiṭṭhāna ttā tasmā sabba padesu dvidhā pavatta kiccataḥ pi idam viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: because of their upholding. So this should be understood as “by function” in all the passages in the various ways according to the circumstances.

original: Yasmā cettha “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”ti idaṃ kārakadassananivāraṇaṃ, “saṅkhārapaccayā🔽viññāṇa”nti attasaṅkantidassananivāraṇaṃ, “viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpa”nti attātiparikappitavatthubhedadassanato
analyzed: yasmai ca ittha avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ti idam kāraka dassana nivāraṇam saṅkhāra paccayā  viññāṇanti atta saṅkanti dassana nivāraṇam viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpam ti attā ati parikappita vatthu bheda dassanato
translated: But here the phrase “With ignorance as condition there are formations” prevents the seeing of a doer; the phrase “With formations as condition, consciousness” prevents the seeing of a self; the phrase “With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality” prevents the seeing of a self as a unity by showing the different components of a self;

original: ghanasaññānivāraṇaṃ, “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”ntiādīsu “attā passati…pe… vijānāti
analyzed: ghana saññā nivāraṇam nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatana nti ādīsu attā vijānāti
translated: the phrase “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base” prevents the seeing of compactness ; the phrases “The self sees … feels … perceives … resolves … has … becomes … is reborn” prevent the seeing of the self as an agent in the following instances: “The self sees visible forms,” etc.,

original: phusati vedayati taṇhiyati upādiyati bhavati jāyati jīyati mīyatī”ti evamādidassananivāraṇaṃ,
analyzed: phusati vedayati taṇhiyati upādiyati bhavati jāyati jīyati mīyati iti evamādi dassana nivāraṇam
translated: “The self feels … perceives … resolves … has … becomes … is reborn.”

original: tasmā micchādassananivāraṇatopetaṃ bhavacakkaṃ ‘nivāraṇato’ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā micchādassana nivāraṇa tā upetam bhava cakkam nivāraṇataḥ viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: So the round of existence should be known as “to be seen as preventing” in the way appropriate to each instance, since it prevents wrong seeing.

original: Yasmā panettha salakkhaṇasāmaññalakkhaṇavasena dhammānaṃ adassanato andho viya avijjā,
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha sa lakkhaṇa sāmañña lakkhaṇa vasena dhammānam a dassanataḥ andhaḥ viya avijjā
translated: But here ignorance is like a blind man in that it does not see states as to their individual essences and their general characteristics;

original: andhassa upakkhalanaṃ viya avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, upakkhalitassa patanaṃ viya saṅkhārapaccayā
analyzed: andhassa upakkhalanam viya avijjā paccayā saṅkhārāḥ upakkhalitassa patanam viya saṅkhāra paccayā
translated: formations with ignorance as condition are like the blind man’s stumbling,

original: viññāṇaṃ, patitassa gaṇḍapātubhāvo viya viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, gaṇḍabhedapīḷakā🔽viya nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanaṃ, gaṇḍapīḷakāghaṭṭanaṃ viya saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso,
analyzed: viññāṇam patitassa gaṇḍa pātubhāvaḥ viya viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpam gaṇḍa bheda pīḷakā  viya nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatanam gaṇḍa pīḷaka āghaṭṭanam viya saḷāyatana paccayā phasso
translated: Consciousness is like the appearance of the boil. With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality is like the pain of the boil’s bursting.🔽With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base is like the rubbing of the boil. With the sixfold base as condition, contact is like the pain of the rubbing.

original: ghaṭṭanadukkhaṃ viya phassapaccayā vedanā, dukkhassa paṭikārābhilāso viya vedanāpaccayā🔽taṇhā, paṭikārābhilāsena asappāyaggahaṇaṃ viya taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādinnaasappāyālepanaṃ
analyzed: ghaṭṭana dukkham viya phassa paccayā vedanā dukkhassa paṭikāra abhilāsaḥ viya vedanā paccayā  taṇhā paṭikāra abhilāsena asappāya ggahaṇam viya taṇhā paccayā upādānam upādinna asappāya ālepanam
translated: With contact as condition, feeling is like the desire to remedy the pain. With feeling as condition, craving is like the seizing of a remedy that is not suitable.

original: viya upādānapaccayā bhavo, asappāyālepanena gaṇḍavikārapātubhāvo viya bhavapaccayā
analyzed: viya upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ asappāya ālepanena gaṇḍa vikāra pātubhāvaḥ viya bhava paccayā
translated: With craving as condition, clinging is like the smearing of the boil with the unsuitable remedy.

original: jāti, gaṇḍavikārato gaṇḍabhedo viya jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ.🔽Yasmā vā panettha avijjā appaṭipattimicchāpaṭipattibhāvena satte abhibhavati paṭalaṃ
analyzed: jāti gaṇḍa vikārataḥ gaṇḍa bhedaḥ viya jāti paccayā jarā maraṇam  yasmai vā pana ittha avijjā appaṭipattim icchā paṭipatti bhāvena satte abhibhavati paṭalam
translated: With clinging as condition, existence is like the boil’s change for the worse. With existence as condition, birth is like the bursting of the boil. With birth as condition, ageing, death, and so on, are like the pain of the boil’s bursting.

original: viya akkhīni, tadabhibhūto ca bālo ponobbhavikehi saṅkhārehi attānaṃ veṭheti kosakārakimi
analyzed: viya akkhīni tad abhibhūto ca bālaḥ ponobbhavikehi saṅkhārehi attānam veṭheti
translated: Or alternatively, ignorance overpowers beings by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave wrongly and by causing them to behave

original: viya kosappadesehi, saṅkhārapariggahitaṃ viññāṇaṃ gatīsu patiṭṭhaṃ labhati pariṇāyakapariggahito🔽viya rājakumāro rajje, upapattinimittaṃ parikappanato viññāṇaṃ paṭisandhiyaṃ anekappakāraṃ
analyzed: viya kosa ppadesehi saṅkhāra pariggahitam viññāṇam gatīsu patiṭṭham labhati pariṇāyaka pariggahitaḥ  viya rāja kumāraḥ rajje upapatti nimittam parikappanataḥ viññāṇam paṭisandhiyam aneka ppakāram
translated: Just as a king’s son, when he has been taken over by his ministers, is established in the kingship, so too consciousness, when it has been taken over by formations, obtains a footing in the destinies.🔽Just as a magician, when he has conjured up a magical image, conjures up various things in it, so too consciousness, when it has obtained a footing in rebirth-linking, produces various kinds of mentality-materiality by its assumption of the appearance of the rebirth.

original: nāmarūpaṃ abhinibbatteti māyākāro viya māyaṃ, nāmarūpe patiṭṭhitaṃ saḷāyatanaṃ vuddhiṃ
analyzed: nāma rūpam abhinibbattā iti māyākāraḥ viya māyam nāma rūpe patiṭṭhitam saḷāyatanam vuddhim
translated: Mentality-materiality, when it has obtained a footing in consciousness, reaches growth, increase, and fulfilment,

original: virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ pāpuṇāti subhūmiyaṃ patiṭṭhito vanappagumbo viya, āyatanaghaṭṭanato
analyzed: virūḷhim vepullam pāpuṇāti subhūmiyam patiṭṭhitaḥ vanappagumbaḥ viya āyatana ghaṭṭanato
translated: just as a forest tree reaches growth, increase, and fulfilment when it has obtained a footing in good soil.🔽Contact arises with the impingement of the bases,🔽just as fire arises with the rubbing together of two sticks.

original: phasso jāyati araṇīsahitābhimaddanato aggi viya, phassena phuṭṭhassa vedanā pātubhavati
analyzed: phassaḥ jāyati araṇī sahita abhimaddanataḥ aggi viya phassena phuṭṭhassa vedanā pātubhavati
translated: When he is contacted by contact, feeling appears to him,🔽just as burning appears to one contacted by fire.🔽When he feels, craving grows in him,🔽just as thirst grows in one who drinks salt water.

original: agginā phuṭṭhassa ḍāho viya, vedayamānassa taṇhā vaḍḍhati loṇūdakaṃ pivato pipāsā
analyzed: agginā phuṭṭhassa ḍāhaḥ viya vedayamānassa taṇhā vaḍḍhati loṇūdakam pivataḥ pipāsā
translated: When he is tormented by craving, he aspires for the kinds of becoming,🔽just as one who is thirsty aspires for drinks.

original: viya, tasito bhavesu abhilāsaṃ karoti pipāsito viya pānīye, tadassupādānaṃ upādānena
analyzed: viya tasitaḥ bhavesu abhilāsam karoti pipāsitaḥ viya pānīye tat assa upādānam upādānena
translated: When he has that craving as his support, he clings,🔽just as a fish that has swallowed the hook clings to the bait.🔽When there is being, there is birth,

original: bhavaṃ upādiyati āmisalobhena maccho baḷisaṃ viya, bhave sati jāti hoti bīje sati
analyzed: bhavam āmisa lobhena macchaḥ baḷisam bhave sati jāti hoti bīje sati
translated: just as when there is a seed there is a shoot.

original: aṅkuro viya, jātassa avassaṃ jarāmaraṇaṃ uppannassa rukkhassa patanaṃ viya, tasmā
analyzed: aṅkuraḥ viya jātassa avassam jarā maraṇam uppannassa rukkhassa patanam viya tasmā
translated: As a sprout from a seed, as falling from a tree when it is ripe, so too,

original: evaṃ ‘upamāhi’ petaṃ bhavacakkaṃ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: evam upamāhi petam bhava cakkam viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: after birth, aging and death are inevitable. Therefore this Wheel of Becoming should be known as it really is by way of the similes.

original: Yasmā ca bhagavatā atthatopi dhammatopi desanātopi paṭivedhatopi gambhīrabhāvaṃ sandhāya🔽“gambhīro cāyaṃ, ānanda, paṭiccasamuppādo gambhīrāvabhāso cā”ti vuttaṃ, tasmā ‘gambhīrabhedato’petaṃ
analyzed: yasmā ca bhagavatā atthataḥ api dhammataḥ api desanātaḥ api paṭivedhataḥ api gambhīra bhāvam sandhāya  gambhīraḥ ca ayam ānanda paṭiccasamuppādaḥ gambhīra avabhāso ca ati vuttam tasmā gambhīra bheda tā upetam
translated: And because the Blessed One said: “This dependent origination is deep, Ananda, and deep in its meaning too,”

original: bhavacakkaṃ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ.
analyzed: bhava cakkam viññātabbam yathāraham
translated: referring to its profundity in meaning, in principle, in teaching, and in penetration, therefore this Wheel of Becoming should be known as it really is by way of its profundity.🔽Herein, aging and death do not come about from birth, nor do they come about from anything other than birth, nor yet do they come about without a cause. But they come about from birth in this way.

original: katthaci ekasandhidvisaṅkhepaṃ desitaṃ, tasmā idaṃ bhavacakkaṃ desanāgambhīranti
analyzed: katthaci eka sandhi dvi saṅkhepam desitam tasmai idam bhava cakkam desanā gambhīram ti
translated: Herein, any knowledge other than the knowledge of omniscience finds support in this wheel of becoming, for this is taught in some sutta in forward order, in some in reverse order, in some in forward and reverse order, in some from the middle to the end and from the end back to the middle, in some from the middle to the front and from the front back to the middle, in some from the front to the end and from the end back to the front, in some from the front to the middle and from the middle back to the front. And it is taught in some sutta with three links and four sections, in some with two links and three sections, in some with one link and two sections. So this wheel of becoming is profound in teaching.

original: ayaṃ desanāgambhīratā.🔽Yasmā panettha yo avijjādīnaṃ sabhāvo, yena paṭividdhena avijjādayo dhammā salakkhaṇato🔽paṭividdhā honti, so duppariyogāhattā gambhīro, tasmā idaṃ bhavacakkaṃ paṭivedhagambhīraṃ.
analyzed: ayam desanā gambhīra tā  yasmā pana ittha yaḥ avijjā ādīnam sabhāvaḥ yena paṭividdhena avijjā ādayaḥ dhammā salakkhaṇato  paṭividdhāḥ honti tasmai idam bhava cakkam paṭivedha gambhīram
translated: This is profundity of teaching.🔽But since the specific nature of ignorance, etc., is profound because it is hard to penetrate, and through penetration of it the states classed as ignorance, etc., are penetrated as to their specific characteristic, therefore this wheel of becoming is profound in penetration.

original: Tathā hettha avijjāya aññāṇādassanasaccāsampaṭivedhaṭṭho gambhīro, saṅkhārānaṃ abhisaṅkharaṇāyūhanasarāgavirāgaṭṭho,
analyzed: tathā ha ittha avijjāya aññāṇa a dassana sacca a sampaṭivedha ṭṭho gambhīraḥ saṅkhārānaṃ abhisaṅkharaṇa a yūhana sa rāga virāga ṭṭho
translated: And here the profundity of ignorance is due to its being the state of unknowing, non-penetration, and non-seeing of the four noble truths; that of formations is due to their being the state of accumulation, of accumulating, and of being subject to cankers; that of consciousness is due to its being the state of the seed of rebirth; that of mentality-materiality is due to its being the state of the seed of the next becoming; that of the sixfold base is due to its being the state of the seed of contact; that of contact is due to its being the state of the seed of feeling; that of feeling is due to its being the state of the seed of craving; that of craving is due to its being the state of the seed of clinging; that of existence is due to its being the state of the seed of the next becoming; that of birth is due to its being the state of the seed of the next becoming; that of ageing and death is due to its being the state of the seed of the next becoming. So this wheel of becoming is profound in penetration.

original: viññāṇassa suññataabyāpāraasaṅkantipaṭisandhipātubhāvaṭṭho, nāmarūpassa ekuppādavinibbhogāvinibbhoganamanaruppanaṭṭho,
analyzed: viññāṇassa suññata a byāpāra asaṅkanti paṭisandhi pātubhāva ṭho nāma rūpassa eka uppāda vinibbhoga avinibbhoga namana ruppana ṭho
translated: The meaning of the emptiness of consciousness, of its non-functioning, of its non-adhesion, of its appearance as rebirth-linking, is deep. The meaning of mentality-materiality as a single arising, as the non-division of the physical body and consciousness, as the bending or yielding of consciousness to the material and the bending or yielding of the material to the mental, as the manifestation of the material in the form of the mental, is deep.

original: saḷāyatanassa adhipatilokadvārakhettavisayavisayībhāvaṭṭho, phassassa phusanasaṅghaṭṭanasaṅgatisannipātaṭṭho,🔽vedanāya ārammaṇarasānubhavanasukhadukkhamajjhattabhāvanijjīvavedayitaṭṭho, taṇhāya
analyzed: saḷāyatanassa adhipati loka dvāra khetta visaya visayībhāva ṭho phassassa phusana saṅghaṭṭana saṅgati sannipāta ṭho  vedanāya taṇhāya
translated: The meaning of the sixfold base as the dominant, as the world, as the door, as the field, as the subject that has an object, is deep. The meaning of contact as touching, as impingement, as conjunction, as union, is deep.

original: abhinanditajjhosānasaritālatānadītaṇhāsamuddaduppūraṇaṭṭho, upādānassa ādānaggahaṇābhinivesaparāmāsaduratikkamanaṭṭho,
analyzed: abhinandita jhosāna sarita alatā nadī taṇhā samudda duppūraṇa ṭhaḥ upādānassa ādāna ggahaṇa abhinivesa parāmāsa duratikkamana ṭhaḥ
translated: The meaning of feeling as the experiencing of the mode of an object, as pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain, as the life of beings, as what is to be felt, is deep. The meaning of craving as cleaving to, as relishing, as flowing, as spreading out, as a river, as the ocean of craving, as filling, is deep. The meaning of clinging as grasping, as holding, as insisting, as misapprehending, as not transcending, is deep.

original: bhavassa āyūhanābhisaṅkharaṇayonigatiṭhitinivāsesu khipanaṭṭho, jātiyā jātisañjātiokkantinibbattipātubhāvaṭṭho,
analyzed: bhavassa āyūhana abhisaṅkharaṇa yoni gati ṭhiti nivāsesu khipana ṭhaḥ jātiyā jāti sañjāti okkanti nibbatti pātubhāva ṭhaḥ
translated: The meaning of becoming as the projecting of the kamma-result, as the determining of the kamma-result, as the womb, as the destiny, as the station, as the abode, is deep. The meaning of birth as birth, as coming to birth, as appearing, as being born, as the manifestation of the aggregates, is deep.

original: jarāmaraṇassa khayavayabhedavipariṇāmaṭṭho gambhīroti ayamettha paṭivedhagambhīratā.
analyzed: jarā maraṇassa khaya vaya bheda vipariṇāma ṭṭhaḥ gambhīraḥ ti ayam ettha paṭivedha gambhīra tā
translated: The meaning of ageing-and-death as exhaustion, as wasting, as breaking up, as change, is deep. This is the depth of penetration.

original: Yasmā panettha ekattanayo, nānattanayo, abyāpāranayo, evaṃdhammatānayoti cattāro
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha ekatta nayaḥ nānatta nayaḥ abyāpāra nayaḥ evaṃdhamma tā nayaḥ cattāro
translated: But since there are four ways of interpreting the meaning here, namely, the method of unity, the method of diversity, the method of non-confusion, and the method of the way things are,

original: atthanayā honti, tasmā ‘nayabhedato’petaṃ bhavacakkaṃ viññātabbaṃ yathārahaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: atthanayāḥ honti tasmā naya bheda tā upetam bhava cakkam viññātabbam yathāraham tattha
translated: therefore this wheel of existence should be known “as to analysis of the method” in the appropriate way. Herein,

original: “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇa”nti evaṃ bījassa aṅkurādibhāvena🔽rukkhabhāvappatti viya santānānupacchedo ‘ekattanayo’ nāma; yaṃ sammā passanto hetuphalasambandhena🔽pavattamānassa santānassa anupacchedāvabodhato ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ pajahati, micchā passanto
analyzed: avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇan ti evam bījassa aṅkura ādi bhāvena  rukkha bhāva ppatti viya santāna an upacchedaḥ eka ttanayaḥ nāma yam sammā passantaḥ hetu phala sambandhena  pavattamānassa santānassa an upaccheda avabodhataḥ uccheda diṭṭhim pajahati micchā passanto
translated: “With ignorance as condition there are formations; with formations as condition, consciousness” ,

original: hetuphalasambandhena pavattamānassa santānānupacchedassa ekattaggahaṇato sassatadiṭṭhiṃ upādiyati.
analyzed: hetu phala sambandhena pavattamānassa santāna anupacchedassa ekatta ggahaṇataḥ sassata diṭṭhim upādiyati
translated: just as the occurrence of the tree by the shoot, etc., is the continuity of the series, so too is the occurrence of the kamma-result by consciousness, etc., the continuity of the series. This is called the “method of unity.” When he sees this correctly, he abandons the view of annihilation because he understands the continuity of the series that occurs with cause and fruit. When he sees it wrongly, he assumes the eternity view because he takes the continuity of the series that occurs with cause and fruit as a unity.

original: Avijjādīnaṃ pana yathāsakalakkhaṇavavatthānaṃ ‘nānattanayo’ nāma; yaṃ sammā passanto
analyzed: avijjā ādīnam pana yathā saka lakkhaṇa vavatthānam nānattanayaḥ nāma yam sammā passanto
translated: But the definition of the specific characteristics of ignorance, etc., is called the “method of diversity.” When he sees this correctly,

original: navanavānaṃ uppādadassanato sassatadiṭṭhiṃ pajahati, micchā passanto ekasantānapatitassa
analyzed: nava navānam uppāda dassanataḥ sassata diṭṭhim pajahati micchā passantaḥ eka santāna patitassa
translated: He abandons the eternalist view by seeing the arising of the new aggregates in each rebirth-linking.

original: bhinnasantānasseva nānattaggahaṇato ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ upādiyati.
analyzed: bhinna santānassa iva nānatta gahaṇataḥ uccheda diṭṭhim upādiyati
translated: He adopts the annihilationist view by grasping the diversity of the aggregates in different continua of one being.

original: Avijjāya ‘saṅkhārā mayā uppādetabbā’, saṅkhārānaṃ vā ‘viññāṇaṃ amhehī’ti evamādibyāpārābhāvo🔽‘abyāpāranayo’ nāma; yaṃ sammā passanto kārakassa abhāvāvabodhato attadiṭṭhiṃ pajahati,
analyzed: avijjāya saṅkhārāḥ mayā uppādetabbā saṅkhārānam vā viññāṇam amhehi iti evamādi byāpāra abhāvaḥ  abyāpāra nayaḥ nāma yam sammā passanto kārakassa abhāva avabodhataḥ atta diṭṭhim pajahati
translated: The absence of any such activity as “The formations should be produced by ignorance” or “Consciousness should be produced by the formations” is called the “principle of non-activity.”🔽He abandons the view of self by rightly seeing the non-existence of an agent.

original: micchā passanto yo asatipi byāpāre avijjādīnaṃ sabhāvaniyamasiddho hetubhāvo tassa
analyzed: micchā passanto yaḥ asati api byāpāre avijjā ādīnam sa bhāva niyama siddho hetu bhāvaḥ tassa
translated: He adopts the view of non-causality by wrongly seeing the absence of any activity, and by not grasping the fact that the state of being a cause of the formations, etc., is established by the nature of ignorance, etc.,

original: aggahaṇato akiriyadiṭṭhiṃ upādiyati.🔽Avijjādīhi pana kāraṇehi saṅkhārādīnaṃyeva sambhavo khīrādīhi dadhiādīnaṃ viya, na
analyzed: aggahaṇataḥ akiriya diṭṭhim upādiyati  avijja ādīhi pana kāraṇehi saṅkhāra ādīnam yeva sambhavaḥ khīra ādīhi dadhi ādīnam na
translated: just as the state of being a cause of curd, etc., is established by the nature of milk, etc.🔽The fact that the formations, etc., are produced only by ignorance, etc., as their causes, like curd, etc., only by milk, etc., as their causes, and not by any other causes, is called the “principle of specific conditionality.”

original: aññesanti ayaṃ ‘evaṃdhammatānayo’ nāma; yaṃ sammā passanto paccayānurūpato phalāvabodhato
analyzed: aññesanti ayam evaṃdhammatā ānayaḥ nāma yam sammā passantaḥ paccaya anurūpataḥ phala avabodhato
translated: He abandons the view of non-causality by rightly seeing the result in accordance with the cause.

original: ahetukadiṭṭhiñca akiriyadiṭṭhiñca pajahati, micchā passanto paccayānurūpaṃ phalappavattiṃ🔽aggahetvā yato kutoci yassa kassaci asambhavaggahaṇato ahetukadiṭṭhiñceva niyatavādañca🔽upādiyatīti evamidaṃ bhavacakkaṃ –🔽Saccappabhavato kiccā, vāraṇā upamāhi ca;
analyzed: ahetuka diṭṭhiñca akiriya diṭṭhiñca pajahati micchā passantaḥ paccaya anurūpam phala ppavattim  aggahetvā yatas kutoci yassa kassaci asambhava ggahaṇataḥ ahetuka diṭṭhiñca iva niyata vādañca  evam idam bhava cakkam  sacca ppabhavataḥ kiccā vāraṇāḥ upamāhi ca

original: kulagaṇṭhikajātā muñjapabbajabhūtā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ nātivattatī”ti.
analyzed: kulagaṇṭhika jātā muñja pabbaja bhūtā apāyam duggatim vinipātam saṃsāram na ativattati iti
translated: He does not transcend the plane of misery, the bad destinations, the nether world, Saṃsāra.

original: Tasmā attano vā paresaṃ vā hitāya sukhāya paṭipanno avasesakiccāni pahāya –
analyzed: tasmai attanaḥ vā paresam vā hitāya sukhāya paṭipanno avasesa kiccāni pahāya
translated: Therefore, one who is engaged in the welfare and happiness of oneself and others, having abandoned the remaining duties,

original: Gambhīre paccayākāra-ppabhede idha paṇḍito;
analyzed: gambhīre paccaya ākāra ppabhede idha paṇḍito
translated: The wise one here, in the profound analysis of conditions,

original: Yathā gādhaṃ labhetheva-manuyuñje sadā satoti.
analyzed: yathā gādham labhetha ivam anuyuñje sadā satā iti
translated: Should always apply himself with mindfulness, as if seeking a crossing.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
translated: The explanation of the Basket of Discourses is concluded.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the Basket of Higher Teachings

original: 243. Evaṃ mahāpathaviṃ pattharanto viya ākāsaṃ vitthārayanto viya ca sabbadhammesu
analyzed: evam mahā pathavim pattharantaḥ viya ākāsam vitthārayantaḥ viya ca sabba dhammesu
translated: Thus, the Teacher, whose knowledge is unobstructed regarding all phenomena, like one spreading out the great earth or expanding the sky,

original: appaṭihatañāṇo satthā suttantabhājanīye niggaṇṭhiṃ nijjaṭaṃ paccayākāraṃ nānācittavasena
analyzed: a paṭihata ñāṇaḥ satthā suttanta bhājanīye niggaṇṭhim nijjaṭam paccaya ākāram nānā citta vasena
translated: having shown the knot, the tangle, the conditionality, by way of various minds in the Basket of Discourses,🔽now, since this conditionality is not only in various minds, but

original: dassetvā idāni yasmā na kevalaṃ ayaṃ paccayākāro nānācittesuyeva hoti, ekacittepi
analyzed: dassetvā idāni yasmā na kevalam ayam paccaya ākāraḥ nānā cittesu yā iva hoti eka citte pi
translated: is also in a single mind,

original: hotiyeva, tasmā abhidhammabhājanīyavasena ekacittakkhaṇikaṃ paccayākāraṃ nānappakārato
analyzed: tasmai abhidhamma bhājanīya vasena eka citta kkhaṇikam paccaya ākāram nānā ppakārato
translated: therefore, by way of the Basket of Higher Teachings, he shows the conditionality in a single moment of consciousness in various ways.

original: dassetuṃ avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārotiādinā nayena mātikaṃ tāva ṭhapesi. Evaṃ ṭhapitāya pana mātikāya –
analyzed: dassetum avijjā paccayā saṅkhāraḥ ti ādinā nayena mātikam tāva ṭhapesi evam ṭhapitāya pana mātikāya
translated: But when the mātikā is set out in this way,🔽The nine terms beginning with “ignorance”

original: Avijjādīhi mūlehi, nava mūlapadā nava;
analyzed: avijja ādīhi mūlehi nava mūla padāḥ nava
translated: Are the nine methods there;🔽The four tetrads and the analysis

original: Nayā tattha catukkāni, vārabhedañca dīpaye.🔽Tatrāyaṃ dīpanā – ettha hi avijjāsaṅkhāraviññāṇanāmachaṭṭhāyatanaphassavedanātaṇhāupādānappabhedehi🔽avijjādīhi navahi mūlapadehi avijjādiko, saṅkhārādiko, viññāṇādiko, nāmādiko, chaṭṭhāyatanādiko,
analyzed: catukkāni vāra bhedam ca dīpaye  tatra ayam dīpanā ettha hi avijjā saṅkhāra viññāṇa nāma chaṭṭha āyatana phassa vedanā taṇhā upādāna ppabhedehi  avijjā ādīhi navahi mūlapadehi avijjā ādikaḥ saṅkhāra ādikaḥ viññāṇa ādikaḥ nāma ādikaḥ chaṭṭha āyatana ādikaḥ
translated: By way of the faculties are shown.

original: phassādiko, vedanādiko, taṇhādiko, upādānādikoti ime nava mūlapadā nava nayā honti.
analyzed: phassa ādiko vedanā ādiko taṇhā ādiko upādāna ādiko iti ime nava mūla padāḥ nava nayāḥ honti
translated: Herein, the nine terms beginning with “ignorance” are the nine methods, namely, the method beginning with ignorance, the method beginning with formations, the method beginning with consciousness, the method beginning with mentality-materiality, the method beginning with the sixfold base, the method beginning with contact, the method beginning with feeling, the method beginning with craving, and the method beginning with clinging.🔽The four tetrads are the four tetrads of condition, cause, association, and reciprocity.🔽And the analysis by way of the faculties is the analysis of the faculties.

original: Tesu yo tāva ayaṃ avijjādiko nayo, tattha paccayacatukkaṃ, hetucatukkaṃ, sampayuttacatukkaṃ,🔽aññamaññacatukkanti cattāri catukkāni honti. Yathā cettha evaṃ sesesupīti ekekasmiṃ
analyzed: tesu yaḥ tāva ayam avijjā ādikaḥ nayo tattha paccaya catukkam hetu catukkam sampayutta catukkam 🔽aññam añña catukkam ti cattāri catukkāni honti yathā ca ittha evam sesesu pi iti ekekasmin
translated: Herein, firstly, as regards the method beginning with ignorance, there are four tetrads, namely, the tetrad of conditions, the tetrad of causes, the tetrad of associations, and the tetrad of reciprocities.

original: naye catunnaṃ catunnaṃ catukkānaṃ vasena chattiṃsa catukkāni. Tattha ekekena catukkena
analyzed: naye catunnam catunnam catukkānam vasena chattiṃsa catukkāni tattha ekekena catukkena
translated: In the case of the four groups of four, there are thirty-six groups of four. Herein, since each of the four groups of four is included in four of the fourfold series,

original: catunnaṃ catunnaṃ vārānaṃ saṅgahitattā catunnampi catukkānaṃ vasena ekekasmiṃ naye
analyzed: catunnam catunnam saṅgahita ttā catunnam api catukkānam vasena ekekasmin naye
translated: in each case there are sixteen permutations in the four groups of four.

original: soḷasa soḷasa vārāti catucattālīsādhikaṃ vārasataṃ hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: soḷasa soḷasa vārā ati catucattālīsa adhikam vāra satam hoti iti veditabbam
translated: So the total should be understood as being one hundred and forty-four.

original: 1. Paccayacatukkaṃ
analyzed: paccaya catukkam
translated: The fourfold series of conditions

original: Tattha yadetaṃ sabbapaṭhame avijjāmūlake naye paccayacatukkaṃ, tasmiṃ paṭhamo nāmarūpaṭṭhāne🔽nāmassa, saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne chaṭṭhāyatanassa ca vuttattā aparipuṇṇaaṅgadvayayutto dvādasaṅgikavāro🔽nāma. Dutiyo nāmarūpaṭṭhāne nāmasseva, saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne ca na kassaci vuttattā aparipuṇṇaekaṅgayutto
analyzed: tattha yat etam sabba paṭhame avijjā mūlake naye paccaya catukkam tasmim paṭhamaḥ nāma rūpa ṭṭhāne  nāmassa chaṭṭha āyatanassa ca vutta ttā aparipuṇṇa aṅga dvaya yuttaḥ dvādasaṅgika vāro  nāma dutiyaḥ nāma rūpa ṭṭhāne nāmassa iva saḷāyatana ṭṭhāne ca na kassaci vutta ttā a paripuṇṇa ekaṅga yuttaḥ
translated: Herein, the first permutation in the first tetrad of conditions, which is that headed by ignorance,🔽is called the “twelve-factored permutation” since it has two incomplete factors, namely, the “state of mentality” in the case of the “name-and-form” factor,🔽and the “sixth base” in the case of the “sixfold base” factor. The second is called the “eleven-factored permutation” since it has one incomplete factor,

original: ekādasaṅgikavāro nāma. Tatiyo saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne chaṭṭhāyatanassa vuttattā paripuṇṇaekaṅgayutto
analyzed: ekādasaṅgikavāraḥ nāma tatiyo saḷāyatana ṭṭhāne chaṭṭha āyatanassa vuttattā paripuṇṇa ekaṅga yutto
translated: namely, the “name” in the case of the “name-and-form” factor, and none in the case of the “sixfold base” factor. The third is called the “one-factored permutation”🔽since it has one complete factor, namely, the “sixth base” in the case of the “sixfold base” factor.

original: dvādasaṅgikavāro nāma. Catuttho pana paripuṇṇadvādasaṅgikoyeva.
analyzed: dvādasaṅgikavāraḥ nāma catutthaḥ pana
translated: The fourth is complete in all twelve factors.

original: Tattha siyā – ayampi chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phassoti vuttattā aparipuṇṇekaṅgayuttoyevāti?
analyzed: tattha siyā ayam pi chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phassaḥ ti vutta ttā aparipuṇṇa ekaṅga yuttaḥ yā iva ati
translated: Here it may be asked: But since it is said “With the sixfold base as condition, contact,” is it not incomplete in one factor?

original: Na, tassa anaṅgattā. Phassoyeva hettha aṅgaṃ, na chaṭṭhāyatanaṃ. Tasmā tassa anaṅgattā
analyzed: na tassa an aṅga ttā phassaḥ uyā iva ha ittha aṅgam na chaṭṭha āyatanam tasmā tassa an aṅga ttā
translated: No, because it has no factor. For contact is the factor here, not the sixfold base. Therefore, since it has no factor,

original: nāyaṃ aparipuṇṇekaṅgayuttoti. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana vuttaṃ – “paṭhamo sabbasaṅgāhikaṭṭhena,
analyzed: na ayam a paripuṇṇa eka aṅga yutto ti aṭṭhakathāyam pana vuttam
