translated: it is not incomplete in one factor. But in the commentary it is said: “The first is included by way of the totality;

original: dutiyo paccayavisesaṭṭhena, tatiyo gabbhaseyyakasattānaṃ vasena, catuttho opapātikasattānaṃ🔽vasena gahito. Tathā paṭhamo sabbasaṅgāhikaṭṭhena, dutiyo paccayavisesaṭṭhena, tatiyo
analyzed: dutiyo paccaya visesa ṭṭhena tatiyaḥ gabbhaseyyaka sattānam vasena catutthaḥ opapātika sattānam  vasena gahito tathā paṭhamaḥ sabba saṅgāhika ṭṭhena dutiyo paccaya visesa ṭṭhena tatiyo
translated: the second, by way of the distinction of conditions; the third, by way of beings who sleep in the womb; the fourth, by way of beings who are spontaneously born.

original: aparipuṇṇāyatanavasena, catuttho paripuṇṇāyatanavasena gahito. Tathā paṭhamo sabbasaṅgāhikaṭṭhena,
analyzed: a paripuṇṇa āyatana vasena catuttho paripuṇṇa āyatana vasena gahito tathā paṭhamo sabba saṅgāhika ṭṭhena
translated: Similarly, the first is included by way of the totality; the second, by way of the distinction of conditions; the third, by way of incomplete sense bases; the fourth, by way of complete sense bases.

original: dutiyo mahānidānasuttantavasena, tatiyo rūpabhavavasena, catuttho kāmabhavavasena gahito”ti.
analyzed: dutiyaḥ mahānidāna suttanta vasena tatiyaḥ rūpa bhava vasena catutthaḥ kāma bhava vasena gahitaḥ ti
translated: Similarly, the first is included by way of the totality; the second, by way of the Mahānidāna Sutta; the third, by way of the form-sphere existence; the fourth, by way of the sense-sphere existence.”

original: Tattha paṭhamo imesu dutiyādīsu tīsu vāresu na katthaci na pavisatīti sabbasaṅgāhikoti vutto. Sesānaṃ viseso parato āvibhavissati. Tassāvibhāvatthaṃ –
analyzed: tattha paṭhamaḥ imesu dutiya ādīsu tīsu vāresu na katthaci na pavisati iti sabba saṅgāhiko ti vutto sesānam viseso paratas āvibhavissati tassa avibhāva attham
translated: In order to make that evident,🔽Whatever is said otherwise,

original: Yaṃ yattha aññathā vuttaṃ, avuttañcāpi yaṃ yahiṃ;
analyzed: yam aññathā vuttam a vuttam ca api yam
translated: And whatever is not said,🔽And how each condition is for each,

original: Yaṃ yathā paccayo yassa, taṃ sabbamupalakkhaye.
analyzed: yam yathā paccayaḥ yassa tam sabbam upalakkhaye
translated: All that I shall point out.

original: Tatrāyaṃ nayo – avisesena tāva catūsupi etesu suttantabhājaniye viya saṅkhārāti avatvā
analyzed: tatra ayam nayaḥ avisesena tāva etesu suttanta bhājaniye avatvā
translated: Here is the method. First of all, without specifying them as formations, they are simply called “formations” in all four of these sutta passages, as in the case of the exposition of the dependent origin in the “Description of the Aggregates” .

original: saṅkhāroti vuttaṃ, taṃ kasmāti? Ekacittakkhaṇikattā. Tatra hi nānācittakkhaṇiko paccayākāro
analyzed: saṅkhāraḥ iti vuttam tam kasmā ati eka citta khaṇika ttā tatra hi nānā citta khaṇikaḥ paccaya ākāro
translated: Why? Because they are in a single conscious moment. For there the conditionality is analyzed as occurring in different conscious moments,

original: vibhatto. Idha ekacittakkhaṇiko āraddho. Ekacittakkhaṇe ca bahū cetanā na santīti
analyzed: vibhattaḥ idha eka cittakkhaṇikaḥ āraddhaḥ eka cittakkhaṇe ca bahū cetanāḥ na santi iti
translated: but here it is taken as occurring in a single conscious moment. And in a single conscious moment there are not many volitions,

original: saṅkhārāti avatvā saṅkhāroti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: saṅkhārā iti avatvā saṅkhārā iti vuttam
translated: so they are called “formations” without specifying them.

original: Paṭhamavāre panettha ekacittakkhaṇapariyāpannadhammasaṅgahaṇato sabbaṭṭhānasādhāraṇato
analyzed: paṭhama vāre pana ittha eka citta khaṇa pariyāpanna dhamma saṅgahaṇato sabba ṭṭhāna sādhāraṇato
translated: But in the first round here they are included as states comprised in a single conscious moment, and they are common to all the remaining instances.

original: ca rūpaṃ chaḍḍetvā “viññāṇapaccayā nāma”ntveva vuttaṃ. Tañhi ekacittakkhaṇapariyāpannaṃ
analyzed: ca rūpam chaḍḍetvā viññāṇa paccayā nāma ntu eva vuttam tat hi eka citta kkhaṇa pariyāpannam
translated: and he has omitted matter and said “With consciousness as condition, name-and-form.” For that is included in a single conscious moment,

original: sabbaṭṭhānasādhāraṇañca, na katthaci viññāṇappavattiṭṭhāne na pavattati. Yasmā ca
analyzed: sabba ṭṭhāna sādhāraṇam ca na katthaci viññāṇa ppavatti ṭhāne na pavattati yasmā ca
translated: and it is common to all instances of consciousness occurrence. And it does not occur in any instance of consciousness occurrence where there is no name-and-form.

original: ekacittakkhaṇapariyāpanno ekovettha phasso, tasmā tassānurūpaṃ paccayabhūtaṃ āyatanaṃ
analyzed: eka citta khaṇa pariyāpannaḥ ekaḥ vettha phassaḥ tasmā tassa anurūpam paccaya bhūtam āyatanam
translated: And since in a single conscious moment there is only one contact, he who takes the base as a condition in conformity with that contact

original: gaṇhanto saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne “nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatana”nti ekaṃ manāyatanaṃyeva āha.🔽Tañhi ekassa akusalaphassassa anurūpaṃ paccayabhūtaṃ. Kāmañcetaṃ saṅkhārapaccayā🔽viññāṇanti etthāpi vuttaṃ, hetuphalavisesadassanatthaṃ pana aṅgapuṇṇatthañca puna🔽idha gahitaṃ. Tatra hi etassa visesena saṅkhāro hetu, avisesena nāmaṃ phalaṃ. Idha
analyzed: gaṇhanto saḷāyatana ṭṭhāne nāma paccayā chaṭṭha āyatanam ti ekam āha  tat hi ekassa akusala phassassa anurūpam paccaya bhūtam kāmañca itam saṅkhāra paccayā  viññāṇanti ettha api vuttam hetu phala visesa dassana attham pana aṅga puṇṇa attham ca puna  tatra hi etassa visesena saṅkhāraḥ hetu avisesena nāmam phalam
translated: says “With name-and-form as condition, the sixth base” at the place in the Paṭṭhāna where the bases are stated.🔽For that is a condition in conformity with the one unprofitable contact. And although this is stated in the Paṭṭhāna too thus “With formations as condition, consciousness,” he has taken it here again🔽in order to show the distinction of cause and fruit and to complete the section. For there the formation is the cause of that with distinction, and name is the fruit without distinction. But here

original: panassa avisesena nāmaṃ hetu, visesena phasso phalanti. Sokādayo pana yasmā sabbe
analyzed: panassa avisesena nāmam hetu visesena phasso phalanti soka ādayaḥ pana yasmā sabbe
translated: name is the cause without distinction, and contact is the fruit with distinction. But grief, etc., are stated here

original: ekacittakkhaṇe na sambhavanti, sabbasmiñca cittappavattiṭṭhāne ceva citte ca na pavattanti,🔽tasmā na gahitā. Jātijarāmaraṇāni pana acittakkhaṇamattānipi samānāni cittakkhaṇe🔽antogadhattā aṅgaparipūraṇatthaṃ gahitāni. Evaṃ tāvettha ‘yaṃ aññathā vuttaṃ. Yañca
analyzed: eka citta kkhaṇe na sambhavanti sabbasmin ca citta ppavatti ṭhāne ca iva citte ca na pavattanti  tasmā na gahitā jāti jarā maraṇāni pana acitta khaṇa mattāni pi samānāni citta kkhaṇe  aṅga paripūraṇa attham gahitāni evam tāva ettha yam aññathā vuttam yam ca
translated: They do not occur in a single consciousness moment, and they do not occur in all instances of consciousness occurrence.🔽Therefore they are not included. But birth, ageing, and death, though they are only a single consciousness moment, are included in order to complete the factors, since they are included within the consciousness moment.

original: avuttaṃ’ taṃ veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: a vuttam tat veditabbam
translated: This is how it should be understood what is stated otherwise here and what is not stated.

original: Yaṃ panettha ito paresu vāresu vuttaṃ, tassattho vuttanayeneva veditabbo. Yasmiṃ yasmiṃ pana vāre yo yo viseso āgato, taṃ taṃ tattha tattheva pakāsayissāma.🔽‘Yaṃ yathā paccayo yassā’ti ettha pana saṅkhārassa avijjā sampayuttadhammasādhāraṇehi
analyzed: yam pana ittha itas paresu vāresu vuttam tassa atthaḥ vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ yasmin yasmin pana vāre yaḥ yaḥ visesaḥ āgataḥ tam tam tattha tattha iva pakāsayissāma  yam yathā paccayaḥ yassa ati ettha pana saṅkhārassa avijjā sampayutta dhamma sādhāraṇehi
translated: But the meaning of what is stated in the other sections here and elsewhere should be understood in the way already given. And we shall point out in each case whatever special meaning there may be in each section.

original: sahajātaaññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi chahi hetupaccayena cāti
analyzed: sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata paccayehi chahi hetu paccayena ca ati
translated: As regards the words “The condition being as stated” , ignorance is a condition for formations by means of six kinds of conditionality, that is to say, by conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, and non- disappearance conditionalities, and also by means of cause conditionality.

original: sattadhā paccayo. Tattha yasmā parato hetucatukkādīni tīṇi catukkāni avigatasampayuttaaññamaññapaccayavasena
analyzed: sattadhā paccayaḥ tattha yasmā paratas hetu catukka ādīni tīṇi catukkāni avigata sampayutta aññamañña paccaya vasena
translated: It is a condition in seven ways. Herein, since the three tetrads beginning with the cause-condition tetrad are stated in the way beginning, “Mentally formed are a condition, as object-condition, for resultant-element-and-form” ,

original: vuttāni, tasmā idha tāni apanetvā avasesānaṃ vasena avijjā saṅkhārassa catudhā paccayoti veditabbo.
analyzed: vuttāni tasmai idha tāni apanetvā avasesānam vasena avijjā saṅkhārassa catudhā paccayaḥ ti veditabbaḥ
translated: therefore, by excluding those, it should be understood that ignorance is a condition in four ways for formations.

original: Saṅkhāro viññāṇassa sādhāraṇehi chahi, kammāhārapaccayehi cāti aṭṭhadhā paccayo.🔽Idha pana teyeva tayo apanetvā pañcadhā. Viññāṇaṃ nāmassa sādhāraṇehi chahi, indriyāhārādhipatīhi
analyzed: saṅkhāraḥ viññāṇassa sādhāraṇehi chahi kamma āhāra paccayehi ca ati aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ  idha pana teyā iva tayo apanetvā pañcadhā viññāṇam nāmassa sādhāraṇehi chahi indriya āhāra adhipatīhi
translated: Formations are a condition in eight ways for consciousness: in the way stated above, and by means of the six common conditions beginning with kamma condition and nutriment condition.🔽But here, by excluding those same three, they are in five ways.🔽Consciousness is a condition in nine ways for mentality-materiality: in the way stated above, and by means of the six common conditions beginning with faculty condition and nutriment condition.

original: cāti navadhā. Idha pana tayo apanetvā chadhā. Nāmaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanassa sādhāraṇehi
analyzed: ca ati navadhā idha pana tayaḥ apanetvā chadhā nāmam chaṭṭha āyatanassa sādhāraṇehi
translated: But here, by excluding those same three, they are in six ways.

original: chahi. Kiñci panettha adhipatipaccayena, kiñci āhārapaccayādīhīti anekadhā. Idha
analyzed: chahi kiñci pana ittha adhipati paccayena kiñci āhāra paccaya ādīhi iti anekadhā idha
translated: Mentality-materiality is a condition in six ways for the sixfold base: in the way stated above, and by means of the six common conditions beginning with temperature condition.🔽But here, by excluding those same three, they are in three ways, four ways, or five ways.

original: pana teyeva tayo apanetvā tidhā catudhā pañcadhā vā. Chaṭṭhāyatanaṃ phassassa yathā
analyzed: pana teyā iva tayaḥ apanetvā tidhā catudhā pañcadhā vā chaṭṭha āyatanam phassassa yathā
translated: The sixfold base is a condition in four ways for contact: in the way stated above, and by means of the four common conditions beginning with faculty condition.

original: viññāṇaṃ nāmassa. Evaṃ phasso vedanāya sādhāraṇehi chahi āhārapaccayena cāti sattadhā.
analyzed: viññāṇam nāma assa evam phassaḥ vedanāya sādhāraṇehi chahi āhāra paccayena ca ati sattadhā
translated: and consciousness is a condition for mentality-materiality. So it is in seven ways by means of the condition consisting in nutriment shared by contact and feeling.

original: Idha pana teyeva tayo apanetvā catudhā. Vedanā taṇhāya sādhāraṇehi chahi jhānindriyapaccayehi
analyzed: idha pana teyā iva tayo apanetvā catudhā vedanā taṇhāya sādhāraṇehi chahi jhānindriya paccayehi
translated: But here, omitting those three, it is in four ways by means of the conditions consisting in jhāna, in faculty, and in path shared by feeling and craving.

original: cāti aṭṭhadhā. Idha pana teyeva tayo apanetvā pañcadhā. Taṇhā upādānassa, yathā avijjā
analyzed: ca ati aṭṭhadhā idha pana teyeva tayo apanetvā pañcadhā taṇhā upādānassa yathā avijjā
translated: So it is in eight ways. But here, omitting those three, it is in five ways. Craving is a condition for clinging, as ignorance is for formations.

original: saṅkhārassa. Evaṃ upādānaṃ bhavassa sādhāraṇehi chahi maggapaccayena cāti sattadhā.🔽Idha pana teyeva tayo apanetvā catudhā. Bhavo jātiyā, yasmā jātīti idha saṅkhatalakkhaṇaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhārassa evam upādānam bhavassa sādhāraṇehi chahi magga paccayena ca ati sattadhā  idha pana teyā iva tayaḥ apanetvā catudhā bhavaḥ jātiyā yasmā jātī iti idha saṅkhata lakkhaṇam
translated: So clinging is a condition for becoming in seven ways by means of the conditions consisting in path and in kamma shared by it.🔽But here, omitting those three, it is in four ways. Becoming is a condition for birth, and birth is a condition for ageing-and-death, because what is intended here by “birth” is the characteristic of the formed,

original: adhippetaṃ, tasmā pariyāyena upanissayapaccayeneva paccayo. Tathā jāti jarāmaraṇassāti.
analyzed: adhippetam tasmā pariyāyena upanissaya paccayena iva paccayaḥ tathā jāti jarā maraṇassa ati
translated: so it is a condition by way of decisive support condition only.

original: Ye pana evaṃ vadanti – “imasmiṃ catukke sabbesampi saṅkhārādīnaṃ avijjādayo sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: ye pana evam vadanti imasmin catukke sabbesam pi saṅkhāra ādīnam avijjā ādayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: But those who say that in this tetrad ignorance, etc., are conditions for formations, etc., by means of the condition consisting of conascence,

original: paccayā honti. Sahajātapaccayavaseneva hi paṭhamavāro āraddho”ti, te bhavādīnaṃ tathā🔽abhāvaṃ sesapaccayānañca sambhavaṃ dassetvā paṭikkhipitabbā. Na hi bhavo jātiyā sahajātapaccayo
analyzed: paccayāḥ honti sahajāta paccaya vasena iva hi paṭhama vāraḥ āraddhaḥ ti te bhava ādīnam tathā  abhāvam sesa paccayānam ca sambhavam dassetvā paṭikkhipitabbā na hi bhavaḥ jātiyā sahajāta paccayo
translated: and they are conditions for them. For the first section was begun by way of the conascence condition only.”

original: hoti, na jāti jarāmaraṇassa. Ye cetesaṃ saṅkharādīnaṃ avasesā paccayā vuttā, tepi🔽sambhavantiyeva. Tasmā na sakkā chaḍḍetunti. Evaṃ tāva paṭhamavāre yaṃ yattha aññathā
analyzed: hoti na jāti jarā maraṇassa ye ca etesam saṅkhara ādīnam avasesā paccayā vuttā te pi  tasmā na sakkā chaḍḍetunti evam tāva paṭhama vāre yam aññathā
translated: But they should be refuted by showing that they are not so and that the remaining conditions are possible. For becoming is not a conascence condition for birth, nor is birth for aging-and-death. And the remaining conditions stated for formations and so on are

original: vuttaṃ, avuttañcāpi yaṃ yahiṃ, yañca yathā yassa paccayo hoti, taṃ veditabbaṃ. Dutiyavārādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: vuttam a vuttam ca api yam yañca yathā yassa paccayaḥ hoti tam veditabbam dutiya vāra ādīsu pi esa iva nayaḥ
translated: possible. Therefore it cannot be rejected. This, firstly, is how it should be understood what is stated otherwise in the first section, what is not stated, and how what is stated is a condition for what. The same method applies to the second section, etc.

original: Ayaṃ pana viseso – dutiyavāre “nāmapaccayā phasso”ti vatvā saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne na kiñci
analyzed: ayam pana viseso dutiya vāre nāma paccayā phasso ti vatvā saḷāyatana ṭṭhāne na kiñci
translated: But there is this difference. In the second section, after “With mentality as condition, contact,” nothing is said at the place of the sixfold base.

original: vuttaṃ, taṃ kimatthanti? Paccayavisesadassanatthañceva mahānidānadesanāsaṅgahatthañca.
analyzed: vuttam tam kimattham ti paccaya visesa dassana attham ca iva mahānidāna desanā saṅgaha ttham ca
translated: What is the meaning of that? It is for the purpose of showing a difference in conditions and for the purpose of including the teaching of the Great Thread .

original: Phassassa hi na kevalañca chaṭṭhāyatanameva paccayo, vedanākkhandhādayo pana tayo🔽khandhāpi paccayāyeva. Mahānidānasuttante cassa “atthi idappaccayā phassoti iti puṭṭhena
analyzed: phassassa hi na kevalam ca chaṭṭha āyatanam eva paccayaḥ vedanā kkhandha ādayo pana tayo  khandhā api paccayāya iva mahānidāna suttante ca assa atthi idappaccayā phasso ti iti puṭṭhena
translated: For contact has not only the sixth sense base as its condition, but also the three aggregates,🔽feeling, perception, and mental formations. In the Great Advice Discourse, when asked, “Is there a specific condition for contact?”

original: satā, ānanda, atthītissa vacanīyaṃ. Kiṃ paccayā phassoti? Iti ce vadeyya, nāmapaccayā
analyzed: satā ānanda atthi itissa vacanīyam kim paccayā phasso ti iti ce vadeyya nāma paccayā
translated: the answer is, “There is, Ananda.” “What is its condition?” “Name, Ananda, is its condition.”

original: phassoti iccassa vacanīya”nti. Evaṃ saḷāyatanaṃ chaḍḍetvā ekādasaṅgiko paṭiccasamuppādo
analyzed: phasso ti evam saḷāyatanam chaḍḍetvā ekādasaṅgikaḥ paṭiccasamuppādo
translated: Thus, omitting the six sense bases, the twelve-factored dependent origination is stated.

original: vutto. Tasmā imassa paccayavisesassa dassanatthaṃ imissā ca mahānidānasuttantadesanāya
analyzed: vuttaḥ tasmai imassa paccaya visesassa dassana attham imissā ca mahānidāna suttanta desanāya
translated: Therefore, in order to show this specific condition and to show the teaching of this Great Advice Discourse,

original: pariggahatthaṃ dutiyavāre “nāmapaccayā phasso”ti vatvā saḷāyatanaṭṭhāne na kiñci
analyzed: pariggaha attham dutiya vāre nāma paccayā phasso ti vatvā saḷāyatana ṭṭhāne na kiñci
translated: in the second version, “Name is the condition for contact” is stated, and nothing is said in place of the six sense bases.

original: vuttanti. Esa tāva dutiyavāre viseso.
analyzed: vuttanti esa tāva dutiya vāre viseso
translated: This is the difference in the second version.

original: Tatiyavāre pana “viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpa”nti suttantabhājanīye āgatameva catutthamaṅgaṃ
analyzed: tatiya vāre pana viññāṇa paccayāḥ nāma rūpanti suttanta bhājanīye āgatam eva catuttham aṅgam
translated: In the third version, the fourth factor, which is stated in the Discourse Basket as “Consciousness is the condition for name-and-form,”

original: vuttaṃ, taṃ ekacittakkhaṇikattā paccayākārassa idha ayuttanti ce? Taṃ nāyuttaṃ. Kasmā?
analyzed: vuttam tam eka citta khaṇika ttā paccaya ākārassa idha ayuttam ti ce tam na ayuttam kasmā
translated: If you say that it is not appropriate here because the mode of conditionality is momentary, that is not so.

original: Sakakkhaṇe paccayabhāvato. Sacepi hi tattha rūpaṃ cittakkhaṇato uddhaṃ tiṭṭhati,
analyzed: saka khaṇe paccaya bhāvato sace pi hi tattha rūpam citta kkhaṇataḥ uddham tiṭṭhati
translated: Because it is a condition in its own moment. Even though materiality persists after the moment of consciousness,

original: tathāpissa taṃ viññāṇaṃ sakakkhaṇe paccayo hoti. Kathaṃ? Purejātassa tāva cittasamuṭṭhānassa🔽aññassa vā pacchājātapaccayena. Vuttañcetaṃ “pacchājātā cittacetasikā dhammā purejātassa
analyzed: tathā api ssa tat viññāṇam saka kkhaṇe paccayaḥ hoti katham purejātassa tāva citta samuṭṭhānassa  aññassa vā pacchājāta paccayena vuttam ca itam pacchājātāḥ citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ purejātassa
translated: nevertheless that consciousness is a condition for it in its own moment. How? First, as a condition for what is originated by it and arose before,🔽as a condition subsequent. For this is said: “States of consciousness and its concomitants that have arisen and have reached cessation are a condition, as a condition subsequent, for this material body that has arisen” .

original: imassa kāyassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo”ti. Sahajātassa pana cittasamuṭṭhānassa🔽nissayapaccayena paccayo. Yathāha “cittacetasikā dhammā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṃ rūpānaṃ
analyzed: imassa kāyassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayo ti sahajātassa pana citta samuṭṭhānassa  nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ yathā āha citta cetasikāḥ dhammāḥ citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam
translated: But as a condition for what is originated by it and arose together with it,

original: nissayapaccayena paccayo”ti.
analyzed: nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ti
translated: it is a condition as support. For this is said: “States of consciousness and its concomitants are a condition, as a support condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness” .

original: Yadi evaṃ, purimavāresu kasmā evaṃ na vuttanti? Rūpappavattidesaṃ sandhāya desitattā.
analyzed: yadi evam purima vāresu kasmai evam na vuttan ti rūpa ppavatti desam sandhāya desita ttā
translated: If that is so, why was it not said in the first section? Because it was taught there with reference to the occurrence of materiality.

original: Ayañhi paccayākāro rūpappavattidese kāmabhave gabbhaseyyakānañceva aparipuṇṇāyatanaopapātikānañca🔽rūpāvacaradevānañca vasena desito. Tenevettha “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”nti avatvā
analyzed: ayam hi paccaya ākāraḥ rūpa ppavatti dese kāma bhave gabbhaseyyakānam ca iva aparipuṇṇa āyatana opapātikānam ca  vasena desitaḥ tena iva ittha nāma rūpa paccayā avatvā
translated: For this conditionality is taught in the section on the occurrence of materiality in the sense-desire becoming, in the case of those who lie in the womb and of those who are spontaneously born, and also in the case of the deities of the fine-material sphere.🔽Therefore, instead of saying “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base,”

original: chaṭṭhāyatananti vuttaṃ. Tattha nāmaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva. Rūpaṃ pana hadayarūpaṃ🔽veditabbaṃ. Taṃ panetassa chaṭṭhāyatanassa nissayapaccayena ceva purejātapaccayena
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatanam ti vuttam tattha nāmam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva rūpam pana hadaya rūpam  veditabbam tam pana itassa chaṭṭha āyatanassa nissaya paccayena ca iva purejāta paccayena
translated: it is said here “With the sixth base.” Herein, the “name” is as already stated. The “materiality” is the heart-basis,🔽which should be understood. That is a condition in two ways, as support condition and as prenascence condition,

original: cāti dvidhā paccayo hotīti esa tatiyavāre viseso.
analyzed: ca ati dvidhā paccayaḥ hoti iti esa tatiya vāre viseso
translated: for this sixth base. This is the difference here in the third section.

original: Catutthavāro pana yonivasena opapātikānaṃ, āyatanavasena paripuṇṇāyatanānaṃ, bhavavasena🔽kāmāvacarasattānaṃ vasena vutto. Tenevettha “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”nti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: catuttha vāro pana yoni vasena opapātikānam āyatana vasena paripuṇṇa āyatanānam bhava vasena  kāmāvacara sattānam vasena vuttaḥ tena iva ittha nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatanam ti vuttam
translated: But the fourth section is stated in the case of those who are spontaneously born, in the case of those whose bases are complete, in the case of beings in the sense-desire becoming, in terms of the kinds of generation.🔽Therefore, instead of saying “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base,”

original: Tattha nāmaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanassa sahajātādīhi, cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ pacchājātapaccayena.
analyzed: tattha nāmam chaṭṭha āyatanassa sahajāta ādīhi cakkhāyatana ādīnam pacchājāta paccayena
translated: it is said here “With the sixth base.” Herein, the “name” is a condition for the sixth base by conascence, etc., and for the eye base, etc., by postnascence condition.

original: Rūpe hadayarūpaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanassa nissayapaccayapurejātapaccayehi, cattāri mahābhūtāni
analyzed: rūpe hadaya rūpam chaṭṭha āyatanassa nissaya paccaya purejāta paccayehi cattāri mahābhūtāni
translated: In the case of materiality, the heart-basis is a support condition and a prenascence condition for the sixth sense base. The four great primaries are a support condition, a decisive-support condition, a prenascence condition, and a non-disappearance condition for the eye sense base, etc.

original: cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ sahajātanissayaatthiavigatehi. Yasmā panesa ekacittakkhaṇiko paccayākāro,
analyzed: cakkha āyatana ādīnam sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatehi yasmā pana esa eka citta khaṇikaḥ paccaya ākāro
translated: But since this is a condition for a single moment of consciousness,

original: tasmā ettha saḷāyatanapaccayāti avatvā “chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti vuttoti ayaṃ
analyzed: tasmai ettha saḷāyatana paccayā ti avatvā chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phasso ti vutto ti ayaṃ
translated: therefore it is said, “With the sixth sense base as condition, contact,” instead of saying, “With the five sense bases as condition, contact,” as it is in the case of the first two sections.

original: catutthavāre viseso.🔽Evametesaṃ nānākaraṇaṃ ñatvā puna sabbesveva tesu visesena paṭhamakā dve vārā arūpabhave
analyzed: catuttha vāre viseso  evam etesam nānākaraṇam ñatvā puna sabbesu eva tesu visesena paṭhamakāḥ dve vārāḥ arūpa bhave
translated: This is the difference in the fourth section.🔽Having thus understood the difference between them, it should be understood that the first two sections are stated in order to show the mode of conditionality in the immaterial sphere, and the third in order to show it in the material sphere.

original: paccayākāradassanatthaṃ vuttāti veditabbā. Arūpabhavasmiñhi rūpena asammissāni paṭiccasamuppādaṅgāni🔽pavattanti. Tatiyo rūpabhave paccayākāradassanatthaṃ vutto. Rūpabhavasmiñhi satipi
analyzed: paccaya ākāra dassana tham vuttā iti veditabbā arūpa bhavasmin hi rūpena asammissāni paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgāni  pavattanti tatiyaḥ rūpa bhave paccaya ākāra dassana ttham vuttaḥ rūpa bhavasmin hi sati pi
translated: For in the immaterial sphere the factors of dependent origination occur unmixed with materiality.🔽In the material sphere, although there is materiality, the sixfold base does not occur.

original: rūpasammissatte saḷāyatanaṃ na pavattati. Catuttho kāmabhave paccayākāradassanatthaṃ
analyzed: rūpa sammissatte saḷāyatanam na pavattati catutthaḥ kāma bhave paccaya ākāra dassana attham
translated: The fourth is stated in order to show the mode of conditionality in the sense-sphere plane.

original: vutto. Kāmabhavasmiñhi sakalaṃ saḷāyatanaṃ pavattati. Tatiyo vā rūpabhave ceva kāmabhave🔽ca aparipuṇṇāyatanānaṃ akusalappavattikkhaṇaṃ sandhāya vutto. Catuttho vā kāmabhave🔽paripuṇṇāyatanānaṃ. Paṭhamo vā sabbatthagāmitaṃ sandhāya vutto. So hi na katthaci🔽cittappavattidese na pavattati. Dutiyo paccayavisesaṃ sandhāya vutto. Ekādasaṅgikattañhettha🔽phassassa ca nāmapaccayattaṃ paccayaviseso. Tatiyo purimayonidvayaṃ sandhāya vutto.
analyzed: vuttaḥ kāma bhavasmin hi sakalam saḷāyatanam pavattati tatiyaḥ vā rūpa bhave ca iva kāma bhave  ca aparipuṇṇa āyatanānam akusala ppavatti kkhaṇam sandhāya vuttaḥ catutthaḥ vā kāma bhave  paripuṇṇa āyatanānam paṭhamaḥ vā sabbatthagāmi tam sandhāya vutto saḥ hi na katthaci  citta ppavatti dese na pavattati dutiyaḥ paccaya visesam sandhāya vuttaḥ  phassassa ca nāma paccaya ttam paccaya viseso tatiyo purima yoni dvayam sandhāya vutto
translated: For in the sensual-desire becoming the whole sixfold base occurs. Or the third is stated with reference to the moment of the occurrence of the unprofitable in the fine-material becoming and in the sensual-desire becoming of those whose bases are incomplete. Or the fourth is stated with reference to those whose bases are complete in the sensual-desire becoming. Or the first is stated with reference to what occurs everywhere. For that occurs in no place where consciousness occurs. Or the second is stated with reference to a special condition. For here the special condition is the fact that contact is a condition for feeling and the fact that it is a member of the eleven-fold formula. Or the third is stated with reference to the first two kinds of generation.

original: Purimāsu hi dvīsu yonīsu so sambhavati, tattha sadā saḷāyatanassa asambhavato. Catuttho🔽pacchimayonidvayaṃ sandhāya vutto. Pacchimāsu hi so dvīsu yonīsu sambhavati, tattha🔽sadā saḷāyatanassa sambhavatoti.
analyzed: purimāsu hi dvīsu yonīsu so sambhavati tattha sadā saḷāyatanassa asambhavato catutthaḥ  pacchima yoni dvayam sandhāya vuttaḥ pacchimāsu hi so dvīsu yonīsu sambhavati tattha  sadā saṅgāyatanassa sambhavatoti
translated: For in the sensual-desire becoming the whole sixfold base occurs. Or the third is stated with reference to the unprofitable occurrence of the sixfold base in the fine-material becoming and in the sensual-desire becoming of those whose bases are incomplete. Or the fourth is stated with reference to those whose bases are complete in the sensual-desire becoming. Or the first is stated with reference to the universal occurrence of the sixfold base. For that occurs in no place where consciousness occurs. Or the second is stated with reference to a special condition. For the special condition here is the fact that contact is a condition for the sixfold base and the sixfold base is a condition for contact. Or the third is stated with reference to the first two kinds of generation. For that occurs in the first two kinds of generation, since the sixfold base is not always present there. Or the fourth is stated with reference to the last two kinds of generation. For that occurs in the last two kinds of generation, since the sixfold base is always present there.

original: Ettāvatā ca yaṃ vuttaṃ catūsupi vāresu –
analyzed: ettāvatā ca yam vuttam catūsu pi vāresu
translated: And in this way it can be said of all four sections that the sixfold base is a condition for contact in the way already stated.

original: Yaṃ yattha aññathā vuttaṃ, avuttañcāpi yaṃ yahiṃ;🔽Yaṃ yathā paccayo yassa, taṃ sabbamupalakkhayeti.
analyzed: yam aññathā vuttam a vuttam ca api yam  yam yathā paccayaḥ yassa tam sabbam upalakkhaya iti
translated: And what is not stated, all that

original: Gāthāya atthadīpanā katā hoti.
analyzed: gāthāya attha dīpanā katā hoti
translated: Should be understood by the method🔽By which it is stated here.🔽The meaning of the verse is explained.

original: Etenevānusārena, sabbametaṃ nayaṃ ito;
analyzed: etena iva anusārena sabbam etam nayam itas
translated: By this method all this should be understood here.

original: Viseso yo ca taṃ jaññā, catukkesu paresupi.
analyzed: visesaḥ ca tam catukkesu paresu pi
translated: But the difference should be known in the other tetrads.

original: 2. Hetucatukkaṃ
analyzed: hetu catukkam
translated: The tetrad on cause

original: 244. Tattha yo tāva idha vutto nayo, so sabbattha pākaṭoyeva. Viseso pana evaṃ veditabbo🔽– hetucatukke tāva avijjā hetu assāti avijjāhetuko. Avijjā assa sahavattanato yāvabhaṅgā
analyzed: tattha yaḥ tāva idha vuttaḥ nayaḥ saḥ sabbattha pākaṭaḥ yā iva visesaḥ pana evam veditabbaḥ  hetu catukke tāva avijjā hetu assa ati avijjā hetukaḥ avijjā assa sahavattanataḥ
translated: Herein, the method stated here is evident everywhere. But the difference should be known as follows:🔽In the first place, in the tetrad on cause, ignorance is a cause in the sense of being a condition for formations, thus it is “with ignorance as condition.” It is a condition for them by being their prenascent support,🔽by being their prenascent object, and by being their conascent support.🔽And it is a condition for them by being their postnascent support, by being their postnascent object, and by being their conascent object.

original: pavattikā gamikāti vuttaṃ hoti. “Avijjāpaccayā”ti ca ettāvatā sahajātādipaccayavasena🔽sādhāraṇato saṅkhārassa avijjā paccayoti dassetvā, puna “avijjāhetuko”ti eteneva
analyzed: pavattikā gamikā iti vuttam hoti avijjā paccayā ti ca ettāvatā sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena  sādhāraṇataḥ saṅkhārassa avijjā paccayaḥ ti dassetvā puna avijjā hetuko ti etena iva
translated: And it is a condition for them by being their prenascent support, by being their postnascent support, and by being their conascent support.

original: visesato avigatapaccayatā dassitā. Saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ saṅkhārahetukantiādīsupi eseva nayo.
analyzed: visesataḥ avigata paccaya tā dassitā saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇam saṅkhāra hetukan ti ādīsu pi esā iva nayo
translated: And it is a condition for them by being their prenascent object, by being their postnascent object, and by being their conascent object.🔽And it is a condition for them by being their prenascent support and prenascent object, by being their prenascent support and conascent object, by being their prenascent support and postnascent object, by being their conascent support and prenascent object, by being their conascent support and postnascent object, by being their postnascent support and prenascent object, by being their prenascent support, prenascent object and conascent object, by being their prenascent support, prenascent object and postnascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent support and prenascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent support and postnascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent support and conascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent object and prenascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent object and postnascent object, by being their prenascent support, conascent object and conascent object, by being their prenascent support, postnascent support and prenascent object, by being their prenas

original: Kasmā pana bhavādīsu hetukaggahaṇaṃ na katanti? Avigatapaccayaniyamābhāvato abhāvato🔽ca avigatapaccayassa. “Tattha katamo upādānapaccayā bhavo? Ṭhapetvā upādānaṃ vedanākkhandho
analyzed: kasmā pana bhava ādīsu hetuka ggahaṇam na katanti avigata paccaya niyama abhāvataḥ abhāvataḥ  ca avigata paccayassa tattha katamaḥ upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ ṭhapetvā upādānam vedanā khandho
translated: But why is the cause not stated in the case of becoming, etc.? Because there is no invariable conditionality in the absence of clinging.

original: saññākkhandho saṅkhārakkhandho viññāṇakkhandho – ayaṃ vuccati upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti🔽vacanato upādānapaccayā catunnaṃ khandhānaṃ idha bhavoti nāmaṃ. Saṅkhārakkhandhe
analyzed: saññā kkhandho saṅkhāra kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho ayam vuccati upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ ti  vacanatas upādāna paccayā catunnam khandhānam idha bhavoti nāmam saṅkhāra kkhandhe
translated: For it is said: “Herein, what is becoming with clinging as condition? With the exception of clinging, the aggregate of material form … the aggregate of consciousness. This is called becoming with clinging as condition” .

original: ca “jāti dvīhi khandhehi saṅgahitā”tiādivacanato jātijarāmaraṇāni antogadhāni.🔽Tattha yāva upādānaṃ tāva jātijarāmaraṇānaṃ anupalabbhanato upādānaṃ bhavassa na🔽niyamato avigatapaccayo hoti. “Yā tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ jātī”ti ādivacanato saṅkhatalakkhaṇesu
analyzed: ca dvīhi khandhehi saṅgahita ati ādi vacanataḥ jāti jarā maraṇāni anta gadhāni  tattha yāva upādānam tāva jāti jarā maraṇānaṃ anupalabbhanato upādānam bhavassa na  niyamataḥ avigata paccayaḥ hoti yā tesam tesam dhammānam jāti iti ādi vacanato saṅkhata lakkhaṇesu
translated: So it is only the four aggregates that are called “becoming” here with clinging as condition. And since it is said: “Birth is included in two aggregates” , etc., birth, ageing, and death are included in the aggregates.

original: jātiyā jarāmaraṇasaṅkhātassa bhavassa jātikkhaṇamatteyeva abhāvato avigatapaccayabhāvo
analyzed: jātiyā jarā maraṇa saṅkhātassa bhavassa abhāvataḥ avigata paccaya bhāvo
translated: Herein, since birth, ageing, and death are not found as long as there is clinging, clinging is not an invariable condition for becoming by way of non-disappearance. But since it is said: “The birth of those things is … the origin of ageing and death” , etc., the state of being a condition by way of non-disappearance belongs to birth in the case of becoming, which is called ageing and death, only at the moment of birth.

original: na sambhavati. Tathā jātiyā jarāmaraṇakkhaṇe abhāvato. Upanissayapaccayeneva pana
analyzed: na sambhavati tathā jātiyāḥ jarā maraṇa khaṇe abhāvato upanissaya paccayena iva pana
translated: and it is not possible to do so. Likewise, because of the absence of birth at the time of aging-and-death,🔽but only by way of decisive support condition.

original: bhavo jātiyā. Jāti jarāmaraṇassa paccayoti sabbathāpi avigatapaccayaniyamābhāvato
analyzed: bhavaḥ jātiyā jāti jarā maraṇassa paccayaḥ ti sabbathā api avigata paccaya niyama abhāvato
translated: Birth is a condition for aging-and-death in all four ways.🔽But because of the absence of the decisive support condition in the cases of existence, etc.,

original: abhāvato ca avigatapaccayassa bhavādīsu hetukaggahaṇaṃ na katanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: abhāvataḥ ca avigata paccayassa bhava ādīsu hetuka ggahaṇam na katam ti veditabbam
translated: it should be understood that the inclusion of causes is not stated.

original: Keci panāhu – “bhavo duvidhenā”ti vacanato upapattimissako bhavo, na ca upapattibhavassa
analyzed: keci pana āhu bhavaḥ duvidhena ati vacanataḥ upapatti missakaḥ bhavaḥ na ca upapatti bhavassa
translated: But some say that because of the statement “Existence in two ways,” existence is mixed with rebirth-linking, and because the condition being decisive support is not present for the existence at rebirth-linking,🔽it is stated thus: “Existence is a condition for birth as a condition by way of decisive support,”

original: upādānaṃ avigatapaccayo hotīti “upādānapaccayā bhavo upādānahetuko”ti avatvā “upādānapaccayā
analyzed: upādānam avigata paccayaḥ hoti iti upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ upādāna hetuko ti avatvā upādāna paccayā
translated: not as “Existence is a condition for birth as a condition by way of decisive support cause.”

original: bhavo”ti vutto. Idha pacchinnattā paratopi na vuttanti. Taṃ idha upapattimissakassa
analyzed: bhavaḥ ti vuttaḥ idha pacchinna ttā paratas pi na vuttam ti tam idha upapatti missakassa
translated: But here, because of the break, it is not stated from the other side.

original: bhavassa anadhippetattā ayuttaṃ. Arūpakkhandhā hi idha bhavoti āgatā.
analyzed: bhavassa an adhippeta ttā ayuttam arūpa kkhandhā hi idha bhavaḥ ti āgatā
translated: But that is inappropriate because existence mixed with rebirth-linking is not intended here. For the immaterial aggregates are what come here as “existence.”

original: Bhavapaccayā jātīti ettha ca ṭhapetvā jātijarāmaraṇāni avaseso bhavo jātiyā paccayoti
analyzed: bhava paccayā jāti iti ettha ca ṭhapetvā jāti jarā maraṇāni avasesaḥ bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayo ti
translated: And here, in the case of “Existence is a condition for birth,” all existence except birth, aging, and death is a condition for birth as a condition by way of decisive support.

original: veditabbo. Kasmā? Jātiādīnaṃ jātiyā appaccayattā. Yadi evaṃ, ṭhapetvā jātijarāmaraṇāni
analyzed: veditabbaḥ kasmā jāti ādīnam jātiyāḥ appaccaya ttā yadi evam ṭhapetvā jāti jarā maraṇāni
translated: Why? Because birth, etc., are not conditions for birth, etc. If that is so, then

original: bhavo jātiyā paccayoti vattabboti? Āma vattabbo, vattabbapadesābhāvato pana na vutto.
analyzed: bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayo ti vattabbo ti āma vattabbaḥ vattabba padesa abhāvataḥ pana na vutto
translated: should it not be said that becoming is a condition for birth, etc., except for birth, aging, and death? —Yes, it should be said, but it is not said because there is no need to say it.

original: Dasamaṅganiddese hi upādānapaccayasambhūto bhavo vattabbo. Ekādasamaṅganiddese jāti
analyzed: dasamaṅga niddese hi upādāna paccaya sambhūtaḥ bhavaḥ vattabbaḥ ekādasamaṅga niddese jāti
translated: For in the description of the ten factors it should be said that becoming, which is originated by the condition of clinging, is a condition for birth in the description of the eleven factors.

original: vattabbā. Yo pana bhavo jātiyā paccayo, tassa vattabbapadeso natthīti vattabbapadesābhāvato🔽na vutto. Avuttopi pana yuttito gahetabboti. Viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpantiādīsu ca viññāṇādīnaṃ
analyzed: vattabbā yaḥ pana bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayo tassa vattabba padeso natthi iti vattabba padesa abhāvato  na vuttaḥ avuttaḥ api pana yuttitaḥ gahetabbo ti viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpa nti ādīsu ca viññāṇa ādīnam
translated: But there is no need to say that becoming is a condition for birth, because there is no need to say what is already established.🔽And although it is not said, it should be understood by implication.

original: avigatapaccayabhāvasambhavato viññāṇahetukādivacanaṃ katanti esa hetucatukke viseso.
analyzed: avigata paccaya bhāva sambhavataḥ viññāṇa hetuka ādi vacanam katan ti esa hetu catukke visesaḥ
translated: And in the case of the phrases “with consciousness as condition, name-and-form,” etc., the words “caused by consciousness,” etc., are used because it is possible that consciousness, etc., are non-separately existing conditions. This is the difference in the four conditions.

original: 3. Sampayuttacatukkaṃ
analyzed: sampayutta catukkam
translated: The four conditions of association

original: 245. Sampayuttacatukkepi avijjāpaccayāti ettāvatā sahajātādipaccayavasena saṅkhārassa
analyzed: sampayutta catukke pi avijjā paccayā ti ettāvatā sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena saṅkhārassa
translated: In the four conditions of association, too, the words “with ignorance as condition there are formations” refer to ignorance as a condition by conascence, etc.,

original: avijjāpaccayataṃ dassetvā puna “avijjāsampayutto”ti sampayuttapaccayatā dassitā.
analyzed: avijjā paccaya tam dassetvā puna avijjā sampayuttaḥ ti sampayutta paccaya tā dassitā
translated: Having shown the conditionality of ignorance, he shows the conditionality of association by saying “associated with ignorance.”

original: Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Yasmā pana arūpīnaṃ dhammānaṃ rūpadhammehi sampayogo natthi,🔽tasmā viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpantiādīsu tatiyacatutthavārapadesu “viññāṇasampayuttaṃ
analyzed: sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ yasmā pana arūpīnam dhammānam rūpa dhammehi sampayogaḥ natthi  tasmā viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpa nti ādīsu tatiya catuttha vāra padesu viññāṇa sampayuttam
translated: The same method applies in the other terms. But since there is no association of immaterial dhammas with material dhammas,🔽in the third and fourth sections, beginning “With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality,” only that which is possible is stated thus: “associated with consciousness,

original: nāma”ntiādinā nayena yaṃ labbhati, tadeva gahitanti esa sampayuttacatukke viseso.
analyzed: nāma nti ādinā nayena yam labbhati tat eva gahitanti esa sampayutta catukke viseso
translated: mentality” and so on. This is the difference in the dyad of association.

original: 4. Aññamaññacatukkaṃ🔽246. Aññamaññacatukkepi avijjāpaccayāti sahajātādipaccayavasena saṅkhārassa avijjāpaccayataṃ
analyzed: aññamañña catukkam  aññamañña catukke pi avijjā paccayā ti sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena saṅkhārassa avijjā paccaya taṃ
translated: The dyad of mutuality

original: dassetvā “saṅkhārapaccayāpi avijjā”ti aññamaññapaccayatā dassitā. Sesapadesupi eseva
analyzed: dassetvā saṅkhāra paccayā api avijjāti aññamañña paccaya tā dassitā sesa padesu pi esā eva
translated: In the dyad of mutuality, having shown the conditionality of formations by way of the condition of conascence, etc., for ignorance, he shows the conditionality of mutuality by saying “With formations as condition, ignorance.” The same method applies in the other terms.

original: nayo. Yasmā pana bhavo nippadeso, upādānaṃ sappadesaṃ, sappadesadhammo ca nippadesadhammassa
analyzed: nayaḥ yasmā pana bhavaḥ nippadesaḥ upādānam sappadesam sappadesa dhammo ca nippadesa dhammassa
translated: But since becoming is undifferentiated and clinging is differentiated, and a differentiated dhamma cannot be a condition for an undifferentiated dhamma,

original: paccayo hoti, na nippadesadhammo sappadesadhammassa, tasmā ettha “bhavapaccayāpi
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti na nippadesa dhammo sappadesa dhammassa tasmai ettha bhava paccayā api
translated: is a condition, not a state without designation, but a state with designation, therefore here “with the condition of being” is said.

original: upādāna”nti na vuttaṃ; heṭṭhā vā desanāya pacchinnattā evaṃ na vuttaṃ. Yasmā ca nāmarūpapaccayā
analyzed: upādānam ti na vuttam heṭṭhā vā desanāya pacchinna ttā evam na vuttam yasmā ca nāma rūpa paccayā
translated: It is a condition, but not a condition in the sense of a state with a specific location, for a state with a specific location. That is why “With becoming as condition, clinging” is not stated here. Or alternatively, it is not stated thus because the teaching is interrupted below.🔽And since there is the sixfold base with mentality-materiality as condition,

original: saḷāyatanaṃ atthi, saḷāyatanapaccayā ekacittakkhaṇe nāmarūpaṃ natthi, yassa saḷāyatanaṃ🔽aññamaññapaccayo bhaveyya, tasmā catutthavāre “chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayāpi nāmarūpa”nti
analyzed: saḷāyatanaṃ atthi saḷāyatana paccayā eka citta kkhaṇe nāma rūpam natthi yassa saḷāyatanam  aññamañña paccayaḥ bhaveyya catuttha vāre chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā api nāma rūpanti
translated: and mentality-materiality in one moment of consciousness is not present with the sixfold base as condition,🔽for which the sixfold base could be a condition by way of mutuality,🔽therefore only that which is possible is stated in the fourth dyad of the third tetrad, namely, “With the sixth base as condition, mentality-materiality.”

original: yaṃ labbhati tadeva gahitanti esa aññamaññacatukke viseso.
analyzed: yam labbhati tat eva gahitan ti esa aññamañña catukke viseso
translated: This is the difference here in the dyad of mutuality.

original: Avijjāmūlakanayamātikā.
translated: The exposition of the method of treatment by way of ignorance as root-cause.

original: Saṅkhārādimūlakanayamātikā
translated: The exposition of the method of treatment by way of formations, etc., as root-cause

original: 247. Idāni saṅkhārapaccayā avijjāti saṅkhāramūlakanayo āraddho. Tatthāpi yathā avijjāmūlake
analyzed: idāni saṅkhāra paccayā avijjā ti saṅkhāra mūlaka nayaḥ āraddhaḥ tattha api yathā avijjā mūlake
translated: Now, the method of treatment by way of formations as root-cause is begun with the words “With formations as condition, ignorance” . Herein, as in the case of ignorance as root-cause,

original: evaṃ cattāri catukkāni soḷasa ca vārā veditabbā. Paṭhamacatukke pana paṭhamavārameva
analyzed: evam cattāri catukkāni soḷasa ca vārāḥ veditabbā paṭhama catukke pana paṭhama vāram eva
translated: so too in this case there are four dyads and sixteen sections to be understood. But in the first dyad, in the first section,

original: dassetvā desanā saṃkhittā. Yathā cettha evaṃ viññāṇamūlakādīsupi. Tattha sabbesveva
analyzed: dassetvā desanā saṃkhittā yathā ca ittha evam viññāṇa mūlaka ādīsu pi tattha sabbesu eva
translated: and the teaching is brief. And as here, so also in the case of the consciousness-born, etc., too. Herein,

original: tesu saṅkhāramūlakādīsu aṭṭhasu nayesu “saṅkhārapaccayā avijjā”tiādinā nayena sahajātādipaccayavasena
analyzed: tesu saṅkhāra mūlaka ādīsu aṭṭhasu nayesu saṅkhāra paccayāḥ avijjā āti ādinā nayena sahajāta ādi paccaya vasena
translated: and the teaching is brief. And as here, so also in the case of the remaining nine beginning with consciousness as the root. Herein, in all these eight methods beginning with determinations as root,

original: avijjāya saṅkhārādipaccayataṃ dassetvā puna “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”tiādinā nayena
analyzed: avijjāya saṅkhāra ādi paccaya tam dassetvā puna avijjā paccayā saṅkhāra ati ādinā nayena
translated: after showing by the method “With determinations as condition, ignorance” how ignorance has determinations, etc., as its condition by conascence condition, etc.,

original: ekacittakkhaṇepi paccayākāracakkassa pavatti dassitā.
analyzed: eka citta kkhaṇe pi paccaya ākāra cakkassa pavatti dassitā
translated: then by the method “With ignorance as condition, determinations” he shows how the wheel of the conditions revolves even in a single conscious moment.

original: Kasmā pana bhavamūlakā jātijarāmaraṇamūlakā vā nayā na vuttā? Kiṃ bhavapaccayā avijjā
analyzed: kasmā pana bhava mūlakā jāti jarā maraṇa mūlakā vā nayā na vuttā kim bhava paccayā avijjā
translated: But why are the methods with becoming as root and with birth, ageing, and death as root not stated? Is it that becoming is not a condition for ignorance?

original: na hotīti? No na hoti. “Saṅkhārapaccayā avijjā”ti evamādīsu pana vuccamānesu na koci🔽bhavapariyāpanno dhammo avijjāya paccayo na vutto. Tasmā apubbassa aññassa avijjāpaccayassa
analyzed: na hoti iti no na hoti saṅkhāra paccayā avijjā ati evamādīsu pana vuccamānesu na koci  bhava pariyāpannaḥ dhammaḥ avijjāya paccayaḥ na vuttaḥ tasmai apubbassa aññassa avijjā paccayassa
translated: It is not that it is not, but when it is stated thus, “With determinations as condition, ignorance,” no state included in becoming is stated as a condition for ignorance.🔽Therefore the method with becoming as root is not stated because there is no need to state any other new condition for ignorance.

original: vattabbassa abhāvato bhavamūlako nayo na vutto. Bhavaggahaṇena ca avijjāpi saṅgahaṃ
analyzed: vattabbassa abhāvataḥ bhava mūlakaḥ nayaḥ na vuttaḥ bhava ggahaṇena ca avijjā api saṅgaham
translated: And by the inclusion of becoming, ignorance is included too.

original: gacchati. Tasmā “bhavapaccayā avijjā”ti vuccamāne “avijjāpaccayā avijjā”tipi vuttaṃ
analyzed: gacchati tasmai bhava paccayā avijjā iti vuccamāne avijjā paccayā avijjā iti pi vuttam
translated: So when it is said, “With becoming as condition, ignorance,” it is as though it were said, “With ignorance as condition, ignorance.”

original: siyā. Na ca ekacittakkhaṇe avijjā avijjāya paccayo nāma hoti. Tattha pacchinnattāva
analyzed: siyā na ca eka citta kkhaṇe avijjā avijjāya paccayaḥ nāma hoti tattha pacchinna ttā ava
translated: But ignorance is not a condition for ignorance in a single cognitive series. Herein, the method beginning with birth and aging-and-death is not included because it is interrupted.

original: jātijarāmaraṇamūlakāpi nayā na gahitā. Apica bhave jātijarāmaraṇānipi antogadhāni.
analyzed: nayā na api ca bhave jāti jarā maraṇāni api
translated: Besides, birth and aging-and-death are included in becoming.

original: Na cetāni ekacittakkhaṇe avijjāya paccayā hontīti bhavamūlakā jātijarāmaraṇamūlakā vā nayā na vuttāti.
analyzed: na cetāni eka citta kkhaṇe avijjāya paccayāḥ honti iti bhava mūlakāḥ jāti jarā maraṇa mūlakāḥ vā nayāḥ na vuttā ati
translated: But they are not conditions for ignorance in a single cognitive series, so the method beginning with birth and aging-and-death is not stated.

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā.
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the matrix.

original: Akusalaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: akusala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the description of the unprofitable

original: 248-249. Idāni yathā heṭṭhā cittuppādakaṇḍe kusalattikaṃ ādiṃ katvā nikkhittamātikāya
analyzed: idāni yathā heṭṭhā cittuppāda kaṇḍe kusala ttikam ādim katvā nikkhitta mātikāya
translated: Now, in the section on the kinds of consciousness below , the profitable triad was stated first in the matrix and then the unprofitable was dealt with in the same order.

original: paṭipāṭiyā paṭhamaṃ kusalaṃ bhājitaṃ, tathā idha mātikāya anikkhittattā paṭhamaṃ
analyzed: paṭipāṭiyā paṭhamam kusalam bhājitam tathā idha mātikāya a nikkhitta ttā paṭhamam
translated: But here, since the unprofitable is stated first in the matrix, the profitable is not mentioned first.

original: kusalaṃ anāmasitvā “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhāro”ti akusaladhammavasena mātikāya nikkhittattā
analyzed: kusalam an āmasitvā avijjā paccayā saṅkhāro ti akusala dhamma vasena mātikāya nikkhitta ttā
translated: “With ignorance as condition there are formations” is stated in the matrix with the unprofitable as the first.

original: nikkhepapaṭipāṭiyāva avijjādīni paṭiccasamuppādaṅgāni bhājetvā dassetuṃ katame dhammā
analyzed: nikkhepa paṭipāṭiyā āva avijjā ādīni paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgāni bhājetvā dassetum katame dhammā
translated: and the factors of the dependent origination, beginning with ignorance, are to be shown by dividing them into the order of arising and the order of teaching.🔽What are the states that are internal?

original: akusalātiādimāha. Tassattho heṭṭhā cittuppādakaṇḍe vuttanayeneva veditabbo. Yasmā
analyzed: akusala iti ādim āha tassa atthaḥ heṭṭhā cittuppāda kaṇḍe vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ yasmā
translated: He has set out the factors of the dependent origination beginning with ignorance in the order in which they arise, and he now says “What are the states that are unskilful? ” in order to show them by analysing them into their component states. The meaning of this should be understood in the way already stated in the Description of the Arising of Consciousness .

original: pana ekacittakkhaṇe taṇhāya ca kāmupādānassa ca sambhavo natthi, tasmā yaṃ ettha
analyzed: pana eka citta khaṇe taṇhāya ca kāma upādānassa ca sambhavaḥ natthi tasmā yam ettha
translated: But since craving and sensual-desire clinging cannot occur together in a single conscious moment,

original: taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ labbhati, tadeva dassetuṃ diṭṭhi diṭṭhigatantiādi vuttaṃ.🔽Bhavaniddese ca yasmā upādānaṃ saṅkhārakkhandhe saṅgahaṃ gacchati, tasmā “ṭhapetvā
analyzed: taṇhā paccayā upādānam labbhati tat eva dassetum diṭṭhi diṭṭhi gata ntiādi vuttaṃ  bhava niddese ca yasmai upādānam saṅkhāra kkhandhe saṅgaham gacchati tasmai ṭhapetvā
translated: he says “view, and the perversions of perception” in order to show the craving that has a condition in that .

original: upādānaṃ vedanākkhandho saññākkhandho saṅkhārakkhandho viññāṇakkhandho”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: upādānam vedanā kkhandhaḥ saññā kkhandho saṅkhāra kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho ti vuttam
translated: And since clinging is included in the formations aggregate, he says “the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formations aggregate, the consciousness aggregate, leaving out clinging” in the description of becoming.

original: Evañhi vuccamāne upādānassa upādānapaccayattaṃ āpajjeyya. Na ca tadeva tassa paccayo
analyzed: evam hi vuccamāne upādānassa upādāna paccaya ttam āpajjeyya na ca tat eva tassa paccayaḥ
translated: For if he had said “the clinging aggregate,” it would follow that clinging is a condition for clinging. But that is not a condition for that.

original: hoti. Jātiādiniddesesu yasmā ete arūpadhammānaṃ jātiādayo, tasmā “khaṇḍiccaṃ, pāliccaṃ,
analyzed: hoti jāti ādi niddesesu yasmai ete arūpa dhammānam jāti ādayaḥ tasmai khaṇḍiccam pāliccam
translated: And since birth, etc., are of immaterial states, he says “the states consisting of the materiality aggregate, the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the formations aggregate, the consciousness aggregate, leaving out birth, leaving out ageing, leaving out death” in the descriptions of birth, ageing, and death.

original: valittacatā, cuti, cavanatā”ti na vuttaṃ.🔽250. Evaṃ paṭhamavāraṃ niṭṭhapetvā puna dutiyavāre yasmiṃ samaye paṭhamavārena paccayākāro🔽dassito, tasmiṃyeva samaye aparenapi nayena paccayākāraṃ dassetuṃ visuṃ samayavavatthānavāraṃ
analyzed: vali ttaca tā cuti cavana tā iti na vuttam  evam paṭhama vāram niṭṭhapetvā puna dutiya vāre yasmin samaye paṭhama vārena paccaya ākāro  dassitaḥ tasmin yeva samaye aparena api nayena paccaya ākāram dassetum visum samaya vavatthāna vāram
translated: and the rest are not mentioned.🔽Having thus completed the first section, in order to show the way of conditions again in another way in the same occasion on which the way of conditions was shown in the first section,

original: avatvā tasmiṃ samaye avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārotiādināva nayena desanā katā. Tattha ṭhapetvā
analyzed: avatvā tasmin samaye avijjā paccayā saṅkhāraḥ ti ādinā ava nayena desanā katā tattha ṭhapetvā
translated: without a separate section on the definition of the occasion, the teaching is given in the second section by the method beginning, “With ignorance as condition there are formations” (M.iii, 10). Herein,

original: phassanti idaṃ yasmā phassopi nāmapariyāpanno, tasmā phassassa nāmato nīharaṇatthaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: idam yasmā phassaḥ api nāma pariyāpannaḥ tasmā phassassa nāmataḥ nīharaṇa attham vuttam
translated: except for contact: this is said in order to remove the name “contact” since contact is included in the expression “with the sixfold base as condition: contact.”

original: 252. Tatiyavāre yassa cittasamuṭṭhānarūpassa viññāṇaṃ paccayo, tasmiṃ pavattamāne
analyzed: tatiya vāre yassa citta samuṭṭhāna rūpassa viññāṇam paccayaḥ tasmim pavattamāne
translated: In the third section, in the case of the materiality that is a mental-data-element,

original: yasmā tenupatthaddhānaṃ cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ upacitattaṃ paññāyati, tasmā cakkhāyatanassa
analyzed: yasmā tena upatthaddhānam cakkha āyatana ādīnam upacita ttam paññāyati tasmā cakkha āyatanassa
translated: when that is occurring, the accumulation of the eye-base, etc., is evident as being due to the manifestation of the consciousness that is its condition. That is why it is said, “With the eye-base as condition: accumulation,”

original: upacayotiādi vuttaṃ. Yasmā ca kammajarūpassapi tasmiṃ samaye vattamānassa viññāṇaṃ
analyzed: upacayaḥ tiādi vuttam yasmā ca kamma ja rūpassa api tasmin samaye vattamānassa viññāṇam
translated: and so on. And in the case of the materiality that is kamma-born, the consciousness that is occurring at that time is a condition for it as rebirth-linking consciousness.

original: pacchājātapaccayena paccayo hoti, tasmāpi evaṃ vuttaṃ. Tattha kiñcāpi kammajaṃ cittasamuṭṭhānanti
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ hoti tasmā api evam vuttam tattha kiñcā api kamma jam citta samuṭṭhānan ti
translated: and it is a condition, as post-nascence condition, for the other two. That is why it is said thus.

original: dveva santatiyo gahitā, itarāpi pana dve santatiyo gahetabbā. Tāsampi hi viññāṇaṃ paccayo hotiyeva.
analyzed: dve iva santatiyaḥ gahitāḥ itarā api pana dve santatiyaḥ gahetabbā tāsam pi hi viññāṇam paccayaḥ hotiya iva
translated: Herein, although only two of the three terms, namely, kamma-born and consciousness-born, are mentioned, the other two should be understood as included. For consciousness is a condition for them too.

original: 254. Catutthavāre pana yasmā ekacittakkhaṇepi mahābhūtarūpapaccayā cakkhāyatanādīni,🔽hadayarūpapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatanaṃ, nāmapaccayā ca pacchājātasahajātādivasena yathānurūpaṃ
analyzed: catuttha vāre pana yasmai eka citta kkhaṇe pi mahābhūta rūpa paccayā cakkhāyatana ādīni  hadaya rūpa paccayā chaṭṭha āyatanam nāma paccayā ca pacchājāta sahajāta ādi vasena yathānurūpam
translated: In the fourth section, however, since the eye-base, etc., have the great primaries born of kamma as their condition,🔽and the sixth base has the heart-basis as its condition, and all the rest occur in the way beginning “Mind is a condition for the mental data base” as post-nascence, conascence, etc.,

original: sabbānipi pavattanti, tasmā tattha katamaṃ nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanaṃ? Cakkhāyatanantiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: sabbāni api pavattanti tasmā tattha katamam nāma rūpa paccayā saḷāyatanam cakkhāyatana ntiādi vuttaṃ
translated: it is said here, “What is the base consisting of six bases with mentality-materiality as condition? The eye-base” and so on.

original: 256. Dutiyacatukke sabbaṃ uttānameva.
analyzed: dutiya catukke sabbam uttānam eva
translated: In the second tetrad all the terms are clear.

original: 264. Tatiyacatukke yassa sampayuttapaccayabhāvo na hoti, yassa ca hoti, taṃ visuṃ visuṃ dassetuṃ idaṃ vuccati viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ viññāṇasampayuttaṃ nāmantiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tatiya catukke yassa sampayutta paccaya bhāvaḥ na hoti yassa ca hoti tam visum visum dassetuṃ idam vuccati viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpam viññāṇa sampayuttam nāma ntiādi vuttam
translated: In the third tetrad, in order to show separately what is not associated with consciousness and what is associated with it, it is said, “With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality: the mentality associated with consciousness” and so on.

original: 272. Catutthacatukke phassapaccayā nāmaniddese kiñcāpi “ṭhapetvā phassaṃ vedanākkhandho…pe…🔽viññāṇakkhandho – idaṃ vuccati phassapaccayā nāma”nti na vuttaṃ, tathāpi anantarātītapadaniddese
analyzed: catuttha catukke phassa paccayāḥ nāma niddese kiñca api ṭhapetvā phassam  viññāṇa kkhandho idam vuccati phassa paccayā nāman ti na vuttam tathā api anantara atīta pada niddese
translated: In the fourth tetrad, although in the description of mentality it is not said that “the feeling aggregate … the perception aggregate … the volitional- formations aggregate … the consciousness aggregate, except contact, is what is called mentality with contact as condition,” nevertheless, since it is said in the description of the immediately past states

original: “ṭhapetvā phassaṃ vedanākkhandho…pe… viññāṇakkhandho”ti vuttattā avuttampi taṃ vuttameva
analyzed: ṭhapetvā phassam vedanā kkhandha upe viññāṇa kkhandho ti vutta ttā avuttam pi tam vuttam eva
translated: that “the feeling aggregate … the consciousness aggregate, except contact,” what is not stated is nevertheless stated by implication.

original: hoti. Yadeva hi nāmaṃ phassassa paccayo, phassopi tasseva paccayoti.
analyzed: hoti yat eva hi nāmam phassassa paccayo phassaḥ api tassa iva paccayo ti
translated: For whatever is a condition for contact as mentality, contact is a condition for that too.

original: Yathā cāyaṃ catucatukko soḷasavārappabhedo avijjāmūlako paṭhamanayo etasmiṃ paṭhamākusalacitte
analyzed: yathā ca ayam catu catukkaḥ soḷasa vāra ppabhedaḥ avijjā mūlako etasmim paṭhama akusala citte
translated: And just as this tetrad with its sixteen sections, rooted in ignorance, is demonstrated in this first unprofitable consciousness,🔽so the other eight methods rooted in formations should be understood. But the texts are brief.

original: pakāsito, evaṃ saṅkhāramūlakādayo aṭṭha nayāpi veditabbā. Pāḷi pana saṃkhittā. Evameva
analyzed: evam saṅkhāra mūlaka ādayaḥ aṭṭha nayā api veditabbā pāḷi pana saṃkhittā evam eva
translated: So too,

original: tasmiṃ paṭhamākusalacitteyeva nava nayā, chattiṃsa catukkāni, catucattālīsādhikañca🔽vārasataṃ hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tasmin nava nayā chattiṃsa catukkāni catucattālīsa adhikañca 🔽vāra satam hoti iti veditabbam
translated: in this first unprofitable consciousness there are nine methods, thirty-six tetrads, and one hundred and forty-four sections.

original: 280. Idāni imināva nayena sesākusalacittesupi paccayākāraṃ dassetuṃ katame dhammā
analyzed: idāni iminā ava nayena sesa akusala cittesu pi paccaya ākāram dassetum katame dhammā
translated: Now, in order to show the way of conditionality in the other unprofitable consciousnesses too, the following is stated: “What are the unprofitable ideas?

original: akusalātiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha yasmā diṭṭhivippayuttesu taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ natthi,
analyzed: akusala ati ādi āraddham tattha yasmā diṭṭhi vippayuttesu taṇhā paccayā upādānam natthi
translated: Herein, since craving as condition for attachment is absent in those dissociated from views,

original: tasmā upādānaṭṭhāne upādānaṃ viya daḷhanipātinā adhimokkhena padaṃ pūritaṃ. Domanassasahagatesu
analyzed: tasmai upādānaṭṭhāne upādānam viya daḷha nipātinā adhimokkhena padam pūritam domanassa sahagatesu
translated: the place of attachment is filled with resolve, which is strong in the sense of being the footing for the wrong view.🔽And in those associated with grief

original: ca yasmā vedanāpaccayā taṇhāpi natthi, tasmā taṇhāṭṭhāne taṇhā viya balavakilesena
analyzed: ca yasmā vedanā paccayā taṇhā api na atthi tasmā taṇhā aṭṭhāne taṇhā viya balava kilesena
translated: craving as condition for feeling is absent, so the place of craving is filled with repulsion, which is strong in the sense of being a defilement,

original: paṭighena padaṃ pūritaṃ. Upādānaṭṭhāne adhimokkheneva. Vicikicchāsampayutte pana
analyzed: paṭighena padam pūritam upādānaṭṭhāne adhimokkhena iva vicikicchā sampayutte pana
translated: like attachment in the place of attachment. But in those associated with uncertainty

original: yasmā sanniṭṭhānābhāvato adhimokkhopi natthi, tasmā taṇhāṭṭhāne balavakilesabhūtāya
analyzed: yasmā sanniṭṭhāna abhāvataḥ adhimokkhaḥ api na atthi tasmā taṇhā aṭṭhāne balava kilesa bhūtāya
translated: there is no resolve because of the absence of any decision, so the place of craving is filled with uncertainty, which is strong in the sense of being a defilement,

original: vicikicchāya padaṃ pūritaṃ. Upādānaṭṭhānaṃ parihīnameva. Uddhaccasampayutte pana
analyzed: vicikicchāya padam pūritam upādānaṭṭhānam parihīnam eva uddhacca sampayutte pana
translated: like craving in the place of craving. The place of attachment is absent. But in those associated with agitation

original: yasmā adhimokkho atthi, tasmā taṇhāṭṭhāne balavakilesena uddhaccena padaṃ pūritaṃ.
analyzed: yasmai adhimokkhaḥ atthi tasmai taṇhā aṭṭhāne balava kilesena uddhaccena padam pūritam
translated: there is resolve, so the place of craving is filled with agitation, which is strong in the sense of being a defilement,🔽like craving in the place of craving.

original: Upādānaṭṭhāne adhimokkheneva. Sabbattheva ca visesamattaṃ dassetvā pāḷi saṃkhittā.
analyzed: upādānaṭṭhāne adhimokkhena iva sabbattha iva ca visesa mattam dassetvā pāḷi saṃkhittā
translated: And in the case of the basis for assuming, by resolution. And the text is stated in brief after showing only the difference in all cases.

original: Yo cāyaṃ viseso dassito, tattha kevalaṃ adhimokkhaniddesova apubbo. Sesaṃ heṭṭhā āgatameva.🔽Adhimokkhaniddese pana adhimuccanavasena adhimokkho. Adhimuccati vā tena ārammaṇe
analyzed: yaḥ ca ayam visesaḥ dassito tattha kevalam adhimokkha niddeso uva apubbaḥ sesam heṭṭhā āgatam eva  adhimokkha niddese pana adhimuccana vasena adhimokkhaḥ adhimuccati vā tena ārammaṇe
translated: And here the only new thing shown in the difference is the description of resolution. The rest is already given below.

original: cittaṃ nibbicikicchatāya sanniṭṭhānaṃ gacchatīti adhimokkho. Adhimuccanākāro adhimuccanā.
analyzed: cittam nibbicikicchatāya sanniṭṭhānam gacchati iti adhimokkhaḥ adhimuccanā ākāraḥ adhimuccanā
translated: But in the description of resolution, resolution is resolution in the sense of resolving. Or it is resolution because it is the going of consciousness to a conclusion in an object with the absence of doubt. The mode of the resolution is the resolving.

original: Tassa cittassa, tasmiṃ vā ārammaṇe adhimuttattāti tadadhimuttatā. Sabbacittesu ca
analyzed: tassa cittassa tasmim vā ārammaṇe adhimutta ttā ati tad adhimutta tā sabba cittesu ca
translated: And it is the state of that consciousness, or of that object, as resolved upon, thus it is the state of that as resolved upon. And in all consciousnesses

original: paṭhamacitte vuttanayeneva nayacatukkavārappabhedo veditabbo. Kevalañhi vicikicchāsampayutte
analyzed: paṭhama citte vutta nayena iva naya catukka vāra ppabhedaḥ veditabbo kevalam hi vicikicchā sampayutte
translated: the analysis by way of the four methods should be understood in the way already stated under the first consciousness. Only, however, because there is no method rooted in assuming associated with doubt,

original: upādānamūlakassa nayassa abhāvā aṭṭha nayā, dvattiṃsa catukkāni, aṭṭhavīsādhikañca vārasataṃ hotīti.
analyzed: upādāna mūlakassa nayassa abhāvā aṭṭha nayā dvattiṃsa catukkāni aṭṭhavīsā adhikam ca vāra satam hoti iti
translated: there are eight methods, thirty-two sets of four, and one hundred and eight permutations.

original: Akusalaniddesavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: akusala niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of unprofitable consciousness is ended.

original: Kusalaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: Description of profitable consciousness

original: 292. Idāni imināva nayena kusalacittādīsupi paccayākāraṃ dassetuṃ katame dhammā kusalātiādi
analyzed: idāni iminā ava nayena kusala citta ādīsu pi paccaya ākāram dassetum katame dhammā kusala ati ādi
translated: Now, in order to show the way of the conditionality in the profitable, etc., too, by the same method, the following is stated: “What are profitable ideas?

original: āraddhaṃ. Yathā pana akusale paṭhamaṃ mātikaṃ nikkhipitvā pacchā niddeso kato, na🔽tathā idha. Kasmā? Appanāvāre nānattasambhavato. Lokiyakusalādīsu hi tesaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: āraddham yathā pana akusale paṭhamam mātikam nikkhipitvā pacchā niddeso kataḥ na  tathā idha kasmai appanā vāre nānatta sambhavataḥ lokiya kusala ādīsu hi tesam dhammānam
translated: But while the exposition was given after the first mātikā had been set out in the case of the unprofitable,🔽it is not so here. Why? Because of the possibility of variety in the absorption.

original: dukkhasaccapariyāpannattā “evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassā”ti appanā hoti,
analyzed: dukkha sacca pariyāpanna ttā evam etassa kevalassa dukkha kkhandhassa ati appanā hoti
translated: For in the case of the mundane profitable, etc., the absorption is “Thus is the whole field of suffering” because those ideas are included in the truth of suffering,

original: lokuttarakusalādīsu “evametesaṃ dhammāna”nti. Tasmā ettha sādhāraṇato mātikaṃ ṭhapetuṃ
analyzed: lokuttara kusala ādīsu evam etesam dhammānanti tasmai ettha sādhāraṇataḥ mātikam ṭhapetum
translated: and in the case of the supramundane profitable, etc., it is “Thus is these ideas” .🔽So it is not possible to set out a mātikā here in common.

original: na sakkāti pāṭiyekkaṃ tesaṃ tesaṃ kusalādīnaṃ mātikaṃ uddisitvāva niddeso katoti.
analyzed: na sakkā ati pāṭiyekkam tesam tesam kusala ādīnam mātikam uddisitvā āva niddeso kato ti
translated: Therefore the exposition is given after setting out a mātikā for each of the profitable, etc., separately.

original: Tattha yasmā ekacittakkhaṇe kusalasaṅkhārena saddhiṃ avijjā natthi, tasmā taṃ avatvā,
analyzed: tattha yasmai eka citta kkhaṇe kusala saṅkhārena saddhim avijjā natthi tasmai tam a vatvā
translated: Herein, since there is no ignorance together with the profitable formations in a single conscious moment, therefore, leaving that out,

original: avijjā viya akusalānaṃ, kusalānaṃ mūlato kusalamūlaṃ, taṇhupādānānañca abhāvato taṇhāṭṭhāne
analyzed: avijjā viya akusalānam kusalānam mūlataḥ kusala mūlam taṇhā upādānānam ca abhāvato taṇhā aṭṭhāne
translated: the profitable root is stated as the root of the profitable instead of ignorance, as is the unprofitable root in the case of the unprofitable. And since there is no craving and no assuming,

original: taṇhā viya ārammaṇe ajjhogāḷho pasādo, upādānaṭṭhāne upādānaṃ viya daḷhanipātī nāma
analyzed: taṇhā viya ārammaṇe ajjhogāḷhaḥ pasādaḥ upādāna ṭṭhāne upādānam viya daḷhanipātī nāma
translated: Confidence is called “deeply immersed” in the way that craving is deeply immersed in its object.

original: adhimokkho vutto. Sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbanti.
analyzed: adhimokkhaḥ vuttaḥ sesam heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabban ti
translated: And resolve is called “firmly placed” in the way that clinging is firmly placed in a place for clinging. The rest should be understood in the way already stated.

original: Kusalaniddesavaṇṇanā.
translated: The description of the profitable is ended

original: Abyākataniddesavaṇṇanā🔽306. Abyākataṃ heṭṭhā cittuppādakaṇḍe āgatapaṭipāṭiyāva vibhattaṃ. Sabbavāresu ca
analyzed: abyākata niddesa vaṇṇanā  abyākatam heṭṭhā cittuppāda kaṇḍe āgata paṭipāṭiyā ava vibhattam sabba vāresu ca
translated: The description of the indeterminate🔽The indeterminate is classed in the same order as that in which it appears in the section on consciousness in the Description of the Aggregates .

original: avijjāmūlakā nayā parihīnā. Kasmā? Avijjāṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbassa abhāvato. Kusalacittesu
analyzed: avijjā mūlakā nayā parihīnā kasmai avijjā ṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbassa abhāvataḥ kusala cittesu
translated: In all cases the method is omitted, because there is no place for it in the place of ignorance.

original: hi avijjāṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbaṃ kusalamūlaṃ atthi, cakkhuviññāṇādīsu natthi. Sahetukesu
analyzed: hi avijjā aṭṭhāne ṭhapetabbam kusala mūlam atthi cakkhu viññāṇa ādīsu na atthi sa hetukesu
translated: For in the case of the profitable consciousnesses there is a profitable root to be placed in the place of ignorance, but there is not in the case of eye-consciousness, etc.,

original: pana kiñcāpi atthi, evaṃ santepi idha pacchinnattā tattha na gahitaṃ. Pañcaviññāṇasote
analyzed: pana kiñcā api atthi evam sante pi idha pacchinna ttā tattha na gahitam pañca viññāṇa sote
translated: and although there is in the case of those with cause, still it is not included there because it is cut off here.

original: sotapatitāva hutvā desanā katāti veditabbā.
analyzed: hutvā desanā katā iti veditabbā
translated: The teaching should be understood as given in the stream of the five consciousnesses as though it had fallen into the stream.

original: Visesato panettha cakkhuviññāṇādīsu taṇhāṭṭhānaṃ upādānaṭṭhānañca parihīnaṃ. Kasmā?
analyzed: visesataḥ pana ittha cakkhu viññāṇa ādīsu taṇhā ṭṭhānam upādāna ṭṭhānam ca parihīnam kasmā
translated: But in particular, in the case of eye-consciousness, etc., the place of craving and the place of clinging are omitted. Why?

original: Taṇhāṭṭhānārahassa balavadhammassa abhāvā adhimokkharahitattā ca. Sesāhetukesu taṇhāṭṭhānameva🔽parihīnaṃ. Sahetukesu pasādasabbhāvato taṇhāṭṭhāne pasādena padaṃ pūritaṃ. Evamettha
analyzed: taṇhā aṭṭhāna arahassa balava dhammassa abhāvāḥ adhimokkha rahita ttā ca sesa ahetukesu taṇhā ṭṭhānam eva  parihīnam sa hetukesu pasāda sabbhāvato taṇhā aṭṭhāne pasādena padam pūritam evam ettha
translated: because there is no strong state there that could be a footing for craving, and because there is no resolution. In the rest of the unprofitable kinds the footing for craving is only lacking.

original: kusalākusalavipākesu cakkhuviññāṇādīsu saṅkhāraviññāṇanāmachaṭṭhāyatanaphassavedanāmūlakā🔽cha cha, sesāhetukesu adhimokkhamūlakena saddhiṃ satta satta, sahetukesu pasādamūlakena
analyzed: kusala akusala vipākesu cakkhu viññāṇa ādīsu saṅkhāra viññāṇa nāma chaṭṭha āyatana phassa vedanā mūlakā  cha cha sesa ahetukesu adhimokkha mūlakena saddhim satta satta sa hetukesu pasāda mūlakena
translated: In the kinds with root-cause the footing for craving is fulfilled by confidence, which is the opposite of faithlessness. This is how the method should be understood here in the case of the profitable and unprofitable resultant eye-consciousness, etc.,

original: saddhiṃ aṭṭha aṭṭha nayā veditabbā.🔽Tattha cakkhuviññāṇādīsupi catunnampi catukkānaṃ ādivārova vutto. Dutiyavāro paccayavisesaṭṭhena🔽labbhamānopi na vutto. Tatiyacatutthavārā asambhavatoyeva. Rūpamissakā hi te, na
analyzed: saddhim aṭṭha aṭṭha nayā veditabbā  tattha cakkhu viññāṇa ādīsu pi catunnam pi catukkānam ādi vāraḥ eva vuttaḥ dutiya vāraḥ paccaya visesa ṭṭhena  labbhamānaḥ api na vuttaḥ tatiya catuttha vārāḥ asambhavataḥ yā iva rūpa missakāḥ hi te na
translated: as six times six, and in the rest of the unprofitable kinds as seven times seven, and in the kinds with root-cause as eight times eight.🔽Herein, in the case of eye-consciousness, etc., only the first of the four times is stated. The second is not stated, though it could be found by the difference in conditions. The third and fourth are impossible,

original: ca cakkhuviññāṇādīni rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpenti. Yathā ca paṭhamacatukke dve vārā labbhanti,
analyzed: ca cakkhu viññāṇa ādīni rūpam samuṭṭhāpenti yathā ca paṭhama catukke dve vārāḥ labbhanti
translated: because they are mixed with matter, and eye-consciousness, etc., do not originate matter. And just as two times are found in the first tetrad,

original: evaṃ sesacatukkesupi. Tasmā paṭhamacatukke dutiyavāro, sesacatukkesu ca dve dve vārā🔽avuttāpi vuttāva hontīti veditabbā. Sesāhetukābyākate sabbacatukkesu sabbepi vārā
analyzed: evam sesa catukkesu pi tasmā paṭhama catukke dutiya vāraḥ sesa catukkesu ca dve dve vārā  avuttā api vuttā ava honti iti veditabbā sesa ahetuka abyākate sabba catukkesu sabbe api vārā
translated: So too with the rest of the four terms. So in the first tetrad the second term, and in the rest of the tetrads the two terms,

original: labbhanti. Idha pacchinnattā pana parato na gahitā. Sotapatitāva hutvā desanā katāti.🔽Sesasahetukavipākesupi eseva nayo aññatra arūpāvacaravipākā. Arūpāvacaravipākasmiñhi
analyzed: labbhanti idha pacchinna ttā pana paratas na gahitā hutvā desanā katā ati  sesa sa hetuka vipākesu pi esa iva nayaḥ aññatra arūpāvacara vipākāḥ arūpāvacara vipākasmin hi
translated: are understood to be stated though not actually stated. In the rest of the unprofitable and indeterminate tetrads all the terms are applicable in all cases. But here only the first terms are given, the rest being understood, and so they are not stated. The teaching is given in this way in order to avoid prolixity.

original: vāradvayameva labbhatīti.
analyzed: vāra dvayam eva labbhati iti
translated: The same method applies in the case of the rest of the profitable and resultant tetrads, except for the resultant of the fine-material sphere. For in the case of the resultant of the fine-material sphere only two terms are applicable.

original: Abyākataniddesavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: abyākata niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the indeterminate is ended.

original: Avijjāmūlakakusalaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽334. Idāni aparena pariyāyena ekacittakkhaṇe paccayākāraṃ dassetuṃ puna katame dhammā
analyzed: avijjā mūlaka kusala niddesa vaṇṇanā  idāni aparena pariyāyena eka citta kkhaṇe paccaya ākāram dassetum puna katame dhammā
translated: Description of the unprofitable rooted in ignorance

original: kusalātiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha avijjāpaccayāti upanissayapaccayataṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kusala ati ādi āraddham tattha avijjā paccayā ti upanissaya paccaya tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: Now, in order to show the mode of condition by another method in a single moment, the text is resumed with the words, “What are the profitable dhammas? ” Herein, ignorance condition is said with the decisive support condition in mind.

original: Teneva niddesavāre “tattha katamā avijjā”ti avibhajitvā “tattha katamo avijjāpaccayā
analyzed: tena iva niddesa vāre tattha katamā avijjā ti a vibhajitvā tattha katamaḥ avijjā paccayā
translated: That is why, in the description of the condition clause, after not analysing “What is ignorance? ” it is said, “What are states with ignorance as condition? ”

original: saṅkhāro”ti vibhattaṃ. Kusalacetanāsaṅkhāto hi saṅkhāroyeva tasmiṃ samaye cittena
analyzed: saṅkhāraḥ iti vibhattam kusala cetanā saṅkhātaḥ hi tasmin samaye cittena
translated: and formations.

original: sahajāto hoti, na avijjā.
analyzed: sahajātaḥ hoti na avijjā
translated: For at that time only the formation consisting in profitable volition is conjoined with consciousness, not ignorance.

original: Tattha lokiyakusalassa heṭṭhā suttantabhājanīye vuttanayeneva avijjā paccayo hoti.
analyzed: tattha lokiya kusalassa heṭṭhā suttanta bhājanīye vutta nayena iva avijjā paccayaḥ hoti
translated: Herein, ignorance is a condition for the mundane profitable in the way already stated under the Suttas in the Description of the Soil .

original: Yasmā pana appahīnāvijjo avijjāya pahānatthaṃ lokuttaraṃ bhāveti, tasmā tassāpi samatikkamavasena
analyzed: yasmā pana appahīna avijjaḥ avijjāya pahāna attham lokuttaram bhāveti tasmā tassa api samatikkama vasena
