translated: When he discerns it in this way gross-grossly, the subtle becomes evident too.🔽As to direction, it lies in both directions. As to location, it is to be found covering the whole body. As to delimitation, it is bounded below by its fixed surface, which is the flesh,🔽and above by space, and all round by what is skin. This is how he defines skin by colour and the rest.🔽As to its location, it is to be found plastered over the whole of the inner surface of the body’s flesh.

original: heṭṭhā patiṭṭhitatalena, upari ākāsena paricchinno. Ayamassa sabhāgaparicchedo. Visabhāgaparicchedo🔽pana kesasadisoyeva.
analyzed: heṭṭhā patiṭṭhita talena upari ākāsena paricchinnaḥ ayam assa sabhāga paricchedaḥ visabhāga paricchedaḥ  pana kesa sadisā uyā iva
translated: As to delimitation, it is bounded below by its fixed surface, which is the flesh,

original: Maṃsanti nava maṃsapesisatāni. Taṃ sabbampi vaṇṇato rattaṃ kiṃsukapupphasadisaṃ;
analyzed: maṃsanti nava maṃsapesi satāni tam sabbam pi vaṇṇataḥ rattam kiṃsuka puppha sadisam
translated: and above by space, and all round by what is bone. This is how he defines bone by colour and the rest.🔽As to shape, the shape of the bones of the leg is that of a yam shoot enclosed in a sheath; the shape of the thighbone is that of a trumpet creeper creeper enclosed in a sheath; the shape of the hipbone is that of a small drum head; the shape of the backbone is that of a string of beads; the shape of the rib bones is that of a sheaf of rods; the shape of the breastbone is that of a half-moon; the shape of the collar bones is that of a creeper tendril; the shape of the upper-arm bones is that of a yam shoot; the shape of the forearm bones is that of a long-gourd creeper; the shape of the thumb is that of a small drum; the shape of the other bones of the fingers is that of a small drum handle; the shape of the bones of the ankle is that of a yam shoot; the shape of the

original: saṇṭhānato jaṅghapiṇḍikamaṃsaṃ tālapaṇṇapuṭabhattasaṇṭhānaṃ, ūrumaṃsaṃ nisadapotakasaṇṭhānaṃ,🔽ānisadamaṃsaṃ uddhanakoṭisaṇṭhānaṃ, piṭṭhimaṃsaṃ tālaguḷapaṭalasaṇṭhānaṃ, phāsukadvayamaṃsaṃ🔽potthalikāya kucchiyaṃ tanumattikālepanasaṇṭhānaṃ, thanamaṃsaṃ vaṭṭetvā avakkhittamattikāpiṇḍasaṇṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: saṇṭhānataḥ jaṅgha piṇḍika maṃsam tāla paṇṇa puṭa bhatta saṇṭhānam ūru maṃsam nisada potaka saṇṭhānam  ānisada maṃsam uddhana koṭi saṇṭhānam piṭṭhi maṃsam tāla guḷa paṭala saṇṭhānam phāsuka dvaya maṃsam  potthalikāya kucchiyam tanu mattikā lepana saṇṭhānam thana maṃsam vaṭṭetvā avakkhitta mattikā piṇḍa saṇṭhānam
translated: As to shape, the flesh of the calf is the shape of rice dumplings wrapped in a betel fold; the flesh of the thighs is the shape of a pillow for the head;🔽the flesh of the buttocks is the shape of the end of an oil-mill lever; the flesh of the back is the shape of a slab of palm sugar; the flesh of the two buttocks is the shape of a long betel-nut leaf smeared with reddish dye; the flesh of the belly is the shape of a bag full of mucus;

original: bāhudvayamaṃsaṃ diguṇaṃ katvā ṭhapitaniccammamahāmūsikasaṇṭhānaṃ. Evaṃ oḷārikoḷārikaṃ🔽maṃsaṃ pariggaṇhantassa sukhumampi pākaṭaṃ hoti. Disato dvīsu disāsu jātaṃ. Okāsato
analyzed: bāhu dvayam aṃsam diguṇam katvā ṭhapita niccamma mahāmūsika saṇṭhānam evam oḷārika uḷārikam  maṃsam pariggaṇhantassa sukhumam pi pākaṭam hoti disataḥ dvīsu disāsu jātam okāsataḥ
translated: the flesh of the chest is the shape of a cake of brown sugar placed over a charcoal dish; the flesh of the two upper arms is the shape of a pair of long bamboo tubes; the flesh of the two forearms is the shape of a pair of long bamboo tubes; the flesh of the two hands is the shape of a pair of long bamboo tubes.

original: sādhikāni tīṇi aṭṭhisatāni anulimpetvā ṭhitaṃ. Paricchedato heṭṭhā aṭṭhisaṅghāte
analyzed: sādhikāni tīṇi aṭṭhi satāni anulimpetvā ṭhitam paricchedataḥ heṭṭhā aṭṭhi saṅghāte
translated: When he has thus defined the flesh in its gross features, the more delicate parts become evident too. As to direction, it lies in both directions. As to location, it is to be found plastered over the three hundred bones. As to delimitation, it is bounded below by the surface of the groups of bones,

original: patiṭṭhitatalena, upari tacena, tiriyaṃ aññamaññena paricchinnaṃ. Ayamassa sabhāgaparicchedo.
analyzed: patiṭṭhita talena upari tacena tiriyam aññamaññena paricchinnam ayam assa sa bhāga paricchedaḥ
translated: above by the skin, and all round each by each other part. This is the delimitation by the similar.

original: Visabhāgaparicchedo pana kesasadisova.
analyzed: visa bhāga paricchedo pana kesa sadisā uva
translated: As to delimitation by the dissimilar, it is like the delimitation of the head-hairs and so on.

original: ‘Nhārū’ti nava nhārusatāni. Vaṇṇato sabbepi nhārū setā; saṇṭhānato nānāsaṇṭhānā.
analyzed: nhārū ti nava nhāru satāni vaṇṇato sabbe pi nhārū setā saṇṭhānataḥ nānā saṇṭhānā
translated: ‘Tendons’ means the nine hundred tendons. As to colour, all the tendons are white; as to shape, they are various in shape.

original: Etesu hi gīvāya uparibhāgato paṭṭhāya pañca mahānhārū sarīraṃ vinaddhamānā hadayassa
analyzed: etesu hi upari bhāgataḥ paṭṭhāya pañca sarīram hadayassa
translated: For of these, beginning from the upper part of the neck, five big tendons go down binding the body and enter the heart

original: purimapassena otiṇṇā, pañca pacchimapassena, pañca dakkhiṇapassena, pañca vāmapassena,🔽dakkhiṇahatthaṃ vinaddhamānāpi hatthassa purimapassena pañca, pacchimapassena pañca,
analyzed: purima passena otiṇṇā pañca pacchima passena pañca dakkhiṇa passena pañca vāma passena  dakkhiṇa hattham vinaddhamānā api hatthassa purima passena pañca pacchima passena pañca
translated: at the front, five at the back, five on the right, and five on the left.🔽And five go down binding the right hand and enter it at the front, five at the back,

original: tathā vāmahatthaṃ vinaddhamānāpi. Dakkhiṇapādaṃ vinaddhamānāpi pādassa purimapassena🔽pañca, pacchimapassena pañca, tathā vāmapādaṃ vinaddhamānāpīti. Evaṃ sarīradhārakā🔽nāma saṭṭhi mahānhārū kāyaṃ vinaddhamānā otiṇṇā, ye kaṇḍarātipi vuccanti. Te sabbepi
analyzed: tathā vāma hattham vinaddha mānā api dakkhiṇa pādam vinaddha mānā api pādassa purima passena  pañca pacchima passena pañca tathā vāma pādam vinaddha mānā api iti evam sarīra dhārakā  nāma saṭṭhi mahānhārū kāyam vinaddhamānāḥ otiṇṇāḥ ye kaṇḍarā atipi vuccanti te sabbe pi
translated: and similarly five go down binding the left hand. And five go down binding the right foot and enter it at the front,🔽five at the back, and similarly five go down binding the left foot. So these sixty big tendons, called ‘body binders,’

original: kandalamakuḷasaṇṭhānā.
analyzed: kandala makuḷa saṇṭhānā
translated: go down binding the body and enter it. They are the shape of a creeper’s tendril.

original: Aññe pana taṃ taṃ padesaṃ ajjhottharitvā ṭhitā tato sukhumatarā suttarajjukasaṇṭhānā.
analyzed: aññe pana tam tam padesam ajjhottharitvā ṭhitā tatas sukhumatarā sutta rajjuka saṇṭhānā
translated: But others are finer than these and are the shape of fine thread or string.

original: Aññe tato sukhumatarā pūtilatāsaṇṭhānā. Aññe tato sukhumatarā mahāvīṇātantisaṇṭhānā.🔽Aññe thūlasuttakasaṇṭhānā. Hatthapādapiṭṭhiyaṃ nhārū sakuṇapādasaṇṭhānā. Sīsanhārū🔽dārakānaṃ sīsajālakasaṇṭhānā. Piṭṭhinhārū ātape pasāritaallajālasaṇṭhānā. Avasesā🔽taṃtaṃaṅgapaccaṅgānugatā nhārū sarīre paṭimukkajālakañcukasaṇṭhānā. Disato dvīsu🔽disāsu jātā. Okāsato sakalasarīre aṭṭhīni ābandhitvā ṭhitā. Paricchedato heṭṭhā tiṇṇaṃ
analyzed: aññe tatas sukhumatarā pūti latā saṇṭhānā aññe tatas sukhumatarā mahā vīṇā tanti saṇṭhānā  aññe thūla suttaka saṇṭhānā hattha pāda piṭṭhiyam nhārū sakuṇa pāda saṇṭhānā sīsa nhārū  dārakānam sīsa jālaka saṇṭhānā piṭṭhinhārū ātape pasārita alla jāla saṇṭhānā avasesā  taṃ taṃaṅga paccaṅga anugatāḥ sarīre paṭimukka jāla kañcuka saṇṭhānāḥ disatas dvīsu  disāsu jātā okāsato sakala sarīre aṭṭhīni ābandhitvā ṭhitā paricchedato heṭṭhā tiṇṇam
translated: Others are still finer, like the shape of a creeper’s tendril. Others are still finer, like the shape of a large lute string.

original: aṭṭhisatānaṃ upari patiṭṭhitatalehi, upari maṃsacammāni āhacca ṭhitapadesehi, tiriyaṃ🔽aññamaññena paricchinnā. Ayaṃ nesaṃ sabhāgaparicchedo. Visabhāgaparicchedo pana kesasadisoyeva.
analyzed: aṭṭhi satānam upari patiṭṭhita talehi upari maṃsa cammāni āhacca ṭhita padesehi tiriyam  aññam aññena paricchinnāḥ ayam sabhāga paricchedaḥ visabhāga paricchedaḥ pana
translated: Others are like the shape of a coarse thread. The veins in the back of the hands and feet are like the shape of a bird’s claw. The veins in the head are like the shape of a child’s net-patterned head-band. The veins in the back are like the shape of a net spread out in the sun. The remaining veins that go to the various limbs and secondary parts of the body are like the shape of a coat of mail covering the body. As to direction, they lie in the two directions. As to location, they are to be found binding the bones all over the body. As to delimitation, they are bounded … below by the surface of the three hundred bones, above by the flesh and skin, and all round by each other. This is the delimitation by the similar; but the delimitation by the dissimilar is the same as that of the head-hairs and so on. Bones 111.There are thirty-two teeth-bones, sixty-four hand-bones,

original: Aṭṭhīti ṭhapetvā dvattiṃsa dantaṭṭhīni avasesāni catusaṭṭhi hatthaṭṭhīni, catusaṭṭhi
analyzed: aṭṭhi iti ṭhapetvā dvattiṃsa danta ṭṭhīni avasesāni catusaṭṭhi hattha ṭṭhīni catusaṭṭhi
translated: sixty-four foot-bones,

original: pādaṭṭhīni, catusaṭṭhi maṃsanissitāni muduaṭṭhīni, dve paṇhikaṭṭhīni, ekekasmiṃ pāde
analyzed: pāda aṭṭhīni catusaṭṭhi maṃsa nissitāni mudu aṭṭhīni dve paṇhika aṭṭhīni ekekasmin pāde
translated: There are sixty-four soft bones attached to the flesh, two heel bones, two ankle bones, two bones on the back part of the two ankles, two bones on the front part of the two ankles, two long bones of the two legs, two knee bones, two thigh bones, two hip bones,

original: dve gopphakaṭṭhīni, dve jaṅghaṭṭhīni, dve jaṇṇukaṭṭhīni, dve ūruṭṭhīni, dve kaṭiṭṭhīni,🔽aṭṭhārasa piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṭṭhīni, catuvīsati phāsukaṭṭhīni, cuddasa uraṭṭhīni, ekaṃ🔽hadayaṭṭhi, dve akkhakaṭṭhīni, dve koṭṭhaṭṭhīni, dve bāhaṭṭhīni, dve dve aggabāhaṭṭhīni,
analyzed: dve gopphaka aṭṭhīni dve jaṅgha aṭṭhīni dve jaṇṇuka aṭṭhīni dve ūru ṭṭhīni dve kaṭi ṭṭhīni  aṭṭhārasa piṭṭhikaṇṭakaṭṭhīni catuvīsati phāsukaṭṭhīni cuddasa uraṭṭhīni ekam  dve akkhakaṭṭhīni dve koṭṭhaṭṭhīni dve bāhaṭṭhīni dve dve aggabāhaṭṭhīni
translated: eighteen backbone bones, twenty-four rib bones, fourteen breast bones, one heart bone, two collar bones, two shoulder blade bones, two upper-arm bones, two pairs of forearm bones,

original: satta gīvaṭṭhīni, dve hanukaṭṭhīni, ekaṃ nāsikaṭṭhi, dve akkhiṭṭhīni, dve kaṇṇaṭṭhīni,
analyzed: satta gīva ṭṭhīni dve hanuka ṭṭhīni ekam nāsika ṭṭhi dve akkhiṭṭhīni dve kaṇṇa ṭṭhīni
translated: seven neck bones, two jaw bones, one nose bone, two eye bones, two ear bones,

original: ekaṃ nalāṭaṭṭhi, ekaṃ muddhaṭṭhi, nava sīsakapālaṭṭhīnīti evaṃ timattāni aṭṭhisatāni.🔽Tāni sabbānipi vaṇṇato setāni, saṇṭhānato nānāsaṇṭhānāni. Tattha hi aggapādaṅguliṭṭhīni
analyzed: ekam nalāṭa ṭṭhi ekam muddha ṭṭhi nava sīsa kapāla ṭṭhīni iti evam timattāni aṭṭhi satāni  tāni sabbāni api vaṇṇato setāni saṇṭhānato nānā saṇṭhānāni tattha hi agga pāda aṅguli ṭṭhīni
translated: one frontal bone, one cranium bone, and nine sincipital bones. Thus there are three hundred bones.

original: katakabījasaṇṭhānāni. Tadanantarāni majjhapabbaṭṭhīni panasaṭṭhisaṇṭhānāni. Mūlapabbaṭṭhīni
analyzed: kataka bīja saṇṭhānāni tad anantarāni majjha pabbaṭṭhīni panasaṭṭhi saṇṭhānāni mūla pabbaṭṭhīni
translated: As to colour, they are all white. As to shape, they are of various shapes. For the bones of the toes are the shape of the seeds of the kataka nut. The bones of the backs of the feet are the shape of a pile of beans. The bones of the front parts of the feet are the shape of a pile of paddy. The two long bones of the legs are the shape of a ladder rung. The two knee bones are the shape of a lotus bud. The two thigh bones are the shape of a big bean. The two hip bones are the shape of a bowl for washing the feet. The eighteen backbone bones are the shape of a pile of saucers. The twenty-four rib bones are the shape of a pile of shavings. The fourteen breast bones are the shape of a pile of bird pellets. The heart bone is the shape of a palm fruit. The two collar bones are the shape of a creeper root. The two shoulder blade bones are the shape of a snake’s belly. The two upper-arm bones are the shape of a bamboo tube. The two pairs of forearm bones are the shape of a pile of bean plants.

original: paṇavasaṇṭhānāni. Piṭṭhipādaṭṭhīni koṭṭhitakandalakandarāsisaṇṭhānāni. Paṇhikaṭṭhi🔽ekaṭṭhitālaphalabījasaṇṭhānaṃ. Gopphakaṭṭhīni bandhakīḷāgoḷakasaṇṭhānāni. Jaṅghaṭṭhīnaṃ
analyzed: paṇava saṇṭhānāni piṭṭhi pāda ṭṭhīni koṭṭhita kandala kandara asi saṇṭhānāni paṇhika ṭṭhi  ekaṭṭhi tāla phala bīja saṇṭhānam gopphakaṭṭhīni bandha kīḷā goḷaka saṇṭhānāni jaṅgha ṭṭhīnam
translated: The heel bones are the shape of a pestle. The ankle bones are the shape of a double-headed drum. The bones of the instep are the shape of a ball of thread. The bones of the toes are the shape of a bunch of young tamarind shoots.

original: abbhantarasadisaṃ. Paññavantānaṃ thokaṃ vikasitaṃ, mandapaññānaṃ makuḷitameva. Anto
analyzed: abbhantara sadisam paññavantānam thokam vikasitam manda paññānam makuḷitam eva antar
translated: This is its specific characteristic.🔽As to its location, the lungs are to be found inside the body between the two breasts, enveloping the heart and kidney.🔽As to shape, they are the shape of a lump of chewed lime placed on the heart and kidney.

analyzed: anāvilam paṇḍaram parisuddham viya jutimantam khāyati disatas  disāya jātam okāsataḥ sarīra abbhantare dvinnam thanānam majjhe patiṭṭhitam paricchedato

original: Papphāsanti dvattiṃsamaṃsakhaṇḍappabhedaṃ papphāsamaṃsaṃ. Taṃ vaṇṇato rattaṃ nātipakkaudumbaraphalavaṇṇaṃ.🔽Saṇṭhānato visamacchinnabahalapūvakhaṇḍasaṇṭhānaṃ. Abbhantare asitapītānaṃ abhāve🔽uggatena kammajatejusmanā abbhāhatattā saṅkhāditapalālapiṇḍamiva nirasaṃ nirojaṃ.

translated: It is like a lump of parched bran. As to direction, it lies in the upper direction. As to location, it is to be found inside the body between the two breasts, covering the heart and kidney.🔽As to delimitation, it is bounded by what appertains to gullet …

analyzed: anta guṇanti anta bhogaṭṭhānesu bandhanam tam vaṇṇato setam daka sītalika mūla vaṇṇam  saṇṭhānataḥ daka sītalika mūla saṇṭhānam eva disataḥ dvīsu disāsu jātam okāsataḥ

analyzed: nānā kuṇapa jātam nipatitvā kaddama udaka āluḷitam dvīhatī ihaccayena sañjāta kimi kulam sūriya ātapa vega santāpa kuthitam

translated: and when it has done so, it causes blood, flesh, etc., to grow. translated: the free bile is the colour of faded blue or red flowers. As to shape,

translated: Pus: pus that has arisen owing to the rotting of blood. As to colour, it is the colour of withered leaves. In a dead body

translated: As to location, there is no fixed location for blood in the body where it might be stored. But wherever blood collects in the body,🔽whether in the skin or flesh or bones, etc.,

analyzed: paccati gaṇḍa piḷaka ādayaḥ vā uppajjanti tatra tatra iva tiṭṭhati paricchedato pubba bhāgena  paricchinnaḥ ayam assa sabhāga paricchedaḥ visabhāga paricchedo pana kesa sadisaḥ uva  lohitanti dve lohitāni sannicitalohitam ca saṃsaraṇalohitam ca tattha sannicitalohitam  vaṇṇataḥ nipakka bahala lākhā rasa vaṇṇam saṃsaraṇa lohitam accha lākhā rasa vaṇṇam saṇṭhānato

analyzed: ubhayam pi okāsa saṇṭhānam disatas sannicita lohitam uparimāya disāya jātam itaram
translated: Pus is to be found wherever there is a suppurating process in the body. As to colour, it is the colour of cooked and thickened lac solution. As to shape, it is the shape of its location. But wherever there is a suppurating process in the body, that is where the pus is to be found. As to delimitation, it is bounded by what appertains to pus …🔽Sweat is to be found in the openings of the body hairs. As to colour, it is the colour of clear sesamum oil. As to shape, it is the shape of its location. As to direction, it belongs to the upper direction. As to location, it is to be found in the openings of the body hairs. As to delimitation, it is bounded by what appertains to sweat …

original: dvīsu disāsu jātaṃ. Okāsato saṃsaraṇalohitaṃ, ṭhapetvā kesalomadantanakhānaṃ maṃsavinimmuttaṭṭhānañceva
analyzed: dvīsu disāsu jātam okāsataḥ saṃsaraṇa lohitam ṭhapetvā kesa loma danta nakhānam maṃsa vinimmutta ṭṭhānam ca iva
translated: It is found in two parts of the body. As to location, the blood that circulates in the physical frame is to be found, except in the case of the head-hairs, body-hairs, teeth, nail-plates, and excrement, in all the places where the lymph is found.

original: thaddhasukkhacammañca, dhamanijālānusārena sabbaṃ upādinnakasarīraṃ pharitvā ṭhitaṃ;🔽sannicitalohitaṃ yakanaṭṭhānassa heṭṭhābhāgaṃ pūretvā ekapattapūramattaṃ hadayavakkapapphāsānaṃ
analyzed: thaddha sukkha cammam ca dhamani jāla anusārena sabbam upādinnaka sarīram pharitvā ṭhitam  sannicita lohitam yakana ṭṭhānassa heṭṭhā bhāgam pūretvā eka patta pūra mattam hadaya vakka papphāsānam
translated: It is found in the two directions. As to location, the circulating blood is to be found spread through the whole of the clung-to physical frame, which is to say, the whole of the frame except for the hair of the head and face, the nails, and the teeth, which are by nature horny growth, and the brain, which is by nature secretion, and the upper skin, which is by nature a membrane.🔽The stored-up blood is to be found filling the lower part of the liver’s site to the extent of a bowlful, and it is to be found moistening the frame to the extent of a bowlful more.

original: upari thokaṃ thokaṃ paggharantaṃ vakkahadayayakanapapphāse temayamānaṃ ṭhitaṃ. Tasmiñhi
analyzed: upari thokam thokam paggharantam vakkahadaya yakana papphāse temayamānam ṭhitam tasmin hi
translated: It is to be found trickling drop by drop over the kidney, heart, liver and lungs.🔽For when the kidney, heart, liver and lungs are not moistened, beings are thirsty.

original: vakkahadayādīni atemente sattā pipāsitā honti. Paricchedato lohitabhāgena paricchinnaṃ.
analyzed: vakka hadaya ādīni sattā pipāsitāḥ honti paricchedataḥ lohita bhāgena paricchinnam
translated: As to delimitation, it is bounded by what appertains to blood …

original: Ayamassa sabhāgaparicchedo. Visabhāgaparicchedo pana kesasadisova.
analyzed: ayam assa sabhāga paricchedaḥ visabhāga paricchedaḥ pana kesa sadisaḥ uva
translated: This is its specific characteristic. As to its general characteristic, it is gross physical matter, and so on.🔽Sweat is the water element that trickles from the pores of the body hairs. As to colour, it is the colour of clear sesamum oil.

original: Sedoti lomakūpādīhi paggharaṇakaāpodhātu. So vaṇṇato vippasannatilatelavaṇṇo. Saṇṭhānato
analyzed: lomakūpa ādīhi so vaṇṇataḥ vippasanna tila tela vaṇṇaḥ saṇṭhānato

original: okāsasaṇṭhāno. Disato dvīsu disāsu jāto. Okāsato sedassokāso nāma nibaddho natthi,
analyzed: okāsa saṇṭhānaḥ disataḥ dvīsu disāsu jātaḥ okāsataḥ sedassokāso nāma nibaddhaḥ natthi
translated: As to direction, it is found in the two directions. As to location, there is no fixed location for sweat.

original: yattha so lohitaṃ viya sadā tiṭṭheyya; yadā pana aggisantāpasūriyasantāpautuvikārādīhi🔽sarīraṃ santappati tadā udakato abbuḷhamattavisamacchinnabhisamūḷālakumudanāḷakalāpo
analyzed: yattha saḥ lohitam sadā tiṭṭheyya yadā pana aggi santāpa sūriya santāpa otuvikāra ādīhi  sarīram santappati tadā udakataḥ
translated: and it would always be there as though it were blood. But when the body is heated by the heat of a fire, the heat of the sun, a change of temperature, etc.,

original: viya sabbakesalomakūpavivarehi paggharati. Tasmā tassa saṇṭhānampi kesalomakūpavivarānaṃyeva
analyzed: viya sabba kesa lomakūpa vivarehi paggharati tasmā tassa saṇṭhānam pi
translated: then it trickles out of all the pores of the head hairs and body hairs like drops of water from a water-bubble, lotus leaf, cabbage leaf, etc., when they are heated by fire. So its shape should be understood to correspond to the pores of the head hairs and body hairs.

original: vasena veditabbaṃ. Sedapariggaṇhakena ca yoginā kesalomakūpavivare pūretvā ṭhitavaseneva
analyzed: vasena veditabbam seda pariggaṇhakena ca yoginā kesa lomakūpa vivare pūretvā ṭhita vasena iva
translated: And the meditator who discerns sweat should give his attention to it as present in the pores of the head hairs and body hairs,

analyzed: visa bhāga paricchedo pana kesa sadisā uva  medaḥ ti thinasinehaḥ saḥ vaṇṇato phālita haliddi vaṇṇo saṇṭhānato thūla sarīrassa tāva
translated: As to its general delimitation, it is the same as that of the head hairs and the rest.🔽Grease is thin oil. As to colour, it is the colour of squeezed turmeric. original: cammamaṃsantare ṭhapitahaliddivaṇṇadukūlapilotikasaṇṭhāno hoti, kisasarīrassa jaṅghamaṃsaṃ

original: tiguṇaṃ katvā ṭhapitahaliddivaṇṇadukūlapilotikasaṇṭhāno. Disato dvīsu disāsu jāto.
analyzed: tiguṇam katvā ṭhapita haliddi vaṇṇa dukūla pilotika saṇṭhānaḥ disatas dvīsu disāsu jātaḥ
translated: The flesh of the thighs is next to the flesh of the calves, the flesh of the back is next to the flesh of the buttocks, and the flesh of the belly is next to the flesh of the back. original: Okāsato thūlassa sakalasarīraṃ pharitvā, kisassa jaṅghamaṃsādīni nissāya ṭhito, yaṃ🔽sinehasaṅkhaṃ gatampi paramajegucchattā neva muddhani telatthāya, na nāsātelādīnaṃ
analyzed: okāsataḥ thūlassa sakala sarīram pharitvā kisassa jaṅgha maṃsa ādīni nissāya ṭhitaḥ yaṃ  sineha saṅkham na iva muddhani tela tthāya na
translated: As to location, in the case of a stout man it spreads all over the body, but in the case of a lean man it is to be found mainly on the calves of the legs, etc.,

translated: It is stored in the eye-sockets like bile in the bile container. When beings laugh loudly with joy,
