translated: Furthermore, the meaning of enlightenment factor should be understood in this way: “Enlightenment factors: in what sense are they enlightenment factors? They lead to enlightenment, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened in turn, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened one by one, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened altogether, thus they are enlightenment factors” .

original: iminā paṭisambhidānayenāpi bojjhaṅgattho veditabbo.
analyzed: iminā paṭisambhidā nayena api bojjhaṅga tthaḥ veditabbo
translated: And in the Paṭisambhidā, the meaning of enlightenment factor should be understood in this way: “Enlightenment factors: in what sense are they enlightenment factors? They lead to enlightenment, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened in turn, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened one by one, thus they are enlightenment factors; they are enlightened altogether, thus they are enlightenment factors” .

original: Satisambojjhaṅgotiādīsu pasattho sundaro ca bojjhaṅgo sambojjhaṅgo, satiyeva sambojjhaṅgo
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ ti ādīsu pasattho sundaro ca bojjhaṅgo sambojjhaṅgo satiyā iva sambojjhaṅgo
translated: In the passages beginning, “The enlightenment factor of mindfulness” , the word sambojjhaṅga is a bahuvrīhi compound, meaning “having a good enlightenment factor” . Mindfulness itself is the good enlightenment factor,

original: satisambojjhaṅgo. Tattha upaṭṭhānalakkhaṇo satisambojjhaṅgo, pavicayalakkhaṇo dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo,
analyzed: sati sambojjhaṅgo tattha upaṭṭhāna lakkhaṇaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgo pavicaya lakkhaṇaḥ dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgo
translated: thus it is the enlightenment factor of mindfulness . Herein, the enlightenment factor of mindfulness has the characteristic of establishing . The enlightenment factor of discrimination of states has the characteristic of investigating .

original: paggahalakkhaṇo vīriyasambojjhaṅgo, pharaṇalakkhaṇo pītisambojjhaṅgo, upasamalakkhaṇo
analyzed: paggaha lakkhaṇaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgo pharaṇa lakkhaṇaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgo upasama lakkhaṇaḥ
translated: The enlightenment factor of energy has the characteristic of exerting . The enlightenment factor of rapture has the characteristic of pervading . The enlightenment factor of tranquillity has the characteristic of quieting .

original: passaddhisambojjhaṅgo, avikkhepalakkhaṇo samādhisambojjhaṅgo, paṭisaṅkhānalakkhaṇo
analyzed: passaddhi sambojjhaṅgo avikkhepa lakkhaṇo samādhi sambojjhaṅgo paṭisaṅkhāna lakkhaṇo
translated: The enlightenment factor of concentration has the characteristic of non-distraction . The enlightenment factor of equanimity has the characteristic of looking on .

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo. Tesu “satiñca khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabbatthikaṃ vadāmī”ti vacanato
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgo tesu satim ca khvā aham bhikkhave sabbatthikam vadāmi iti vacanato
translated: And in the passage, “Bhikkhus, I say that mindfulness is necessary in all things” ,

original: sabbesaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ upakārakattā satisambojjhaṅgo paṭhamaṃ vutto. Tato paraṃ “so
analyzed: sabbesam bojjhaṅgānam upakāraka ttā sati sambojjhaṅgo paṭhamam vutto tatas param so
translated: The enlightenment factor of mindfulness is mentioned first because it is helpful to all the enlightenment factors.

original: tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinatī”tiādinā nayena evaṃ anukkameneva
analyzed: tathā satas viharantaḥ tam dhammam paññāya pavicinati iti ādinā nayena evam anukkamena iva
translated: The enlightenment factor of mindfulness is mentioned first because it is helpful to all the enlightenment factors. After that, “while he is dwelling thus in mindfulness” and so on is stated in the same order.

original: nikkhepapayojanaṃ pāḷiyaṃ āgatameva.
analyzed: nikkhepa payojanam pāḷiyam āgatam eva
translated: The purpose of the teaching is given in the text itself.

original: Kasmā panete satteva vuttā, anūnā anadhikāti? Līnuddhaccapaṭipakkhato sabbatthikato
analyzed: kasmā pana ete sattā iva vuttāḥ anūnāḥ anadhikā ati līn uddhacca paṭipakkhato sabbatthikato
translated: But why are there only seven enlightenment factors, neither more nor less? Because they are the counteragents to the three hindrances and because they are the factors of all profitable consciousness.

original: ca. Ettha hi tayo bojjhaṅgā līnassa paṭipakkhā, yathāha – “yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave,
analyzed: ca ettha hi tayaḥ bojjhaṅgāḥ līnassa paṭipakkhāḥ yathā āha yasmin ca kho bhikkhave
translated: Herein, three enlightenment factors are the counteragents to slackness, according to:

original: samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya,
analyzed: samaye līnam cittam hoti kālo tasmin samaye dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya
translated: “Bhikkhus, when the mind is slack, that is the time for developing the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states,

original: kālo vīriyasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo pītisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāyā”ti. Tayo
analyzed: kālaḥ vīriya sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya kālaḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya ati tayo
translated: the enlightenment factor of energy, and the enlightenment factor of rapture” .🔽Three are the counteragents to agitation, according to:

original: uddhaccassa paṭipakkhā, yathāha – “yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, samaye uddhataṃ cittaṃ
analyzed: uddhaccassa paṭipakkhā yathā āha yasmin ca kho bhikkhave samaye uddhatam cittam
translated: “Bhikkhus, when the mind is agitated,

original: hoti, kālo tasmiṃ samaye passaddhisambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya, kālo samādhisambojjhaṅgassa
analyzed: hoti kālo tasmin samaye passaddhi sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya kālo samādhi sambojjhaṅgassa
translated: It is time to develop the tranquillity factor of complete awakening,🔽it is time to develop the concentration factor of complete awakening,

original: bhāvanāya, kālo upekkhāsambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāyā”ti. Eko panettha loṇadhūpanaṃ viya
analyzed: bhāvanāya kālaḥ upekkhā sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya ati ekaḥ pana ittha loṇa dhūpanam viya
translated: it is time to develop the equanimity factor of complete awakening.” But one of these is like salt in all seasonings,

original: sabbabyañjanesu, sabbakammikaamacco viya ca sabbesu rājakiccesu, sabbabojjhaṅgesu
analyzed: sabba byañjanesu sabba kammika amaccaḥ viya ca sabbesu rāja kiccesu sabba bojjhaṅgesu
translated: and like a skilled cook in all the king’s duties, and like all the factors of complete awakening

original: icchitabbato sabbatthiko, yathāha – “satiñca khvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sabbatthikaṃ vadāmī”ti.🔽“Sabbatthaka”ntipi pāḷi. Dvinnampi sabbattha icchitabbanti attho. Evaṃ līnuddhaccapaṭipakkhato
analyzed: icchitabbataḥ sabbatthikaḥ yathā āha satim ca khvā aham bhikkhave sabbatthikam vadāmi iti  sabbatthakam tipi dvinnam pi sabbattha icchitabbanti attho evam līn uddhacca paṭipakkhato
translated: because it is wanted in all instances, according to the text, “Bhikkhus, I say that mindfulness is wanted in all instances” .

original: sabbatthikato ca satteva vuttāti veditabbā.
analyzed: sabbatthikato ca sattā iva vuttā iti veditabbā
translated: And there is a reading “sabbatthika” . The meaning of both is “wanted in all instances.” So they should be understood as stated as seven because they are wanted in all instances🔽and because they are the opposites of depression and agitation.

original: 467. Idāni nesaṃ ekasmiṃyevārammaṇe attano attano kiccavasena nānākaraṇaṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: idāni nesam ekasmiṃ yeva ārammaṇe attanaḥ attanaḥ kicca vasena nānākaraṇam dassetuṃ
translated: Now, in order to point out their difference in function in a single object,

original: tattha katamo satisambojjhaṅgotiādi āraddhaṃ. Tattha idha bhikkhūti imasmiṃ sāsane
analyzed: tattha katamaḥ sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ ti ādi āraddham tattha idha bhikkhu iti imasmim sāsane
translated: the text begins thus, “Herein, what is the mindfulness factor of complete awakening?” Herein, bhikkhu means in this Dispensation,

original: bhikkhu. Satimā hotīti paññāya paññavā, yasena yasavā, dhanena dhanavā viya satiyā
analyzed: bhikkhu satimā hoti iti paññāya paññavā yasena yasavā dhanena dhanavā viya satiyā
translated: “The mindful one”: the wise one is mindful through understanding,

original: satimā hoti, satisampannoti attho. Paramenāti uttamena; tañhi paramatthasaccassa
analyzed: satimā hoti sati sampannaḥ ti attho paramena ati uttamena tat hi paramattha saccassa
translated: as one who is famous is famous through fame, and as one who is wealthy is wealthy through wealth. The meaning is that he is provided with mindfulness.

original: nibbānassa ceva maggassa ca anulomato paramaṃ nāma hoti uttamaṃ seṭṭhaṃ. Satinepakkenāti
analyzed: nibbānassa ca iva maggassa ca anulomataḥ paramam nāma hoti uttamam seṭṭham sati nepakkena ati
translated: “The highest”: the supreme. For this is called the highest, the supreme, the best, in conformity with the supreme truth, Nibbāna, and the path.

original: nepakkaṃ vuccati paññā; satiyā ceva nepakkena cāti attho.
analyzed: nepakkam vuccati paññā satiyā ca iva nepakkena ca ati attho
translated: “Through mindfulness and clear comprehension”: clear comprehension is called wisdom. The meaning is that he is mindful and has clear comprehension.

original: Kasmā pana imasmiṃ satibhājanīye paññā saṅgahitāti? Satiyā balavabhāvadīpanatthaṃ.
analyzed: kasmā pana imasmin sati bhājanīye paññā saṅgahitā ati satiyāḥ balava bhāva dīpana attham
translated: But why is wisdom included in this section on mindfulness? For the purpose of showing the strength of mindfulness.

original: Sati hi paññāya saddhimpi uppajjati vināpi, paññāya saddhiṃ uppajjamānā balavatī
analyzed: sati hi paññāya saddhim pi uppajjati vinā api paññāya saddhim uppajjamānā balavatī
translated: For although mindfulness arises together with wisdom and also without wisdom, when it arises together with wisdom it is strong.

original: hoti, vinā uppajjamānā dubbalā. Tenassā balavabhāvadīpanatthaṃ paññā saṅgahitā. Yathā
analyzed: hoti vinā uppajjamānā dubbalā tena assāḥ balava bhāva dīpana attham paññā saṅgahitā yathā
translated: When it arises without wisdom it is weak. Therefore wisdom is included in order to show its strength.

original: hi dvīsu disāsu dve rājamahāmattā tiṭṭheyyuṃ; tesu eko rājaputtaṃ gahetvā tiṭṭheyya,
analyzed: hi dvīsu disāsu dve rāja mahāmattā tiṭṭheyyum tesu ekaḥ rāja puttam gahetvā tiṭṭheyya
translated: For example, suppose there were two royal ministers in two different directions. One would stand there holding a prince,

original: eko attano dhammatāya ekakova tesu rājaputtaṃ gahetvā ṭhito attanopi tejena rājaputtassapi🔽tejena tejavā hoti; attano dhammatāya ṭhito na tena samatejo hoti; evameva rājaputtaṃ🔽gahetvā ṭhitamahāmatto viya paññāya saddhiṃ uppannā sati, attano dhammatāya ṭhito🔽viya vinā paññāya uppannā. Tattha yathā rājaputtaṃ gahetvā ṭhito attanopi tejena
analyzed: ekaḥ attanaḥ dhamma tāya ekakaḥ eva tesu rāja puttam gahetvā ṭhitaḥ attanaḥ api tejena rāja puttassa api  tejena tejavā hoti attanaḥ dhamma tāya ṭhitaḥ na tena sama tejaḥ hoti evam eva rāja puttam  gahetvā ṭhita mahāmattaḥ viya paññāya saddhim uppannā sati attanaḥ dhamma tāya ṭhitaḥ  viya vinā paññāya uppannā tattha yathā rāja puttam gahetvā ṭhitaḥ attanaḥ api tejena
translated: One of them, by his own nature, stands alone by himself, and by his own brilliance and by the brilliance of the prince he stands as one of great brilliance. By his own nature he stands alone, and he is not of equal brilliance with him. So too, mindfulness arisen together with understanding is like the minister who stands by holding on to the prince. Mindfulness arisen without understanding is like the minister who stands alone by himself.

original: rājaputtassapi tejena tejavā hoti, evaṃ paññāya saddhiṃ uppannā sati balavatī hoti;🔽yathā attano dhammatāya ṭhito na tena samatejo hoti, evaṃ vinā paññāya uppannā dubbalā
analyzed: rāja puttassa api tejena tejavā hoti evam paññāya saddhim uppannā sati balavatī hoti  yathā attanaḥ dhamma tāya ṭhitaḥ na tena sama tejaḥ hoti evam vinā paññāya uppannā dubbalā
translated: One who stands by his own nature alone with them is powerful by his own power and by the prince’s power. He is not equal in power to one who stands by his own nature. So too, mindfulness arisen with understanding is like the minister who stands with the prince. Mindfulness arisen without understanding is like the one who stands by his own nature. Herein, just as the one who stands with the prince is powerful by his own power and by the prince’s power, so mindfulness arisen with understanding is strong;

original: hotīti balavabhāvadīpanatthaṃ paññā gahitāti.
analyzed: hoti iti balava bhāva dīpana attham paññā gahitā ti
translated: just as the one who stands by his own nature is not equal in power to that one, so mindfulness arisen without understanding is weak. So it is shown that it is because of strength that understanding is mentioned as “grasped.”

original: Cirakatampīti attano vā parassa vā kāyena cirakataṃ vattaṃ vā kasiṇamaṇḍalaṃ vā kasiṇaparikammaṃ
analyzed: cirakatam pi iti attanaḥ vā parassa vā kāyena cirakatam vattam vā kasiṇa maṇḍalam vā kasiṇa parikammam
translated: “Long since done”: a course of action done long ago by oneself or another, or a kasiṇa, or the preliminary work for a kasiṇa.

original: vā. Cirabhāsitampīti attanā vā parena vā vācāya cirabhāsitaṃ bahukampi, vattasīse
analyzed: vā cira bhāsitam pi iti attanā vā parena vā vācāya cira bhāsitam bahukam pi
translated: “Even if spoken for a long time”: even if spoken for a long time by oneself or by another, even if spoken much,

original: ṭhatvā dhammakathaṃ vā kammaṭṭhānavinicchayaṃ vā, vimuttāyatanasīse vā ṭhatvā dhammakathameva.
analyzed: ṭhatvā dhamma katham vā kammaṭṭhāna vinicchayam vā vimutta āyatana sīse vā ṭhatvā dhamma katham eva
translated: and so on. For a long time: for a long time by himself or by others, whether spoken or recited, much or little. He gives attention to it as “spoken” or “recited” or “heard” or “contemplated in the mind” or “spoken by others” or “spoken by myself” or “spoken by myself a long time ago” or “spoken by others a long time ago” or “spoken by myself and others a long time ago” or “spoken by myself and others not long ago” or “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and not long ago” or “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” or “spoken by others and myself a long time ago and recently and at present” or “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present.”

original: Saritā hotīti taṃ kāyaviññattiṃ vacīviññattiñca samuṭṭhāpetvā pavattaṃ arūpadhammakoṭṭhāsaṃ🔽‘evaṃ uppajjitvā evaṃ niruddho’ti saritā hoti. Anussaritāti punappunaṃ saritā. Ayaṃ🔽vuccati satisambojjhaṅgoti ayaṃ evaṃ uppannā sesabojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpikā vipassanāsampayuttā
analyzed: saritā hoti iti tam kāya viññattim vacī viññattiñca samuṭṭhāpetvā pavattam arūpa dhamma koṭṭhāsam  evam uppajjitvā evam niruddhaḥ ti saritā hoti anussaritā ati punappunam saritā ayam  vuccati sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ ti ayam evam uppannā sesa bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpikā vipassanā sampayuttā
translated: He gives attention to it as “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” in the sense of the past, in the sense of the future, in the sense of the present.🔽He gives attention to it as “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” in the sense of the past, in the sense of the future, in the sense of the present, in the sense of the internal, in the sense of the external, in the sense of the internal and external.

original: sati satisambojjhaṅgo nāma kathīyati.🔽So tathā sato viharantoti so bhikkhu tenākārena uppannāya satiyā sato hutvā viharanto.
analyzed: sati satisambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma kathīyati  so tathā sataḥ viharanto ti so bhikkhu tena ākārena uppannāya satiyā sataḥ hutvā viharanto
translated: He gives attention to it as “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” in the sense of the past, in the sense of the future, in the sense of the present, in the sense of the internal, in the sense of the external, in the sense of the internal and external, in the sense of what is included in the world, in the sense of what is not included in the world.

original: Taṃ dhammanti taṃ cirakataṃ cirabhāsitaṃ heṭṭhā vuttappakāraṃ dhammaṃ. Paññāya pavicinatīti
analyzed: tam dhammanti tam cira katam cira bhāsitam heṭṭhā vutta ppakāram dhammam paññāya pavicinati iti
translated: He gives attention to it as “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” in the sense of the past, in the sense of the future, in the sense of the present, in the sense of the internal, in the sense of the external, in the sense of the internal and external, in the sense of what is included in the world, in the sense of what is not included in the world, in the sense of what is far, in the sense of what is near.🔽He gives attention to it as “spoken by myself and others a long time ago and recently and at present” in the sense of the

original: paññāya ‘aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ anattā’ti pavicinati. Pavicaratīti ‘aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ anattā’ti
analyzed: paññāya aniccam dukkham anattā ati pavicinati pavicarati iti aniccam dukkham anattā ati
translated: He scrutinizes: he scrutinizes that by means of the understanding described above thus: ‘What is impermanent is suffering, what is suffering is non-self.’

original: tattha paññaṃ carāpento pavicarati. Parivīmaṃsaṃ āpajjatīti olokanaṃ gavesanaṃ āpajjati.
analyzed: tattha paññam carāpento pavicarati parivīmaṃsam āpajjati iti olokanam gavesanam āpajjati
translated: He scrutinizes it by making understanding travel there. He applies thorough analysis: he applies the investigation.

original: Ayaṃ vuccatīti idaṃ vuttappakāraṃ bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpakaṃ vipassanāñāṇaṃ dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.
analyzed: ayam vuccati iti idam vutta ppakāram bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpakam vipassanā ñāṇam dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati
translated: This is called: this insight knowledge that originates the enlightenment factors, which is of the kind already stated, is called the enlightenment factor of discrimination of states.

original: Tassa taṃ dhammanti tassa bhikkhuno taṃ heṭṭhā vuttappakāraṃ dhammaṃ. Āraddhaṃ hotīti
analyzed: tassa tam dhammanti tassa bhikkhuno tam heṭṭhā vutta ppakāram dhammam āraddham hoti iti
translated: His: that bhikkhu’s. That: the state described above. Is aroused:

original: paripuṇṇaṃ hoti paggahitaṃ. Asallīnanti āraddhattāyeva asallīnaṃ. Ayaṃ vuccatīti
analyzed: paripuṇṇam hoti paggahitam a sallīnam ti āraddha ttāya iva a sallīnam ayam vuccati iti
translated: is fulfilled, is taken up. Not slack: it is not slack because it is aroused. This is called:

original: idaṃ bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpakaṃ vipassanāsampayuttaṃ vīriyaṃ vīriyasambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.
analyzed: idam bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpakam vipassanā sampayuttam vīriyam vīriya sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati
translated: this energy associated with insight that originates the enlightenment factors is called the enlightenment factor of energy.

original: Nirāmisāti kāmāmisalokāmisavaṭṭāmisānaṃ abhāvena nirāmisā parisuddhā. Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpikā vipassanāsampayuttā pīti pītisambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.🔽Pītimanassāti pītisampayuttacittassa. Kāyopi passambhatīti khandhattayasaṅkhāto nāmakāyo
analyzed: nirāmisā ti kāma āmisa loka āmisa vaṭṭa āmisānam abhāvena nirāmisā parisuddhā ayam vuccati iti ayam bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpikā vipassanā sampayuttā pīti pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati  pīti manassa ati pīti sampayutta cittassa kāyaḥ api passambhati iti khandha ttaya saṅkhāto nāmakāyo
translated: “Unworldly”: it is unworldly since it is free from the worldliness of sense desires, of the worlds, and of the round of rebirths. This is called the enlightenment factor of rapture: this rapture associated with insight that occurs as the producer of the enlightenment factors is called the enlightenment factor of rapture.

original: kilesadarathapaṭippassaddhiyā passambhati. Cittampīti viññāṇakkhandhopi tatheva passambhati.
analyzed: kilesa daratha paṭippassaddhiyā passambhati cittam pi iti viññāṇa kkhandho pi tathā iva passambhati
translated: With a mind that has rapture: with a mind associated with rapture. The body becomes tranquil: the body consisting of the three ordinary kinds of physical matter becomes tranquil through the quieting of the defilements’ fever. And the mind: the consciousness aggregate becomes tranquil in the same way.

original: Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpikā vipassanāsampayuttā passaddhi passaddhisambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.
analyzed: ayam vuccati iti ayam bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpikā vipassanā sampayuttā passaddhi passaddhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati
translated: This is called the enlightenment factor of tranquillity: this tranquillity associated with insight that occurs as the producer of the enlightenment factors is called the enlightenment factor of tranquillity.

original: Passaddhakāyassa sukhinoti passaddhakāyatāya uppannasukhena sukhitassa. Samādhiyatīti
analyzed: passaddha kāyassa sukhino ti passaddha kāya tāya uppanna sukhena sukhitassa samādhiyati iti
translated: For one whose body is tranquil, pleasure arises: for one whose body is tranquil through the arising of the pleasure that has tranquillity as its characteristic. His mind becomes concentrated:

original: sammā ādhiyati, niccalaṃ hutvā ārammaṇe ṭhapīyati, appanāppattaṃ viya hoti. Ayaṃ
analyzed: sammā ādhiyati niccalam hutvā ārammaṇe ṭhapīyati appanā appattam viya hoti ayaṃ
translated: it is rightly concentrated, it is steadied on the object, it has reached access concentration. This is called

original: vuccatīti ayaṃ bojjhaṅgasamuṭṭhāpikā vipassanāsampayuttā cittekaggatā samādhisambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.
analyzed: vuccati iti ayam bojjhaṅga samuṭṭhāpikā vipassanā sampayuttā citta ekagga tā samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati
translated: “This is called the concentration enlightenment factor”: the unification of mind associated with insight that instigates the enlightenment factors is called the concentration enlightenment factor.

original: Tathā samāhitanti tena appanāppattena viya samādhinā samāhitaṃ. Sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā
analyzed: tathā samāhitam ti tena appanā appattena viya samādhinā samāhitam sādhukam ajjhupekkhitā
translated: “And so he is concentrated”: he is concentrated with concentration that has reached absorption.

original: hotīti suṭṭhu ajjhupekkhitā hoti; tesaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānavaḍḍhane abyāvaṭo hutvā ajjhupekkhati.
analyzed: hoti iti suṭṭhu ajjhupekkhitā hoti tesam dhammānam pahāna vaḍḍhane abyāvaṭaḥ hutvā ajjhupekkhati
translated: “He watches closely”: he watches closely in the sense of not turning away from the increase of the abandoning of those states.

original: Ayaṃ vuccatīti ayaṃ channaṃ bojjhaṅgānaṃ anosakkanaanativattanabhāvasādhako majjhattākāro
analyzed: ayam vuccati iti ayam channam bojjhaṅgānam anosakkana anativattana bhāva sādhakaḥ majjhatta ākāraḥ
translated: “This is called”: this equanimity that is the middle way and is the establishment of the enlightenment factors without partiality or perversion

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo nāma vuccati.
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgaḥ nāma vuccati
translated: is called the equanimity enlightenment factor.

original: Ettāvatā kiṃ kathitaṃ nāma hoti? Apubbaṃ acarimaṃ ekacittakkhaṇe nānārasalakkhaṇā pubbabhāgavipassanā bojjhaṅgā kathitā hontīti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kim kathitam nāma hoti apubbam acarimam eka citta khaṇe nānā rasa lakkhaṇā pubbabhāga vipassanā bojjhaṅgā kathitāḥ honti iti
translated: What has been demonstrated so far? The successive insight into the various characteristics in a single moment without repetition or omission is called the enlightenment factors in the preliminary stage.

original: Paṭhamo nayo.
analyzed: paṭhamaḥ
translated: This is the first method.

original: 468-469. Idāni yena pariyāyena satta bojjhaṅgā cuddasa honti, tassa pakāsanatthaṃ
analyzed: idāni yena pariyāyena satta bojjhaṅgā cuddasa honti tassa pakāsana attham
translated: Now, in order to show the method by which the seven enlightenment factors become fourteen,

original: dutiyanayaṃ dassento puna satta bojjhaṅgātiādimāha. Tatrāyaṃ anupubbapadavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya nayam dassentaḥ puna satta bojjhaṅgā ti ādim āha tatra ayam anupubba pada vaṇṇanā
translated: He is showing the second method when he says “Seven enlightenment factors” and so on. Here is the word commentary:🔽“Mindfulness internally” is mindfulness arisen in one who discerns internal determinations.

original: – ajjhattaṃ dhammesu satīti ajjhattikasaṅkhāre pariggaṇhantassa uppannā sati. Bahiddhā
analyzed: ajjhattam dhammesu sati iti ajjhattika saṅkhāre pariggaṇhantassa uppannā sati bahiddhā
translated: “Mindfulness externally” is mindfulness arisen in one who discerns external determinations.

original: dhammesu satīti bahiddhāsaṅkhāre pariggaṇhantassa uppannā sati. Yadapīti yāpi. Tadapīti
analyzed: dhammesu satī iti bahiddhā saṅkhāre pariggaṇhantassa uppannā sati yat api iti yā api tat api iti
translated: “That too” is “that” and also “too.”

original: sāpi. Abhiññāyāti abhiññeyyadhamme abhijānanatthāya. Sambodhāyāti sambodhi vuccati
analyzed: sā api abhiññāya ati abhiññeyya dhamme abhijānana atthāya sambodhāya ati sambodhi vuccati
translated: “For direct knowledge”: for the purpose of direct-knowing the states that are to be directly known.🔽“For full understanding”: the path is called “full understanding” ; the meaning is: for the purpose of the path.

original: maggo, maggatthāyāti attho. Nibbānāyāti vānaṃ vuccati taṇhā; sā tattha natthīti nibbānaṃ,
analyzed: maggaḥ magga tthāya ati atthaḥ nibbānāya ati vānam vuccati taṇhā sā tattha natthi iti nibbānam
translated: “For Nibbāna”: craving is called “vāna” ; that is absent here, thus it is “nibbāna” ;🔽the meaning is: it leads to that, to the unformed, deathless element, for the purpose of realizing it.

original: tadatthāya, asaṅkhatāya amatadhātuyā sacchikiriyatthāya saṃvattatīti attho. Dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgepi eseva nayo.🔽Kāyikaṃ vīriyanti caṅkamaṃ adhiṭṭhahantassa uppannavīriyaṃ. Cetasikaṃ vīriyanti “na
analyzed: tad atthāya asaṅkhatāya amata dhātuyā sacchikiriya tthāya saṃvattati iti atthaḥ dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅge pi esa eva nayo 🔽kāyikam vīriyanti caṅkamam adhiṭṭhahantassa uppanna vīriyam cetasikam vīriyanti na
translated: The same method applies to the enlightenment factor of investigation of (mental) states.

original: tāvāhaṃ imaṃ pallaṅkaṃ bhindissāmi yāva me na anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuccissatī”ti🔽evaṃ kāyapayogaṃ vinā uppannavīriyaṃ. Kāyapassaddhīti tiṇṇaṃ khandhānaṃ darathapassaddhi.
analyzed: tāva aham imam pallaṅkam bhindissāmi yāva me na an upādāya āsavehi cittam vimuccissati iti  evam kāya payogam vinā uppanna vīriyam kāya passaddhi iti tiṇṇam khandhānam daratha passaddhi
translated: I will break up this couch until my mind is liberated from the taints by non-clinging.’🔽Thus the energy arisen without bodily effort is called ‘purity of perception of physical objects.’ ‘Tranquillization of body’ is the tranquillization of the three aggregates associated with the faculties of feeling, perception, and formations.

original: Cittapassaddhīti viññāṇakkhandhassa darathapassaddhi. Upekkhāsambojjhaṅge satisambojjhaṅgasadisova
analyzed: citta passaddhi iti viññāṇa kkhandhassa daratha passaddhi upekkhā sambojjhaṅge sati sambojjhaṅga sadisā uva
translated: ‘Tranquillization of cognizance’ is the tranquillization of the cognizance aggregate. The exposition of equanimity should be understood in the same way as that of mindfulness.

original: vinicchayo. Imasmiṃ naye satta bojjhaṅgā lokiyalokuttaramissakā kathitā.
analyzed: vinicchayaḥ imasmin naye satta bojjhaṅgāḥ lokiya lokuttara missakā kathitā
translated: In this Thread the seven enlightenment factors are stated as a mixture of mundane and supramundane.

original: Porāṇakattherā pana ‘ettakena pākaṭaṃ na hotī’ti vibhajitvā dassesuṃ. Etesu hi ajjhattadhammesu
analyzed: porāṇaka therā pana ettakena pākaṭam na hoti iti vibhajitvā dassesuṃ etesu hi ajjhatta dhammesu
translated: But the ancient teachers, thinking ‘That is not clear enough,’ gave the division as follows. For of these factors of enlightenment

original: sati pavicayo upekkhāti ime tayo attano khandhārammaṇattā lokiyāva honti. Tathā maggaṃ
analyzed: sati pavicayaḥ upekkhāti ime tayo attano khandha ārammaṇa ttā lokiyā ava honti tathā maggaṃ
translated: mindfulness, investigation of states, and equanimity are mundane only because they have as their object one’s own aggregates.🔽So too the energy that has not reached the path.

original: appattaṃ kāyikavīriyaṃ. Avitakkaavicārā pana pītisamādhiyo lokuttarā honti. Sesā
analyzed: appattam kāyika vīriyam avitakka avicārāḥ pana pīti samādhiyaḥ lokuttarāḥ honti sesā
translated: But the happiness and concentration without thought and exploration are supramundane.

original: lokiyalokuttaramissakāti.
analyzed: lokiya lokuttara missakā ati
translated: The rest are a mixture of mundane and supramundane.

original: Tattha ajjhattaṃ tāva dhammesu satipavicayaupekkhā ajjhattārammaṇā, lokuttarā pana
analyzed: tattha ajjhattam tāva dhammesu sati pavicaya aupekkhā ajjhatta ārammaṇā lokuttarā pana
translated: Herein, firstly, the equanimity in the investigation of states in the four foundations of mindfulness is only concerned with what is internal, and the supramundane is only concerned with what is external.🔽So their supramundane state would not be established.🔽And the energy that arises with the application of the will is mundane.

original: bahiddhārammaṇāti tesaṃ lokuttarabhāvo mā yujjittha. Caṅkamappayogena nibbattavīriyampi
analyzed: bahiddhā ārammaṇā ti tesam lokuttara bhāvaḥ mā caṅkama ppayogena nibbatta vīriyam pi
translated: So there is no contradiction in saying that.

original: lokiyanti vadanto na kilamati. Avitakkaavicārā pana pītisamādhiyo kadā lokuttarā
analyzed: vadantaḥ na kilamati avitakka avicārā pana kadā lokuttarā
translated: But when are the happiness and concentration without thought and exploration supramundane?

original: hontīti? Kāmāvacare tāva pītisambojjhaṅgo labbhati, avitakkaavicārā pīti na labbhati.
analyzed: honti iti kāmāvacare tāva pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ labbhati avitakka avicārā pīti na labbhati
translated: In the case of the happiness enlightenment factor, that of the sense sphere is obtained, but the happiness without thought and exploration is not obtained.🔽In the case of the happiness of the fine-material sphere, the happiness without thought and exploration is obtained, but the happiness enlightenment factor is not obtained.

original: Rūpāvacare avitakkaavicārā pīti labbhati, pītisambojjhaṅgo pana na labbhati. Arūpāvacare
analyzed: rūpāvacare avitakka avicārā pīti labbhati pīti sambojjhaṅgo pana na labbhati arūpāvacare
translated: In the case of the immaterial sphere,

original: sabbena sabbaṃ na labbhati. Ettha pana alabbhamānakaṃ upādāya labbhamānakāpi paṭikkhittā.🔽Evamayaṃ avitakkaavicāro pītisambojjhaṅgo kāmāvacaratopi nikkhanto rūpāvacaratopi
analyzed: sabbena sabbam na labbhati ettha pana alabbhamānakam upādāya labbhamānakā api paṭikkhittā  evam ayam a vitakka a vicāraḥ pīti sambojjhaṅgaḥ kāmāvacarataḥ pi nikkhantaḥ rūpāvacarataḥ pi
translated: neither is obtained. But because of the non-obtaining of the one, the other is also rejected.

original: arūpāvacaratopīti nibbattitalokuttaro yevāti kathito.
analyzed: arūpa avacarataḥ pi iti nibbattita lokuttaraḥ yā iva ati kathitaḥ
translated: So this happiness enlightenment factor without thought and exploration is said to be “gone beyond” the sense sphere, the fine-material sphere, and the immaterial sphere, and so it is called “supramundane” in the sense of being generated in the supramundane path.

original: Tathā kāmāvacare samādhisambojjhaṅgo labbhati, avitakkaavicāro pana samādhi na labbhati.
analyzed: tathā kāmāvacare samādhi sambojjhaṅgaḥ labbhati avitakka avicāro pana samādhi na labbhati
translated: Likewise the concentration factor of complete awakening is found in the sense-sphere jhāna, but the concentration without thinking and without exploring is not found there.

original: Rūpāvacaraarūpāvacaresu avitakkaavicāro samādhi labbhati, samādhisambojjhaṅgo pana
analyzed: rūpāvacara arūpāvacaresu avitakka avicāro samādhi labbhati samādhi sambojjhaṅgo pana
translated: The concentration without thinking and without exploring is found in the fine-material and immaterial jhānas, but the concentration factor of complete awakening is not found there.

original: na labbhati. Ettha pana alabbhamānakaṃ upādāya labbhamānakopi paṭikkhitto. Evamayaṃ🔽avitakkaavicāro samādhi kāmāvacaratopi nikkhanto rūpāvacaratopi arūpāvacaratopīti
analyzed: na labbhati ettha pana a labbhamānakam upādāya labbhamānakaḥ api paṭikkhittaḥ evam ayam  a vitakka a vicāro samādhi kāma avacarataḥ pi nikkhantaḥ rūpa avacarataḥ pi a rūpa avacarataḥ pi iti
translated: But here, by way of what is not found, what is found is also rejected.

original: nibbattitalokuttaro yevāti kathito.
analyzed: nibbattita lokuttaraḥ yā iva ati kathitaḥ
translated: Thus this concentration without thinking and without exploring is said to be “gone beyond the sense-sphere, gone beyond the fine-material sphere, gone beyond the immaterial sphere,🔽and become the supramundane deliverance.”

original: Apica lokiyaṃ gahetvā lokuttaro kātabbo; lokuttaraṃ gahetvā lokiyo kātabbo. Ajjhattadhammesu
analyzed: apica lokiyam gahetvā lokuttaraḥ kātabbaḥ lokuttaram gahetvā lokiyaḥ kātabbaḥ ajjhatta dhammesu
translated: Moreover, the supramundane can be made mundane by taking it as an object, and the mundane can be made supramundane by taking it as an object.

original: hi satipavicayaupekkhānaṃ lokuttarabhāvanākālopi atthi. Tatridaṃ suttaṃ – “ajjhattavimokkhaṃ
analyzed: hi satipa vicaya aupekkhānam lokuttara bhāvanā kālaḥ api atthi tatra idam suttam ajjhatta vimokkham
translated: For there is a time when the investigation, equanimity, and mindfulness factors of complete awakening, which are states of consciousness, are developed supramundane.

original: khvāhaṃ, āvuso, sabbupādānakkhayaṃ vadāmi; evamassime āsavā nānusentī”ti iminā suttena
analyzed: khvā aham āvuso sabba upādāna kkhayam vadāmi evam assa ime āsavāḥ na anusenti iti iminā suttena
translated: Here is a sutta: “I say that the deliverance of mind is the destruction of passion, friends; thus these taints do not exist for him” .

original: lokuttarā honti. Yadā pana caṅkamapayogena nibbatte kāyikavīriye anupasanteyeva vipassanā🔽maggena ghaṭīyati, tadā taṃ lokuttaraṃ hoti. Ye pana therā “kasiṇajjhāne, ānāpānajjhāne,🔽brahmavihārajjhāne ca bojjhaṅgo uddharanto na vāretabbo”ti vadanti, tesaṃ vāde avitakkaavicārā
analyzed: lokuttarāḥ honti yadā pana caṅkama payogena nibbatte kāyika vīriye vipassanā  maggena tadā tam lokuttaram hoti ye pana therā kasiṇa jhāne āna apāna jhāne  brahmavihāra jhāne ca bojjhaṅgaḥ uddharantaḥ na vāretabbo ti vadanti tesam vāde avitakka avicārā
translated: They are supramundane when the energy arisen through the exertion of walking back and forth is not interrupted and is brought to culmination by the path of insight.

original: pītisamādhisambojjhaṅgā lokiyā hontīti.
analyzed: pīti samādhi sambojjhaṅgāḥ lokiyāḥ honti iti
translated: But when the elders say that “when one is emerging from the jhāna in the kasiṇa, mindfulness of breathing, and divine abidings, one should not be restrained,” then in their view the factors of enlightenment of applied thought, sustained thought, and happiness are mundane.

original: Dutiyo nayo.🔽470-471. Idāni bojjhaṅgānaṃ bhāvanāvasena pavattaṃ tatiyanayaṃ dassento puna satta🔽bojjhaṅgātiādimāha. Tatthāpi ayaṃ anupubbapadavaṇṇanā – bhāvetīti vaḍḍheti; attano
analyzed: dutiyaḥ  idāni bojjhaṅgānam bhāvanā vasena pavattam tatiya nayam dassento puna satta  bojjhaṅga āti ādim āha tattha api ayam anupubba pada vaṇṇanā bhāveti iti vaḍḍheti attanaḥ
translated: This is the second method.

original: santāne punappunaṃ janeti abhinibbatteti. Vivekanissitanti viveke nissitaṃ. Vivekoti
analyzed: santāne punappunam janeti abhinibbatteti viveka nissitam ti viveke nissitam
translated: Now, in order to show the third method, which occurs in the development of the factors of enlightenment, he says, “Again, seven factors of enlightenment,” etc. Here too, the explanation of the individual terms is this: He develops means he causes to grow, he generates again and again in his own continuity, he brings into being. Dependent on seclusion means dependent on seclusion. Seclusion means

original: vivittatā. So cāyaṃ tadaṅgaviveko, vikkhambhanasamucchedapaṭippassaddhinissaraṇavivekoti
analyzed: vivitta tā saḥ ca ayam tad aṅga vivekaḥ vikkhambhana samuccheda paṭippassaddhi nissaraṇa vivekaḥ ti
translated: separation. And this is the seclusion of the parts, the seclusion of suppression, the seclusion of cutting off, the seclusion of development, and the seclusion of escape.

original: pañcavidho. Tattha tadaṅgaviveko nāma vipassanā. Vikkhambhanaviveko nāma aṭṭha samāpattiyo.
analyzed: pañcavidhaḥ tattha tad aṅga vivekaḥ nāma vipassanā vikkhambhana vivekaḥ nāma aṭṭha samāpattiyo
translated: It is fivefold. Herein, the “discernment of the particular” is insight. The “discernment of suppression” is the eight attainments.

original: Samucchedaviveko nāma maggo. Paṭippassaddhiviveko nāma phalaṃ. Nissaraṇaviveko nāma
analyzed: samuccheda vivekaḥ nāma maggaḥ paṭippassaddhi vivekaḥ nāma phalam nissaraṇa vivekaḥ nāma
translated: The “discernment of eradication” is the path. The “discernment of appeasement” is fruition. The “discernment of escape” is Nibbāna,

original: sabbanimittanissaṭaṃ nibbānaṃ. Evametasmiṃ pañcavidhe viveke nissitaṃ vivekanissitanti
analyzed: sabba nimitta nissaṭam nibbānam evam etasmin pañcavidhe viveke nissitam viveka nissitanti
translated: which is the escape from all signs. So the meaning of “resorting to discernment” should be understood as follows:

original: tadaṅgavivekanissitaṃ samucchedavivekanissitaṃ nissaraṇavivekanissitañca satisambojjhaṅgaṃ🔽bhāvetīti ayamattho veditabbo.🔽Tathā hi ayaṃ satisambojjhaṅgabhāvanānuyogamanuyutto yogī vipassanākkhaṇe kiccato🔽tadaṅgavivekanissitaṃ, ajjhāsayato nissaraṇavivekanissitaṃ, maggakāle pana kiccato
analyzed: tad aṅga viveka nissitam samuccheda viveka nissitam nissaraṇa viveka nissitam ca sati sambojjhaṅgam  bhāveti iti ayam attho veditabbo  tathā hi ayam sati sambojjhaṅga bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttaḥ yogī vipassanā kkhaṇe kiccato  tad aṅga viveka nissitam ajjhāsayataḥ nissaraṇa viveka nissitam magga kāle pana kiccataḥ
translated: he develops the enlightenment factor of mindfulness that resorts to the discernment of the particular, that resorts to the discernment of suppression, that resorts to the discernment of eradication,🔽that resorts to the discernment of appeasement, that resorts to the discernment of escape.🔽For when the meditator is devoted to the development of the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, at the moment of insight his mindfulness resorts to the discernment of the particular in the sense of function,

original: samucchedavivekanissitaṃ, ārammaṇato nissaraṇavivekanissitaṃ, satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti.
analyzed: samuccheda viveka nissitam ārammaṇataḥ nissaraṇa viveka nissitam sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: and to the discernment of escape in the sense of object. But at the moment of the path it resorts to the discernment of eradication in the sense of function,🔽and to the discernment of escape in the sense of object.

original: Pañcavivekanissitampīti eke. Te hi na kevalaṃ balavavipassanāmaggaphalakkhaṇesu eva
analyzed: pañca viveka nissitam pi iti eke te hi na kevalam balava vipassanā magga phala kkhaṇesu eva
translated: Some say that it is also dependent on the five kinds of separation. For they extract the enlightenment factors not only in the kinds of path and fruition that are strong insight,

original: bojjhaṅgaṃ uddharanti, vipassanāpādakakasiṇajjhānaānāpānāsubhabrahmavihārajjhānesupi
analyzed: bojjhaṅgam uddharanti vipassanā pādaka kasiṇa jhāna ānāpāna asubha brahmavihāra jhānesu pi
translated: but also in the kinds of jhāna that are insight- preliminary, namely, the kasiṇa jhāna, the jhāna of the recollection of the Buddha’s qualities, the mindfulness of breathing, the sublime abidings, and the divine abidings.

original: uddharanti, na ca paṭisiddhā aṭṭhakathācariyehi. Tasmā tesaṃ matena etesaṃ jhānānaṃ🔽pavattikkhaṇe kiccato eva vikkhambhanavivekanissitaṃ. Yathā ca vipassanākkhaṇe “ajjhāsayato
analyzed: uddharanti na ca paṭisiddhāḥ aṭṭhakathā cariyehi tasmā tesam matena etesam jhānānam  pavatti kkhaṇe kiccataḥ eva vikkhambhana viveka nissitam yathā ca vipassanā kkhaṇe ajjhāsayato
translated: And they are not contradicted by the teachers of the commentaries. So according to their view, the enlightenment factors are dependent on the separation due to suppression in the moments of arising of these jhānas.🔽And just as it is said that they are dependent on the separation due to surmounting in the moment of insight, so too it may be said that they are developed dependent on the separation due to tranquillization.

original: nissaraṇavivekanissita”nti vuttaṃ, evaṃ “paṭippassaddhivivekanissitampi bhāvetī”ti🔽vattuṃ vaṭṭati. Esa nayo virāganissitādīsu. Vivekatthā eva hi virāgādayo.
analyzed: nissaraṇa viveka nissitan ti vuttam evam paṭippassaddhi viveka nissitam api bhāveti iti  vattum vaṭṭati esa nayaḥ virāga nissita ādīsu viveka atthāḥ eva hi virāga ādayaḥ
translated: And so too in the case of the dependence on fading away, etc., for fading away, etc., are just different terms for separation.

original: Kevalañcettha vossaggo duvidho – pariccāgavossaggo ca pakkhandanavossaggo cāti. Tattha
analyzed: kevalañca ittha vossaggaḥ duvidhaḥ pariccāga vossaggo ca pakkhandana vossaggo ca ati tattha
translated: But the surmounting is twofold as giving up and as entering into. Herein,

original: ‘pariccāgavossaggo’ti vipassanākkhaṇe ca tadaṅgavasena maggakkhaṇe ca samucchedavasena
analyzed: pariccāga vossaggaḥ ti vipassanā kkhaṇe ca tad aṅga vasena magga kkhaṇe ca samuccheda vasena
translated: giving up as giving up is in the moment of insight by the giving up of the defilements’ possession, and in the moment of the path by the giving up of their underlying tendencies.

original: kilesappahānaṃ. ‘Pakkhandanavossaggo’ti vipassanākkhaṇe tanninnabhāvena, maggakkhaṇe
analyzed: kilesa ppahānam pakkhandana vossaggaḥ ti vipassanā kkhaṇe tad ninna bhāvena magga kkhaṇe
translated: and the abandoning of defilements. ‘Surrender by commitment’ is the commitment to Nibbāna at the moment of insight by being intent on it, and at the moment of the path by making it the object.

original: pana ārammaṇakaraṇena nibbānapakkhandanaṃ. Tadubhayampi imasmiṃ lokiyalokuttaramissake🔽atthavaṇṇanānaye vaṭṭati. Tathā hi ayaṃ sati sambojjhaṅgo yathāvuttena pakārena kilese
analyzed: pana ārammaṇa karaṇena nibbāna pakkhandanam tat ubhayam pi imasmim lokiya lokuttara missake  attha vaṇṇanā naye vaṭṭati tathā hi ayam sati sambojjhaṅgaḥ yathā vuttena pakārena kilese
translated: Both these kinds of surrender are appropriate in this commentary, which is a mixture of mundane and supramundane exposition.

original: pariccajati, nibbānañca pakkhandati.🔽Vossaggapariṇāminti iminā pana sakalena vacanena vossaggatthaṃ pariṇamantaṃ pariṇatañca,
analyzed: pariccajati nibbānam ca pakkhandati  vossagga pariṇāmin ti iminā pana sakalena vacanena vossagga attham pariṇamantam pariṇatam ca
translated: For this mindfulness factor, in the way already stated, surrenders defilements and commits to Nibbāna.🔽‘Surrender by transformation’ is what is meant by the whole phrase ‘surrender by transformation.’

original: paripaccantaṃ paripakkañcāti idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti. Ayañhi bojjhaṅgabhāvanamanuyutto bhikkhu🔽yathā satisambojjhaṅgo kilesapariccāgavossaggatthaṃ nibbānapakkhandanavossaggatthañca
analyzed: paripaccantam paripakkam ca iti idam vuttam hoti ayan hi bojjhaṅga bhāvanam anuyuttaḥ bhikkhu  yathā sati sambojjhaṅgo kilesa pariccāga vossagga attham nibbāna pakkhandana vossagga attham ca
translated: What is meant is this: the bhikkhu who is devoted to the development of the enlightenment factors🔽surrenders the defilements and commits to Nibbāna for the sake of the surrender and the commitment by the development of the mindfulness factor.

original: paripaccati, yathā ca paripakko hoti, tathā naṃ bhāvetīti. Esa nayo sesabojjhaṅgesupi.
analyzed: paripaccati yathā ca paripakkaḥ hoti tathā nam bhāveti iti esa nayo sesa bojjhaṅgesu pi
translated: And he develops it in such a way that it surrenders and commits in this way. So too with the other enlightenment factors.

original: Imasmimpi naye lokiyalokuttaramissakā bojjhaṅgā kathitāti.
analyzed: imasmin pi naye lokiya lokuttara missakā bojjhaṅgā kathitā ati
translated: In this method too the factors of enlightenment are spoken of as mixed with the supramundane and the mundane.

original: Suttantabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
translated: The commentary on the Suttantabhāṇavāra is ended.

original: 2. Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā🔽472. Abhidhammabhājanīye sattapi bojjhaṅge ekato pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca pāṭiyekkaṃ
analyzed: abhidhamma bhājanīye satta pi bojjhaṅge ekatas pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca pāṭiyekkam
translated: The commentary on the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra

original: pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca vasena dve nayā. Tesaṃ atthavaṇṇanā heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbā.
analyzed: pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca vasena dve nayā tesam attha vaṇṇanā heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbā
translated: In the Abhidhammabhāṇavāra the seven factors of enlightenment are asked about and answered in two methods: by asking about them all together and answering them all together, and by asking about and answering them separately. The explanation of the meaning of these should be understood in the way already stated.

original: Upekkhāsambojjhaṅganiddese pana upekkhanavasena upekkhā. Upekkhanākāro upekkhanā.
translated: In the description of the equanimity enlightenment factor, equanimity is equanimity as a state of being. Equanimity as a kind of seeing is the seeing of the state of equanimity.

original: Upekkhitabbayutte samappavatte dhamme ikkhati, na codetīti upekkhā. Puggalaṃ upekkhāpetīti
analyzed: upekkhitabba yutte sama ppavatte dhamme ikkhati na codeti iti upekkhā puggalam upekkhāpeti iti
translated: It is equanimity because it looks on, it does not censure, the states that have occurred evenly in regard to what should be looked on.🔽It is equanimity as a kind of seeing because it sees the person with equanimity.

original: upekkhanā. Bojjhaṅgabhāvappattiyā lokiyaupekkhanāya adhikā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā.
analyzed: upekkhanā bojjhaṅga bhāva ppattiyā lokiya upekkhanāya adhikā upekkhanā ajjhupekkhanā
translated: The equanimity that is the basis for the attainment of the enlightenment factor is the equanimity of looking on.

original: Abyāpārāpajjanena majjhattabhāvo majjhattatā. Sā pana cittassa, na sattassāti dīpetuṃ
analyzed: a byāpāra āpajjanena majjhatta bhāvaḥ majjhatta tā sā pana cittassa na sattassa ati dīpetum
translated: The state of being in the middle is the state of the middle. But in order to show that it is of the mind, not of a being,

original: majjhattatā cittassāti vuttanti. Ayamettha anupubbapadavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: majjhatta tā cittassa ti vuttan ti ayam ettha anupubba pada vaṇṇanā
translated: it is said to be the state of the middle of the mind. This is the word commentary.

original: Nayā panettha gaṇetabbā – sattannampi hi bojjhaṅgānaṃ ekato pucchitvā vissajjane🔽ekekamagge nayasahassaṃ nayasahassanti cattāri nayasahassāni vibhattāni. Pāṭiyekkaṃ
analyzed: nayā pana ittha gaṇetabbā sattannam pi hi bojjhaṅgānam ekatas pucchitvā vissajjane  ekeka magge naya sahassam naya sahassanti cattāri naya sahassāni vibhattāni pāṭiyekkam
translated: But here it should not be reckoned thus. For when the questions are put together and the answers are given together,🔽there are four thousand methods in each path, that is to say, a thousand methods for each of the four paths. When the questions are put separately

original: pucchitvā vissajjane ekekabojjhaṅgavasena cattāri cattārīti satta catukkā aṭṭhavīsati.
analyzed: pucchitvā vissajjane ekeka bojjhaṅga vasena cattāri cattāri iti satta catukkāḥ aṭṭhavīsati
translated: and the answers are given separately, there are four times seven, that is to say, twenty-eight,🔽making thirty-two in all with the previous four. All these

original: Tāni purimehi catūhi saddhiṃ dvattiṃsāti sabbānipi abhidhammabhājanīye dvattiṃsa🔽nayasahassāni vibhattāni kusalāneva. Yasmā pana phalakkhaṇepi bojjhaṅgā labbhanti,
analyzed: tāni purimehi catūhi saddhim dvattiṃsā ati sabbāni api abhidhamma bhājanīye dvattiṃsa  naya sahassāni vibhattāni kusalāna eva yasmā pana phala kkhaṇe pi bojjhaṅgāḥ labbhanti
translated: are given in the Abhidhamma Commentary in thirty-two thousand methods.🔽But since the enlightenment factors occur in the state of fruition too,

original: kusalahetukāni ca sāmaññaphalāni, tasmā tesupi bojjhaṅgadassanatthaṃ kusalaniddesapubbaṅgamāya🔽eva tantiyā vipākanayo āraddho. Sopi ekato pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca, pāṭiyekkaṃ
analyzed: kusala hetukāni ca sāmañña phalāni tasmā tesu pi bojjhaṅga dassana ttham kusala niddesa pubbaṅgamāya  eva tantiyā vipāka nayaḥ āraddho saḥ api ekatas pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca pāṭiyekkam
translated: and since the fruits of asceticism are due to profitable causes, therefore the method of fruition is begun with the profitable method as the precedent,

original: pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca vasena duvidho hoti. Sesamettha heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: pucchitvā vissajjanassa ca vasena duvidhaḥ hoti sesam ettha heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva veditabbam
translated: in order to show the enlightenment factors in that too. That method is twofold as that of questions put together and answers given together, and that of questions put separately and answers given separately. The rest should be understood here in the way already stated .

original: Vipāke pana kusalato tiguṇā nayā kātabbāti.
analyzed: vipāke pana kusalataḥ tiguṇā nayā kātabbā ati
translated: But in the case of the result, the method should be made three times.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the Abhidhamma basket.

original: 3. Pañhāpucchakavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañhāpucchaka vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the questions

original: 482. Pañhāpucchake pāḷianusāreneva bojjhaṅgānaṃ kusalādibhāvo veditabbo. Ārammaṇattikesu
analyzed: pañhāpucchake pāḷi anusārena iva bojjhaṅgānam kusala ādi bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ārammaṇa attikesu
translated: In the case of the questions, the profitable, etc., state of the enlightenment factors should be understood according to the text of the Abhidhamma itself.

original: pana sabbepete appamāṇaṃ nibbānaṃ ārabbha pavattito appamāṇārammaṇā eva, na maggārammaṇā.
analyzed: pana sabbe pete appamāṇam nibbānam ārabbha pavattitaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇāḥ eva na magga ārammaṇāḥ
translated: But in the case of the “questions on objects” they are all “with immeasurable object” since they occur with Nibbāna as object, which is immeasurable, and not with a path as object.

original: Sahajātahetuvasena panettha kusalā maggahetukā, vīriyaṃ vā vīmaṃsaṃ vā jeṭṭhakaṃ🔽katvā maggabhāvanākāle maggādhipatino, chandacittajeṭṭhikāya maggabhāvanāya na vattabbā
analyzed: sahajāta hetu vasena pana ittha kusalāḥ magga hetukāḥ vīriyam vā vīmaṃsam vā jeṭṭhakam  katvā magga bhāvanā kāle magga adhipatino chanda citta jeṭṭhikāya magga bhāvanāya na vattabbā
translated: Herein, those that are “with root cause” are “with root cause that is profitable and path-related” when energy or investigation is the most outstanding factor.🔽They are “with root cause that is path-related and path-predominant” when they are being developed as path.🔽But they are not “with root cause that is path-related and path-predominant” when they are being developed as fruition with zeal or consciousness as the most outstanding factor.

original: maggādhipatinoti, phalakālepi na vattabbā eva.

analyzed: pañcaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ idam te suttam akāmakassa lokuttara maggo aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ ti dīpeti  sace ettakena sallakkheti icca itam kusalam no ce sallakkheti aññāni api kāraṇāni āharitvā
translated: How can there be a five-factor path? This sutta shows the supramundane path with its eight factors to one who does not want it” .

original: saññāpetabbo. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā –
analyzed: saññāpetabbaḥ vuttam ha etam bhagavatā
translated: If he can understand it thus, that is good. If not, he should be made to understand it by bringing in other reasons. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: “Yasmiṃ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo na upalabbhati, samaṇopi
analyzed: yasmin kho subhadda dhamma vinaye ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ na upalabbhati samaṇaḥ api
translated: “Subhadda, in any doctrine and discipline where the noble eightfold path is not found there can be no true ascetic,

original: tattha na upalabbhati…pe… imasmiṃ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo
analyzed: tattha na imasmin kho subhadda dhamma vinaye ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: Herein, the Noble Eightfold Path is not found … In this Dhamma and Discipline, Subhadda, the Noble Eightfold Path is found. Herein, Subhadda, is the recluse,

original: upalabbhati; idheva, subhadda, samaṇo…pe… suññā parappavādā samaṇehi aññehīti.
analyzed: upalabbhati idha iva subhadda samaṇa upe suññā parappavādā samaṇehi aññehi iti
translated: herein is the brahmin, herein is the deva, herein is the Independent Sambuddha, herein is the Perfect Sambuddha. Other sects are empty for you, Subhadda, of recluses. Other sects are empty for you, Subhadda, of brahmins. Other sects are empty for you, Subhadda, of gods. Other sects are empty for you, Subhadda, of Independent Sambuddhas. Other sects are empty for you, Subhadda, of Perfect Sambuddhas.”

original: Aññesupi anekesu suttasatesu aṭṭhaṅgikova maggo āgato. Kathāvatthuppakaraṇepi vuttaṃ –
analyzed: aññesu pi anekesu sutta satesu aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ va maggo āgataḥ kathā vatthu ppakaraṇe pi vuttam
translated: And in many other hundreds of suttas the Noble Eightfold Path is mentioned. In the Kathāvatthu it is said:

original: “Maggānaṃ aṭṭhaṅgiko seṭṭho, saccānaṃ caturo padā;
analyzed: maggānam aṭṭhaṅgiko seṭṭhaḥ saccānam caturo padā
translated: “The eight-factored path is the best of paths, the four truths are the best of words,

original: Virāgo seṭṭho dhammānaṃ, dvipadānañca cakkhumā”ti –🔽“Attheva suttantoti”? “Āmantā”“tena hi aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo”ti. Sace pana ettakenāpi
analyzed: virāgaḥ seṭṭhaḥ dhammānam dvipadānam ca cakkhumā ti  atthā iva suttanto ti āmantā tena hi aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo ti sace pana ettakena api
translated: The fading away of lust is the best of states, the one with vision is the best of bipeds.”

original: saññattiṃ na gacchati, “gaccha, vihāraṃ pavisitvā yāguṃ pivāhī”ti uyyojetabbo. Uttarimpana
analyzed: saññattim na gacchati gaccha vihāram pavisitvā yāgum pivāhi iti uyyojetabbaḥ uttarimpana
translated: “Is there a sutta?” “There is.” “Then the eight-factored path.” But if he still does not admit it, he should be told: “Go and enter the monastery and drink rice-gruel.” But he goes on to say

original: kāraṇaṃ vakkhatīti aṭṭhānametaṃ. Sesamettha uttānatthameva.🔽Nayā panettha gaṇetabbā. Aṭṭhaṅgikamaggasmiñhi ekato pucchitvā ekato vissajjane catūsu
analyzed: kāraṇam vakkhati iti aṭṭhānam etam sesam ettha uttāna attham eva 🔽nayā pana ittha gaṇetabbā aṭṭhaṅgika maggasmin hi ekatas pucchitvā ekatas vissajjane catūsu
translated: that there is a reason for this. That is a point to be remembered. The rest is clear.

original: maggesu cattāri nayasahassāni vibhattāni. Pañcaṅgikamagge ekato pucchitvā ekato vissajjane
analyzed: maggesu cattāri naya sahassāni vibhattāni pañcaṅgika magge ekatas pucchitvā ekatas vissajjane
translated: In the Paths there are four thousand methods. In the five-factored Path, when the questions are asked all together and the answers given all together, there are four;

original: cattāri; pāṭiyekkaṃ pucchitvā pāṭiyekkaṃ vissajjane cattāri cattārīti pañcasu aṅgesu🔽vīsati. Iti purimāni aṭṭha imāni ca vīsatīti sabbānipi maggavibhaṅge aṭṭhavīsati
analyzed: cattāri pāṭiyekkam pucchitvā pāṭiyekkam vissajjane cattāri cattāri iti pañcasu aṅgesu  vīsati iti purimāni aṭṭha imāni ca vīsati iti sabbāni api magga vibhaṅge aṭṭha vīsati
translated: when the questions are asked separately and the answers given separately, there are four fours, that is, twenty, in the five factors.🔽So the first eight and these twenty make a total of twenty-eight in the exposition of the Path.

original: nayasahassāni vibhattāni. Tāni ca kho nibbattitalokuttarāni kusalāneva. Vipāke pana
analyzed: naya sahassāni vibhattāni tāni ca kho nibbattita lokuttarāni kusalāna eva vipāke pana
translated: And these are all mundane supramundane profitable only. But in the case of the fruition attainment

original: kusalato tiguṇā nayā kātabbāti.
analyzed: kusalataḥ tiguṇā nayā kātabbā ati
translated: the methods should be made three times as many as the profitable ones.

original: Abhidhammabhājanīyavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: abhidhammabhājanīya vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Requisites of the Abhidhamma is ended.

original: 3. Pañhāpucchakavaṇṇanā
analyzed: pañhāpucchaka vaṇṇanā
translated: The Description of the Questions and Answers

original: 504. Pañhāpucchake pāḷianusāreneva maggaṅgānaṃ kusalādibhāvo veditabbo. Ārammaṇattikesu
analyzed: pañhāpucchake pāḷi anusārena iva maggaṅgānam kusala ādi bhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ ārammaṇa attikesu
translated: In the Questions and Answers the method of the profitable and so on of the path factors should be understood according to the text.🔽But in the case of the questions on object

original: pana sabbānipetāni appamāṇaṃ nibbānaṃ ārabbha pavattito appamāṇārammaṇāneva, na maggārammaṇāni.
analyzed: pana sabbānipetāni appamāṇam nibbānam ārabbha pavattitaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇāni eva na magga ārammaṇāni
translated: all these are only of immeasurable object since they occur with reference to the immeasurable Nibbāna, not with reference to the path.

original: Neva hi maggo na phalaṃ maggaṃ ārammaṇaṃ karoti. Sahajātahetuvasena panettha kusalāni
analyzed: na iva hi maggaḥ na phalam maggam ārammaṇam karoti sahajāta hetu vasena pana ittha kusalāni
translated: For neither the path nor the fruition makes the path its object. But here the profitable

original: maggahetukāni; vīriyaṃ vā vīmaṃsaṃ vā jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā maggabhāvanākāle maggādhipatīni;
analyzed: magga hetukāni vīriyam vā vīmaṃsam vā jeṭṭhakam katvā magga bhāvanā kāle magga adhipatīni
translated: and they are roots of the path. When he is developing the path, they are predominants of the path, making either energy or investigation the chief factor.

original: chandacittajeṭṭhikāya maggabhāvanāya na vattabbāni maggādhipatīnīti; phalakālepi na vattabbāneva.
analyzed: chanda citta jeṭṭhikāya magga bhāvanāya na vattabbāni magga adhipatīni iti phala kāle pi na vattabbāni eva
translated: But they cannot be called predominants of the path when he is developing the path with faith or cognizance as the chief factor. And they cannot be called predominants of the path even at the time of fruition.

original: Atītādīsu ekārammaṇabhāvenapi na vattabbāni; nibbānassa pana bahiddhādhammattā bahiddhārammaṇāni
analyzed: atīta ādīsu eka ārammaṇa bhāvena api na vattabbāni nibbānassa pana bahiddhā dhamma ttā bahiddhā ārammaṇāni
translated: Nor can they be called internal or external since they have a single object in the past, future, and present. But they are external since Nibbāna is an external idea.

original: nāma hontīti evametasmiṃ pañhāpucchakepi nibbattitalokuttarāneva maggaṅgāni kathitāni.🔽Sammāsambuddhena hi suttantabhājanīyasmiṃyeva lokiyalokuttarāni maggaṅgāni kathitāni;
analyzed: nāma honti iti evam etasmin pañhāpucchake pi maggaṅgāni kathitāni  sammāsambuddhena hi suttanta bhājanīyasmin yeva lokiya lokuttarāni maggaṅgāni kathitāni
translated: So in this question-and-answer section too only the supramundane path factors are dealt with.🔽For the supramundane and mundane path factors are dealt with in the Suttas, which are the vessel for the Suttas,

original: abhidhammabhājanīye pana pañhāpucchake ca lokuttarānevāti evamayaṃ maggavibhaṅgopi🔽teparivaṭṭaṃ nīharitvāva bhājetvā dassitoti.
analyzed: abhidhamma bhājanīye pana pañhāpucchake ca evam ayam magga vibhaṅgaḥ api  nīharitvā ava bhājetvā dassitoti
translated: but only the supramundane ones in the Abhidhamma, which is the vessel for the Abhidhamma, and in the question-and-answer section.

original: Sammohavinodaniyā vibhaṅgaṭṭhakathāya
analyzed: sammoha vinodaniyā vibhaṅga ṭṭhakathāya
translated: So this exposition of the path has been given by taking the three rounds and the three characteristics and omitting the rest.

original: Maggaṅgavibhaṅgavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽12. Jhānavibhaṅgo
analyzed: maggaṅga vibhaṅga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  jhāna vibhaṅgo
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the path factors is ended.🔽The exposition of the jhānas

original: 1. Suttantabhājanīyaṃ
analyzed: suttanta bhājanīyam
translated: The sutta-vessel

original: Mātikāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: mātikā vaṇṇanā
translated: The exposition of the mātikā

original: 508. Idāni tadanantare jhānavibhaṅge yā tāva ayaṃ sakalassāpi suttantabhājanīyassa🔽paṭhamaṃ mātikā ṭhapitā, tattha idhāti vacanaṃ pubbabhāgakaraṇīyasampadāya sampannassa🔽sabbappakārajjhānanibbattakassa puggalassa sannissayabhūtasāsanaparidīpanaṃ, aññasāsanassa
analyzed: idāni tad anantare jhāna vibhaṅge yā tāva ayam sakalassa api suttanta bhājanīyassa  paṭhamam mātikā ṭhapitā tattha idha iti vacanam pubba bhāga karaṇīya sampadāya sampannassa  sabba ppakāra jjhāna nibbattakassa puggalassa sannissaya bhūta sāsana paridīpanam añña sāsanassa
translated: Now, in the following jhāna-vibhaṅga, the mātikā that was set out first is the whole of the sutta-bhāṇavāra.

original: ca tathābhāvapaṭisedhanaṃ. Vuttañhetaṃ – “idheva, bhikkhave, samaṇo…pe… suññā parappavādā
analyzed: ca tathābhāva paṭisedhanam vuttam ha etam idha iva bhikkhave samaṇope suññā parappavādā
translated: Herein, the word “here” is a designation for the Dispensation, which is the support for the person who has completed the equipment that is to be done beforehand and who is a producer of all kinds of jhāna. It is a refutation of the fact that any other Dispensation is such. For this is said: “Here, bhikkhus, is the ascetic, here is the holy life. Other sects are empty for me” .

original: samaṇehi aññehī”ti. Bhikkhūti tesaṃ jhānānaṃ nibbattakapuggalaparidīpanaṃ. Pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutoti
analyzed: samaṇehi aññehi iti bhikkhu iti tesam jhānānam nibbattaka puggala paridīpanam pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto ti
translated: “Bhikkhu”: this is a designation for the person who produces those jhānas.

original: idamassa pātimokkhasaṃvare patiṭṭhitabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Viharatīti idamassa tadanurūpavihārasamaṅgībhāvaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: idam assa pātimokkha saṃvare patiṭṭhita bhāva paridīpanam viharati iti idam assa tad anurūpa vihāra samaṅgībhāva paridīpanam
translated: “Restrained with the Pātimokkha restraint”: this is a designation for his being established in the Pātimokkha restraint.🔽“Lives” : this is a designation for his being furnished with a way of life in conformity therewith.

original: Ācāragocarasampannoti idamassa heṭṭhā pātimokkhasaṃvarassa upari jhānānuyogassa ca
analyzed: ācāra gocara sampanno ti idam assa heṭṭhā pātimokkha saṃvarassa upari jhāna anuyogassa ca
translated: “Possessing good conduct and resort”: this is a designation for his being furnished with the equipment of virtue that is the proximate cause for the jhāna- attainment.

original: upakāradhammaparidīpanaṃ. Aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvīti idamassa pātimokkhato🔽acavanadhammatāparidīpanaṃ. Samādāyāti idamassa sikkhāpadānaṃ anavasesato ādānaparidīpanaṃ.🔽Sikkhatīti idamassa sikkhāya samaṅgībhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Sikkhāpadesūti idamassa sikkhitabbadhammaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: upakāra dhamma paridīpanam aṇumattesu vajjesu idam assa pātimokkhato  a cavana dhamma tā paridīpanam samādāya ati idam assa sikkhāpadānam anavasesataḥ ādāna paridīpanam  sikkhati iti idam assa sikkhāya samaṅgībhāva paridīpanam sikkhā padesu iti idam assa sikkhitabba dhamma paridīpanam
translated: This is the explanation of the profitable idea. “ Seeing fear in the slightest fault”: this is the explanation of his not overstepping the bounds of the Pātimokkha.🔽“ Having undertaken” : this is the explanation of his taking up the training rules without exception.

original: Indriyesūti idamassa guttadvāratāya bhūmiparidīpanaṃ; rakkhitabbokāsaparidīpanantipi
analyzed: indriyesu iti idam assa gutta dvāra tāya bhūmi paridīpanam rakkhitabba ukāsa paridīpanam ti pi
translated: “ He trains” : this is the explanation of his being furnished with the training. “ In the training rules” : this is the explanation of the idea to be trained in.

original: vadanti eva. Guttadvāroti idamassa chasu dvāresu saṃvihitārakkhabhāvaparidīpanaṃ.🔽Bhojane mattaññūti idamassa santosādiguṇaparidīpanaṃ. Pubbarattāpararattaṃ jāgariyānuyogamanuyuttoti
analyzed: vadanti eva idam assa chasu dvāresu saṃvihita ārakkha bhāva paridīpanam  bhojane idam assa santosa ādi guṇa paridīpanam pubba ratta apara rattam jāgariya anuyogam anuyuttaḥ ti
translated: “ In the faculties” : this is the explanation of the ground for the guardedness of the doors of the sense faculties. They also say that it is the explanation of the guardedness of the openings.🔽“ Guarded in the faculties” : this is the explanation of his being one who has placed guarding at the doors of the six sense faculties.🔽“ Moderate in eating” : this is the explanation of his possessing the qualities of contentment and so on.

original: idamassa kāraṇabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Sātaccaṃ nepakkanti idamassa paññāpariggahitena
analyzed: idam assa kāraṇa bhāva paridīpanam sātaccam nepakkam ti idam assa paññā pariggahitena
translated: “ Devoting himself to wakefulness, ever zealous” : this is the explanation of his being a cause. “ Steadfast, ardent” : this is the explanation of his being furnished with understanding.

original: vīriyena sātaccakāritāparidīpanaṃ. Bodhipakkhikānaṃ dhammānaṃ bhāvanānuyogamanuyuttoti
analyzed: vīriyena sātacca kāri tā paridīpanam bodhi pakkhikānam dhammānam bhāvanā anuyogam anuyuttaḥ ti
translated: He is devoted to wakefulness in the higher virtue, etc.,

original: idamassa paṭipattiyā nibbedhabhāgiyattaparidīpanaṃ.
analyzed: idam assa paṭipattiyā nibbedha bhāgiya tta paridīpanaṃ
translated: this shows the state of being devoted to the practice that is conducive to penetration.🔽He is one who acts with clear comprehension in all situations,🔽this shows the state of being endowed with mindfulness and clear comprehension in all activities.

original: So abhikkante…pe… tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī hotīti idamassa sabbattha satisampajaññasamannāgatattaparidīpanaṃ.🔽So vivittaṃ senāsanaṃ bhajatīti idamassa anurūpasenāsanapariggahaparidīpanaṃ. Araññaṃ…pe…
analyzed: saḥ abhikkanta īpe tuṇhībhāve sampajāna kārī hoti iti idam assa sabbattha sati sampajañña samannāgata tta paridīpanaṃ  saḥ vivittam senāsanam bhajati iti idam assa anurūpa senāsana pariggaha paridīpanam
translated: He frequents a secluded lodging,🔽this shows the state of being furnished with a suitable lodging. A lodging in the forest, etc.,

original: paṭisallānasāruppanti idamassa senāsanappabhedanirādīnavatānisaṃsaparidīpanaṃ. So
analyzed: paṭisallāna sāruppam ti idam assa senāsana ppabheda nirādīnava tā nisaṃsa paridīpanam so
translated: is suitable for the development of concentration. This shows the different kinds of lodging and the disadvantages and benefits in this matter.🔽He, having gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty place,

original: araññagato vāti idamassa vuttappakārena senāsanena yuttabhāvaparidīpanaṃ. Nisīdatīti🔽idamassa yogānurūpairiyāpathaparidīpanaṃ. Parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvāti idamassa
analyzed: arañña gataḥ vā ti idam assa vutta ppakārena senāsanena yutta bhāva paridīpanam nisīdati iti  idam assa yoga anurūpa eriyāpatha paridīpanam parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā ati idam assa
translated: this shows the state of being furnished with the lodging of the kind already described. He sits down, having folded his legs crosswise,🔽this shows the posture suitable for the practice. Having set his body erect,🔽this shows the state of being furnished with the right direction for the practice. Having established mindfulness in front of him,

original: yogārambhaparidīpanaṃ. So abhijjhaṃ loke pahāyātiādi panassa kammaṭṭhānānuyogena
analyzed: yoga ārambha paridīpanam so abhijjham loke pahāya ati ādi panassa kammaṭṭhāna anuyogena
translated: this shows the state of being furnished with the right object for the practice. Having given up desire for the world,🔽this shows the state of being furnished with the right aspiration for the practice.

original: nīvaraṇappahānaparidīpanaṃ. Tasseva pahīnanīvaraṇassa vivicceva kāmehītiādi paṭipāṭiyā
analyzed: nīvaraṇa pahāna paridīpanam tassa iva pahīna nīvaraṇassa vivicca iva kāmehi itiādi paṭipāṭiyā
translated: The words “having thus abandoned these five hindrances” show the abandoning of the hindrances.

original: jhānuppattiparidīpanaṃ.
translated: The words “quite secluded from sense desires, secluded from unwholesome things” show the attainment of jhāna in order.

original: Api ca idha bhikkhūti imasmiṃ sāsane jhānuppādako bhikkhu. Idāni yasmā jhānuppādakena🔽bhikkhunā cattāri sīlāni sodhetabbāni, tasmāssa pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvutoti iminā
analyzed: api ca idha bhikkhu iti imasmin sāsane jhāna uppādakaḥ bhikkhu idāni yasmā jhāna uppādakena  bhikkhunā cattāri sīlāni sodhetabbāni tasmā assa pātimokkha saṃvara saṃvuto ti iminā
translated: Moreover, here the words “a bhikkhu” are said of a bhikkhu who has aroused jhāna in the Dispensation.🔽Now, since the bhikkhu who has aroused jhāna should purify the four kinds of moral discipline, the Blessed One teaches him purification in the first instance as the moral discipline of the Pātimokkha with the words “possessed of moral discipline through the restraint of the Pātimokkha.”

original: pātimokkhasaṃvarasīlavisuddhiṃ upadisati. Ācāragocarasampannotiādinā ājīvapārisuddhisīlaṃ.
analyzed: pātimokkha saṃvara sīla visuddhim upadisati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ ti ādinā ājīva pārisuddhi sīlam
translated: With the words “perfect in observance” he teaches him the moral discipline consisting in observance of the right course.

original: Samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesūti iminā tesaṃ dvinnaṃ sīlānaṃ anavasesato ādānaṃ.
analyzed: samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu iti iminā tesam dvinnam sīlānam anavasesataḥ ādānam
translated: With the words “having undertaken the training rules” he teaches him the undertaking of the two kinds of moral discipline without exception.

original: Indriyesu guttadvāroti iminā indriyasaṃvarasīlaṃ. Bhojane mattaññūti iminā paccayasannissitasīlaṃ.
analyzed: indriyesu iminā indriya saṃvara sīlam bhojane iminā paccaya sannissita sīlam
translated: With the words “guarded in the doors of the sense faculties” he teaches him the moral discipline consisting in restraint of the sense faculties. With the words “moderate in eating” he teaches him the moral discipline consisting in choice of resort.

original: Pubbarattāpararattantiādinā sīle patiṭṭhitassa jhānabhāvanāya upakārake dhamme. So
analyzed: pubbaratta apararatta nti ādinā sīle patiṭṭhitassa jhāna bhāvanāya upakārake dhamme so
translated: With the words “devoted to wakefulness” he teaches him the states that are helpful to the development of jhāna by one who is established in moral discipline.

original: abhikkantetiādinā tesaṃ dhammānaṃ aparihānāya kammaṭṭhānassa ca asammosāya satisampajaññasamāyogaṃ.🔽So vivittantiādinā bhāvanānurūpasenāsanapariggahaṃ. So araññagato vātiādinā taṃ senāsanaṃ
analyzed: abhikkanta iti ādinā tesam dhammānam a parihānāya kammaṭṭhānassa ca asammosāya sati sampajañña samāyogam  so vivitta ntiādinā bhāvanā anurūpa senāsana pariggaham saḥ arañña gataḥ vā ti ādinā tam senāsanam
translated: and the words “on going out” and so on refer to the combination of mindfulness and full awareness for the purpose of not losing those ideas and not forgetting the meditation subject.🔽The words “he should go to a secluded resting place” and so on refer to the choice of a lodging suitable for development of meditation.

analyzed: bhikkhuniddese samaññāya āti paññattiyā vohārena ati attho samaññāya eva hi ekacco  bhikkhū iti paññāyati tathā hi nimantana ādimhi bhikkhūsu gaṇīyamānesu sāmaṇere api gahetvā  satam bhikkhū sahassam bhikkhū iti vadanti paṭiññāya ati attanaḥ paṭijānanena  hi ekaccaḥ bhikkhu iti paññāyati tassa kaḥ ettha āvuso ti aham āvuso bhikkhu iti
