analyzed: paṭhama jhānataḥ vuṭṭhitam dutiya jhāna adhigama tthāya tudanti codenti tassa upari  dutiya jhāna anupakkhandānam saññā manasikārānam vasena sā paṭhama jhāna paññā visesa bhūtassa
translated: When he has emerged from the first jhāna, they urge and impel him to attain the second jhāna.🔽The understanding of the first jhāna is called “associated with change of lineage” because it is the cause for the arising of the second jhāna, which is a different “lineage” from the first jhāna.

original: dutiyajjhānassa uppattiṭṭhānatāya visesabhāginīti vuttā. Nibbidāsahagatāti tameva🔽paṭhamajjhānato vuṭṭhitaṃ nibbidāsaṅkhātena vipassanāñāṇena sahagatā. Vipassanāñāṇañhi
analyzed: dutiya jhānassa uppatti ṭṭhāna tāya visesa bhāginī iti vuttā nibbidā sahagatā ati tam eva  paṭhama jhānataḥ vuṭṭhitam nibbidā saṅkhātena vipassanā ñāṇena sahagatā vipassanā ñāṇam hi
translated: When he has emerged from the first jhāna, they urge and impel him to attain the second jhāna by means of the associated perception and attention.🔽“Associated with dispassion” means associated with the knowledge of insight called “dispassion” .

original: jhānaṅgabhede vattante nibbindati ukkaṇṭhati, tasmā nibbidāti vuccati. Samudācarantīti
analyzed: jhāna aṅga bhede vattante nibbindati ukkaṇṭhati tasmā nibbidā ati vuccati samudācaranti iti
translated: For the knowledge of insight is called “dispassion” because it occurs as “dispassion” in the sense of “dispassionateness” when the jhāna factors are being distinguished.🔽“Occurring in turns” means urging and impelling for the purpose of realizing Nibbāna.

original: nibbānasacchikiriyatthāya tudanti codenti. Virāgūpasañhitāti virāgasaṅkhātena nibbānena
analyzed: nibbāna sacchikiriya tthāya tudanti codenti virāgu upasañhitā ati virāga saṅkhātena nibbānena
translated: “Associated with fading away” means associated with the Nibbāna called “fading away” .

original: upasaṃhitā. Vipassanāñāṇamhi sakkā iminā maggena virāgaṃ nibbānaṃ sacchikātunti pavattito
analyzed: upasaṃhitā vipassanā ñāṇamhi sakkā iminā maggena virāgam nibbānam sacchikātun ti pavattito
translated: For the knowledge of insight is called “associated with fading away” because it occurs with the thought “By this path the fading away of lust can be realized.”

original: “virāgūpasañhita”nti vuccati. Taṃsampayuttā saññāmanasikārāpi virāgūpasañhitā eva
analyzed: virāga upasañhitanti vuccati tad sampayuttā saññā manasikārā api virāga upasañhitā eva
translated: The associated perception and attention are also “associated with fading away.”

original: nāma. Tassa tesaṃ saññāmanasikārānaṃ vasena sā paṭhamajjhānapaññā ariyamaggapaṭivedhassa🔽padaṭṭhānatāya nibbedhabhāginīti vuttā. Evaṃ catūsu ṭhānesu paṭhamajjhānapaññāva
analyzed: nāma tassa tesam saññā manasikārānam vasena sā paṭhamajjhāna paññā ariya magga paṭivedhassa  padaṭṭhāna tāya nibbedha bhāginī iti vuttā evam catūsu ṭhānesu paṭhama jhāna paññā ava
translated: The first-jhāna understanding is called “conducive to penetration” because it is the footing for the penetration of the noble path by means of the exercise of these kinds of perception.🔽So it is the first-jhāna understanding in these four instances that is called “conducive to penetration.”🔽

original: kathitā. Dutiyajjhānapaññādīsupi imināva nayena attho veditabbo.🔽801. Kicchena kasirena samādhiṃ uppādentassāti lokuttarasamādhiṃ uppādentassa pubbabhāge
analyzed: kathitā dutiya jhāna paññā ādīsu pi iminā ava nayena atthaḥ veditabbo  kicchena kasirena samādhim uppādentassa ati lokuttara samādhim uppādentassa pubba bhāge
translated: The first jhāna’s understanding is called “conducive to penetration” because it is the proximate cause for the penetration of the noble path. Thus the first jhāna’s understanding is mentioned in four places. The meaning should be understood in the same way in the case of the second jhāna’s understanding, etc.

original: āgamanakāle kicchena kasirena dukkhena sasaṅkhārena sappayogena kilamantassa kilese🔽vikkhambhetvā āgatassa. Dandhaṃ taṇṭhānaṃ abhijānantassāti vikkhambhitesu kilesesu
analyzed: āgamana kāle kicchena kasirena dukkhena sa saṅkhārena sa payogena kilamantassa kilese  vikkhambhetvā āgatassa dandham taṇṭhānam abhijānantassa ati vikkhambhitesu kilesesu
translated: “For one who attains concentration with difficulty and slowly”: for one who attains the supramundane concentration in the earlier stage, who comes to it with difficulty, slowly, laboriously, painfully, with effort and with prompting, after overcoming defilements.

original: vipassanāparivāse ciraṃ vasitvā taṃ lokuttarasamādhisaṅkhātaṃ ṭhānaṃ dandhaṃ saṇikaṃ
analyzed: vipassanā parivāse ciram vasitvā tam lokuttara samādhi saṅkhātam ṭhānam dandham saṇikam
translated: “Who understands slowly the state of stillness”: after the defilements have been overcome, he dwells for a long time in the state of stillness called supramundane concentration, surrounded by insight. He understands it slowly, penetrates it slowly; the meaning is, he reaches it slowly.

original: abhijānantassa paṭivijjhantassa, pāpuṇantassāti attho. Ayaṃ vuccatīti yā esā evaṃ
analyzed: abhijānantassa paṭivijjhantassa pāpuṇantassa ati atthaḥ ayam vuccati iti yā esā evam
translated: “This is called the first”: this kind of understanding of the first jhāna is called the first noble person.

original: uppajjati, ayaṃ kilesavikkhambhanapaṭipadāya dukkhattā, vipassanāparivāsapaññāya
analyzed: uppajjati ayam kilesa vikkhambhana paṭipadāya dukkhattā vipassanā parivāsa paññāya
translated: It is called the painful-slow path because of the slowness of the insight that occurs in a single moment at the time of the path owing to the slowness of the understanding that is the condition for insight and to the slowness of the path owing to the slowness of the insight.

original: ca dandhattā maggakāle ekacittakkhaṇe uppannāpi paññā āgamanavasena dukkhapaṭipadā
analyzed: ca dandha ttā magga kāle eka citta kkhaṇe uppannā api paññā āgamana vasena dukkha paṭipadā
translated: And the understanding that occurs in a single moment at the time of the path is called the painful-slow path because of the slowness of the arrival of the path, which is due to the slowness of the understanding that is the condition for insight.

original: dandhābhiññā nāmāti vuccati. Upari tīsu padesupi imināva nayena attho veditabbo.🔽802. Samādhissa na nikāmalābhissāti yo samādhissa na nikāmalābhī hoti, so tassa na
analyzed: dandhābhiññā nāma ati vuccati upari tīsu padesu pi iminā ava nayena atthaḥ veditabbo  samādhissa na nikāma lābhissa ati yaḥ samādhissa na nikāma lābhī hoti saḥ tassa na
translated: The meaning should be understood in the same way in the case of the other three terms.

original: nikāmalābhī nāma. Yassa samādhi uparūpari samāpajjanatthāya ussakkituṃ paccayo na🔽hoti, tassa appaguṇajjhānalābhissāti attho. Ārammaṇaṃ thokaṃ pharantassāti paritte🔽suppamatte vā sarāvamatte vā ārammaṇe parikammaṃ katvā tattheva appanaṃ patvā taṃ
analyzed: nikāma lābhī nāma yassa samādhi upari upari samāpajjana tthāya ussakkitum paccayaḥ na  hoti tassa appaguṇa jjhāna lābhissa ati attho ārammaṇam thokam pharantassa ati paritte  suppamatte vā sarāva matte vā ārammaṇe parikammam katvā tattha iva appanam patvā tam
translated: “Not readily attainable” : one who is not readily attainable is called “not readily attainable.” He is one who is not a condition for the attainment of jhāna higher up. The meaning is, one who has attained only a small amount of jhāna.🔽“When he extends his mind” : having done the preliminary work on a limited object, the size of a span, or the size of a hand, and so on, and attained absorption there, he extends his mind and develops it with that same limited object.

original: avaḍḍhitaṃ thokameva ārammaṇaṃ pharantassāti attho. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Nanikāmalābhīpaṭipakkhato
analyzed: avaḍḍhitam thokam eva ārammaṇam pharantassa ati attho sesa padesu pi esa iva nayaḥ na ni kāma lābhī paṭipakkhato
translated: The same method of explanation applies in the other three cases.🔽“Not readily attainable” is the opposite of “readily attainable.”

original: hi paguṇajjhānalābhī ettha nikāmalābhīti vutto. Avaḍḍhitārammaṇapaṭipakkhato ca vaḍḍhitārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: hi paguṇa jhāna lābhī ettha nikāma lābhī iti vuttaḥ avaḍḍhita ārammaṇa paṭipakkhato ca vaḍḍhita ārammaṇam
translated: And the object of the jhāna that has a measure is said to be “limited” in the sense of being opposed to the object of the jhāna that has no measure.

original: vipulanti vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ tādisameva.
analyzed: vipulanti vuttam sesam tādisam eva
translated: The rest is as already stated.

original: Jarāmaraṇepetaṃ ñāṇanti nibbānameva ārammaṇaṃ katvā catunnaṃ saccānaṃ ekapaṭivedhavasena etaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ñāṇam ti nibbānam eva ārammaṇam katvā catunnam saccānam eka paṭivedha vasena etam vuttam
translated: “This knowledge is about ageing-and-death”: this is said with reference to the penetration of the four truths in a single moment, making Nibbāna itself the object.

original: Jarāmaraṇaṃ ārabbhātiādīni pana ekekaṃ vatthuṃ ārabbha pavattikāle pubbabhāge saccavavatthāpanavasena vuttāni. Sesaṃ sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.
analyzed: jarā maraṇam ārabbha ati ādīni pana ekekam vatthum ārabbha pavatti kāle pubba bhāge sacca vavatthāpana vasena vuttāni sesam sabbattha uttānattham eva ati
translated: But “with ageing-and-death as the ground” and so on are said with reference to the prior determination of the truths at the time of their occurrence with each of the grounds respectively. The rest is evident in all cases.

original: Catukkaniddesavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: catukka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the fourfold reckoning is ended.

original: (5.) Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā🔽804. Pañcavidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese pītipharaṇatādīsu pītiṃ pharamānā uppajjatīti🔽dvīsu jhānesu paññā pītipharaṇatā nāma. Sukhaṃ pharamānā uppajjatīti tīsu jhānesu
analyzed: dvīsu jhānesu paññā pīti pharaṇa tā nāma sukham pharamānā uppajjati iti tīsu jhānesu
translated: The description of the fivefold reckoning🔽In the description of the five kinds of knowledge by way of object, in the case of the two kinds of knowledge called “the extension of happiness” and “the extension of bliss,” the knowledge in the two jhānas is called “the extension of happiness” because it arises extending happiness.🔽The knowledge in the three jhānas is called “the extension of bliss” because it arises extending bliss.

original: paññā sukhapharaṇatā nāma. Paresaṃ cetopharamānā uppajjatīti cetopariyapaññā cetopharaṇatā
analyzed: paññā sukha pharaṇa tā nāma paresam cetaḥ pharamānā uppajjati iti cetaḥ pariya paññā cetaḥ pharaṇa tā
translated: The knowledge in the four jhānas is called “the extension of unification” because it arises extending unification.🔽The knowledge in the four jhānas is called “the extension of unification” because it arises extending unification. The knowledge in the four jhānas is called “the extension of unification” because it arises extending unification.

original: nāma. Ālokaṃ pharamānā uppajjatīti dibbacakkhupaññā ālokapharaṇatā nāma. Paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ
analyzed: nāma ālokam pharamānā uppajjati iti dibba cakkhu paññā āloka pharaṇa tā nāma paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam
translated: “Light-radiantness” is the knowledge of the divine eye.🔽The sign of reviewing is the reviewing knowledge.

original: paccavekkhaṇānimittaṃ nāma. Teneva vuttaṃ “dvīsu jhānesu paññā pītipharaṇatā”tiādi.
analyzed: paccavekkhaṇā nimittam nāma tena iva vuttam dvīsu jhānesu paññā pīti pharaṇa tā tiādi
translated: Hence it is said: “Understanding in the two jhānas is the radiantness of happiness” , and so on.

original: Tattha ca pītipharaṇatā sukhapharaṇatā dve pādā viya, cetopharaṇatā ālokapharaṇatā
analyzed: tattha ca pīti pharaṇa tā sukha pharaṇa tā dve pādāḥ cetaḥ pharaṇa tā āloka pharaṇa tā
translated: Herein, the radiantness of happiness and the radiantness of bliss are like the two feet, and the radiantness of cognizance and the radiantness of light are like the two hands,

original: dve hatthā viya, abhiññāpādakajjhānaṃ majjhimakāyo viya, paccavekkhaṇānimittaṃ sīsaṃ🔽viya. Iti bhagavā pañcaṅgikaṃ sammāsamādhiṃ aṅgapaccaṅgasampannaṃ purisaṃ viya katvā🔽dassesi. Ayaṃ pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhīti ayaṃ hatthapādasīsasadisehi pañcahi aṅgehi
analyzed: dve hatthāḥ viya abhiññā pādaka jjhānam majjhima kāyaḥ viya paccavekkhaṇā nimittam sīsam  viya iti bhagavā pañcaṅgikam sammāsamādhim aṅga paccaṅga sampannam purisam viya katvā  dassesi ayam pañcaṅgiko sammāsamādhi iti ayam hattha pāda sīsa sadisehi pañcahi aṅgehi
translated: and the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge is like the middle of the body, and the sign of reviewing is like the head.🔽So the Blessed One has shown the right concentration with five factors like a man with his limbs.🔽“This right concentration with five factors”: this concentration with five factors consisting of the right view, etc.,

original: yutto sammāsamādhīti pādakajjhānasamādhiṃ kathesi.
analyzed: yuttaḥ sammāsamādhi iti pādaka jhāna samādhim kathesi
translated: which is called “right concentration” because it is accompanied by the five factors consisting of the right view, etc., like a man with his hands and feet, etc., is concentration consisting in the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge.

original: Ayaṃ samādhi paccuppannasukho cevātiādīsu arahattaphalasamādhi adhippeto. So hi appitappitakkhaṇe
analyzed: ayam samādhi paccuppanna sukho ca iva ati ādīsu arahatta phala samādhi adhippeto saḥ hi appita ppita kkhaṇe
translated: “This concentration is pleasant now and in the future” , etc.: the concentration intended here is that of the fruition attainment of Arahantship. For that is the most excellent of all kinds of concentration.

original: sukhattā paccuppannasukho. Purimo purimo pacchimassa pacchimassa samādhisukhassa
analyzed: sukhattā paccuppanna sukho purimo purimo pacchimassa pacchimassa samādhi sukhassa
translated: It is pleasant now because of the pleasure of the jhāna itself. It is productive of pleasantness in the future because it is a condition for the pleasure of the successive jhāna. It generates a pleasant visible-data object, etc., that is peaceful and sublime, and a pleasant heart-deliverance that is the ultimate fruit.

original: paccayattā āyatiṃ sukhavipāko. Santaṃ sukhumaṃ phalacittaṃ paṇītaṃ madhurarūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti.🔽Phalasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhitassa hi sabbakāyānugataṃ sukhasamphassaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: paccayattā āyatim sukha vipākaḥ santam sukhumam phala cittam paṇītam madhura rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti  phala samāpattiyā vuṭṭhitassa hi sabba kāya anugatam sukha samphassam phoṭṭhabbam paṭicca
translated: For when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.🔽And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.

original: sukhasahagataṃ kāyaviññāṇaṃ uppajjati. Imināpi pariyāyena āyatiṃ sukhavipāko. Kilesehi🔽ārakattā ariyo. Kāmāmisavaṭṭāmisalokāmisānaṃ abhāvā nirāmiso. Buddhādīhi mahāpurisehi🔽sevitattā akāpurisasevito. Aṅgasantatāya ārammaṇasantatāya sabbakilesadarathasantatāya
analyzed: sukha sahagatam kāya viññāṇam uppajjati iminā api pariyāyena āyatim sukha vipākaḥ kilesehi  ārakattā ariyaḥ kāma āmisa vaṭṭa āmisa loka āmisānaṃ abhāvā nirāmisaḥ buddha ādīhi mahāpurisehi  sevitattā a kāpurisa sevitaḥ aṅga santatāya ārammaṇa santatāya sabba kilesa daratha santatāya
translated: And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.🔽And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.🔽And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.

original: ca santo. Atappanīyaṭṭhena paṇīto. Kilesapaṭippassaddhiyā laddhattā kilesapaṭippassaddhibhāvassa
analyzed: ca santo a tappanīya ṭṭhena paṇīto kilesa paṭippassaddhiyā laddha ttā kilesa paṭippassaddhi bhāvassa
translated: And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there arises in him, contingent upon the pleasant object consisting in the jhāna, which is a special quality of the path, and which is the cause for the appearance of the heart-deliverance, a pleasant bodily feeling that is the counterpart of that pleasant object, and it pervades his whole body.🔽And when he emerges from the fruition attainment, there

original: vā laddhattā paṭippassaddhiladdho. Paṭippassaddhaṃ paṭippassaddhīti hi idaṃ atthato
analyzed: vā laddhattā paṭippassaddhi laddhaḥ paṭippassaddham paṭippassaddhi iti hi idam atthataḥ
translated: and it is called “attained to serenity” because it is attained by one whose defilements are serene. For “serene” and “attained to serenity” are one in meaning but different in the letter.

original: ekaṃ. Paṭippassaddhakilesena vā arahatā laddhattāpi paṭippassaddhiladdho. Ekodibhāvena🔽adhigatattā ekodibhāvameva vā adhigatattā ekodibhāvādhigato. Appaguṇasāsavasamādhi🔽viya sasaṅkhārena sappayogena cittena paccanīkadhamme niggayha kilese vāretvā anadhigatattā
analyzed: ekam paṭippassaddha kilesena vā arahatā laddha ttā api paṭippassaddhi laddhaḥ eka udi bhāvena  adhigata ttā ekodi bhāvam eva vā adhigata ttā ekodi bhāva adhigataḥ appaguṇa sa āsava samādhi  sa saṅkhārena sa payogena cittena paccanīka dhamme niggayha kilese vāretvā anadhigata ttā
translated: Or alternatively, it is called “attained to serenity” because it is attained by an Arahant whose defilements are serene.🔽It is called “unification of mind attained by keeping in being” because it is attained by keeping in being in the way stated.🔽Or alternatively, it is called “unification of mind attained by keeping in being” because it is attained by keeping in being in the way stated.

original: na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato. Tañca samādhiṃ samāpajjanto tato vā vuṭṭhahanto
analyzed: na sa saṅkhāra niggayha vārita gataḥ tam ca samādhim samāpajjantaḥ tatas vā vuṭṭhahantaḥ
translated: It is called “unification of mind not obtained by surmounting” because it is not obtained by surmounting, by setting aside, the defilements by means of a consciousness accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, as is the case with the first jhāna, and by means of a formless-world consciousness, as is the case with the noble path.

original: sativepullappattattā satova samāpajjati satova vuṭṭhahati. Yathāparicchinnakālavasena🔽vā sato samāpajjati sato vuṭṭhahati. Tasmā yadettha “ayaṃ samādhi paccuppannasukho
analyzed: sati vepulla ppatta ttā sataḥ iva samāpajjati sataḥ iva vuṭṭhahati yathā paricchinna kāla vasena  vā sataḥ samāpajjati sataḥ vuṭṭhahati tasmā yat ettha ayam samādhi paccuppanna sukho
translated: It is called “unification of mind entered upon and possessed” because it is entered upon and possessed by one who has attained it.🔽And when he attains that jhāna and emerges from it, he recollects its state of being blissful by mental deliverance, and so it is called “recollected as blissful.”🔽Or alternatively, it is called “recollected as blissful” because it is recollected as blissful by one who has attained it and emerged from it.

original: ceva āyatiñca sukhavipāko”ti evaṃ paccavekkhamānassa paccattaṃyeva aparappaccayaṃ
analyzed: ca iva āyatim ca sukha vipāko ti evam paccavekkhamānassa paccattam yeva aparappaccayam
translated: Or alternatively, it is called “recollected as blissful” because it is recollected as blissful by one who has attained it and emerged from it.🔽And when he attains that jhāna and emerges from it, he recollects its state of being accompanied by equanimity, and so it is called “recollected as accompanied by equanimity.”🔽Or alternatively, it is called “recollected as accompanied by equanimity” because it is recollected as accompanied by equanimity by one who has attained it and emerged from it.

original: ñāṇaṃ uppajjati – taṃ ekamaṅgaṃ. Esa nayo sesesupi. Evamimehi pañcahi paccavekkhaṇañāṇehi
analyzed: ñāṇam uppajjati tam ekam aṅgam esa nayaḥ sesesu pi evam imehi pañcahi paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇehi
translated: Knowledge arises: this is one factor. The same method applies in the other cases. So this concentration is called right concentration with five kinds of knowledge.

original: ayaṃ samādhi pañcañāṇiko sammāsamādhi nāma vuttoti.
analyzed: ayam samādhi pañcañāṇiko sammāsamādhi nāma vutto ti
translated: This is said of right concentration with five kinds of knowledge.

original: Pañcakaniddesavaṇṇanā.🔽(6.) Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the pentad is ended.

original: 805. Chabbidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese iddhividhe ñāṇanti “ekopi hutvā bahudhā hotī”tiādinayappavatte🔽iddhividhe ñāṇaṃ. Iminā avitakkāvicārā upekkhāsahagatā rūpāvacarā bahudhābhāvādisādhikā🔽ekacittakkhaṇikā appanāpaññāva kathitā. Sotadhātuvisuddhiyā ñāṇanti dūrasantikādibhedasaddārammaṇāya
analyzed: chabbidhena ñāṇa vatthu niddese iddhi vidhe ekaḥ api hutvā bahudhā hoti iti ādi naya ppavatte  iddhi vidhe ñāṇam iminā a vitakka a vicārā upekkhā sahagatā rūpa avacarā bahudhā bhāva ādi sādhikā  eka citta khaṇikā appanā paññā ava kathitā sota dhātu visuddhiyā dūra santika ādi bheda sadda ārammaṇāya
translated: In the description of the six kinds of direct-knowledge, the knowledge of the mind-made body is the knowledge of the mind-made body consisting in the various kinds of supernormal power, such as the ability to become one and to appear again as many, etc.,🔽which is accompanied by the equanimity of the fine-material sphere and is the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge and is concerned with the production of the various kinds of supernormal power.🔽This is said of the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge and is concerned with the production of the various kinds of supernormal power.🔽The knowledge of the divine ear element is the knowledge of the divine ear element that has as its object sounds in the various modes of distance, proximity, and so on,

original: dibbasotadhātuyā ñāṇaṃ. Imināpi avitakkāvicārā upekkhāsahagatā rūpāvacarā pakatisotavisayātītasaddārammaṇā
analyzed: dibba sota dhātuyāḥ ñāṇam iminā api a vitakka a vicārā upekkhā sahagatā rūpa avacarā pakati sota visaya atīta sadda ārammaṇā
translated: which is accompanied by the equanimity of the fine-material sphere and is the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge and is concerned with the divine ear element.🔽This is said of the jhāna that is the basis for direct-knowledge and is concerned with the divine ear element.

original: ekacittakkhaṇikā appanāpaññāva kathitā. Paracitte ñāṇanti parasattānaṃ cittaparicchede
analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā appanā paññā ava kathitā para citte ñāṇam ti para sattānam citta paricchede
translated: The knowledge of penetration of hearts is the knowledge of penetration of hearts that has as its object the mental constituents of other beings and other persons,

original: ñāṇaṃ. Imināpi yathāvuttappakārā paresaṃ sarāgādicittārammaṇā ekacittakkhaṇikā appanāpaññāva🔽kathitā. Pubbenivāsānussatiyā ñāṇanti pubbenivāsānussatisampayuttaṃ ñāṇaṃ. Imināpi
analyzed: ñāṇam iminā api yathā vutta ppakārā paresam sa rāga ādi citta ārammaṇā eka citta khaṇikā appanā paññā va  kathitā pubbenivāsa anussatiyāḥ ñāṇanti pubbenivāsa anussati sampayuttam ñāṇam iminā api
translated: Knowledge. By this too it is the same kind of knowledge as before, namely, the unification of mind in the ninth plane, which is the direct-knowledge of the consciousness of others’ in the ninefold method.

original: yathāvuttappakārā pubbe nivutthakkhandhānussaraṇasatisampayuttā ekacittakkhaṇikā🔽appanāpaññāva kathitā. Sattānaṃ cutūpapāte ñāṇanti sattānaṃ cutiyañca upapāte ca🔽ñāṇaṃ. Imināpi yathāvuttappakārā cavanakaupapajjanakānaṃ sattānaṃ vaṇṇadhātuārammaṇā
analyzed: yathā vutta ppakārā pubbe nivuttha kkhandha anussaraṇa sati sampayuttā eka citta kkhaṇikā  appanā paññā ava kathitā sattānam cutūpapāte ñāṇam ti sattānam cutiyam ca upapāte ca  ñāṇam iminā api yathā vutta ppakārā cavanaka aupapajjanakānam sattānam vaṇṇa dhātu ārammaṇā
translated: Knowledge of recollection of past lives. By this too it is the same kind of knowledge as before, namely, the unification of mind in the ninth plane, which is the direct-knowledge of recollection of past lives in the ninefold method.🔽Knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings. By this too it is the same kind of knowledge as before, namely, the unification of mind in the ninth plane, which is the direct-knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings in the ninefold method.

original: ekacittakkhaṇikā appanāpaññāva kathitā. Āsavānaṃ khaye ñāṇanti saccaparicchedajānanañāṇaṃ.
analyzed: eka citta khaṇikā appanā paññā ava kathitā āsavānam khaye ñāṇam ti sacca pariccheda jānana ñāṇam
translated: Knowledge of the destruction of the cankers. By this too it is the same kind of knowledge as before, namely, the unification of mind in the ninth plane, which is the direct-knowledge of the destruction of the cankers in the ninefold method.

original: Idaṃ lokuttarameva. Sesāni lokiyānīti.
analyzed: idam lokuttaram eva sa isāni lokiyāni iti
translated: But the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is only supramundane. The rest are mundane.

original: Chakkaniddesavaṇṇanā.🔽(7.) Sattakaniddesādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: chakka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The description of the section on sixes is ended.🔽The description of the section on sevens, etc.

original: 806. Sattavidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇantiādinā nayena pavattinivattivasena
analyzed: sattavidhena ñāṇa vatthu niddese jāti paccayāḥ jarā maraṇa nti ādinā nayena pavatti nivatti vasena
translated: In the Description of the Knowledge of the Seven Sets of Seven, etc., the method of treatment is the same as that in the case of the sixes.

original: ekādasasu paṭiccasamuppādaṅgesu ekekasmiṃ kālattayabhedato paccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ vatvā
analyzed: ekādasasu paṭiccasamuppāda aṅgesu ekekasmin kāla ttaya bhedato paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam vatvā
translated: The knowledge of reviewing in the eleven factors of the dependent origination by way of the division of the three times is stated.

original: puna “yampissa taṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇa”nti evaṃ tadeva ñāṇaṃ saṅkhepato khayadhammatādīhi
analyzed: puna yat pi issa tam dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam ti evam tat eva ñāṇam saṅkhepataḥ khaya dhamma tā ādīhi
translated: Then, after that, the same knowledge is stated again in brief by way of the modes of destruction, etc., with the words: “And the knowledge of the stability of the Dhamma.”

original: pakārehi vuttaṃ. Tattha jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ, asati jātiyā natthi jarāmaraṇanti
analyzed: pakārehi vuttam tattha jāti paccayā jarā maraṇam asati jātiyā natthi jarā maraṇam ti
translated: Herein, the two kinds of knowledge, namely, “With birth as condition, aging-and-death; without birth as condition, aging-and-death does not come to be,”🔽are stated by way of the present period. The same two kinds of knowledge

original: ñāṇadvayaṃ paccuppannaddhānavasena vuttaṃ. Atītampi addhānaṃ, anāgatampi addhānanti
analyzed: ñāṇa dvayam paccuppanna ddhāna vasena vuttam atītam api addhānam anāgatam api addhānam ti
translated: are stated by way of the past period and the future period.

original: evaṃ atīte ñāṇadvayaṃ, anāgate ñāṇadvayanti cha. Tāni dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇena saddhiṃ
analyzed: evam atīte ñāṇa dvayam anāgate ñāṇa dvayanti cha tāni dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇena saddhiṃ
translated: Thus there are two kinds of knowledge in the past and two kinds of knowledge in the future, making six. Together with the knowledge of the stability of the Dhamma,🔽there are seven. Herein, the knowledge of the stability of the Dhamma is the knowledge of the mode of conditions.

original: satta. Tattha dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇanti paccayākārañāṇaṃ. Paccayākāro hi dhammānaṃ pavattiṭṭhitikāraṇattā
analyzed: satta tattha dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇan ti paccaya ākāra ñāṇam paccaya ākāraḥ hi dhammānam pavatti ṭṭhiti kāraṇa ttā
translated: For the mode of conditions is called the stability of the Dhamma because it is the cause for the occurrence and stability of dhammas.

original: dhammaṭṭhitīti vuccati; tattha ñāṇaṃ dhammaṭṭhitiñāṇaṃ. Etasseva chabbidhassa ñāṇassetaṃ
analyzed: dhamma ṭṭhiti iti vuccati tattha ñāṇam dhamma ṭṭhiti ñāṇam etassa eva chabbidhassa ñāṇassa etam
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the stability of the Dhamma. This is a designation for the six kinds of knowledge.

original: adhivacanaṃ. Evaṃ ekekasmiṃ aṅge imāni satta satta katvā ekādasasu aṅgesu sattasattati
analyzed: adhivacanam evam eka ekasmin aṅge imāni satta satta katvā ekādasasu aṅgesu satta sattati
translated: Thus, by taking these seven in each factor, there are seventy-seven in the eleven factors.

original: honti. Tattha khayadhammanti khayagamanasabhāvaṃ. Vayadhammanti vayagamanasabhāvaṃ.
analyzed: honti tattha khaya dhammanti khaya gamana sabhāvam vaya dhammanti vaya gamana sabhāvam
translated: Herein, subject to destruction: of the nature of going to destruction. Subject to passing away: of the nature of going to passing away.

original: Virāgadhammanti virajjanasabhāvaṃ. Nirodhadhammanti nirujjhanasabhāvaṃ. Iminā kiṃ
analyzed: virāga dhammanti virajjana sabhāvam nirodha dhammanti nirujjhana sabhāvam iminā kim
translated: Subject to fading away: of the nature of fading away. Subject to cessation: of the nature of cessation. What is stated by this?

original: kathitaṃ? Aparavipassanāya purimavipassanāsammasanaṃ kathitaṃ. Tena kiṃ kathitaṃ🔽hoti? Sattakkhattuṃ vipassanāpaṭivipassanā kathitā. Paṭhamañāṇena hi sabbasaṅkhāre
analyzed: kathitam apara vipassanāya purima vipassanā sammasanam kathitam tena kim kathitam  hoti satta kkhattum vipassanā paṭivipassanā kathitā paṭhama ñāṇena hi sabba saṅkhāre
translated: The surmounting of the prior insight by subsequent insight is stated. What is stated by that?

original: aniccā dukkhā anattāti disvā taṃ ñāṇaṃ dutiyena daṭṭhuṃ vaṭṭati, dutiyaṃ tatiyena,
analyzed: aniccā dukkhā anattā ati disvā tam ñāṇam dutiyena daṭṭhum vaṭṭati dutiyam tatiyena
translated: The sevenfold insight into insight is stated. For having seen with the first knowledge that all formations are impermanent, painful, not-self, that knowledge should be seen with the second, the second with the third,

original: tatiyaṃ catutthena, catutthaṃ pañcamena, pañcamaṃ chaṭṭhena, chaṭṭhaṃ sattamena.🔽Evaṃ satta vipassanāpaṭivipassanā kathitā hontīti.
analyzed: tatiyam catutthena catuttham pañcamena pañcamam chaṭṭhena chaṭṭham sattamena  evam satta vipassanā paṭivipassanā kathitā honti iti
translated: the third with the fourth, the fourth with the fifth, the fifth with the sixth, and the sixth with the seventh.🔽Thus the sevenfold insight into insight is stated.

original: Sattakaniddesavaṇṇanā.
translated: The exposition of the sevenfold insight is ended.

original: 807. Aṭṭhavidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese sotāpattimagge paññāti sotāpattimaggamhi paññā. Iminā sampayuttapaññāva kathitā. Sesapadesupi eseva nayoti.
analyzed: aṭṭhavidhena ñāṇa vatthu niddese sotāpatti magge paññā ati sotāpatti maggamhi paññā iminā sampayutta paññā ava kathitā sesa padesu pi esā iva nayo ti
translated: In the exposition of the ninefold basis for knowledge, the understanding in the path of stream-entry is the understanding in the path of stream-entry. By this the understanding associated with that path is meant. The same method applies in the other cases.

original: Aṭṭhakaniddesavaṇṇanā.🔽808. Navavidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese anupubbavihārasamāpattīsūti anupubbavihārasaṅkhātāsu🔽samāpattīsu. Tāsaṃ anupubbena anupaṭipāṭiyā vihāritabbaṭṭhena anupubbavihāratā, samāpajjitabbaṭṭhena🔽samāpattitā daṭṭhabbā. Tattha paṭhamajjhānasamāpattiyā paññātiādayo aṭṭha sampayuttapaññā🔽veditabbā. Navamā paccavekkhaṇapaññā. Sā hi nirodhasamāpattiṃ santato paṇītato paccavekkhamānassa
analyzed: aṭṭhaka niddesa vaṇṇanā  navavidhena ñāṇa vatthu niddese anupubba vihāra samāpattīsu iti anupubba vihāra saṅkhātāsu  samāpattīsu tāsam anupubbena anupaṭipāṭiyā vihāritabba ṭṭhena anupubba vihāra tā samāpajjitabba ṭṭhena  samāpatti tā daṭṭhabbā tattha paṭhama jhāna samāpattiyā paññāti ādayaḥ aṭṭha sampayutta paññā  veditabbā navamā paccavekkhaṇa paññā sā hi nirodha samāpattim santataḥ paṇītataḥ paccavekkhamānassa
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the eights is ended.

original: pavattati. Tena vuttaṃ – “saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhitassa paccavekkhaṇañāṇa”nti.
analyzed: pavattati tena vuttam saññā vedayita nirodha samāpattiyā vuṭṭhitassa paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam ti
translated: In the exposition of the tenfold basis for knowledge, in the attainment of the successive cessations is in the attainments called “successive cessations” . They should be regarded as “successive cessations” in the sense that they are to be entered upon successively, one after the other, and as “attainments” in the sense that they are to be reached. Herein, the understanding in the attainment of the first jhāna, etc., should be understood as the eight kinds of associated understanding. The ninth is reviewing understanding. For that occurs in one who reviews the attainment of cessation as peaceful and sublime. Hence it is said, “The knowledge of reviewing in one who has emerged from the attainment of cessation of perception and feeling” .

original: Navakaniddesavaṇṇanā.
analyzed: navaka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the nines is ended.

original: (10.) Dasakaniddesavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dasaka niddesa vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the tens

original: Paṭhamabalaniddeso
translated: The first section of the exposition of the powers

original: 809. Dasavidhena ñāṇavatthuniddese aṭṭhānanti hetupaṭikkhepo. Anavakāsoti paccayapaṭikkhepo.
analyzed: dasavidhena ñāṇa vatthu niddese aṭṭhānam ti hetu paṭikkhepaḥ anavakāso ti paccaya paṭikkhepaḥ
translated: “No occasion” is a denial of cause.

original: Ubhayenāpi kāraṇameva paṭikkhipati. Kāraṇañhi tadāyattavuttitāya attano phalassa
analyzed: ubhayena api kāraṇam eva paṭikkhipati kāraṇam hi tad āyatta vutti tāya attanaḥ phalassa
translated: By both he denies only cause. For cause is called “occasion” and “opportunity” because its fruit occurs dependent on it.

original: ṭhānanti ca avakāsoti ca vuccati. Yanti yena kāraṇena. Diṭṭhisampannoti maggadiṭṭhiyā
analyzed: ṭhānam ti ca avakāso ti ca vuccati yanti yena kāraṇena diṭṭhi sampanno ti magga diṭṭhiyā
translated: “By which” : by which cause. “One accomplished in view” : a stream-enterer, a noble disciple, accomplished in the view of the path.

original: sampanno sotāpanno ariyasāvako. Kañci saṅkhāranti catubhūmakesu saṅkhatasaṅkhāresu🔽kañci ekaṃ saṅkhārampi. Niccato upagaccheyyāti niccoti gaṇheyya. Netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatīti
analyzed: sampanno sotāpannaḥ ariya sāvako kañci catu bhūmakesu saṅkhata saṅkhāresu  kañci ekam saṅkhāram pi niccatas upagaccheyya ati niccaḥ uti gaṇheyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: “Any formation” : any one of the formations of the four planes.

original: etaṃ kāraṇaṃ natthi, na upalabbhati. Yaṃ puthujjanoti yena kāraṇena puthujjano. Ṭhānametaṃ🔽vijjatīti etaṃ kāraṇaṃ atthi; sassatadiṭṭhiyā hi so tebhūmakesu saṅkhāresu kañci
analyzed: etam kāraṇam na atthi na upalabbhati yam puthujjanaḥ iti yena kāraṇena puthujjanaḥ ṭhānam etam  vijjati iti etam kāraṇam atthi sassata diṭṭhiyā hi so tebhūmakesu saṅkhāresu kañci
translated: “As permanent” : as eternal. “This is not possible” : this cause does not exist, is not found.

original: saṅkhāraṃ niccato gaṇheyyāti attho. Catutthabhūmakasaṅkhāro pana tejussadattā divasaṃ
analyzed: saṅkhāram niccatas gaṇheyya ati attho catuttha bhūmaka saṅkhāro pana divasam
translated: “For a worldling” : for which cause a worldling. “This is possible” : this cause exists. For the meaning is that he would take any formation of the three planes as permanent through the view of eternalism. But a formation of the fourth plane he would not take as permanent, because it is like fire.

original: santatto ayoguḷo viya makkhikānaṃ diṭṭhiyā vā aññesaṃ vā akusalānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ na
analyzed: santattaḥ ayaḥ guḷaḥ viya makkhikānam diṭṭhiyā vā aññesam vā akusalānam ārammaṇam na
translated: Like a red-hot ball of iron, it is not a condition for the perception of flies or for any other unprofitable things.

original: hoti. Iminā nayena kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhatotiādīsupi attho veditabbo. Sukhato upagaccheyyāti
analyzed: hoti iminā nayena kañci saṅkhāram sukhataḥ tiādīsu pi atthaḥ veditabbo sukhataḥ upagaccheyya ati
translated: The meaning should be understood in this way in the case of any formation, whether pleasant or painful, etc., that is, whether it is pleasant, painful, mental, bodily, or of a kind other than these.

original: “ekantasukhī attā hoti arogo parammaraṇā”ti evaṃ attadiṭṭhivasena sukhato gāhaṃ sandhāyetaṃ
analyzed: ekanta sukhī attā hoti arogo evam atta diṭṭhi vasena sukhataḥ gāham sandhāya itam
translated: He would misrepresent it as pleasant: this is said with reference to the misrepresentation of it as pleasant by way of the view of self, thus: “After death a self that is blissful and healthy exists eternally.”

original: vuttaṃ. Diṭṭhivippayuttacittena pana ariyasāvako pariḷāhābhibhūto pariḷāhavūpasamatthaṃ,
analyzed: vuttam diṭṭhi vippayutta cittena pana ariya sāvako pariḷāha abhibhūto pariḷāha vūpasamattham
translated: But the noble disciple, though he has a mind not associated with the view of self, misrepresents a formation as pleasant when he seeks pleasure in a formation in order to allay the fever of a bodily or mental affliction,

original: mattahatthīparitāsito viya, sucikāmo pokkhabrāhmaṇo gūthaṃ kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhato
analyzed: matta hatthī paritāsitaḥ viya su cikāmaḥ pokkha brāhmaṇaḥ gūtham kañci saṅkhāram sukhataḥ
translated: just as the brahmin Pokkharasāti, though he was not a lustful man, sought pleasure in the touch of the body of the nun Vajira when he was afflicted by a severe fever.

original: upagacchati. Attavāde kasiṇādipaṇṇattisaṅgahatthaṃ saṅkhāranti avatvā kañci dhammanti
analyzed: upagacchati atta vāde kasiṇa ādi paṇṇatti saṅga hattham saṅkhāranti avatvā kañci
translated: And in order to include the kasiṇa and other immaterial objects in the definition, he says “any state” instead of “any formation.”

original: vuttaṃ. Idhāpi ariyasāvakassa catubhūmakavasena paricchedo veditabbo, puthujjanassa
analyzed: vuttam idha api ariya sāvakassa catu bhūmaka vasena paricchedaḥ veditabbo puthujjanassa
translated: Herein, the noble disciple’s delimitation should be understood as fourfold, according to the four paths,🔽and the worldling’s as threefold, according to the three lower paths.

original: tebhūmakavasena; sabbavāresu vā ariyasāvakassāpi tebhūmakavaseneva paricchedo vaṭṭati.
analyzed: tebhūmaka vasena sabba vāresu vā ariyasāvakassa api tebhūmaka vasena iva paricchedaḥ vaṭṭati
translated: Or the noble disciple’s delimitation may be understood as threefold only.

original: Yaṃ yañhi puthujjano gaṇhāti, tato tato ariyasāvako gāhaṃ viniveṭheti. Puthujjano
analyzed: yam yam hi puthujjanaḥ gaṇhāti tatas tatas ariya sāvakaḥ gāham viniveṭheti puthujjanaḥ
translated: For whatever the worldling takes hold of, the Noble Disciple turns away from it.

original: hi yaṃ yaṃ niccaṃ sukhaṃ attāti gaṇhāti, taṃ taṃ ariyasāvako aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ anattāti
analyzed: hi yam yam niccam sukham attā ati gaṇhāti tam tam ariya sāvakaḥ aniccam dukkham anattā ati
translated: For whatever the worldling takes hold of as permanent, as happiness, as self, the Noble Disciple takes hold of as impermanent, as suffering, as non-self.

original: gaṇhanto gāhaṃ viniveṭheti.🔽Mātarantiādīsu janikāva mātā. Manussabhūtova khīṇāsavo arahāti adhippeto. Kiṃ pana🔽ariyasāvako aññaṃ jīvitā voropeyyāti? Etampi aṭṭhānaṃ. Sacepi bhavantaragataṃ ariyasāvakaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhantaḥ gāham viniveṭha iti  mātaranti ādīsu janikā iva mātā manussa bhūtaḥ uva khīṇa āsavaḥ arahā ati adhippetaḥ kim pana  ariya sāvako aññam jīvitā voropeyya ati etam pi aṭṭhānam sace pi bhavantara gatam ariya sāvakam
translated: Thus he turns away from taking hold.

original: attano ariyasāvakabhāvaṃ ajānantampi koci evaṃ vadeyya – ‘imaṃ kunthakipillikaṃ jīvitā
analyzed: attanaḥ ariya sāvaka bhāvam a jānantam pi koci evam vadeyya imam kuntha kipillikam jīvitā
translated: “Mother” and so forth: the mother is the one who gave birth. The one intended is the Arahant with cankers destroyed who is a human being. But how could the Noble Disciple deprive anyone of life? This is impossible. Even if the Noble Disciple were to be reborn in another world-system,

original: voropetvā sakalacakkavāḷagabbhe cakkavattirajjaṃ paṭipajjāhī’ti, neva so taṃ jīvitā
analyzed: voropetvā sakala cakkavāḷa gabbhe cakkavatti rajjam paṭipajjāhi iti na iva saḥ tam jīvitā
translated: and if someone were to say to him: “Deprive this ant of life, and you will become a Wheel-turning Monarch ruling over the entire world,”

original: voropeyya. Atha vāpi naṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ – ‘sace imaṃ na ghātessasi, sīsaṃ te chindissāmā’ti,
analyzed: voropeyya atha vā api nam evam vadeyyum sace imam na ghātessasi sīsam te chindissāma ati
translated: he would not deprive it of life. Or if they were to say: “If you do not kill it, we will cut off your head,”

original: sīsamevassa chindeyyuṃ, neva so taṃ ghāteyya. Puthujjanabhāvassa pana mahāsāvajjabhāvadassanatthaṃ
analyzed: sīsam evassa chindeyyum na iva saḥ tam ghāteyya puthujjana bhāvassa pana mahā sāvajja bhāva dassana attham
translated: This was said in order to show the very great blameworthiness of the ordinary man’s state and

original: ariyasāvakassa ca baladīpanatthametaṃ vuttaṃ. Ayañhettha adhippāyo – sāvajjo puthujjanabhāvo,
analyzed: ariya sāvakassa ca bala dīpana attham etam vuttam ayam ha ittha adhippāyaḥ sāvajjaḥ puthujjana bhāvaḥ
translated: in order to show the strength of the noble disciple. The meaning is as follows. The ordinary man’s state is very blameworthy,

original: yatra hi nāma puthujjano mātughātādīnipi ānantariyāni karissati. Mahābalo ariyasāvako;
analyzed: yatra hi nāma puthujjanaḥ mātughāta ādīni pi ānantariyāni karissati mahā balaḥ ariya sāvako
translated: for the ordinary man commits the crimes with unfailing result of matricide, etc. But the noble disciple is strong;

original: so etāni kammāni na karotīti.
analyzed: saḥ etāni kammāni na karoti iti
translated: he does not commit these crimes.🔽With a mind of hate: with a mind associated with hate, with a mind to kill.

original: Paduṭṭhena cittenāti dosasampayuttena vadhakacittena. Lohitaṃ uppādeyyāti jīvamānakasarīre🔽khuddakamakkhikāya pivanamattampi lohitaṃ uppādeyya. Saṅghaṃ bhindeyyāti samānasaṃvāsakaṃ
analyzed: paduṭṭhena cittena ati dosa sampayuttena vadhaka cittena lohitam uppādeyya ati jīvamānaka sarīre  khuddaka makkhikāya pivana mattam pi lohitam uppādeyya saṅgham bhindeyya ati samāna saṃvāsakam
translated: Should shed blood: should cause to flow blood from a living being, even as much as a louse might drink.

original: samānasīmāyaṃ ṭhitaṃ pañcahi kāraṇehi saṅghaṃ bhindeyya, vuttañhetaṃ – “pañcahupāli,
analyzed: samāna sīmā ayam ṭhitam pañcahi kāraṇehi saṅgham bhindeyya vuttam ha etam
translated: Should split the Saṅgha: should split the Saṅgha by means of one of the five kinds of schism, namely, by a schism consisting in a legal question, a schism consisting in a person, a schism consisting in speech, a schism consisting in consent, or a schism consisting in a faction. For this is said: “There are five ways, Upāli,

original: ākārehi saṅgho bhijjati – kammena, uddesena, voharanto, anussāvanena, salākaggāhenā”ti.
analyzed: ākārehi saṅghaḥ bhijjati kammena uddesena voharantaḥ anussāvanena salākaggāhena ati
translated: in which a schism in the Saṅgha occurs: by means of a legal question, by means of a person, by means of speech, by means of consent, by means of a faction” .

original: Tattha ‘kammenā’ti apalokanādīsu catūsu kammesu aññatarena kammena. ‘Uddesenā’ti
analyzed: tattha kammena ati apalokana ādīsu catūsu kammesu aññatarena kammena uddesena ati
translated: Herein, by a legal procedure means by one of the four legal procedures consisting of a proclamation, etc.

original: pañcasu pātimokkhuddesesu aññatarena uddesena. ‘Voharanto’ti kathayanto, tāhi tāhi
analyzed: pañcasu pātimokkha uddesesu aññatarena uddesena voharanto ti kathayanto tāhi tāhi
translated: By a motion means by one of the five kinds of motions.

original: uppattīhi ‘adhammaṃ dhammo’tiādīni aṭṭhārasa bhedakaravatthūni dīpento. ‘Anussāvanenā’ti
analyzed: uppattīhi adhammam dhamma uti ādīni aṭṭhārasa bheda kara vatthūni dīpentaḥ anussāvanena ati
translated: By speaking means by speaking, by expounding the eighteen grounds for schism beginning thus: “What is not the rule is the rule,”🔽By a resolution means by a resolution consisting of the announcement:

original: ‘nanu tumhe jānātha mayhaṃ uccākulā pabbajitabhāvaṃ bahussutabhāvañca! Mādiso nāma
analyzed: nanu tumhe jānātha mayham uccākulā pabbajita bhāvam bahu suta bhāvam ca mādisaḥ nāma
translated: “Do you not know that I come of a good family and that I am well-versed? It is not proper for you

original: uddhammaṃ ubbinayaṃ satthusāsanaṃ gāheyyāti cittampi uppādetuṃ tumhākaṃ na yuttaṃ.
analyzed: uddhammam ubbinayam satthu sāsanam gāheyyāti cittam pi uppādetum tumhākam na yuttam
translated: to arouse a thought of rebellion against me, who am expounding the True Idea.

original: Kiṃ mayhaṃ avīci nīluppalavanaṃ viya sītalo? Kimahaṃ apāyato na bhāyāmī’tiādinā nayena🔽kaṇṇamūle vacībhedaṃ katvā anussāvanena. ‘Salākaggāhenā’ti evaṃ anussāvetvā tesaṃ
analyzed: kim mayham kim aham apāyatas na bhāyāmi iti ādinā nayena  kaṇṇa mūle vacībhedam katvā anussāvanena salākaggāhena ati evam anussāvetvā tesam
translated: What is Avīci to me, if it is as cool as a blue-lotus pond? Why should I fear the states of loss?”🔽and so on, by making a resolution in their ears.

original: cittaṃ upatthambhetvā anivattanadhamme katvā “gaṇhatha imaṃ salāka”nti salākaggāhena.
analyzed: cittam upatthambhetvā a nivattana dhamme katvā gaṇhatha imam salākan ti salākaggāhena
translated: By a ballot means by a ballot after he has thus made a resolution and has confirmed their state of mind and made it irreversible, by saying, “Take this ballot.”

original: Ettha ca kammameva uddeso vā pamāṇaṃ vohārānussāvanasalākaggāhā pana pubbabhāgā.
analyzed: ettha ca kammam eva uddesaḥ vā pamāṇam vohāra anussāvana salākaggāhā pana pubbabhāgā
translated: And here the act itself is the proclamation or the measure. The announcement, the voting, and the taking of the ticket are preliminaries.

original: Aṭṭhārasavatthudīpanavasena hi voharantena tattha rucijananatthaṃ anussāvetvā salākāya🔽gāhitāyapi abhinnova hoti saṅgho. Yadā pana evaṃ cattāro vā atirekā vā salākaṃ gāhetvā
analyzed: aṭṭhārasa vatthu dīpana vasena hi voharantena tattha ruci janana attham anussāvetvā salākāya  abhinnaḥ uva hoti saṅghaḥ yadā pana evam cattāraḥ vā atirekāḥ vā salākam gāhetvā
translated: For when one who is announcing the schism explains the eighteen grounds for schism, he announces it in order to arouse approval for it.🔽And when the voting is done and the ticket is taken, the Saṅgha is split right then.

original: āveṇikaṃ kammaṃ vā uddesaṃ vā karonti, tadā saṅgho bhinno nāma hoti.🔽Evaṃ diṭṭhisampanno puggalo saṅghaṃ bhindeyyāti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. Ettāvatā mātughātādīni
analyzed: āveṇikam kammam vā uddesam vā karonti tadā saṅghaḥ bhinnaḥ nāma hoti  evam diṭṭhi sampannaḥ puggalo saṅgham bhindeyya ati na itam ṭhānam vijjati ettāvatā mātughāta ādīni
translated: But when four or more take the ticket and do the proclamation or the act separately, then the Saṅgha is said to be split.🔽It is impossible for a person possessed of right view to split the Saṅgha.

original: pañca ānantariyakammāni dassitāni honti, yāni puthujjano karoti, na ariyasāvako.
analyzed: pañca ānantariya kammāni dassitāni honti yāni puthujjanaḥ karoti na ariya sāvako
translated: So far the five crimes of immediate retribution beginning with matricide have been shown, which an ordinary man commits, not a noble disciple.

original: Tesaṃ āvibhāvatthaṃ –
analyzed: tesam āvi bhāva attham
translated: The exposition should be known🔽By way of action, door, and so on,

original: Kammato dvārato ceva, kappaṭṭhitiyato tathā;🔽Pākasādhāraṇādīhi, viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: kammataḥ dvārataḥ ca iva kappa ṭṭhitiyataḥ tathā  pāka sādhāraṇa ādīhi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: By way of ripening, sharing, and so on.

original: Tattha ‘kammato’ tāva – ettha hi manussabhūtasseva manussabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ
analyzed: tattha kammataḥ tāva ettha hi manussa bhūtassa iva manussa bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram
translated: Herein, by way of action: firstly, by way of action, matricide is the most serious among the five crimes of immediate retribution. For it is only a human being who can commit matricide, not one who is not a human being.

original: vā api parivattaliṅgaṃ jīvitā voropentassa kammaṃ ānantariyaṃ hoti. Tassa vipākaṃ🔽paṭibāhissāmī’ti sakalacakkavāḷaṃ mahācetiyappamāṇehi kañcanathūpehi pūretvāpi, sakalacakkavāḷaṃ🔽pūretvā nisinnabhikkhusaṅghassa mahādānaṃ datvāpi, buddhassa bhagavato saṅghāṭikaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: vā api parivatta liṅgam jīvitā voropentassa kammam ānantariyam hoti tassa vipākam  paṭibāhissāmi iti sakala cakkavāḷam mahā cetiya ppamāṇehi kañcana thūpehi pūretvā api sakala cakkavāḷam  pūretvā nisinna bhikkhu saṅghassa mahā dānam da tvā api buddhassa bhagavato saṅghāṭi kaṇṇam
translated: If he kills his mother who has changed sex, the kamma is an ānantariya kamma.

original: amuñcitvāva vicaritvāpi, kāyassa bhedā nirayameva upapajjati. Yo pana sayaṃ manussabhūto🔽tiracchānabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā, sayaṃ vā tiracchānabhūto manussabhūtaṃ, tiracchānabhūtoyeva
analyzed: a muñcitvā ava vicaritvā api kāyassa bhedā nirayam eva upapajjati yaḥ pana sayam manussa bhūto  tiracchāna bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram vā sayam vā tiracchāna bhūtaḥ manussa bhūtam tiracchāna bhūtaḥ yā iva
translated: I will restrain him from experiencing its result.’ Even if he were to fill the entire world with great caityas the size of the great shrine at Sāvatthī, and even if he were to give a great gift to a Community of monks filling the entire world, and even if he were to wander about without taking a stitch off the Buddha, the Blessed One’s, outer cloak, still he would be reborn in hell on the dissolution of the body.

original: vā tiracchānabhūtaṃ jīvitā voropeti, tassa kammaṃ ānantariyaṃ na hoti, kammaṃ pana
analyzed: vā tiracchāna bhūtam jīvitā voropeti tassa kammam ānantariyam na hoti kammam pana
translated: But if he himself, being a human being, kills his mother or father who have become animals, or if he himself, being an animal, kills a human being or another animal, then his kamma is not an ānantariya kamma, but

original: bhāriyaṃ hoti, ānantariyaṃ āhacceva tiṭṭhati. Manussajātikānaṃ pana vasena ayaṃ pañho kathito.
analyzed: bhāriyam hoti ānantariyam āhacca iva tiṭṭhati manussa jātikānam pana vasena ayam pañho kathito
translated: it is a kamma of result, and it remains as an ānantariya kamma. But this question is stated in terms of human beings.

original: Ettha eḷakacatukkaṃ, saṅgāmacatukkaṃ, coracatukkañca kathetabbaṃ. ‘Eḷakaṃ māremī’ti🔽abhisandhināpi hi eḷakaṭṭhāne ṭhitaṃ manusso manussabhūtaṃ mātaraṃ vā pitaraṃ vā🔽mārento ānantariyaṃ phusati. Eḷakābhisandhinā pana mātāpitiabhisandhinā vā eḷakaṃ
analyzed: ettha eḷaka catukkam saṅgāma catukkam cora catukkañca kathetabbam eḷakam mā āremi iti  abhisandhinā api hi eḷaka ṭṭhāne ṭhitam manussaḥ manussa bhūtam mātaram vā pitaram vā  ānantariyam phusati eḷaka abhisandhinā pana mātā piti abhisandhinā vā eḷakam
translated: Herein, the four cases of the ox, the four cases of the battle, and the four cases of the thief should be told. “I will kill the ox”

original: mārento ānantariyaṃ na phusati. Mātāpitiabhisandhinā mātāpitaro mārento phusateva.
analyzed: ānantariyam na phusati mātā piti abhisandhinā mātā pitaraḥ phusatā iva
translated: . For even one who is standing in the place of an ox and who is a human being kills his mother or father with the aim of killing a human being and he touches the immediate on that occasion. But one who kills an ox with the aim of killing a human being or one who kills a human being with the aim of killing an ox does not touch the immediate. But one who kills his mother or father with the aim of killing his mother or father touches it.

original: Esa nayo itarasmimpi catukkadvaye. Yathā ca mātāpitūsu, evaṃ arahantepi etāni catukkāni🔽veditabbāni. Manussaarahantameva ca māretvā ānantariyaṃ phusati, na yakkhabhūtaṃ;🔽kammaṃ pana bhāriyaṃ ānantariyasadisameva. Manussaarahantassa ca puthujjanakāleyeva
analyzed: itarasmin pi catukka dvaye yathā ca mātā pitūsu evam etāni catukkāni  veditabbāni manussa arahantam eva ca māretvā ānantariyam phusati na yakkha bhūtam  kammam pana bhāriyam ānantariya sadisam eva manussa arahantassa ca puthujjana kāleya iva
translated: And so too with the other two sets of four. And as with mother and father, so also with an arahat.

original: satthappahāre vā vise vā dinnepi yadi so arahattaṃ patvā teneva marati, arahantaghāto
analyzed: sattha ppahāre vā vise vā dinne pi yadi saḥ arahattam patvā tena iva marati arahanta ghāto
translated: But he touches the immediate only by killing a human being arahat, not by killing a non-human arahat or an animal arahat. But the kamma is heavy and is like the immediate. And if he gives a blow with a weapon or poison to a human being arahat when he is still an ordinary person, and he dies later on after reaching arahatship, then the killing is of an arahat.

original: hotiyeva. Yaṃ pana puthujjanakāle dinnaṃ dānaṃ arahattaṃ patvā paribhuñjati, puthujjanasseva
analyzed: yam pana puthujjana kāle dinnam dānam arahattam patvā paribhuñjati puthujjanassa iva
translated: But what he gives after reaching Arahantship is given by an ordinary man.

original: taṃ dinnaṃ hoti. Sesaariyapuggale mārentassa ānantariyaṃ natthi, kammaṃ pana bhāriyaṃ🔽ānantariyasadisameva.🔽Lohituppāde tathāgatassa abhejjakāyatāya parūpakkamena cammacchedaṃ katvā lohitapaggharaṇaṃ
analyzed: tat dinnam hoti sesa ariya puggale mārentassa ānantariyam natthi kammam pana bhāriyam  ānantariya sadisam eva  lohituppāde tathāgatassa a bhejja kāya tāya paru pakkamena camma chedam katvā lohita paggharaṇam
translated: There is no immediate result for one who kills an ariyan person other than a Paccekabuddha or a fully enlightened Buddha. But the kamma is heavy.

original: nāma natthi. Sarīrassa pana antoyeva ekasmiṃ ṭhāne lohitaṃ samosarati. Devadattena
analyzed: nāma natthi sarīrassa pana ekasmiṃ ṭhāne lohitam samosarati devadattena
translated: In the case of drawing blood from the Tathāgata, there is no drawing of blood by piercing the skin, because the Tathāgata’s body is unpierceable. But blood may appear by the mere intention to harm, for the blood collects in one place inside the body.

original: paṭividdhasilāto bhijjitvā gatā sakalikāpi tathāgatassa pādantaṃ pahari. Pharasunā🔽pahaṭo viya pādo antolohitoyeva ahosi. Tathā karontassa ānantariyaṃ hoti. Jīvako
analyzed: paṭividdha silātaḥ bhijjitvā gatā sa kalikā api tathāgatassa pādantam pahari pharasunā  pahaṭaḥ viya pādaḥ antolohitaḥ yā iva ahosi tathā karontassa ānantariyam hoti jīvako
translated: When Devadatta hurled a rock, a splinter struck the Tathāgata’s foot, which became as if filled with splinters.🔽When Jīvaka treated the Tathāgata’s foot with a sharp knife, it was as if he were cutting with a razor on a living flesh.

original: pana tathāgatassa ruciyā satthakena cammaṃ chinditvā tamhā ṭhānā duṭṭhalohitaṃ nīharitvā🔽phāsukamakāsi. Tathā karontassa puññakammameva hoti.
analyzed: pana tathāgatassa ruciyā satthakena cammam chinditvā tamhā ṭhānā duṭṭha lohitam nīharitvā 🔽phāsukam akāsi tathā karontassa puñña kammam eva hoti
translated: But Jīvaka removed the blood by sucking it out with his mouth, and he did so at the Tathāgata’s request.

original: Atha ye ca parinibbute tathāgate cetiyaṃ bhindanti, bodhiṃ chindanti, dhātumhi upakkamanti,🔽tesaṃ kiṃ hotīti? Bhāriyaṃ kammaṃ hoti ānantariyasadisaṃ. Sadhātukaṃ pana thūpaṃ
analyzed: atha ye ca parinibbute tathāgate cetiyam bhindanti bodhim chindanti dhātumhi upakkamanti  tesam kim hoti iti bhāriyam kammam hoti ānantariya sadisam sa dhātukam pana thūpam
translated: Now, what happens to those who break a shrine, cut down a Bodhi tree, or do violence to the relics?

original: vā paṭimaṃ vā bādhayamānaṃ bodhisākhañca chindituṃ vaṭṭati. Sacepi tattha nilīnā
analyzed: vā paṭimam vā bādhayamānam bodhisākham ca chinditum vaṭṭati sace pi tattha nilīnā
translated: It is a serious kamma, similar to an immediate-resultant kamma. But it is allowable to cut down a branch of a Bodhi tree that is obstructing a shrine or an image house,

original: sakuṇā cetiye vaccaṃ pātenti, chindituṃ vaṭṭatiyeva. Paribhogacetiyato hi sarīracetiyaṃ
analyzed: sakuṇā cetiye vaccam chinditum chinditum paribhoga cetiyataḥ hi sarīra cetiyam
translated: or a relic chamber. If birds roosting in a shrine drop excrement on it, the branch may be cut down. For the relic shrine is more important than the shrine for use.

original: mahantataraṃ. Cetiyavatthuṃ bhinditvā gacchantaṃ bodhimūlampi chinditvā harituṃ vaṭṭati.
analyzed: mahantataram cetiya vatthum bhinditvā gacchantam bodhi mūlam pi chinditvā haritum vaṭṭati
translated: It is allowable to cut down a Bodhi tree and carry it off after breaking up the shrine site.

original: Yā pana bodhisākhā bodhigharaṃ bādhati, taṃ geharakkhaṇatthaṃ chindituṃ na labbhati.
analyzed: yā pana bodhisākhā bodhigharam bādhati tam geha rakkhaṇa attham chinditum na labbhati
translated: But it is not allowable to cut down a branch of a Bodhi tree that is obstructing a Bodhi house in order to preserve the house.

original: Bodhiatthañhi gehaṃ, na gehatthāya bodhi. Āsanagharepi eseva nayo. Yasmiṃ pana āsanaghare
analyzed: bodhi attham hi geham na geha atthāya bodhi āsana ghare pi esa iva nayaḥ yasmim pana āsana ghare
translated: For the house is for the sake of the Bodhi tree, not the Bodhi tree for the sake of the house. The same applies to a seat house.

original: dhātu nihitā hoti, tassa rakkhaṇatthāya bodhisākhaṃ chindituṃ vaṭṭati. Bodhijagganatthaṃ
analyzed: dhātu nihitā hoti tassa rakkhaṇa atthāya bodhisākham chinditum vaṭṭati bodhi jaggana attham
translated: But it is allowable to cut down a branch of a Bodhi tree in order to preserve a relic chamber in which relics are deposited.

original: ojoharaṇasākhaṃ vā pūtiṭṭhānaṃ vā chindituṃ vaṭṭatiyeva; sarīrapaṭijaggane viya puññampi hoti.
analyzed: ojaḥ haraṇa sākham vā pūtiṭṭhānam vā chinditum vaṭṭatiyā iva sarīra paṭijaggane viya puññam pi hoti
translated: He may cut down a branch that bears sap or a rotten tree. There is merit as in the case of the care of the body.

original: Saṅghabhede sīmaṭṭhakasaṅghe asannipatite visuṃ parisaṃ gahetvā katavohārānussāvanasalākaggāhassa
analyzed: saṅgha bhede sīmaṭṭhaka saṅghe a sannipatite visum parisam gahetvā kata vohāra anussāvana salāka ggāhassa
translated: When the schism in the Saṅgha is in a territory, and the Saṅgha in the territory is not united, and he takes a separate faction and recites the proclamation of the transaction and distributes ballots,

original: kammaṃ vā karontassa uddesaṃ vā uddisantassa bhedo ca hoti ānantariyakammañca. Samaggasaññāya
analyzed: kammam vā karontassa uddesam vā uddisantassa bhedo ca hoti ānantariya kammam ca samagga saññāya
translated: and he performs a transaction or he recites the recitation, there is schism and a heinous kamma.🔽But if he does it with the perception of unity,

original: pana vaṭṭati. Samaggasaññāya hi karontassa neva bhedo hoti na ānantariyakammaṃ. Tathā
analyzed: pana vaṭṭati samagga saññāya hi karontassa na iva bhedaḥ hoti na ānantariya kammam tathā
translated: there is no schism and no heinous kamma. So too

original: navato ūnaparisāyaṃ. Sabbantimena pana paricchedena navannaṃ janānaṃ yo saṅghaṃ bhindati,
analyzed: navataḥ ūna parisāyam sabbantimena pana paricchedena navannam janānam yaḥ saṅgham bhindati
translated: if it is with a faction of less than nine. But if he splits the Saṅgha with any of the nine persons,

original: tassa ānantariyakammaṃ hoti. Anuvattakānaṃ adhammavādīnaṃ mahāsāvajjaṃ kammaṃ; dhammavādino
analyzed: tassa ānantariya kammam hoti anuvattakānam adhamma vādīnam mahāsāvajjam kammam dhamma vādino
translated: there is a heinous kamma for him. For the followers who side with him and speak contrary to the Dhamma, there is a very grave kamma;🔽for those who side with him and speak in accordance with the Dhamma, there is no offense.

original: anavajjā. Tattha navannameva saṅghabhede idaṃ suttaṃ – “ekato, upāli, cattāro honti,
analyzed: anavajjā tattha navannam eva saṅgha bhede idam suttam ekatas upāli cattāro honti
translated: Herein, this Thread is relevant to the schism in the Saṅgha with any of the nine persons: “Four, Upāli, on one side,

original: ekato cattāro, navamo anussāveti salākaṃ gāheti – ‘ayaṃ dhammo, ayaṃ vinayo, idaṃ🔽satthusāsanaṃ, idaṃ gaṇhatha, idaṃ rocethā’ti. Evaṃ kho, upāli, saṅgharāji ceva hoti
analyzed: ekatas cattāraḥ navamaḥ anussāveti salākam gāheti ayam dhammaḥ ayam vinayaḥ idam  satthu sāsanam idam gaṇhatha idam rocetha ati evam kho upāli saṅgha rāji ca iva hoti
translated: four on one side, the ninth one announces, ‘This is the rule, this is the Monastic Law, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this up, approve of this.’ In this way, Upāli, there is a schism in the Sangha and🔽🔽

original: saṅghabhedo ca. Navannaṃ vā, upāli, atirekanavannaṃ vā saṅgharāji ceva hoti saṅghabhedo cā”ti.
analyzed: saṅgha bhedaḥ ca navannam vai upāli atireka navannam vā saṅgha rāji ca iva hoti saṅgha bhedaḥ ca ati
translated: Four on one side, the ninth one announces, ‘This is the rule, this is discipline, this is the Teacher’s instruction; take this, approve of this.’ Thus, Upāli, there is a schism in the Sangha and a split in the Sangha. But if there are nine or more, there is a schism in the Sangha and a split in the Sangha.”

original: Etesu ca pana pañcasu saṅghabhedo vacīkammaṃ, sesāni kāyakammānīti. Evaṃ kammatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: etesu ca pana pañcasu saṅgha bhedaḥ vacī kammam sesāni kāya kammāni iti evam kammataḥ pi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: And of these five, the schism in the Sangha is verbal action, while the rest are bodily action. This is how the exposition should be understood here “as to action.”

original: ‘Dvārato’ti sabbāneva cetāni kāyadvāratopi vacīdvāratopi samuṭṭhahanti. Purimāni🔽panettha cattāri āṇattikavijjāmayapayogavasena vacīdvārato samuṭṭhahitvāpi kāyadvārameva🔽pūrenti. Saṅghabhedo hatthamuddāya bhedaṃ karontassa kāyadvārato samuṭṭhahitvāpi
analyzed: dvārataḥ ti sabbān eva cetāni kāya dvārataḥ pi vacī dvārataḥ pi samuṭṭhahanti purimāni  pana ittha cattāri āṇattika vijjā maya payoga vasena vacī dvārataḥ samuṭṭhahitvā api kāya dvāram eva  pūrenti saṅgha bhedaḥ hattham uddāya bhedam karontassa kāyadvārato samuṭṭhahitvā api
translated: “As to door”: all these offenses originate both by body and by speech. But the first four

original: vacīdvārameva pūretīti. Evamettha dvāratopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: vacī dvāram eva pūreti iti evam ettha dvārataḥ pi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: originate by speech and then fulfill themselves by body. The schism in the Sangha originates by body and then fulfills itself by speech. This is how the exposition should be understood here “as to door.”

original: ‘Kappaṭṭhitiyato’ti saṅghabhedoyeva cettha kappaṭṭhitiyo. Saṇṭhahante hi kappe kappavemajjhe
analyzed: kappa ṭṭhitiyato ti saṅgha bhedaḥ yā iva ca ittha kappa ṭṭhitiyaḥ saṇṭhahante hi kappe kappa vemajjhe
translated: ‘By lasting for an aeon’: here only schism in the Community lasts for an aeon. For when the aeon is contracting, he is released only when the aeon has expanded again,

original: vā saṅghabhedaṃ katvā kappavināseyeva muccati. Sacepi hi ‘sve kappo vinassissatī’ti
analyzed: vā saṅgha bhedam katvā muccati sace pi hi sve kappaḥ vinassissati iti
translated: or in the middle of the aeon, after he has made schism in the Community. Even if he were to make schism in the Community today, thinking, ‘Tomorrow the aeon will be destroyed,’

original: ajja saṅghabhedaṃ karoti, sveyeva muccati, ekadivasameva niraye paccati. Evaṃ karaṇaṃ
analyzed: ajja saṅgha bhedam karoti sveyā iva muccati eka divasam eva niraye paccati evam karaṇam
translated: he would be released tomorrow, and he would be reborn in hell for one day only. But there is no such case.

original: pana natthi. Sesāni cattāri kammāni ānantariyāneva honti, na kappaṭṭhitiyānīti. Evamettha🔽kappaṭṭhitiyatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.🔽‘Pākato’ti yena ca pañcapetāni kammāni katāni honti, tassa saṅghabhedoyeva paṭisandhivasena
analyzed: pana natthi sesāni cattāri kammāni honti na kappa ṭṭhitiyāni iti evam ettha  viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ  yena ca pañca petāni kammāni katāni honti tassa paṭisandhi vasena
translated: The other four actions are only immediate, not lasting for an aeon. This is how the exposition should be known here ‘by lasting for an aeon.’

original: vipaccati. Sesāni “ahosi kammaṃ nāhosi kammavipāko”ti evamādīsu saṅkhaṃ gacchanti.
analyzed: vipaccati sesāni ahosi kammam na ahosi kamma vipāko ti evamādīsu saṅkham gacchanti
translated: ‘By ripening’: and the schism in the Community ripens by rebirth-linking for him who has done the five actions entailing immediate retribution. The other actions are reckoned as follows in the passage beginning, ‘There was action but not result of action’ .🔽In the absence of schism in the Community, the drawing of blood is the most serious,🔽in the absence of that, the killing of an arahat,

original: Saṅghabhedābhāve lohituppādo, tadabhāve arahantaghāto, tadabhāve sace pitā sīlavā
analyzed: saṅgha bheda abhāve lohituppādaḥ tad abhāve arahantaghāto tad abhāve sace pitā sīlavā
translated: in the absence of that, if the father is virtuous,

original: hoti, mātā dussīlā no vā tathā sīlavatī, pitughāto paṭisandhivasena vipaccati. Sace
analyzed: hoti mātā dussīlā no vā tathā sīlavatī pitu ghāto paṭisandhi vasena vipaccati sace
translated: and the mother is immoral or virtuous, the killing of one’s mother ripens by rebirth-linking.

original: mātā mātughāto. Dvīsupi sīlena vā dussīlena vā samānesu mātughātova paṭisandhivasena
analyzed: mātā mātughātaḥ sīlena vā dussīlena vā samānesu mātughātaḥ uva paṭisandhi vasena
translated: If the mother is a matricide, then in the case of two mothers who are equal in virtue or immorality, the killing of the mother is the one that ripens by rebirth-linking;

original: vipaccati; mātā hi dukkarakāriṇī bahūpakārā ca puttānanti. Evamettha pākatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: vipaccati mātā hi dukkara kāriṇī bahu upakārā ca puttānam ti evam ettha pākataḥ api viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: for the mother is the one who does what is difficult to do and is the one who is of great service to the child.” This is how the exposition should be understood here too.

original: ‘Sādhāraṇādīhī’ti purimāni cattāri sabbesampi gahaṭṭhapabbajitānaṃ sādhāraṇāni. Saṅghabhedo
analyzed: sādhāraṇa ādīhi iti purimāni cattāri sabbesam pi gaha ṭṭha pabbajitānam sādhāraṇāni saṅgha bhedaḥ
translated: As regards the shared and so on: the first four are shared by all householders and those gone forth. But schism in the Community🔽is for a monk who is fully ordained, who is of the same affiliation, who is standing in the same territory, who is dividing the Community.

original: pana “na kho, upāli, bhikkhunī saṅghaṃ bhindati, na sikkhamānā, na sāmaṇero, na sāmaṇerī,
analyzed: pana na kho upāli bhikkhunī saṅgham bhindati na sikkhamānā na sāmaṇeraḥ na sāmaṇerī
translated: For it is said: “Upāli, a nun does not divide the Community, nor a female trainee, nor a male novice, nor a female novice,

original: na upāsako, na upāsikā saṅghaṃ bhindati. Bhikkhu kho, upāli, pakatatto samānasaṃvāsako
analyzed: na upāsakaḥ na upāsikā saṅgham bhindati bhikkhu kho upāli pakatattaḥ samāna saṃvāsakaḥ
translated: nor a male lay follower, nor a female lay follower.

original: samānasīmāyaṃ ṭhito saṅghaṃ bhindatī”ti vacanato vuttappakārassa bhikkhunova hoti,
analyzed: samāna sīmāyam ṭhitaḥ saṅgham bhindati iti vacanataḥ vutta ppakārassa bhikkhuno u va hoti
translated: A monk who is fully ordained, Upāli, who is of the same affiliation, who is standing in the same territory, divides the Community” .

original: na aññassa; tasmā asādhāraṇo. Ādisaddena sabbepete dukkhavedanāsahagatā dosamohasampayuttā
analyzed: na aññassa tasmai asādhāraṇaḥ ādi saddena dukkha vedanā sahagatā dosa moha sampayuttā
translated: not another’s, therefore it is not shared. By the word ‘etc.’ are included all these associated with pain and with hate and delusion.

original: cāti evamettha sādhāraṇādīhipi viññātabbo vinicchayo.🔽Aññaṃ satthāranti ‘ayaṃ me satthā satthukiccaṃ kātuṃ samattho’ti bhavantarepi aññaṃ
analyzed: ca ati evam ettha sādhāraṇa ādīhi pi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ  aññam satthāran ti ayam me satthā satthu kiccam kātum samatthaḥ iti bhavantare pi aññam
translated: So the exposition should be known here as to shared and unshared, etc., too.

original: titthakaraṃ ‘ayaṃ me satthā’ti evaṃ gaṇheyya – netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatīti attho. Aṭṭhamaṃ
analyzed: titthakaram ayam me satthā ati evam gaṇheyya na itam ṭhānam vijjati iti atthaḥ aṭṭhamam
translated: ‘He would not take up another teacher’: the meaning is that he would not take up another sect-master as his teacher, thinking ‘This is my teacher, he is able to do the teacher’s job,’ even in a future existence. The eighth

original: bhavaṃ nibbatteyyāti sabbamandapaññopi sattamaṃ bhavaṃ atikkamitvā aṭṭhamaṃ nibbatteyya🔽– netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati. Uttamakoṭiyā hi sattamaṃ bhavaṃ sandhāyevesa “niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti🔽vutto. Kiṃ pana taṃ niyāmeti? Kiṃ pubbahetu niyāmeti udāhu paṭiladdhamaggo udāhu
analyzed: bhavam nibbatteyya ati sabba manda paññaḥ api sattamam bhavam atikkamitvā aṭṭhamam nibbatteyya  na itam ṭhānam vijjati uttama koṭiyāḥ hi sattamam bhavam sandhāya iva īsa niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti  vuttaḥ kim pana tam niyāmeti kim pubba hetu niyāmeti udāhu paṭiladdha maggaḥ udāhu
translated: ‘He would not be reborn in an eighth existence’: even one of slow understanding would surmount the seventh existence and be reborn in an eighth existence—🔽this is impossible. For this ‘he is certain to attain supreme enlightenment’ is said only with reference to the seventh existence at the most. But what is it that determines him? Is it a previous cause that determines him, or is it the path that he has obtained, or is it the three higher paths?

original: upari tayo maggāti? Sammāsambuddhena gahitaṃ nāmamattametaṃ. Puggalo pana niyato
analyzed: upari tayaḥ maggāḥ ti sammāsambuddhena gahitam nāma mattam etam puggalaḥ pana niyataḥ
translated: This is merely a name taken by the Fully Enlightened One. But the person is determined

original: nāma natthi. “Pubbahetu niyāmetī”ti vutte hi upari tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ upanissayo vutto
analyzed: nāma natthi pubba hetu niyāmeti iti vutte hi upari tiṇṇam maggānam upanissayaḥ vutto
translated: There is no such thing. If it were said that the past cause determines, then the past cause would be the decisive support for the three higher paths,

original: hoti, paṭhamamaggassa upanissayābhāvo āpajjati. Iccassa ahetu appaccayā nibbattiṃ🔽pāpuṇāti. “Paṭiladdhamaggo niyāmetī”ti vutte upari tayo maggā akiccakā honti, paṭhamamaggova🔽sakiccako, paṭhamamaggeneva kilese khepetvā parinibbāyitabbaṃ hoti. “Upari tayo maggā🔽niyāmentī”ti vutte paṭhamamaggo akiccako hoti, upari tayo maggāva sakiccakā, paṭhamamaggaṃ
analyzed: hoti paṭhama maggassa upanissaya abhāvaḥ āpajjati iccassa ahetu appaccayā nibbattim  pāpuṇāti paṭiladdha maggaḥ niyāmeti iti vutte upari tayo maggāḥ akiccakāḥ honti paṭhama maggā uva  paṭhama maggena iva kilese khepetvā parinibbāyitabbam hoti upari tayaḥ maggāḥ  niyāmenti iti vutte paṭhama maggaḥ akiccakaḥ hoti upari tayo maggāḥ sa kiccakā paṭhama maggam
translated: and it would follow that the first path has no decisive support. And then it would be born without cause and condition.🔽If it were said that the path already obtained determines, then the three higher paths would be useless, and only the first path would be useful. And then defilements would have to be eliminated and Nibbāna reached without the first path being produced.

original: anibbattetvā upari tayo maggā nibbattetabbā honti, paṭhamamaggena ca anuppajjitvāva
analyzed: a nibbattetvā upari tayo maggāḥ nibbattetabbāḥ honti paṭhama maggena ca an uppajjitvā ava
translated: If it were said that the three higher paths determine, then the first path would be useless, and only the three higher paths would be useful. And then the three higher paths would have to be produced without the first path being produced, and defilements would have to be eliminated without being reached by the first path.

original: kilesā khepetabbā honti. Tasmā na añño koci niyāmeti, upari tiṇṇaṃ maggānaṃ vipassanāva
analyzed: kilesā khepetabbāḥ honti tasmā na aññaḥ koci niyāmeti upari tiṇṇam maggānam vipassanā ava
translated: That is why no one else determines. It is insight that determines the three higher paths.

original: niyāmeti. Sace hi tesaṃ vipassanā tikkhā sūrā hutvā vahati, ekaṃyeva bhavaṃ nibbattetvā
analyzed: niyāmā iti sace hi tesam vipassanā tikkhā sūrā hutvā vahati ekam yā iva bhavam nibbattetvā
translated: For if insight proceeds rapidly and powerfully in them, they will be reborn only once more and

original: arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāti. Tato mandatarapañño dutiye vā tatiye vā catutthe vā
analyzed: arahattam patvā parinibbāti tatas mandatara paññaḥ dutiye vā tatiye vā catutthe vā
translated: and attains Nibbāna. The one of medium slow understanding attains Arahantship in the second, third, fourth,

original: pañcame vā chaṭṭhe vā bhave arahattaṃ patvā parinibbāti. Sabbamandapañño sattamaṃ
analyzed: pañcame vā chaṭṭhe vā bhave arahattam patvā parinibbāti sabba manda paññaḥ sattamam
translated: fifth, or sixth becoming. The one of very slow understanding is reborn in a seventh

original: bhavaṃ nibbattetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇāti, aṭṭhame bhave paṭisandhi na hoti. Iti sammāsambuddhena
analyzed: bhavam nibbattetvā arahattam pāpuṇāti aṭṭhame bhave paṭisandhi na hoti iti sammāsambuddhena
translated: becoming and then attains Arahantship. After that there is no rebirth. Thus this is merely a name

original: gahitaṃ nāmamattametaṃ. Satthā hi buddhatulāya tuletvā sabbaññutañāṇena paricchinditvā
analyzed: gahitam nāma mattam etam satthā hi buddha tulāya tuletvā sabbaññuta ñāṇena paricchinditvā
translated: given by the Fully Enlightened One. For the Teacher, having weighed him with the scale of Buddha- knowledge, has defined him thus:

original: ‘ayaṃ puggalo sabbamahāpañño tikkhavipassako ekameva bhavaṃ nibbattetvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: ayam puggalaḥ sabba mahā paññaḥ tikkha vipassakaḥ ekam eva bhavam nibbattetvā arahattam
translated: ‘This person, of all the greatly wise, of all those of keen insight, will be reborn in one becoming only and will then attain Arahantship.’

original: gaṇhissatī’ti ‘ekabījī’ti nāmaṃ akāsi; ‘ayaṃ puggalo dutiyaṃ, tatiyaṃ, catutthaṃ,
analyzed: gaṇhissati iti ekabījī iti nāmam akāsi ayam puggalaḥ dutiyam tatiyam catuttham
translated: And he has given him the name ‘one-seeder.’ ‘This person will be reborn in a second, third, fourth,

original: pañcamaṃ, chaṭṭhaṃ bhavaṃ nibbattetvā arahattaṃ gaṇhissatī’ti ‘kolaṃkolo’ti nāmaṃ
analyzed: pañcamam chaṭṭham bhavam nibbattetvā arahattam gaṇhissati iti kolaṃkoloti nāmaṃ
translated: fifth, or sixth becoming and will then attain Arahantship,’ and he has given him the name ‘cluster-ender.’

original: akāsi; ‘ayaṃ puggalo sattamaṃ bhavaṃ nibbattetvā arahattaṃ gaṇhissatī’ti ‘sattakkhattuparamo’ti nāmaṃ akāsi.
analyzed: akāsi ayam puggalaḥ sattamam bhavam nibbattetvā arahattam gaṇhissati iti satta kkhattu paramaḥ ti nāmam akāsi
translated: ‘This person will be reborn in a seventh becoming and will then attain Arahantship,’ and he has given him the name ‘one who goes to perdition seven times.’

original: Koci pana puggalo sattannaṃ bhavānaṃ niyato nāma natthi. Ariyasāvako pana yena kenacipi
analyzed: koci pana puggalo sattannam bhavānam niyataḥ nāma natthi ariya sāvako pana yena kenacid pi
translated: But there is no one who is definitely limited to seven existences.

original: ākārena mandapañño samāno aṭṭhamaṃ bhavaṃ appatvā antarāva parinibbāti. Sakkasadisopi
analyzed: ākārena manda pañño samānaḥ aṭṭhamam bhavam ap patvā antarā ava parinibbāti sakka sadisaḥ pi
translated: However, a noble disciple, even though he is of dull intellect in some way or other, does not reach an eighth existence, but attains Nibbāna in the interval.🔽Even one who is devoted to the round of existences like Sakka

original: vaṭṭābhirato sattamaṃyeva bhavaṃ gacchati. Sattame bhave sabbakārena pamādavihārinopi
analyzed: vaṭṭa abhirataḥ sattamaṃya iva bhavam gacchati sattame bhave sabba kārena pamāda vihārino pi
translated: reaches only the seventh existence. In the seventh existence, even one who dwells in negligence in every way

original: vipassanāñāṇaṃ paripākaṃ gacchati. Appamattakepi ārammaṇe nibbinditvā nibbutiṃ pāpuṇāti.🔽Sacepi hissa sattame bhave niddaṃ vā okkamantassa, parammukhaṃ vā gacchantassa, pacchato
analyzed: vipassanā ñāṇam paripākam gacchati appamattake api ārammaṇe nibbinditvā nibbutim pāpuṇāti  sace pi hissa sattame bhave niddam vā okkamantassa parammukham vā gacchantassa pacchatas
translated: brings to maturity the knowledge of insight. He becomes dispassionate towards even a trifling object and attains dispassion.🔽For even if he were to fall asleep, or die with his face turned away,

original: ṭhatvā tikhiṇena asinā kocideva sīsaṃ pāteyya, udake vā osādetvā māreyya, asani vā
analyzed: ṭhatvā tikhiṇena asinā kocid eva sīsam pāteyyaḥ udake vā osādetvā māreyyaḥ asani vā
translated: or if someone were to strike off his head with a sharp sword while he is standing behind him, or if he were to be drowned in water,

original: panassa sīse pateyya, evarūpepi kāle sappaṭisandhikā kālaṃkiriyā nāma na hoti, arahattaṃ
analyzed: panassa sīse pateyya evarūpe pi kāle sappaṭisandhikā kālaṃkiriyā nāma na hoti arahattam
translated: or if lightning were to strike his head, there is no death with rebirth-linking in such a case.

original: patvāva parinibbāti. Tena vuttaṃ – “aṭṭhamaṃ bhavaṃ nibbatteyya – netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjatī”ti.
analyzed: patvā ava parinibbāti tena vuttam aṭṭhamam bhavam nibbatteyya  na etam ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: and he attains extinction without ever returning from that world. Hence it was said above: “It is not possible that he will be reborn in an eighth existence” .
