original: Ekissā lokadhātuyāti dasasahassilokadhātuyā. Tīṇi hi khettāni – jātikhettaṃ, āṇākhettaṃ,
analyzed: ekissā lokadhātuyā ati dasa sahassi lokadhātuyā tīṇi hi khettāni jāti khettam āṇā khettam
translated: In one world-element : in a world-system consisting of four continents, a primary and a minor world-system, and a single universe. For there are three “fields” : the field of birth, the field of command,

original: visayakkhettanti. Tattha ‘jātikkhettaṃ’ nāma dasasahassilokadhātu. Sā hi tathāgatassa
analyzed: visaya khettanti tattha jāti kkhettam nāma dasa sahassi lokadhātu sā hi tathāgatassa
translated: and the field of influence. Herein, the field of birth is a world-system consisting of a single universe,

original: mātukucchiokkamanakāle, nikkhamanakāle, sambodhikāle, dhammacakkapavattane, āyusaṅkhāravossajjane,🔽parinibbāne ca kampati. Koṭisatasahassacakkavāḷaṃ pana ‘āṇākhettaṃ’ nāma. Āṭānāṭiyamoraparittadhajaggaparittaratanaparittādīnañhi
analyzed: mātu kucchi ukkamana kāle nikkhamana kāle sambodhi kāle dhammacakka pavattane āyu saṅkhāra vossajjane  parinibbāne ca kampati koṭi sata sahassa cakkavāḷam pana āṇā khettam nāma āṭā nāṭiya mora paritta dhajagga paritta ratana paritta ādīnam hi
translated: for it shakes when a Perfect One is conceived, when he is born, when he attains supreme enlightenment, when he sets in motion the Wheel of the Dhamma, when he relinquishes the life-process,

original: ettha āṇā vattati. ‘Visayakhettassa’ pana parimāṇaṃ natthi. Buddhānañhi “yāvatakaṃ🔽ñāṇaṃ tāvatakaṃ ñeyyaṃ, yāvatakaṃ ñeyyaṃ tāvatakaṃ ñāṇaṃ, ñāṇapariyantikaṃ ñeyyaṃ,
analyzed: ettha āṇā vattati visaya khettassa pana parimāṇam natthi buddhānam hi yāvatakam 🔽ñāṇam tāvatakam ñeyyam yāvatakam ñeyyam tāvatakam ñāṇam ñāṇa pariyantikam ñeyyam
translated: and when he attains final extinction. But the field of command is a world-system consisting of a million world-spheres, for the Buddha’s command extends over that. But there is no limit to the field of influence, for the knowledge of the Buddhas extends over the entire world.

original: ñeyyapariyantikaṃ ñāṇa”nti vacanato avisayo nāma natthi.
analyzed: ñeyya pariyantikam ñāṇan ti vacanataḥ avisayaḥ nāma natthi
translated: “There is no field of knowledge that is beyond his knowledge” .

original: Imesu pana tīsu khettesu, ṭhapetvā imaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ, aññasmiṃ cakkavāḷe buddhā uppajjantīti
analyzed: imesu pana tīsu khettesu ṭhapetvā imam cakkavāḷam aññasmin cakkavāḷe buddhāḥ uppajjanti iti
translated: But as for these three fields, apart from this world-system there is no sutta to the effect that Buddhas arise in another world-system,🔽but there is a sutta to the effect that they do not arise there.

original: suttaṃ natthi, na uppajjantīti pana atthi. Tīṇi piṭakāni – vinayapiṭakaṃ, suttantapiṭakaṃ,🔽abhidhammapiṭakanti. Tisso saṅgītiyo – mahākassapattherassa saṅgīti, yasattherassa
analyzed: suttam natthi na uppajjanti iti pana atthi tīṇi piṭakāni vinaya piṭakam suttanta piṭakam  abhidhamma piṭakanti tissaḥ saṅgītiyaḥ mahākassapa therassa saṅgīti yasa therassa
translated: The three Piṭakas are the Vinaya Piṭaka, the Suttanta Piṭaka,🔽and the Abhidhamma Piṭaka. The three Councils were the Council of the Elder Mahākassapa,

original: saṅgīti, moggaliputtatissattherassa saṅgītīti. Imā tisso saṅgītiyo āruḷhe tepiṭake
analyzed: saṅgīti moggaliputta tissa therassa saṅgīti iti imāḥ tissaḥ saṅgītiyaḥ āruḷhe tepiṭake
translated: the Council of the Elder Yasatthero, and the Council of the Elder Moggaliputtatissa.

original: buddhavacane imaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ muñcitvā aññattha buddhā uppajjantīti suttaṃ natthi,
analyzed: buddha vacane imam cakkavāḷam muñcitvā aññattha buddhāḥ uppajjanti iti suttam na atthi
translated: As for these three Councils, apart from the world-system described in the Piṭakas, there is no sutta to the effect that Buddhas arise elsewhere,

original: nuppajjantīti pana atthi.
analyzed: nuppajjanti iti pana atthi
translated: but there is a sutta to the effect that they do not arise there.

original: Apubbaṃ acarimanti apure apacchā; ekato nuppajjanti, pure vā pacchā vā uppajjantīti
analyzed: a pubbam a carimanti a pure apacchā ekatas nu uppajjanti pure vā pacchā vā uppajjanti iti
translated: “They did not arise before” : they did not arise before or after; they do not arise together, but they arise either before or after.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Tattha bodhipallaṅke “bodhiṃ appatvā na uṭṭhahissāmī”ti nisinnakālato
analyzed: vuttam hoti tattha bodhi pallaṅke bodhim a patvā na uṭṭhahissāmi iti nisinna kālataḥ
translated: Herein, from the time that the Bodhisatta sat down on the throne of enlightenment, thinking, “I will not rise until I have attained enlightenment,”

original: paṭṭhāya yāva mātukucchismiṃ paṭisandhiggahaṇaṃ tāva pubbenti na veditabbaṃ. Bodhisattassa🔽hi paṭisandhiggahaṇe dasasahassacakkavāḷakampaneneva jātikkhettapariggaho kato, aññassa
analyzed: paṭṭhāya yāva mātukucchismim paṭisandhi ggahaṇam tāva na veditabbam bodhisattassa  hi paṭisandhi ggahaṇe dasa sahassa cakkavāḷa kampanena iva jāti khetta pariggaho kataḥ aññassa
translated: but it should not be understood that they are the same as the time from the arousing of the aspiration until the descent into the womb.

original: buddhassa uppatti nivāritā hoti. Parinibbānato paṭṭhāya ca yāva sāsapamattāpi dhātuyo
analyzed: buddhassa uppatti nivāritā hoti parinibbānato paṭṭhāya ca yāva sāsapa mattā api dhātuyo
translated: For when the Bodhisatta’s descent into the womb takes place, the field of the birth is delimited by the quaking of the ten-thousand world-element, and the arising of another Buddha is prevented.🔽And it should not be understood that the time is the same as the time from the parinibbāna until the relics remain, even for the duration of a finger-snap.

original: tiṭṭhanti tāva pacchāti na veditabbaṃ. Dhātūsu hi ṭhitāsu buddhā ṭhitāva honti. Tasmā
analyzed: tiṭṭhanti tāva pacchā ati na veditabbam dhātūsu hi ṭhitāsu buddhāḥ ṭhitā ava honti tasmā
translated: For as long as the relics remain, so long do the Buddhas remain. Therefore

original: etthantare aññassa buddhassa uppatti nivāritāva hoti, dhātuparinibbāne pana jāte
analyzed: etthantare aññassa buddhassa uppatti nivāritā ava hoti dhātu parinibbāne pana jāte
translated: the arising of another Buddha is prevented during that time. But when the relics have finally disappeared,

original: aññassa buddhassa uppatti na nivāritā.🔽Tīṇi hi antaradhānāni nāma – pariyattiantaradhānaṃ, paṭivedhaantaradhānaṃ, paṭipattiantaradhānanti.
analyzed: aññassa buddhassa uppatti na nivāritā  tīṇi hi antaradhānāni nāma pariyatti antaradhānam paṭivedha antaradhānam paṭipatti antaradhānanti
translated: the arising of another Buddha is not prevented.🔽There are three kinds of disappearance, that is to say, disappearance of the tradition, disappearance of the direct knowledge, and disappearance of the practice.

original: Tattha ‘pariyattī’ti tīṇi piṭakāni; ‘paṭivedho’ti saccapaṭivedho; ‘paṭipattī’ti paṭipadā.
analyzed: tattha pariyatti iti tīṇi piṭakāni paṭivedho ti sacca paṭivedho paṭipatti iti paṭipadā
translated: Herein, the “tradition” is the three Piṭakas; the “direct knowledge” is the penetration of the truths; the “practice” is the way.

original: Tattha paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hotipi na hotipi. Ekasmiñhi kāle paṭivedhakarā bhikkhū🔽bahū honti; ‘esa bhikkhu puthujjano’ti aṅguliṃ pasāretvā dassetabbo hoti. Imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: tattha paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hoti pi na hoti pi ekasmin hi kāle paṭivedha karāḥ bhikkhū  bahū honti esa bhikkhu puthujjanaḥ ti aṅgulim pasāretvā dassetabbo hoti imasmin yeva
translated: Herein, penetration and practice may or may not be. For at one time there are many bhikkhus who are penetrating,

original: dīpe ekavāraṃ kira puthujjanabhikkhu nāma nāhosi. Paṭipattipūrakāpi kadāci bahū honti,
analyzed: dīpe eka vāram kira puthujjana bhikkhu nāma na ahosi paṭipatti pūrakā api kadāci bahū honti
translated: and then it is possible to point out a bhikkhu as an ordinary man by extending the index finger thus . In this very island, it seems, there was never an ordinary man bhikkhu. And those who fulfil the practice are sometimes many and sometimes few.

original: kadāci appā. Iti paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hotipi na hotipi.
analyzed: kadāci appā iti paṭivedho ca paṭipatti ca hoti pi na hoti pi
translated: So penetration and practice may or may not be.

original: Sāsanaṭṭhitiyā pana pariyattiyeva pamāṇaṃ. Paṇḍito hi tepiṭakaṃ sutvā dvepi pūreti.
analyzed: sāsana ṭṭhitiyā pana pariyattiyā iva pamāṇam paṇḍitaḥ hi tepiṭakam sutvā dve pi pūreti
translated: But the scriptures alone are the measure of the duration of the Dispensation. For the wise man fulfils both by learning the three Piṭakas.

original: Yathā amhākaṃ bodhisatto āḷārassa santike pañcābhiññā satta ca samāpattiyo nibbattetvā🔽nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā parikammaṃ pucchi, so ‘na jānāmī’ti āha; tato udakassa
analyzed: yathā amhākam bodhisattaḥ āḷārassa santike pañca abhiññā satta ca samāpattiyaḥ nibbattetvā  nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana samāpattiyā parikammam pucchi saḥ na jānāmi iti āha tatas udakassa
translated: For example, our Bodhisatta, after producing the five kinds of supernormal power and the seven kinds of knowledge in Āḷāra Kālāma’s presence,🔽asked for the preliminary work for the attainment of the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception. Āḷāra Kālāma said, “I do not know it.” Then he went to Uddaka Rāmaputta,

original: santikaṃ gantvā adhigatavisesaṃ saṃsandetvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammaṃ
analyzed: santikam gantvā adhigata visesam saṃsandetvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammam
translated: and after explaining the special quality he had discovered, he asked for the preliminary work for the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: pucchi; so ācikkhi; tassa vacanasamanantarameva mahāsatto taṃ sampādesi; evameva
analyzed: pucchi saḥ ācikkhi tassa vacana samanantaram eva mahāsatto tam sampādesi evam eva
translated: He asked the Elder, who explained it to him. Immediately after the Elder’s explanation the Great Being accomplished it. So too

original: paññavā bhikkhu pariyattiṃ sutvā dvepi pūreti. Tasmā pariyattiyā ṭhitāya sāsanaṃ
analyzed: paññavā bhikkhu pariyattim sutvā dve api pūreti tasmai pariyattiyā ṭhitāya sāsanam
translated: the wise bhikkhu, after learning the scriptures, fulfills both. Therefore when the scriptures are established the Dispensation

original: ṭhitaṃ hoti. Yadā pana sā antaradhāyati tadā paṭhamaṃ abhidhammapiṭakaṃ nassati.
analyzed: ṭhitam hoti yadā pana sā antaradhāyati tadā paṭhamam abhidhamma piṭakam nassati
translated: is established. But when they disappear first the Abhidhamma Piṭaka disappears.

original: Tattha paṭṭhānaṃ sabbapaṭhamaṃ antaradhāyati. Anukkamena pacchā dhammasaṅgaho. Tasmiṃ
analyzed: tattha paṭṭhānam sabba paṭhamam antaradhāyati anukkamena pacchā dhamma saṅgaho tasmin
translated: Herein, the Paṭṭhāna is the first to disappear. In due course later the Dhammasanganī disappears. When that has

original: antarahite itaresu dvīsu piṭakesu ṭhitesu sāsanaṃ ṭhitameva hoti.🔽Tattha suttantapiṭake antaradhāyamāne paṭhamaṃ aṅguttaranikāyo ekādasakato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: antar ahite itaresu dvīsu piṭakesu ṭhitesu sāsanam ṭhitam eva hoti  tattha suttanta piṭake antaradhāyamāne paṭhamam aṅguttara nikāyo ekādasakataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: disappeared, the Dispensation is still established in the remaining two Piṭakas.🔽Herein, when the Sutta Piṭaka is disappearing, first the Anguttara Nikāya disappears, starting from the Elevens

original: yāva ekakā antaradhāyati. Tadanantaraṃ saṃyuttanikāyo cakkapeyyālato paṭṭhāya yāva
analyzed: yāva ekakā antaradhāyati tad anantaram saṃyutta nikāyo cakkapeyyālato paṭṭhāya yāva
translated: and going back to the Ones. Next the Saṃyutta Nikāya disappears, starting from the Cakka-peyyāla and going forward to the

original: oghataraṇā antaradhāyati. Tadanantaraṃ majjhimanikāyo indriyabhāvanato paṭṭhāya yāva
analyzed: ogha taraṇā antaradhāyati tad anantaram majjhima nikāyaḥ indriya bhāvanataḥ paṭṭhāya yāva
translated: Ogha-peyyāla. Next the Majjhima Nikāya disappears, starting from the Indriyabhāvanā and going forward to the

original: mūlapariyāyā antaradhāyati. Tadanantaraṃ dīghanikāyo dasuttarato paṭṭhāya yāva brahmajālā
analyzed: mūla pariyāyāḥ tad anantaram dīgha nikāyaḥ paṭṭhāya yāva brahmajālā
translated: The root text disappears. Next the Dīgha Nikāya disappears, starting from the Dasuttara Sutta and ending with the Brahmajāla Sutta.

original: antaradhāyati. Ekissāpi dvinnampi gāthānaṃ pucchā addhānaṃ gacchati; sāsanaṃ dhāretuṃ🔽na sakkoti sabhiyapucchā viya āḷavakapucchā viya ca. Etā kira kassapabuddhakālikā
analyzed: antaradhāyati ekissā api dvinnam pi gāthānam pucchā addhānam gacchati sāsanam dhāretum  na sakkoti sabhiya pucchā viya āḷavaka pucchā viya ca etā kira kassapa buddha kālikā
translated: If even one verse of the two is asked about, the Dispensation goes on a journey; it cannot be borne.

original: antarā sāsanaṃ dhāretuṃ nāsakkhiṃsu.🔽Dvīsu pana piṭakesu antarahitesupi vinayapiṭake ṭhite sāsanaṃ tiṭṭhati. Parivārakhandhakesu
analyzed: antarā sāsanam dhāretum na asakkhiṃsu  dvīsu pana piṭakesu antarahitesu pi vinaya piṭake ṭhite sāsanam tiṭṭhati parivāra khandhakesu
translated: It is said that they were unable to bear the Dispensation during the interval between the Buddhas Kassapa and Gotama.🔽But even when two of the Piṭakas have disappeared, the Dispensation remains as long as the Vinaya Piṭaka remains.🔽When the Parivāra and the Khandhakas have disappeared, it remains as long as the two Vibhaṅgas remain.

original: antarahitesu ubhatovibhaṅge ṭhite ṭhitameva hoti. Ubhatovibhaṅge antarahite mātikāya
analyzed: anta rahitesu ubhatas vibhaṅge ṭhite ṭhitam eva hoti ubhatas vibhaṅge anta rahite
translated: When the two Vibhaṅgas have disappeared, it remains as long as the mātikā remains.

original: ṭhitāyapi ṭhitameva hoti. Mātikāya antarahitāya pātimokkhapabbajjāupasampadāsu ṭhitāsu
analyzed: ṭhitāya api ṭhitam eva hoti mātikāya antara hitāya pātimokkha pabbajjā upasampadāsu ṭhitāsu
translated: When the mātikā has disappeared, the Dispensation remains as long as the Pāṭimokkha, the admission , and the full admission remain.

original: sāsanaṃ tiṭṭhati. Liṅgaṃ addhānaṃ gacchati. Setavatthasamaṇavaṃso pana kassapabuddhakālato
analyzed: sāsanam tiṭṭhati liṅgam addhānam gacchati setavattha samaṇa vaṃso pana kassapa buddha kālato
translated: The sign goes on a journey. But the lineage of the white-clothed ascetics goes back to the time of the Buddha Kassapa.

original: paṭṭhāya sāsanaṃ dhāretuṃ nāsakkhi. Pacchimakassa pana saccapaṭivedhato pacchimakassa
analyzed: paṭṭhāya sāsanam dhāretum na asakkhi pacchimakassa pana sacca paṭivedhato pacchimakassa
translated: and from that time on the Dispensation was unable to be upheld. But from the time of the breach of morality of the last (patriarch)

original: sīlabhedato ca paṭṭhāya sāsanaṃ osakkitaṃ nāma hoti. Tato paṭṭhāya aññassa buddhassa uppatti na vāritā.

The fire element will arise in the relics and will blaze up as far as the Brahmā world.

analyzed: ekasmin pana dhammam desente desanā api acchariyā hoti vivāda bhāvato ca bahūsu ca  buddhesu uppannesu bahūnam ācariyānam antevāsikāḥ viya amhākam buddhaḥ pāsādikaḥ amhākam

analyzed: kim nu kho bhante nāgasena ati dhamma bhārena pathavī calati iti mahā rāja

original: sakaṭaṃ bhijjatī”ti? “Āma, bhante”ti. “Evameva kho, mahārāja, atidhammabhārena pathavī calatīti.🔽“Apica, mahārāja, imaṃ kāraṇaṃ buddhabalaparidīpanāya osāritaṃ. analyzed: sakaṭam bhijjati iti āma bhante iti evam eva kho mahā rāja ati dhamma bhārena pathavī calati iti  apica mahā rāja imam kāraṇam buddha bala paridīpanāya osāritam aññam pi tattha patirūpam  kāraṇam suṇohi yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka kkhaṇe nu pajjanti yadi mahā rāja  dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka kkhaṇe uppajjeyyum parisāya vivādaḥ uppajjeyya tumhākam

As, sire, if two powerful wrestlers were to meet in combat, they would be divided into two factions.

original: parisāya vivādo uppajjeyya – ‘tumhākaṃ amacco, amhākaṃ amacco’ti ubhatopakkhajātā
analyzed: parisāya vivādaḥ uppajjeyya tumhākam amaccaḥ amhākam amaccaḥ iti ubhatas pakkha jātā
translated: and there would be a dispute in the assembly: ‘Your minister, our minister.’

original: honti; evameva kho, mahārāja, yadi dve sammāsambuddhā ekakkhaṇe uppajjeyyuṃ, tesaṃ
analyzed: honti evam eva kho mahā rāja yadi dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka khaṇe uppajjeyyum tesam
translated: Just so, sire, if two Perfect Buddhas were to arise at one time,

original: parisāya vivādo uppajjeyya – ‘tumhākaṃ buddho, amhākaṃ buddho’ti ubhatopakkhajātā
analyzed: parisāya vivādaḥ uppajjeyya tumhākam buddhaḥ amhākam buddhaḥ iti ubhatas pakkha jātā
translated: there would be a dispute in their assemblies: ‘Your Buddha, our Buddha.’

analyzed: bhaveyyum idam tāva mahā rāja ekam kāraṇam yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka khaṇe na uppajjanti
translated: This, sire, is one reason why two Perfect Buddhas do not arise at one time.

original: “Aparampi uttariṃ kāraṇaṃ suṇohi yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhā ekakkhaṇe nuppajjanti.
analyzed: aparam pi uttarim kāraṇam suṇohi yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka khaṇe na uppajjanti
translated: “Listen further, sire, to another reason why two Perfect Buddhas do not arise at one time.

original: Yadi, mahārāja, dve sammāsambuddhā ekakkhaṇe uppajjeyyuṃ ‘aggo buddho’ti yaṃ vacanaṃ
analyzed: yadi mahā rāja dve sammāsambuddhāḥ eka kkhaṇe uppajjeyyum aggaḥ buddhaḥ iti yam vacanam
translated: If, sire, two Perfect Buddhas were to arise at one time, then the statement: ‘The Buddha is the foremost of men’

analyzed: tam micchā bhaveyya jeṭṭhaḥ buddho iti seṭṭhaḥ buddho iti visiṭṭhaḥ buddho iti uttamaḥ
translated: would be false, and the statement: ‘The Buddha is the chief, the best, the highest, the excellent,

original: buddho’ti ‘pavaro buddho’ti ‘asamo buddho’ti ‘asamasamo buddho’ti ‘appaṭisamo buddho’ti
analyzed: buddho ti pavaraḥ buddho ti asamaḥ buddho ti asamasamaḥ buddho ti appaṭisamaḥ buddho ti
translated: the supreme, the incomparable, the matchless, the unequalled’

original: ‘appaṭibhāgī buddho’ti ‘appaṭipuggalo buddho’ti yaṃ vacanaṃ taṃ micchā bhaveyya.
analyzed: appaṭibhāgī buddhaḥ ti appaṭipuggalaḥ buddhaḥ iti yam vacanam tam micchā bhaveyya
translated: ‘The Buddha has no equal’ and ‘The Buddha has no counterpart’ would be a wrong statement.

original: Idampi kho tvaṃ, mahārāja, kāraṇaṃ tathato sampaṭiccha yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhā🔽ekakkhaṇe nuppajjanti.
analyzed: idam api kho tvam mahā rāja kāraṇam tathatas sampaṭiccha yena kāraṇena dve sammāsambuddhā  eka khaṇe nu uppajjanti
translated: This, too, is a reason why two Fully Enlightened Buddhas do not arise simultaneously.

original: “Apica, mahārāja, buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ sabhāvapakati esā yaṃ ekoyeva buddho loke
analyzed: apica mahā rāja buddhānam bhagavantānam sabhāva pakati esā yam ekaḥ yā iva buddhaḥ loke
translated: ‘Again, sire, it is the very nature of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, that there is only one Buddha in the world.

original: uppajjati. Kasmā kāraṇā? Mahantattā sabbaññubuddhaguṇānaṃ. Aññampi, mahārāja, yaṃ🔽loke mahantaṃ taṃ ekaṃyeva hoti. Pathavī, mahārāja, mahantā, sā ekāyeva; sāgaro mahanto,🔽so ekoyeva; sineru girirājā mahanto, so ekoyeva; ākāso mahanto, so ekoyeva; sakko🔽mahanto, so ekoyeva; mahābrahmā mahanto, so ekoyeva; tathāgato arahaṃ sammāsambuddho
analyzed: uppajjati kasmā kāraṇā mahanta ttā sabbaññu buddha guṇānam aññam pi mahā rāja yam  loke mahantam tam ekaṃyā iva hoti pathavī mahā rāja mahantā sā ekāyā iva sāgaraḥ mahantaḥ  saḥ ekaḥ yā iva giri rājā mahantaḥ saḥ ekaḥ yā iva ākāsaḥ mahantaḥ saḥ ekaḥ yā iva sakko  mahantaḥ saḥ ekaḥ yā iva mahā brahmā mahantaḥ saḥ ekaḥ yā iva tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: And why? Because of the greatness of the qualities of the Omniscient Buddha. Moreover, sire,

original: mahanto, so ekoyeva lokasmiṃ. Yattha te uppajjanti tattha aññesaṃ okāso na hoti.
analyzed: mahantaḥ so eko yā iva lokasmiṃ yattha te uppajjanti tattha aññesam okāso na hoti
translated: whatever is great in the world is only one. The earth, sire, is great and it is only one; the ocean is great and it is only one; Sineru, the king of mountains, is great and it is only one; space is great and it is only one; Sakka is great and he is only one; Great Brahmā is great and he is only one; the Tathāgata, the arahat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is great and he is only one in the world. Where they arise there is no room for another.🔽‘Again, sire, the Tathāgata, the arahat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is great and he is only one in the world. Where they arise there is no room for another.

original: Tasmā, mahārāja, tathāgato arahaṃ sammāsambuddho ekoyeva loke uppajjatī”ti.
analyzed: tasmai mahā rāja tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ ekaḥ yā iva loke uppajjati iti
translated: Therefore, sire, the Tathāgata, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One appears in the world alone.”

original: “Sukathito, bhante nāgasena, pañho opammehi kāraṇehī”ti.🔽Ekissā lokadhātuyāti ekasmiṃ cakkavāḷe. Heṭṭhā imināva padena dasa cakkavāḷasahassāni
analyzed: su kathitaḥ bhante nāgasena pañhaḥ opammehi kāraṇehi iti  ekissā lokadhātuyā ati ekasmin cakkavāḷe heṭṭhā iminā ava padena dasa cakkavāḷa sahassāni
translated: “The question has been well answered, revered Nāgasena, with good reasons.”

original: gahitāni. Tānipi ekacakkavāḷeneva paricchindituṃ vaṭṭanti. Buddhā hi uppajjamānā🔽imasmiṃyeva cakkavāḷe uppajjanti; uppajjanaṭṭhāne pana vārite ito aññesu cakkavāḷesu
analyzed: gahitāni tāni api eka cakkavāḷena iva paricchinditum vaṭṭanti buddhā hi uppajjamānā  imasmin yeva cakkavāḷe uppajjanti uppajjana ṭṭhāne pana vārite itas aññesu cakkavāḷesu
translated: In one world-element means in one world-system. The ten thousand world-systems below are included by this very word. They too can be defined by one world-system. For Buddhas, when they appear,

original: na uppajjantīti vāritameva hoti. Apubbaṃ acarimanti ettha cakkaratanapātubhāvato🔽pubbe pubbaṃ, tasseva antaradhānato pacchā carimaṃ. Tattha dvidhā cakkaratanassa
analyzed: na uppajjanti iti vāritam eva hoti apubbam ettha cakka ratana pātubhāvato  pubbe pubbam tassa iva antaradhānato pacchā carimam tattha dvidhā cakkaratanassa
translated: appear in this very world-system. But when the place of appearance is obstructed, they do not appear in other world-systems, and so it is obstructed. They have not gone before means that before the appearance of the Wheel-Jewel

original: antaradhānaṃ hoti – cakkavattino kālakiriyāya vā pabbajjāya vā. Antaradhāyamānañca
analyzed: antaradhānam hoti cakkavattinaḥ kālakiriyāya vā pabbajjāya vā antaradhāyamānam ca
translated: it was the first, and after its disappearance it was the last. Herein, the disappearance of the Wheel-Jewel is twofold: by the death of the Wheel-turning Monarch or by his renunciation. And when it is disappearing

original: pana taṃ kālakiriyato vā pabbajjato vā sattame divase antaradhāyati. Tato paraṃ cakkavattino
analyzed: pana tam kālakiriyataḥ vā pabbajjataḥ vā sattame divase antaradhāyati tato param cakkavattinaḥ
translated: but it disappears either on the seventh day after his death or on the seventh day after his renunciation of the world.🔽After that there is no hindrance to the appearance of a Wheel-turning Monarch.

original: pātubhāvo avārito. Kasmā pana ekacakkavāḷe dve cakkavattino nuppajjantīti? Vivādupacchedato🔽anacchariyabhāvato cakkaratanassa mahānubhāvato ca. Dvīsu hi uppajjantesu ‘amhākaṃ
analyzed: pātubhāvaḥ a vārito kasmā pana eka cakkavāḷe dve cakkavattino na uppajjanti iti vivāda upacchedato  anacchariya bhāvataḥ cakkaratanassa mahā anubhāvataḥ ca dvīsu hi uppajjantesu amhākam
translated: But why do two Wheel-turning Monarchs not arise in one world-sphere?🔽Because of the cutting off of disputes,

original: rājā mahanto, amhākaṃ rājā mahanto’ti vivādo uppajjeyya. ‘Ekasmiṃ dīpe cakkavattī,
analyzed: rājā mahantaḥ amhākam rājā mahantaḥ iti vivādaḥ uppajjeyya ekasmin dīpe cakkavattī
translated: because of the non-marvellousness, and because of the great power of the Wheel Treasure. For if two were to arise, dispute would arise thus: ‘Our king is the great one, our king is the great one’;

original: ekasmiṃ dīpe cakkavattī’ti ca anacchariyo bhaveyya. Yo cāyaṃ cakkaratanassa dvisahassadīpaparivāresu
analyzed: ekasmin dīpe cakkavattī iti ca bhaveyya yaḥ ca ayam cakkaratanassa dvi sahassa dīpa parivāresu
translated: and it would not be marvellous if there were a Wheel-turning Monarch in one continent and another Wheel-turning Monarch in another continent.🔽And the great power of the Wheel Treasure, which is able to extend dominion over the two-thousand- continent world-sphere and the four great continents, would be diminished.

original: catūsu mahādīpesu issariyānuppadānasamattho mahānubhāvo, so parihāyeyya. Iti vivādupacchedato
analyzed: catūsu mahā dīpesu issariya an uppadāna samatthaḥ mahā anubhāvo so parihāyeyya iti vivāda upacchedato
translated: So because of the cutting off of disputes,

original: anacchariyabhāvato cakkaratanassa mahānubhāvato ca na ekacakkavāḷe dve uppajjanti.
analyzed: anacchariya bhāvataḥ cakkaratanassa mahā anubhāvataḥ ca na eka cakkavāḷe dve uppajjanti
translated: because of the non-marvellousness, and because of the great power of the Wheel Treasure, two do not arise in one world-sphere.

original: Yaṃ ittho arahaṃ assa sammāsambuddhoti ettha tiṭṭhatu tāva sabbaññuguṇe nibbattetvā lokattāraṇasamattho buddhabhāvo, paṇidhānamattampi itthiyā na sampajjati.
analyzed: yam ittho arahan assa sammāsambuddhaḥ ti ettha tiṭṭhatu tāva sabbaññu guṇe nibbattetvā loka ttāraṇa samatthaḥ buddha bhāvaḥ paṇidhāna mattam pi itthiyā na sampajjati
translated: As to the words “a woman who was a Perfect One, a fully enlightened Buddha” , let alone the state of being a Buddha, which is capable of saving the world by producing the special qualities of omniscience, the mere aspiration is not possible for a woman.🔽Human birth, the right sex,

original: “Manussattaṃ liṅgasampatti, hetu satthāradassanaṃ;
translated: The root of good, the seeing of a Buddha,🔽Going forth, the special qualities,

original: Pabbajjā guṇasampatti, adhikāro ca chandatā;
analyzed: pabbajjā guṇa sampatti adhikāraḥ ca chanda tā
translated: The opportunity, and the wish,🔽The combination of these eight factors

original: Aṭṭhadhammasamodhānā, abhinīhāro samijjhatī”ti. ;
analyzed: aṭṭha dhamma samodhānā abhinīhāraḥ samijjhati iti
translated: Makes aspiration fruitful.

original: Imāni hi paṇidhānasampattikāraṇāni. Iti paṇidhānampi sampādetuṃ asamatthāya itthiyā
analyzed: imāni hi paṇidhāna sampatti kāraṇāni iti paṇidhānam pi sampādetum a samatthāya itthiyā
translated: These are the causes for the fulfilment of the aspiration. So, since a woman is incapable of fulfilling even the aspiration,🔽how can she be a Buddha?

original: kuto buddhabhāvoti “aṭṭhānametaṃ, anavakāso yaṃ itthī arahaṃ assa sammāsambuddho”ti
analyzed: kutas buddha bhāvaḥ ti aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam itthī arahan assa sammāsambuddho ti
translated: That is why it was said above “It is impossible, there is no way that a woman can become a Perfect One, a fully enlightened Buddha” .

original: vuttaṃ. Sabbākāraparipūro vā puññussayo sabbākāraparipūrameva attabhāvaṃ nibbattetīti
analyzed: vuttam sabba ākāra paripūraḥ vā puññussayaḥ sabba ākāra paripūram eva atta bhāvam nibbatteti iti
translated: Or a man of perfect virtue produces a personality that is also perfect in all aspects.

original: purisova arahaṃ hoti sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: purisaḥ uva araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: So only a man can be a Perfect One, a fully enlightened Buddha.

original: Yaṃ itthī rājā assa cakkavattītiādīsupi yasmā itthiyā kosohitavatthaguyhādīnaṃ abhāvena
analyzed: yam itthī rājā assa cakkavattī iti ādīsu pi yasmai itthiyā abhāvena
translated: As to the words “a woman who was a universal monarch” , etc., since a woman does not have the concealed penis, etc., which are

original: lakkhaṇāni na paripūrenti, itthiratanabhāvena sattaratanasamaṅgitā na sampajjati,🔽sabbamanussehi ca adhiko attabhāvo na hoti, tasmā “aṭṭhānametaṃ anavakāso yaṃ itthī
analyzed: lakkhaṇāni na paripūrenti itthi ratana bhāvena satta ratana samaṅgi tā na sampajjati  sabba manussehi ca adhikaḥ atta bhāvaḥ na hoti tasmai aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam itthī
translated: The characteristics are not fulfilled, and the perfection of the seven kinds of treasures by way of the jewel of a woman is not accomplished.

original: rājā assa cakkavattī”ti vuttaṃ. Yasmā ca sakkattādīnipi tīṇi ṭhānāni uttamāni, itthiliṅgañca
analyzed: rājā assa cakkavattī iti vuttam yasmā ca tīṇi ṭhānāni uttamāni itthi liṅgam ca
translated: And there is no state of being superior to all men. That is why it is said: “It is impossible, there is no way that a woman can become a Ruler, a King, a Universal Monarch.”

original: hīnaṃ, tasmā tassā sakkattādīnipi paṭisiddhāni. Nanu ca yathā itthiliṅgaṃ evaṃ purisaliṅgampi
analyzed: hīnam paṭisiddhāni nanu ca yathā itthi liṅgam evam purisa liṅgam pi
translated: And because the three states of Sakka, etc., are the highest, and the female sex is the lowest, therefore the states of Sakka, etc., are also denied to her.

original: brahmaloke natthi, tasmā “yaṃ puriso brahmattaṃ kāreyya – ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”tipi
analyzed: brahma loke na atthi tasmai yam purisaḥ brahmattam kāreyya ṭhānam etam vijjati itipi
translated: But is it not the case that just as the female sex, so also the male sex is not found in the Brahmā-world? Therefore should it not be said: “It is possible that a man might perform the function of Brahmā”?

original: na vattabbaṃ siyāti? No na vattabbaṃ. Kasmā? Idha purisassa tattha nibbattanato.🔽Brahmattanti hi mahābrahmattaṃ adhippetaṃ. Itthī ca idha jhānaṃ bhāvetvā kālaṃ katvā
analyzed: na vattabbam siyāti no na vattabbam kasmā idha purisassa tattha nibbattanato  brahmattanti hi mahābrahmattam adhippetam itthī ca idha jhānam bhāvetvā kālam katvā
translated: No, it should not be said. Why not? Because here a man is reborn there.

original: brahmapārisajjānaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati, na mahābrahmānaṃ. Puriso pana tattha na
analyzed: brahma pārisajjānam sahabyatam upapajjati na mahābrahmānam puriso pana tattha na
translated: For “the function of Brahmā” means the function of Great Brahmā. And a woman, having developed jhāna here, on the dissolution of the body is reborn in the company of the attendants of Great Brahmā, not among the Great Brahmās. But a man is reborn among the Great Brahmās.

original: uppajjatīti na vattabbo. Samānepi cettha ubhayaliṅgābhāve purisasaṇṭhānāva brahmāno,
analyzed: uppajjati iti na vattabbo samāne pi ca ittha ubhaya liṅga abhāve brahmāno
translated: And although both are devoid of sex, the Brahmās have the form of a man,

original: na itthisaṇṭhānā. Tasmā suvuttamevetaṃ.
analyzed: na itthi saṇṭhānā tasmā su vuttam eva etam
translated: not the form of a woman. That is why it is well said.

original: Kāyaduccaritassātiādīsu yathā nimbabījakosātakībījādīni madhuraṃ phalaṃ na nibbattenti,
analyzed: kāya duccaritassa ati ādīsu yathā nimba bīja kosātakī bīja ādīni madhuram phalam na nibbattenti
translated: As to the words “in the case of bodily misconduct, etc.”, just as seeds of neem, margosa, etc., do not produce a sweet fruit,

original: asātaṃ amadhurameva nibbattenti, evaṃ kāyaduccaritādīni madhuraṃ vipākaṃ na nibbattenti,🔽amadhurameva nibbattenti. Yathā ca ucchubījasālibījādīni madhuraṃ sādhurasameva phalaṃ
analyzed: asātam amadhuram eva nibbattenti evam kāya duccarita ādīni madhuram vipākam na nibbattenti  amadhuram eva nibbattenti yathā ca ucchu bīja sāli bīja ādīni madhuram sādhu rasam eva phalam
translated: but produce only a bitter, unpleasant fruit, so bodily misconduct, etc., do not produce a sweet ripening,🔽but produce only a bitter, unpleasant ripening. And just as seeds of sugar-cane, rice, etc., produce only a sweet, pleasant fruit,

original: nibbattenti, na asātaṃ kaṭukaṃ, evaṃ kāyasucaritādīni madhurameva vipākaṃ nibbattenti,
analyzed: nibbattenti na asātam kaṭukam evam kāya su carita ādīni madhuram eva vipākam nibbattenti
translated: so good bodily conduct, etc., produce only a sweet ripening,

original: na amadhuraṃ. Vuttampi cetaṃ –
analyzed: na amadhuram
translated: not a bitter one. And this is said:

original: “Yādisaṃ vapate bījaṃ, tādisaṃ harate phalaṃ;
analyzed: yādisam vapate bījam tādisam harate phalam
translated: “Whatever seed a man sows, That will he reap as fruit;

original: Kalyāṇakārī kalyāṇaṃ, pāpakārī ca pāpakanti. ;
analyzed: kalyāṇa kārī kalyāṇam pāpa kārī ca
translated: The doer of good will reap good, The doer of evil will reap evil.”

original: Tasmā “aṭṭhānametaṃ anavakāso, yaṃ kāyaduccaritassā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tasmai aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam kāya duccaritassa atiādi vuttam
translated: That is why it is said above, “It is impossible that bodily misconduct … should lead to … rebirth in a happy destination in the heavenly world” , and so on.

original: Kāyaduccaritasamaṅgītiādīsu samaṅgīti pañcavidhā samaṅgitā – āyūhanasamaṅgitā, cetanāsamaṅgitā,
analyzed: samaṅgī iti ādīsu samaṅgī iti pañcavidhā samaṅgi tā āyūhana samaṅgi tā cetanā samaṅgi tā
translated: As regards the terms “endowed with bodily misconduct” and so on, “endowment” is of five kinds: endowment with accumulation, endowment with volition,

original: kammasamaṅgitā, vipākasamaṅgitā, upaṭṭhānasamaṅgitāti. Tattha kusalākusalakammāyūhanakkhaṇe
analyzed: kamma samaṅgi tā vipāka samaṅgi tā upaṭṭhāna samaṅgi tā ti tattha kusala akusala kamma āyūhana khaṇe
translated: endowment with kamma, endowment with result, and endowment with manifestation. Herein, at the moment of accumulating profitable and unprofitable kamma,

original: ‘āyūhanasamaṅgitā’ vuccati. Tathā ‘cetanāsamaṅgitā’. Yāva pana arahattaṃ na pāpuṇanti
analyzed: āyūhana samaṅgi tā vuccati tathā cetanā samaṅgi tā yāva pana arahattam na pāpuṇanti
translated: “endowment with accumulation” and “endowment with volition” are what are meant. But as long as they have not reached Arahantship,

original: tāva sabbepi sattā pubbe upacitaṃ vipākārahaṃ kammaṃ sandhāya kammasamaṅginoti vuccanti
analyzed: tāva sabbe api sattā pubbe upacitam vipāka araham kammam sandhāya kamma samaṅginaḥ ti vuccanti
translated: all beings are called “endowed with kamma” in the sense of having previously accumulated kamma that is capable of resulting;

original: – esā ‘kammasamaṅgitā’. ‘Vipākasamaṅgitā’ pana vipākakkhaṇeyeva veditabbā. Yāva pana
analyzed: esā kamma samaṅgi tā vipāka samaṅgi tā pana vipāka kkhaṇeya iva veditabbā yāva pana
translated: this is “endowment with kamma.” But “endowment with result” should be understood as occurring only at the moment of result. As long as they have not reached Arahantship,

original: sattā arahattaṃ na pāpuṇanti tāva tesaṃ tato tato cavitvā niraye tāva uppajjamānānaṃ
analyzed: sattāḥ arahattam na pāpuṇanti tāva tesam tatas tatas cavitvā niraye tāva uppajjamānānam
translated: beings who die here and are reborn in hell are endowed with hell, in other words, with the manifestation of hell, in the sense that they are not devoid of hell,

original: aggijālalohakumbhīādīhi upaṭṭhānākārehi nirayo, gabbhaseyyakattaṃ āpajjamānānaṃ mātukucchi,
analyzed: aggi jāla loha kumbhī ādīhi upaṭṭhāna ākārehi nirayaḥ gabbhaseyyaka ttam āpajjamānānam mātukucchi
translated: because of the manifestation of hell in such forms as the iron net, the iron cauldron, and so on. And those who are reborn in a womb are endowed with a womb, in other words, with a mother’s womb, in the sense that they are not devoid of a womb,

original: devesu uppajjamānānaṃ kapparukkhavimānādīhi upaṭṭhānākārehi devalokoti evaṃ upapattinimittaṃ
analyzed: devesu uppajjamānānam kappa rukkha vimāna ādīhi upaṭṭhāna ākārehi deva lokaḥ ti evam upapatti nimittam
translated: When they are about to be reborn among the gods, the celestial world appears to them in the form of celestial mansions, celestial trees, etc., as the place of rebirth.

original: upaṭṭhāti. Iti nesaṃ iminā uppattinimittūpaṭṭhānena aparimuttattā ‘upaṭṭhānasamaṅgitā’
analyzed: upaṭṭhāti iti na isam iminā uppatti nimitta upaṭṭhānena a parimutta ttā upaṭṭhāna samaṅgi tā
translated: So this is called ‘the appearance of the place of rebirth’.🔽It moves; the rest are motionless.

original: nāma. Sāva calati, sesā niccalā. Niraye hi upaṭṭhitepi devaloko upaṭṭhāti; devaloke🔽upaṭṭhitepi nirayo upaṭṭhāti; manussaloke upaṭṭhitepi tiracchānayoni upaṭṭhāti; tiracchānayoniyā
analyzed: nāma sā ava calati sesā niccalā niraye hi upaṭṭhite pi deva lokaḥ upaṭṭhāti deva loke  upaṭṭhite api nirayaḥ upaṭṭhāti manussa loke upaṭṭhite api tiracchānayoni upaṭṭhāti tiracchānayoniyā
translated: For when the celestial world appears, the hell world appears too; when the celestial world disappears, the hell world disappears too.

original: ca upaṭṭhitāyapi manussaloko upaṭṭhātiyeva.
analyzed: ca manussa lokaḥ
translated: When the human world appears, the animal world appears too; when the human world disappears, the animal world disappears too.

original: Tatridaṃ vatthu – soṇagiripāde kira acelavihāre soṇatthero nāma eko dhammakathiko.🔽Tassa pitā sunakhavājiko nāma luddako ahosi. Thero taṃ paṭibāhantopi saṃvare ṭhapetuṃ
analyzed: tatra idam vatthu soṇagiri pāde kira acelavihāre soṇa theraḥ nāma ekaḥ dhamma kathiko  tassa pitā sunakhavājikaḥ nāma luddakaḥ ahosi thero tam paṭibāhantaḥ api saṃvare ṭhapetum
translated: Here is a story. A certain Elder named Soṇa, it seems, who was a preacher of the Dhamma, lived in a hermitage on Mount Soṇaka.🔽His father was a hunter named Sunakha. Although the elder tried to dissuade him, he was unable to make him take up the virtue of refraining from killing.

original: asakkonto ‘mā nassi varāko’ti mahallakakāle akāmakaṃ pabbājesi. Tassa gilānaseyyāya
analyzed: a sakkontaḥ mā nassi varākaḥ ti mahallaka kāle akāmakam pabbājesi tassa gilāna seyyāya
translated: So when he was old and did not want to go forth, the elder had him go forth out of compassion, thinking, “Let him not be lost.” When he was sick in bed,

original: nipannassa nirayo upaṭṭhāsi. Soṇagiripādato mahantā mahantā sunakhā āgantvā khāditukāmā
analyzed: nipannassa nirayaḥ upaṭṭhāsi soṇagiri pādataḥ mahantā mahantā su nakhā āgantvā khāditu kāmā
translated: As he lay there, he saw hell. From the foot of Mount Soṇāgiri great dogs came and surrounded him as if to devour him.

original: viya samparivāresuṃ. So mahābhayabhīto “vārehi, tāta soṇa! Vārehi, tāta soṇā”ti āha.🔽“Kiṃ mahātherā”ti? “Na passasi, tātā”ti taṃ pavattiṃ ācikkhi. Soṇatthero ‘kathañhi
analyzed: samparivāresum saḥ mahā bhaya bhītaḥ vārehi tāta soṇa vārehi tāta soṇa ati āha  kim mahā thera ati na passasi tāta ati tam pavattim ācikkhi soṇa ttheraḥ katham hi
translated: In great fear he cried out, “Save me, dear Soṇa! Save me, dear Soṇa!”

original: nāma mādisassa pitā niraye nibbattissati, patiṭṭhāhamassa bhavissāmī’ti sāmaṇerehi
analyzed: nāma mādisassa pitā niraye nibbattissati patiṭṭhā aham assa bhavissāmi iti sāmaṇerehi
translated: “What is it, great elder?” “Don’t you see, dear?” He told him what had happened. Elder Soṇa thought, “How can my father be reborn in hell? I will be his support.”

original: nānāpupphāni āharāpetvā cetiyaṅgaṇabodhiyaṅgaṇesu mālāsanthārapūjañca āsanapūjañca🔽kāretvā pitaraṃ mañcena cetiyaṅgaṇaṃ haritvā mañce nipajjāpetvā “ayaṃ me, mahāthera,🔽pūjā tumhākaṃ atthāya katā; ‘ayaṃ me, bhagavā, duggatapaṇṇākāro’ti vatvā bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: nānā pupphāni āhara āpetvā cetiyaṅgaṇa bodhiyaṅgaṇesu mālā santhāra pūjam ca āsana pūjam ca  kāretvā pitaram mañcena cetiyaṅgaṇam haritvā mañce ayam me mahāthera  pūjā tumhākam atthāya katā ayam me bhagavā duggata paṇṇākāraḥ iti vatvā bhagavantam
translated: He had the novices bring various flowers and had them make flower-offerings and seat-offerings in the shrine-terrace and the Bodhi-tree terrace.🔽Then he had his father carried to the shrine-terrace on a couch and laid on the couch. “This offering, great elder,” he said,

original: vanditvā cittaṃ pasādehī”ti āha. So mahāthero pūjaṃ disvā tathākaronto cittaṃ pasādesi.
analyzed: vanditvā cittam pasādehi iti āha saḥ mahā theraḥ pūjam disvā tathā karontaḥ cittam pasādesi
translated: “is made for you. Say, ‘This is my bad action, Blessed One,’ and pay homage to the Blessed One and make your mind pliant.” The great elder saw the offering and did as he was asked. He made his mind pliant.

original: Tāvadevassa devaloko upaṭṭhāsi, nandavanacittalatāvanamissakavanaphārusakavanavimānāni🔽ceva devanāṭakāni ca parivāretvā ṭhitāni viya ahesuṃ. So “apetha, soṇa! Apetha, soṇā”ti
analyzed: tāvadevassa deva lokaḥ upaṭṭhāsi nanda vana cittalatā vana missaka vana phārusaka vana vimānāni  ca iva deva nāṭakāni ca parivāretvā ṭhitāni viya ahesum saḥ apetha soṇa apetha soṇa ati
translated: The deva world appeared to him, with the Nandana, the Missaka, the Pāricchattaka, and the Phārusaka groves, and the celestial orchestras, all standing as though they had been invited. He said: “Go away, Soṇa, go away, Soṇa.” “Why is that, great elder?” “Those are your mothers coming, my dear.” He thought: “The elder’s heaven has appeared;🔽the great elder’s heaven has appeared” . So it should be understood that the possession of the conditions for rebirth there is what “moves” .

original: āha. “Kimidaṃ, mahātherā”ti? “Etā te, tāta, mātaro āgacchantī”ti. ‘Thero saggo upaṭṭhito🔽mahātherassā’ti cintesi. Evaṃ upaṭṭhānasamaṅgitā calatīti veditabbā. Etāsu samaṅgitāsu
analyzed: āha kim idam mahā thera ati etāḥ te tāta mātaraḥ āgacchanti iti theraḥ saggaḥ upaṭṭhitaḥ  mahā therassa ati cintesi evam upaṭṭhāna samaṅgi tā calati iti veditabbā etāsu samaṅgi tāsu
translated: Of these possessions,

original: idha āyūhanacetanākammasamaṅgitāvasena “kāyaduccaritasamaṅgī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Sesaṃ
analyzed: idha āyūhana cetanā kamma samaṅgi tā vasena kāya duccarita samaṅgī iti ādi vuttam sesam
translated: herein it is said that he is “possessed of bodily misconduct” because of the possession of the volition to accumulate that. The rest is

original: sabbattha uttānatthamevāti.
analyzed: sabbattha uttāna attham eva ti
translated: all plain in meaning.

original: Paṭhamabalaniddesavaṇṇanā.
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the first strength is ended.

original: Dutiyabalaniddeso
translated: Exposition of the second strength

original: 810. Dutiyabalaniddese gatisampattipaṭibāḷhānīti gatisampattiyā paṭibāhitāni nivāritāni🔽paṭisedhitāni. Sesapadesupi eseva nayo. Ettha ca gatisampattīti sampannā gati devaloko
analyzed: dutiya bala niddese gati sampatti paṭibāḷhāni iti gati sampattiyā paṭibāhitāni nivāritāni 🔽paṭisedhitāni sesa padesu pi esā iva nayo ettha ca gati sampattī iti sampannā deva loko
translated: In the second strength, the words “the conditions for rebirth in happy states of the sense sphere” are a term for the five kinds of kamma consisting of the performance of the ten kinds of meritorious deeds.🔽The words “the conditions for rebirth in the brahmā-world” are a term for the four jhānas. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the fine-material and immaterial worlds” are a term for the fine-material and immaterial jhānas. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the imperturbable” are a term for the attainment of cessation. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the noble fruits” are a term for the four paths. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the supramundane states” are a term for the four paths and the four fruitions. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the enlightenment of a disciple” are a term for the path of a disciple’s enlightenment. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the enlightenment of a paccekabuddha” are a term for the path of a paccekabuddha’s enlightenment. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the enlightenment of a perfectly enlightened Buddha” are a term for the path of a perfectly enlightened Buddha’s enlightenment. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the states of the worldling” are a term for the kamma of the worldling. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the states of the noble ones” are a term for the kamma of the noble ones. The words “the conditions for rebirth in the states of the ordinary man

original: ca manussaloko ca. Gativipattīti vipannā gati cattāro apāyā. Upadhisampattīti attabhāvasamiddhi.🔽Upadhivipattīti hīnaattabhāvatā. Kālasampattīti surājasumanussakālasaṅkhāto sampannakālo.
analyzed: ca manussa loko ca gati vipatti iti vipannā cattāraḥ apāyāḥ upadhi sampatti iti atta bhāva samiddhi  upadhi vipatti iti hīna atta bhāva tā kāla sampatti iti su rāja su manussa kāla saṅkhāto sampanna kālaḥ
translated: and the human world. “Misfortune of destiny” is a misfortune of destiny, namely, the four lower worlds. “Prosperity of acquisitions” is the excellence of the individual existence.🔽“Misfortune of acquisitions” is the inferiority of the individual existence. “Prosperity of time” is the excellence of time, namely, the time of good kings and good human beings.

original: Kālavipattīti durājadumanussakālasaṅkhāto vipannakālo. Payogasampattīti sammāpayogo.
analyzed: kāla vipatti iti du rāja dumanussa kāla saṅkhātaḥ vipanna kālaḥ payoga sampatti iti sammāpayogaḥ
translated: “Misfortune of time” is the misfortune of time, namely, the time of bad kings and bad human beings. “Prosperity of effort” is right effort.

original: Payogavipattīti micchāpayogo.
analyzed: payoga vipatti iti micchā apayogaḥ
translated: “Misfortune of effort” is wrong effort.

original: Tattha ekaccassa bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni gativipattiyaṃ ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: tattha ekaccassa bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni gati vipattiyam ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ
translated: Herein, some person has done many kinds of evil actions. They would ripen in one who is unfortunate in destiny.

original: So pana ekena kalyāṇakammena gatisampattiyaṃ devesu vā manussesu vā nibbatto. Tādise🔽ca ṭhāne akusalassa vāro natthi, ekantaṃ kusalasseva vāroti. Evamassa tāni kammāni
analyzed: so pana ekena kalyāṇa kammena gati sampattiyam devesu vā manussesu vā nibbattaḥ tādise  ca ṭhāne akusalassa vāro natthi ekantam kusalassa iva vāro ti evam assa tāni kammāni
translated: But he is reborn among the gods or human beings through a single good action in a prosperity of destiny.🔽And in such a case there is no opportunity for the unprofitable, only for the profitable. So he understands that those actions

original: gatisampattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: gati sampatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: do not ripen in him because they are obstructed by the prosperity of destiny.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni upadhivipattiyaṃ ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni upadhi vipattiyam ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ
translated: Some person has done many kinds of evil actions. They would ripen in one who is unfortunate in acquisitions.

original: So pana ekena kalyāṇakammena upadhisampattiyaṃ ṭhito susaṇṭhitaṅgapaccaṅgo abhirūpo
analyzed: so pana ekena kalyāṇa kammena upadhi sampattiyam ṭhitaḥ su saṇṭhita aṅga paccaṅgaḥ abhirūpaḥ
translated: But he, by one good deed, was established in the possession of requisites. He was well-proportioned, handsome,

original: dassanīyo brahmavacchasadiso. Sacepi dāsiyā kucchismiṃ dāsajāto hoti ‘evarūpo attabhāvo
analyzed: dassanīyaḥ brahma vaccha sadisaḥ sace pi dāsiyā kucchismim dāsa jātaḥ hoti evarūpaḥ atta bhāvo
translated: and like a brahmin in appearance. Even if he was born in the womb of a slave-woman, such a form

original: kiliṭṭhakammassa nānucchaviko’ti hatthimeṇḍaassabandhakagopālakakammādīni taṃ na🔽kārenti; sukhumavatthāni nivāsāpetvā bhaṇḍāgārikaṭṭhānādīsu ṭhapenti. Sace itthī
analyzed: kiliṭṭha kammassa na anucchavikaḥ ti hatthi meṇḍa assabandhaka gopālaka kamma ādīni tam na  kārenti su khuma vatthāni bhaṇḍāgārika ṭṭhāna ādīsu ṭhapenti sace itthī
translated: was not suitable for a defiled deed. They did not make him do the work of a hand-servant, a slave, a keeper of cows, and so on;🔽they dressed him in fine clothes and placed him in the position of a treasurer and so on. If he was a woman, they did not make him cook rice for elephants and so on;

original: hoti, hatthibhattapacanādīni na kārenti; vatthālaṅkāraṃ datvā sayanapālikaṃ vā naṃ
analyzed: hoti hatthi bhattapacana ādīni na kārenti vattha alaṅkāram da tvā sayana pālikam vā
translated: they gave him clothes and ornaments and made him a bed-keeper,

original: karonti, somadevi viya vallabhaṭṭhāne vā ṭhapenti. Bhātikarājakāle kira gomaṃsakhādake
analyzed: karonti vallabha ṭṭhāne vā ṭhapenti bhātika rāja kāle kira go maṃsa khādake
translated: or placed him in the position of a favourite, like Somadevi. At the time of the brother-king, it seems, they captured many people who ate cow’s flesh

original: bahujane gahetvā rañño dassesuṃ. Te ‘daṇḍaṃ dātuṃ sakkothā’ti puṭṭhā ‘na sakkomā’ti
analyzed: bahu jane gahetvā raññaḥ dassesum te daṇḍam dātum sakkotha ati puṭṭhāḥ na sakkoma ati
translated: and showed them to the king. When they were asked, ‘Can you give punishment?’ they said, ‘We cannot.’

original: vadiṃsu. Atha ne rājaṅgaṇe sodhake akaṃsu. Tesaṃ ekā dhītā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā.
analyzed: vadiṃsu atha ne rājaṅgaṇe sodhake tesam ekā dhītā abhirūpā dassanīyā pāsādikā
translated: Then they were made to clean the royal compound. One of their daughters was beautiful, pleasant, and graceful.

original: Taṃ disvā rājā antepuraṃ abhinetvā vallabhaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi. Sesañātakāpi tassā ānubhāvena
analyzed: tam disvā rājā antepuram abhinetvā vallabha ṭṭhāne ṭhapesi sesa ñātakā api tassāḥ ānubhāvena
translated: The king saw her and sent her to the harem, where he appointed her to the position of chief consort. The rest of her relatives also lived happily through her influence.

original: sukhaṃ jīviṃsu. Tādisasmiñhi attabhāve pāpakammānipi vipākaṃ dātuṃ na sakkonti. Evaṃ
analyzed: sukham jīviṃsu tādisasmin hi atta bhāve pāpa kammāni api vipākam dātum na sakkonti evam
translated: For in such a physical frame even evil actions are unable to give results. Thus

original: upadhisampattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.🔽Ekassa bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni kālavipattiyaṃ ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ. So pana🔽ekena kalyāṇakammena paṭhamakappikānaṃ vā cakkavattirañño vā buddhānaṃ vā uppattisamaye
analyzed: upadhi sampatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti  ekassa bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni kāla vipattiyam ṭhitassa vipacceyyum saḥ pana  ekena kalyāṇa kammena paṭhama kappikānam vā cakkavatti raññaḥ vā buddhānam vā uppatti samaye
translated: he knows that they do not ripen because of the strength of the excellence of the physical basis.

original: surājasumanussakāle nibbatto. Tādise ca kāle nibbattassa akusalassa vipākaṃ dātuṃ
analyzed: su rāja su manussa kāle nibbattaḥ tādise ca kāle nibbattassa akusalassa vipākam dātum
translated: Another has done many evil actions. They would ripen in one who is in a period of life when they would ripen. But he was reborn at the time of the appearance of the first-cycle beings, or at the time of a universal monarch, or at the time of the Buddhas, or at the time of the chief ministers, the treasurers, and so on, of the chief merchants, the chief brahmans, and the chief householders.🔽And when one is reborn at such a time, there is no opportunity for the ripening of unwholesome action; there is only opportunity for the ripening of wholesome action. Thus

original: okāso natthi, ekantaṃ kusalasseva okāsoti. Evaṃ kālasampattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: okāsaḥ natthi ekantam kusalassa iva okāsaḥ ti evam kāla sampatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: he knows that they do not ripen because of the strength of the excellence of the period of life.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni payogavipattiyaṃ ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni payoga vipattiyam ṭhitassa vipacceyyum
translated: Another has done many evil actions. They would ripen in one who is in a period of life when they would ripen. But he has not given up his attachment to the things that spell his undoing.

original: So pana ekena kalyāṇakammena payogasampattiyaṃ ṭhito pāṇātipātādīhi virato kāyavacīmanosucaritāni
analyzed: saḥ pana ekena kalyāṇa kammena payoga sampattiyam ṭhitaḥ pāṇa atipāta ādīhi virataḥ kāya vacī manaḥ su caritāni
translated: But he is established in the excellence of means by a single good deed, and he abstains from killing living beings, etc., and he fulfills bodily, verbal, and mental good conduct.

original: pūreti. Tādise ṭhāne akusalassa vipaccanokāso natthi, ekantaṃ kusalasseva okāsoti.
analyzed: pūreti tādise ṭhāne akusalassa vipaccanokāsaḥ natthi ekantam kusalassa iva okāso ti
translated: In such a case there is no opportunity for the unprofitable, only for the profitable.

original: Evaṃ payogasampattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: evam payoga sampatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: Thus he understands how they do not ripen because they are blocked by the excellence of means.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni gatisampattiyaṃ ṭhitassa na vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni gati sampattiyam ṭhitassa na vipacceyyum
translated: Another has done many evil deeds. They would not ripen in one who was established in the excellence of destiny.

original: So panekena pāpakammena gativipattiyaṃyeva nibbatto. Tatthassa tāni kammāni upagantvā
analyzed: so panekena pāpa kammena gati vipattiyaṃ yeva nibbattaḥ tattha assa tāni kammāni upagantvā
translated: But he is reborn in the very place where those deeds are to be experienced,

original: vārena vārena vipākaṃ denti – kālena niraye nibbattāpenti, kālena tiracchānayoniyaṃ,
analyzed: vārena vārena vipākam denti kālena niraye nibbattāpenti kālena tiracchānayoniyam
translated: and there they go on giving him their ripening turn by turn. Sometimes he is reborn in hell, sometimes in the animal realm,

original: kālena pettivisaye, kālena asurakāye, dīghenāpi addhunā apāyato sīsaṃ ukkhipituṃ🔽na denti. Evaṃ gatisampattipaṭibāhitattā vipākaṃ dātuṃ asakkontāni gativipattiṃ āgamma
analyzed: kālena pettivisaye kālena asura kāye dīghena api addhunā apāyataḥ sīsam ukkhipitum  na denti evam gati sampatti paṭibāhita ttā vipākam dātum a sakkontāni gati vipattim āgamma
translated: sometimes in the realm of ghosts, sometimes in the host of the Asuras. Even after a long time he does not get his head out of the states of loss.

original: vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: Thus he understands how they ripen in the next existence because they are blocked by the excellence of destiny.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni upadhisampattiyaṃ ṭhitassa na vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni upadhi sampattiyam ṭhitassa na vipacceyyum
translated: And he has done many other bad actions as well. But if he had been endowed with the requisites, they would not have ripened.

original: So pana ekena pāpakammena upadhivipattiyaṃyeva patiṭṭhito dubbaṇṇo durūpo dussaṇṭhito🔽bībhaccho pisācasadiso. So sace dāsiyā kucchiyaṃ dāsajāto ‘imāni etassa anucchavikānī’ti
analyzed: so pana ekena pāpa kammena upadhi vipattiyaṃ yeva patiṭṭhitaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ durūpaḥ dussaṇṭhitaḥ  bībhacchaḥ pisāca sadisaḥ saḥ sace dāsiyā kucchiyam dāsa jātaḥ imāni etassa anucchavikāni iti
translated: But because of one bad action he is now established in the misfortune of requisites. He is ugly, unsightly, and repulsive,

original: sabbāni naṃ kiliṭṭhakammāni kārenti antamaso pupphachaḍḍakakammaṃ upādāya. Sace itthī
analyzed: sabbāni nam kiliṭṭha kammāni kārenti antamasaḥ pupphachaḍḍaka kammam upādāya sace itthī
translated: a frightful monster. If he is born in a slave-woman’s womb, they make him do all the menial tasks, such as sweeping, that are suitable for a slave,

original: hoti ‘imāni etissā anucchavikānī’ti sabbāni naṃ hatthibhattapacanādīni kiliṭṭhakammāni
analyzed: hoti imāni etissā anucchavikāni iti sabbāni nam hatthi bhatta pacana ādīni kiliṭṭha kammāni
translated: because they think, ‘These are suitable for him.’ If he is born as a man, they make him do all the menial tasks, such as cooking elephant-feed, that are suitable for a slave,

original: kārenti. Kulagehe jātampi baliṃ sādhayamānā rājapurisā ‘gehadāsī’ti saññaṃ katvā
analyzed: kārenti kula gehe balim sādhayamānāḥ rāja purisāḥ geha dāsī iti saññam katvā
translated: because they think, ‘These are suitable for her.’ If he is born in a good family, the king’s men, thinking ‘A slave in a house,’

original: bandhitvā gacchanti, kotalavāpīgāme mahākuṭumbikassa gharaṇī viya. Evaṃ upadhisampattipaṭibāhitattā
analyzed: bandhitvā gacchanti kotala vāpī gāme mahākuṭumbikassa viya evam upadhi sampatti paṭibāhita ttā
translated: arrest him and take him off, as they did the wife of a great money-lender in the village of Kottaka-vāpi. So the kammas are unable to yield their results because of the misfortune of requisites,

original: vipākaṃ dātuṃ asakkontāni upadhivipattiṃ āgamma vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: vipākam dātum a sakkontāni upadhi vipattim āgamma vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: which has taken precedence over them. But when the misfortune of requisites has occurred, the kammas then yield their results.”

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni kālasampattiyaṃ nibbātassa na vipacceyyuṃ.🔽So pana ekena pāpakammena kālavipattiyaṃ durājadumanussakāle kasaṭe niroje dasavassāyukakāle🔽nibbatto, yadā pañca gorasā pacchijjanti, kudrūsakaṃ aggabhojanaṃ hoti. Kiñcāpi manussaloke
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni kāla sampattiyam nibbātassa na vipacceyyum  saḥ pana ekena pāpa kammena kāla vipattiyam du rāja du manussa kāle kasaṭe niroje dasa vassa āyuka kāle  nibbattaḥ yadā pañca gorasā pacchijjanti kudrūsakam agga bhojanam hoti kiñcā api manussa loke
translated: And there are many other bad actions which would not have ripened if he had been born at a time when the conditions were favourable.🔽But he is born at a time when the conditions are unfavourable, at a time when there is a bad king and bad people, at a time when the earth produces thorns and the staple food is kudru roots,

original: nibbatto, migapasusarikkhajīviko pana hoti. Evarūpe kāle kusalassa vipaccanokāso
analyzed: nibbattaḥ miga pasu sarikkha jīviko pana hoti evarūpe kāle kusalassa vipaccanokāsaḥ
translated: and though he is born in the human world, he has to live like an animal. At such a time there is no opportunity for profitable action,

original: natthi, ekantaṃ akusalasseva hoti. Evaṃ kālasampattipaṭibāhitattā vipākaṃ dātuṃ asakkontāni
analyzed: natthi ekantam akusalassa iva hoti evam kāla sampatti paṭibāhita ttā vipākam dātum a sakkontāni
translated: only for unprofitable action. So he understands that because the conditions were not favourable for the ripening of the kamma,

original: kālavipattiṃ āgamma vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: kāla vipattim āgamma vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: the kamma has ripened through the unfavourable conditions.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni pāpakammāni honti. Tāni payogasampattiyaṃ ṭhitassa na vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni pāpa kammāni honti tāni payoga sampattiyam ṭhitassa na vipacceyyum
translated: And there are many other bad actions which would not have ripened if he had been born at a time when the conditions were favourable,

original: So pana payogavipattiyaṃ ṭhito pāṇātipātādīni dasa akusalakammāni karoti. Tamenaṃ
analyzed: so pana payoga vipattiyam ṭhito pāṇātipāta ādīni dasa akusala kammāni karoti tam enam
translated: but he is born at a time when the conditions are unfavourable, and he commits the ten kinds of bad kamma beginning with killing breathing things.

original: sahoḍḍhaṃ gahetvā rañño dassenti. Rājā bahūkammakāraṇāni kāretvā ghātāpeti. Evaṃ
analyzed: sahoḍḍham gahetvā raññaḥ dassenti rājā bahu kamma kāraṇāni kāretvā ghātāpeti evam
translated: and they bring them to the King. The King has many executions carried out and has them killed. Thus

original: payogasampattipaṭibāhitattā vipākaṃ dātuṃ asakkontāni payogavipattiṃ āgamma vipaccantīti
analyzed: payoga sampatti paṭibāhita ttā vipākam dātum a sakkontāni payoga vipattim āgamma vipaccanti iti
translated: because of the failure of the means, the bad kamma is unable to give its result. It ripens through the failure of the means.

original: pajānāti. Evaṃ catūhi sampattīhi paṭibāhitaṃ pāpakammaṃ vipākaṃ adatvā catasso vipattiyo āgamma deti.
analyzed: pajānāti evam catūhi sampattīhi paṭibāhitam pāpa kammam vipākam a datvā catassaḥ vipattiyaḥ āgamma deti
translated: Thus bad kamma, blocked by the four successes, gives its result through the four failures without giving its result.

original: Yathā hi kocideva puriso kenacideva kammena rājānaṃ ārādheyya. Athassa rājā ṭhānantaraṃ
analyzed: yathā hi kocid eva purisaḥ kenacid eva kammena rājānam ārādheyya athassa rājā
translated: Just as a certain man might please the King with some service, and the King might give him a post,

original: datvā janapadaṃ dadeyya. So taṃ sammā paribhuñjituṃ asakkonto makkaṭena gahitabhattapuṭaṃ🔽viya bhindeyya; yassa yaṃ yānaṃ vā vāhanaṃ vā dāsaṃ vā dāsiṃ vā ārāmaṃ vā vatthuṃ
analyzed: da tvā janapadam dadeyya saḥ tam sammā paribhuñjitum a sakkontaḥ makkaṭena gahita bhatta puṭam  viya bhindeyya yassa yam yānam vā vāhanam vā dāsam vā dāsim vā ārāmam vā vatthum
translated: and then the man, being unable to enjoy it properly, might break it up like a monkey with a bowl of food,

analyzed: vā sampanna rūpam passati sabbam balakkārena gaṇheyya manussāḥ rāja vallabhaḥ iti kiñci

original: vattuṃ na sakkuṇeyyuṃ. So aññassa vallabhatarassa rājamahāmattassa virujjheyya. So🔽taṃ gahetvā supothitaṃ pothāpetvā bhūmiṃ piṭṭhiyā ghaṃsāpento nikkaḍḍhāpetvā rājānaṃ
analyzed: vattum na sakkuṇeyyum saḥ aññassa vallabhatarassa rāja mahāmattassa virujjheyya saḥ  tam gahetvā su pothitam pothāpetvā bhūmim piṭṭhiyā ghaṃsāpentaḥ nikkaḍḍhāpetvā rājānam

analyzed: attha ekaccāni kalyāṇāni kamma samādānāni gati vipatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti ādīsu pi
translated: In the case of the words “some good kamma that has been done is thwarted by the state of existence” and so on,

translated: And in such a place it is impossible for the good kamma to give its fruit; only the bad kamma can do so.

original: sakkotīti. Evamassa tāni kammāni gativipattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.
analyzed: sakkoti iti evam assa tāni kammāni gati vipatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti
translated: So he knows that the good kamma is thwarted by the state of existence.

original: Aparassāpi bahūni kalyāṇakammāni honti. Tāni upadhisampattiyaṃ ṭhitassa vipacceyyuṃ.
analyzed: aparassa api bahūni kalyāṇa kammāni honti tāni upadhi sampattiyam ṭhitassa vipacceyyum
translated: In another’s case much good kamma has been done. It would ripen in him if he were to be reborn in a time of abundance.

original: So pana ekena pāpakammena upadhivipattiyaṃ patiṭṭhito dubbaṇṇo hoti pisācasadiso.
analyzed: so pana ekena pāpa kammena upadhi vipattiyam patiṭṭhitaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ hoti pisāca sadiso
translated: But he is ugly, like a pisāca, because of his one bad action, which is the reason for his downfall in respect of his requisites.

original: So sacepi rājakule nibbatto pituaccayena ‘kiṃ imassa nissirīkassa rajjenā’ti rajjaṃ
analyzed: saḥ sace pi rāja kule nibbattaḥ pitu accayena kim imassa nissirīkassa rajjena ati rajjam
translated: Even if he is reborn in a royal family, when his father dies he does not get the kingship, thinking, ‘What is royalty to one who has no majesty?’

original: na labhati. Senāpatigehādīsu nibbattopi senāpatiṭṭhānādīni na labhati.🔽Imassa panatthassāvibhāvatthaṃ dīparājavatthu kathetabbaṃ – rājā kira putte jāte
analyzed: na labhati senāpati geha ādīsu nibbattaḥ api senāpati ṭṭhāna ādīni na labhati  imassa pana atthassa avibhāva attham dīpa rāja vatthu kathetabbam rājā kira putte jāte
translated: Even if he is reborn in the house of a general, etc., he does not get the rank of general, and so on.

original: deviyā pasīditvā varaṃ adāsi. Sā varaṃ gahetvā ṭhapesi. Kumāro sattaṭṭhavassakāleva
analyzed: deviyā pasīditvā varam adāsi sā varam gahetvā ṭhapesi kumāraḥ satta ṭṭhavassa kālā iva

original: rājaṅgaṇe kukkuṭe yujjhāpesi. Eko kukkuṭo uppatitvā kumārassa akkhīni bhindi. Kumāramātā
analyzed: rājaṅgaṇe kukkuṭe yujjhāpesi ekaḥ kukkuṭaḥ uppatitvā kumārassa akkhīni bhindi kumāra mātā

analyzed: devī puttassa pannarasa soḷasa vassa kāle rajjam vāressāmi iti rājānam upasaṅkamitvā
translated: the boy’s mother, when her son was fifteen or sixteen years old, thought, “I shall ask for the boon now.” So she went to the king

original: āha – “deva, tumhehi kumārassa jātakāle varo dinno. Mayā so gahetvā ṭhapito; idāni
analyzed: āha deva tumhehi kumārassa jāta kāle varaḥ dinnaḥ mayā saḥ gahetvā ṭhapitaḥ idāni
translated: and said, “Sire, you gave a boon to me when the boy was born. I accepted it but put it off. Now I ask for the boon.

original: naṃ gaṇhāmī”ti. “Sādhu, devi, gaṇhāhī”ti. “Mayā, deva, tumhākaṃ santikā kiñci aladdhaṃ
analyzed: naṃ gaṇhāmi iti sādhu devi gaṇhāhi iti mayā deva tumhākam santikā kiñci a laddham
translated: “Very well, Queen, take it.” “Your Majesty, there is nothing I have not received from you.

original: nāma natthi. Idāni pana mama puttassa rajjaṃ vāremī”ti. “Devi, tava putto aṅgavikalo.🔽Na sakkā tassa rajjaṃ dātu”nti. “Tumhe mayhaṃ ruccanakavaraṃ adātuṃ asakkontā kasmā
analyzed: nāma natthi idāni pana mama puttassa rajjam vāremi iti devi tava putto aṅga vikalaḥ  na sakkā tassa rajjam dātunti tumhe mayham ruccanaka varam a dātum a sakkontā kasmā
translated: But now I ask for the kingship for my son.” “Queen, your son is defective in his limbs.🔽It is not possible to give him the kingship.” “You were unable to give me the choice boon I asked for.

original: varaṃ adatthā”ti? Rājā ativiya nippīḷiyamāno “na sakkā tuyhaṃ puttassa sakalalaṅkādīpe
analyzed: varam adattha ati rājā nippīḷiyamānaḥ na sakkā tuyham puttassa sakala laṅkā dīpe
translated: Why did you give me a boon?” The king, being greatly distressed, said, “It is not possible to give your son the kingship over all Laṅkā with its provinces and districts;

original: rajjaṃ dātuṃ; nāgadīpe pana chattaṃ assāpetvā vasatū”ti nāgadīpaṃ pesesi. So dīparājā
analyzed: rajjam dātum nāga dīpe pana chattam vasatu iti nāga dīpam pesesi saḥ dīpa rājā
translated: but he may go to the island of the nāgas and live there, having the nāga-umbrella held over him.” So he sent him to the island of the nāgas. He became king of that island.

original: nāma ahosi. Sace cakkhuvikalo nābhavissā tiyojanasatike sakalatambapaṇṇidīpe sabbasampattiparivāraṃ
analyzed: nāma ahosi sace cakkhu vikalaḥ ti yojana satike sakala tamba paṇṇi dīpe sabba sampatti parivāram
translated: If he had not been defective in his eyes, he would have received the kingship over all Tambapaṇṇi, with its three yojanas in extent, and all its wealth and splendor.

original: rajjaṃ alabhissā. Evaṃ upadhivipattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti.

analyzed: saḥ pana ekena pāpa kammena kāla vipattiyam du rāja du manussa kāle kasaṭe niroje appāyuke

analyzed: ayam pana payoga vipattiyam ṭhito pāṇam sabbam dussīlyam pūreti tathā tena  saddhim sama jātikāni api kulāni āvāha vivāham na karonti itthi dhuttaḥ surā dhuttaḥ akkha dhuttaḥ

translated: a wicked man.” His good actions cannot give their fruit. Thus🔽he understands that they do not come to fruition because they are obstructed by a misfortune of means. Thus,

original: payogavipattipaṭibāḷhāni na vipaccantīti pajānāti. Evaṃ catasso sampattiyo āgamma
analyzed: payoga vipatti paṭibāḷhāni na vipaccanti iti pajānāti evam catasso sampattiyaḥ āgamma

analyzed: aparassa api bahūni kalyāṇa kammāni honti tāni gati vipattiyam ṭhitassa na vipacceyyum
translated: Again, someone else has done many good actions. They would not ripen in him if he were to be reborn in a state of deprivation.🔽But he is reborn in a state of distinction by means of a single good action. There

analyzed: aparassa api bahūni kalyāṇa kammāni honti tāni upadhi vipattiyam ṭhitassa na vipacceyyum  so pana ekena kalyāṇa kammena upadhi sampattiyaṃ yeva patiṭṭhitaḥ abhirūpaḥ dassanīyaḥ
translated: Again, someone else has done many good actions. They would not ripen in him if he were to be reborn in a state of deprivation of requisites.

translated: But he is reborn in a state of distinction of requisites by means of a single good action. He is handsome, comely, graceful, possessing perfect complexion, like Brahmā in form. So they ripen in him when he has come to a state of distinction of requisites,🔽because they are unable to give their fruit while he is in a state of deprivation of requisites.

translated: If he is reborn in a royal family’s harem, he gets the position of viceroy, general, treasurer,🔽or banker after his father’s death. Thus he understands that since the support has been thwarted,

translated: After asking about the matter, they learned that the supply was exhausted. They thought, ‘What shall we do if we go there?’ Twenty-four
